fzTZGbsKvRXSDZshcuBZng.text: Juan, our bartender was the absolute best.  He makes sure you have a great time and awesome drinks. Great food and awesome service!!! Met the chef, Paco.  He came out and introduce himself, and even took a picture of me and my husband.   If you're in Vegas and you like Mexican food, this place is a must. Please don't leave without trying the churros and flan. Wow!!! What a gem of of a place!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At El Dorado Cantina. Good times!

lQnJDRdU7WnrqPUZj5m43A.text: I love this place I take anybody that visits Las Vegas. It's stuck right next to sapphire but it's an extremely classy restaurant with 5 star service. Maria is also a great server.

0JGANS43L-0rY00c9ETW6w.text: First time coming, the lobster tacos tasted different than the other(weird). The waitress Maria was amazing and made some mighty tasty guacamole...This is one of the most expensive Mexican restaurants here for Mexican and the taste isn't that much a difference if you want to over pay 40-50 for a meal. Also FYI if you get a free flan double check your bill cos when we got back to our room I saw we still got charged when it was free apparently.

YR_Q9wNC_-i-xaFoa07vEQ.text: Made a reservation a few hours before. It took about 15 minutes to get seated so we just waited at the bar. Was a little disappointed that it took about 10 minutes to be acknowledged while waiting at the bar (wasn't packed/lots of open seats). The place isn't cheap but the food is organic non-gmo and has a lot of vegan/gluten free options. The guacamole was amazing! So delicious and they come with a cart and make it in front of you! I ordered the cilantro lime cocktail-- I didn't like it but my husband did. It's a nice place to stop for lunch or dinner, with friends or family. The reason I gave it 4 stars was because, when we did sit down at our table, it took a very long time to order our food and we weren't sure who our waiter even was, until we stopped someone to ask.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Making the guacamole for us at our table
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cilantro and Lime Cocktail
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole $16 but they make it in front of you! Best I&#39;ve had

FHjg1Qn1vxCv6uG6wiuWGA.text: The chips, both green and red salsas and the table side guacamole were really good. The veggie fajitas were good. The blended margarita was great! We shared everything. The place is pricey for this type of cuisine. It came out to about $87 for two and we only ordered the one drink to share. I confirmed that they were not cooking the grasshoppers on the grill before i ordered. Would not want that!!!! The gothic decor is creatively cool. We will be back if we are in the mood for Mexican food in Vegas. The plus is they are open 24 hours.

1lK5re0fLh2ojMml6WVuig.text: Amazing menu and it's all 24/7!!!  Don't let the location fool you, in fact embrace it. Plenty of parking or valet service.  Chef Paco has put together an incredible, authentic menu that he and the staff serves 24/7. Non- GMO and organic ingredients are the rule here, the menus even list the source farms for many of the items. Large selection of vegetarian and GF options - and and the chef is great about making  modifications for vegans (mmm...churros). It's a True Vegas dining gem.   The vibe and  decor are great and the staff is super friendly. Be sure to check their web site or Facebook page for all of the great specials they offer though out the week. Chances are if you stop here once, you'll find yourself becoming a regular.  The private room is great for groups, I had a dinner for 40 and everyone loved the food and service. They personalized our menus and really made the night special.   It's also a great location for dinner before a Las Vegas 51s baseball game. Loving the Veggie Bowl with a house margarita! Great service even during the dinner rush. Come to think of it, I'll probably be back after the game too!  If you want to surprise someone by pulling into a Gentleman's Club parking lot when you were to be going to dinner make sure you come around to so you are taking Industrial south and turn into the parking lot - or distract your guest from looking at the building as there is now large lit signage on the street side of the building.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ta-da! Chef Paco hooks a girl up...off the menu portabello vegan burger. Ask for it!

Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s 11:30 pm on your Monday night. You&#39;re vegan and famished...good thing there is Chef Paco and El Dorado Cantina to come to your rescue.
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El Dorado Cantina Veggie Bowl, minus the cheese. A meal fit for a vegan Duchess.

XHzotoWAZUz57YYc5ntWxg.text: After eating here at least 50 times, I figured it was time to leave a review.  The food is some of the best I've ever had. Anywhere. It's hard to go wrong. Throw a dart at the menu from a distance, order whatever meal the dart lands on, and you'll love it.  Everything is great - some of my favorites include: -The house salad, add chicken -The taco plate (the Cochinita is downright the best taco I've ever had) -Chicken lettuce wraps (add the habanero sauce) -Chicken or Mahi signature bowls (makes for 2 meals) -Chilaquiles (you can't beat this breakfast anywhere else in Vegas. This is not hyperbole)  The staff are all super friendly, swift, and thorough. They care about good service and give the place a great energy.  It's hard to find a non-GMO, organic eatery in Vegas. In fact, one of only two of them I know of. There's not much of a market for it in this city; the locals and tourists here aren't particularly discerning when it comes to their food. But for those of us who care, this place is like a sanctuary. A food sanctuary.   I'll really miss this place. Come to Portland El Dorado Cantina!

1CxhA5-CCEyspov8xrsUVA.text: This place is like a time machine back to my Grandmother's table.  This was my first time here and I'm already planning on my next visit with my family members.  We had the shrimp chicken steak fajitas and elote.  Our waiter Enrique was so friendly and knowledgeable about the menu options and yummy factors.  Who cares if it is next door to a strip club, if you went to a restaurant next to a tattoo shop you wouldn't have to get ink, duh. You dont have to get a lap dance unless you want to.   Not a bad idea.

kgXfPUJGcGF_rcgkM4zcxg.text: Pleasantly surprised by this place. The atmosphere was not what I was expecting at all.. Considering it is located next to a strip club. Only on vegas I tell ya! The food was great, the decor was right up my ally.. And I will definitely be back :) Ask for Nell

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PFQv8iitAfhL0OAyZ2dUUA.text: So let me start by saying it's right next door/connected to the sapphire gentlemen club. Do not let that stop you from trying this place. They are open 24/7 and it's fantastic. The bar has happy hour specials from 12am-2am. Street tacos for $2.50 each. The carnitas are pretty good. Not dry and not over salted. The Chips and salsa are also good, especially the red sauce, but only the first basket is free. All refills are $3.50. Definitely a surprise at how classy this place is considering it's open all night and next to the club. It's worth the visit. Only about 3 minutes off of the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s a happy margarita!

BU1eOo6_N0xZ6bU0BxXGCg.text: Super delicious food amazing service the bar was amazing and the manager Martine was just super all in all wished I could give them a 10 but 5 is the best I can do definitely will come back and with more friends

3bGZw39iO_izFodmz7nomw.text: Yum-a-thon!  I had a vegetarian, black bean burrito that was good and the side of corn on the cob is fantastico (I'd come back just for that) and also the FLAN - OMG!  I like the environment here too. Cozy and chic at the same time. Servers are friendly. The prices are a little on the high side, but not too bad for the quality and NON-GMO menu. It's a great late night stop after a night of partying or a great date night.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vege-burrito!

jWZcx3gPAMAe43AMPjHyCA.text: Been here several times for night life and lunch time and its perfect every time! One of the few places where I can count on healthy fresh foods that taste amazing.

1Sot-m7gZ7q4GTPIxXN8Eg.text: Scary at first, only because it is located in the same building as a strip club, so they get a wee bit overshadowed driving up. BUT-food is outstanding. And reasonably priced. We spent our time at the bar ordering off the happy hour menu. And loved the flavors. Highly recommend.

PS0OJIJ-EKBPniGEm2pJpw.text: A Review In Haiku: El Dorado Cantina.   Where else in Vegas |  Can you get organic guac |  Next door to tacos?

7bycN3mhB3aOo3yX6QiYkg.text: Enjoyed my Carne Asada Burrito. Yes,, it was as big as my head. Margarita was very good, but small.

2OjaAQhzR5fTCTXlXVAFug.text: Me and my husband had dinner at this restaurant for the first time and it was delicious!!!we had the pineapple shrimp and the cilantro shrimp both were perfect  Chef Paco come out to make sure all dishes were okay and to introduce himself. The restaurant is nice and inviting has nothing to do with next door our waitress told us about the daily and local specials which we'll take advantage of we definitely will go back

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grasshoppers!!! Gotta try them

u-3-FSZhk53H5qZ17rVYhg.text: The food here is delicious, which is why this place is a weekly must for my boyfriend and I. From the drinks, to the food, to the service. Absolutely superb!!

edSyV7wwSIt20BjNmcVw3g.text: Amazing organic food. The salsa is so delicious and you must try the flavored water. Everything I ordered here was fabulous.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food was incrediable. And the service phenomenal, Danny is the best.  I highly recommend eating here.

AK43DSXA4TflVcgj5uERRg.text: So first off, the location is a bit hidden. It shares a wall with sapphire and covered in greenery. We weren't expecting it so it was a bit confusing at first. We came here after going to Drai's so we were all a bit drunk already. And drunk + mexican food = bliss! The restaurant itself was pretty empty but that might just be because of the time we were there at. They were blasting a shakira concert on the TV's which we LOVED! I ordered the carnitas burrito which came in a pretty decent portion especially for the prices. I must say. The star of all of our dishes though, was the rice. Omg that was literally the most amazing rice I'd ever had! And I'm chinese so I've eaten plenty of rice in my lifetime! The rice was just so fluffy and BUTTERY! It was to die for! I can't get over just how amazing it was!  For dessert, we ordered the free flan for checking in on yelp. It was so rich and creamy! Decadent to say the least!   I'm not joking about the rice though! My sister went back to vegas a couple weeks later and I had her bring me back an order of that rice no lie!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That rice though!

GrZoUHhdTWxGvcXmCVCuIg.text: Great Mexican food, the best in LV. The margarita is really good! It's also close from the best strip club in LV (sapphire). Big parking lot and the staff is great!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KG8Rk5qAWaDur80rvoiH7Q.text: Came on a Tuesday night for margaritas and tacos. I had carne asada and al pastor, both were delicious! Sat and the bar and enjoyed both a 1942 Cadillac margarita and a frozen strawberry. They were both very good, and the service and Liz the bartender we had were as great as the drinks themselves. 5 stars and I will be back soon. At the end Executive Chef Paco brought out his new dessert creation. (Pictured)

4cYEyiSbH3kwXqA9IqsyqA.text: We don't have enough words to describe how amazing the food was.....like....nothing. Hands down the best restaurant we visited in Vegas. Everything was perfect from service to the food. Even the Chef came out to meet us to make sure it was to our liking. I recommend this place to anyone. You will not be disappointed. We will never eat Chipotle again! Lol

xFgPET5lXX875yzfFw2DPQ.text: Great service, clean, good atmosphere, and good food. To me the food is delicious, but I do feel like it's Americanized. Salsa that accompanied a huge portion of chips was really good not that watered down flavorless crap that a lot of restaurant serve.  My bf got the Ghost chili margarita, which he loved but was very spicy for him (he's Indian so that's saying something!!!). Appetizers were tasted and looked good. Fried ice cream was great but prefer when fried ice cream is served warm/fresh out of the fryer. The waiter was attentive, friendly, and professional.   This place is attached to a strip club (not inside).  Only down side is I feel like it is over priced.

A_StVaoenttDb4VGsV4e6Q.text: We had a wonderful experience at the el dorado cantina! The food was awesome, including the presentation....margaritas were delicious and our server Stella was nothing short of amazing! 5 stars... will return here next visit to Vegas for sure!

gkRd7SO849XBVrEBop6viw.text: This is the best place in town! Amazing atmosphere and I love the food! You have to order the table side guacamole. Also ask for Jeff, the service awesome ! This is my go to place.

jl1yRlW5l8aCC4CXvALWKg.text: The food here is delicious. Our server Jess was amazing and made us feel welcome. All entrees are made fresh and have a authentic taste!

tFNMWkcyFKve96QHMSswWw.text: This is absolutely my favorite Authentic Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas! 100% the best experience for my friends and I tonight. This egg nog tres leches dessert was amazing! Chef Paco is hands down a fantastic first class Leader in the food industry! My all time favorite entree as of today is the seafood enchiladas! And my all-time favorite dessert the flan! Thank you Chef Paco, our server Danny and the entire front and back of house staff for such a great experience! You guys ROCK!!

Igxse1l4aL8GpFJeDa230Q.text: Good, but pricey for what it is. Asked for Chile de Arbil because it was kind of bland and needed a little more kick, but they had no idea what I was talking about. Service was good and margaritas were fresh--may return.

DM-ru-UsZAOkIExA0uehYQ.text: Off the beaten path but worth it.  Al pastor tacos highly recommended.  Great service from Jess.  Will be back.

f_nCjQlgsMwpSRG7bxd4Kw.text: I've been here numerous times and it never disappoints. Our server Juan provided great service as always. Every time I come to Vegas I make sure to stop here. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for good Mexican food.  Also they have the best best flan ever!

42SO3gE5hQauhKfj9Fq1Pw.text: Went here with a few friends for a birthday celebration.  They lost our reservation but was still able to accommodate our large group.  They would not seat us until the whole group was there so we sat at the bar and had drinks.  Bartenders were great at making recommendations for drinks until our group showed up.  Food and drinks were very good but service was a bit slow at times.  I would recommend the guacamole.  It was delicious.  Everything we ordered was very good.

NO032fGFJ8h5GYMAT8j_4Q.text: This is our second visit to El Dorado Cantina and we were not disappointed! The rice is amazing, simple flavor but done well. The Carne Assad street tacos were very good and the flan was out of this world! The aesthetics of the place is sexy and has a great vibe.  Don't be scared away that it's attached to a gentleman's club the atmosphere is romantic and upscale.  The service was exceptional and the chef personally came out to see if we were enjoying our meal.  This is a must eat place!

sFNgNawCi2CvUMFjdCWDxQ.text: Burrito, lettuce wraps and organic orange dessert! Phenomenal STRONG house margaritas! My new go to for clean  & beautiful Mexican food!

J3fgbPHDoezQ6dOeVDA5LA.text: This place is absolutely amazing! They've been rated in the top 5 Mexican restaurants in the U.S. The service we received by our waiter, Angel, was incredible. Super friendly, super fun & exotic. The food was unlike any other. They also have great options for vegetarians and vegans. It's great for children as well. In my experience it was perfect, I highly suggest this lovely place. The pricing is reasonable, too. It's wonderful.

Every year we celebrate our anniversary here and this ur was amazing as always. Thank you chef Paco and Grace for serving us. Such great service, food and drinks .

Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank you Ariana and Chef Paco for making our big day so special!!

gbNoDMF9-VjQm_dOmxy-Xw.text: Amazing food. And service. Very gluten and diary friendly.   I am originally from Texas and now live in Ohio so decent Mexican food is no where to be found. This place was authentic and absolutely amazing. It's worth the $7 Uber. But hey if your in Vegas and can't afford a $7 Uber you probably shouldn't be there.

96SPPnYQYxJTk6yU1ZzbVw.text: Our server Sara was great. My sister ordered, literally, the most difficult and specific order and she got it spot on. The food never disappoints! The best 24 hour place in town.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They use fresh fruit in their flavored margarita!

4QBTjCQEt9b-U3feOvQyUA.text: Food is delicious! The portions are worth the price, al pastor tacos are amazing. Won't regret it!

ij7EJ4Edf1OR7t-pMfClWQ.text: We just found this place as we were driving and wanted to get a quick bite. So we pulled into the lot, apprehensive, it's located next to a giant strip club, it's open 24 hours, never good signs.  To say we were pleasantly surprised is an understatement, we were downright shocked, El Dorado Cantina probably has some of the best Mexican food we have ever eaten, and I mean ever. The tacos were rich and flavourful with complex taste profiles, the tortillas were fluffy with such an amazing texture that I didn't believe they were all gluten free, really it was the best meal we've had on our Vegas trip and that includes the super fancy places by famous chefs that charge hundreds of dollars per head. I want to go back as soon as possible and make my way down their whole menu.

AdnpwKl0NxPbdVCvXtJqHw.text: We have had this restaurant suggested to us a few times. It sounded sketchy since it is housed in the same building as Sapphire Gentleman's club. Please don't let this stop you. The room is lovely with a cool Day of the Dead decor. The service was first rate. Christela our server was very nice and accommodating about our food questions. Doris the manager took the time to speak with us and let us know about specials during the week such as industry Monday and tequila Tuesday. Of course the food is the most important part of any room. This is really good food. The menu offers some typical Mexican fare such as burritos and enchiladas but also some specialties that I have never seen before. The menu is coded with symbols for heat, vegetarian, gluten free and house specialty. Our entree choices were all delicious. They are open 24 hours and do have a small breakfast menu. They also have a nice sized bar. It is in a perfect spot for strip casino workers to go after shifts. Try it you'll like it.

wdKTLNmITZAwuyGnAD0ZBg.text: I really enjoyed the food. I had a carne asada burrito that was awesome. Our waitress, Emily, was fantastic. She pays attention to detail and make sure her customers are satisfied. Great experience here

tQsSAUwfroax3fPfKPNPvg.text: Best Mexican food in Vegas!  Table side guacamole and Churros are must haves.  The service is also terrific and friendly.  Vladimir was our waiter and he was very good.  I would highly recommended!

2f-RPvYhc0HmCyaCCB_sfA.text: Great food, great atmosphere. Our server Grace was awesome. The best guacamole I've ever had made fresh right at your table.

PCMlUUw7nlA19eVT1u1gpg.text: This is an awesome restaurant with authentic Mexican food.  I had a Carnitas Bowl that is like a burrito without a tortilla.  My colleague had three tacos.  The green Chile salsa is fantastic with just the right kick of spice plus great flavor. This place shares a building and parking lot with a strip club but don't let that put you off on trying this great dining experience.

IXNL7U8Ki6Yv1Wp02zdNJw.text: Had dinner after a business event. Great food if you are looking for something near the Strip but without the hassle of driving down Las Vegas Blvd. I like that it's open 24 hours.

oI8q2MY7Z15TElFUkC71QQ.text: The food and service were awesome! We loved the recommendations made by the waiter! The fresh pineapple juice was great, my husband had the watermelon juice and loved it.

X4Z49_A8NhFyI7Z9_C4uUg.text: My wife and I had our wedding reception here several years ago. So every time we come to Vegas we come and eat! Ohhhh did I forget to mention they are one of the best tasting Mexican restaurants I've ever had!!!!.... well not only is every dish they serve bomb, but I definitely have to recommend their pozole and shrimp with cilantro rice! Unbelievably great foo!!! Chef Paco is a class act and a True artist!! We absolutely love this place!! A must when in Vegas!!! Nothing better in Vegas!

rzThVkRTSxLaH30NxpQdKA.text: This place is one of the hidden gems in the city. Don't be put off by the location, it is worth the trip. I've been here three times and each time I have no issues with waiting for a table or a seat at the bar. The bartenders here are friendly and if you need help with what to eat, they offer great suggestions. The carne asada and the grilled mahi tacos are a must.

GmlL14jvm4-ZPYnwagLqww.text: I would've gave this 5 stars but Yelp's algorithm is being a douche and I'm not trying to have their Yelp account blocked. First timer. I like to judge a restaurant by their salsas and guac first.... FIRE!!! Sara needs a promotion because her level of service is top notch. Don't let the fact that it's next to the strip club deter from enjoying some bomb ass food. I'm definitely making this place a "must visit before I go home" destination.

U8pbyu_0dkQ2_NZaFiZLmQ.text: Amazing!!!!! Amazing!!! Ivette and Rodolfo gave us A+ service. I ordered the Carne Asada plate and it did not disappoint. You have to try it!

4_TeuRSx9HeAfbar1iSfaQ.text: Liz, Ivette, y Gustavo are are some of the best servers/ bartenders in Las Vegas. They really make you feel welcome. The food is delicious! Everything is so flavorful. Best happy hour around.

iECrcIG-3WM9Ti4eABU15w.text: Just over here in a food coma and drooling.  The Cucumber Margarita was AhMazing, the quesadillas, the table side guacamole and the Queso was all deeeee licious. Highly recommend.

qCPsDeoihv4MlqiMJyj6UQ.text: OMG the food here is fantastic! We ordered as an appetizer panuchos and elotes the both hit the mark. For our entrees we ordered chicken enchiladas, seafood burrito, carne asada street taco and a carne asada burrito, everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meal. Juan, our server, was awesome he made us feel special. He provided us with great recommendations. Thank you Juan for your excellent customer service and honest navigation through the menu!!   WE WILL BE BACK FOR SURE!!

U7dpm-RCzcJ7Ua6EOENH2w.text: So after driving around searching for a Mexican restaurant that actually serves chicken my partner and I found El Dorado cantina and let me tell you the food is to die for lol super delicious very fresh and the service was excellent our server was Ms. Ivette she was super sweet and made some excellent recommendations ! I highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely go back on my next trip to LAS VEGAS

4PcNKZKVGDWCZEH0V1Sr9g.text: This is one of those times when I wish Yelp would let us rate the service separately from the food.  Let me say the food is five stars and the margaritas, well I don't believe I've ever had better.   However....  We had made our reservation through Yelp which was something new but I thought a really great idea.  Made the reservation And received an email confirmation as well as the reservation on my phone in the app and a reminder the day of.   Seemed efficient. Got to the restaurant which is right next door to a mens club which makes it easy to get a taxi back. Walked in, the hostess couldn't find our reservation and said Well, she'd find us a table. Manager was all upset because it wasn't there. I looked down at the reservations on her tablet, there was my name. One star gone for idiocy and a less than stellar table when We planned ahead.   Got water right away, a real plus because you usually have to ask for it and the server appeared soon after with chips and three salsas. The tomatillo was the best I've had in ages. He took drink orders and then it was probably 15 minutes before we saw him again. I ordered grilled shrimp tacos, hubby cheese enchiladas. Quite a long time before we were served, ate all the chips and no one offered to refill them. Food arrives by a runner, no server in  sight. Hubby was supposed to,have cheese, got chicken.  No server in sight for 15 minutes or so.  Rather than go hungry hubby ate the chicken Ones, said they were good but not what he wanted. Server finally shows up, surprised the food was incorrect and can he replace them. Where was he when the food was served.  Lost a star for that as well.  In spite of the service missteps, the food and drink,were excellent and worth more than three stars.  The place was very noisy.  Apparently they were having some contest and because of being seated where we were it was impossible tocarry on a conversation until the contest was over.  We come to Vegas a lot and will probably go there again since it's organic and just to see if this was a one time lack of service.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table side guamole

RGNwTP_REnvaH3rI6ojJNw.text: Had an amazing lunch today with Jess as our waitress who made THE BEST tableside guacamole I have ever had ANYWHERE... I had the shrimp tacos with black beans and the cilantro rice was amazing too!

8n1lS7AhnhQ0ZTkf0U2i0w.text: 1st visit, food was amazing. Our server, Emily gave excellent service and recommendations. Table-side guacamole is a must and definitely order one of their remarkable margaritas. Empanadas as another starter proved brilliant. Pozole, a home run. Dozens of fantastic Entrees to choose from including the enchiladas and Chicken Rajas which we really enjoyed. No meal is complete without the flan and tres leches cake. No question, our best Mexican meal in Las Vegas. We will be back!

Pwtv8vhlj_Ih1dUcH4qfEw.text: We love this place. The freshly made guacamole is the best in town. Delicious meat and good quality food over all. Our server Andrew was great. And Kenn kindly put on cartoons on TV to keep our toddler occupied.

uItcuCQ1ksF5plGXGhKW_g.text: This was one of the best Mexican meals we have had in the US.  All around excellent experience as well.  Easy to make reservations, very nice and helpful staff (fantastic waiter Chris), and decent atmosphere (sports and music on the televisions around the restaurant).  We had guacamole, margaritas, fajitas - guacamole made to your taste at table, margaritas made from scratch (no mix), and fajitas well-cooked and v fresh.  Would definitely go back!

bCLdAXV1X0-8R_zqKXr0Mg.text: Best sangria ever. Awesome shrimp. Platter with 2 choices can feed 2 of not too hungry. Really friendly service.

YjlIapMQguUo1AJfWHcILQ.text: I absolutely LOVED this place! There food is amazing!! I highly recommend this place to everyone who wants some True wholesome Organic food!!

jxXBkbIc2u5SiEtEetNdCA.text: Very health conscious and tries to use locally farmed foods. Authentic and the salsas are the best in Vegas. The Chef can cook up almost anything, and frequently does. Definitely worth the stop if you are a tourist or local near the strip.

_zGmJjGpkBFt8s-S8Tr-ug.text: Amazing food, strawberry daiquiris with whip cream are to die for here. Incredible customer service, table side made guacamole was huge & tasted better than any I've had yet. Our server was Joaquin and everything came out exactly as we requested! I'd recommend this restaurant 100%!

M-P6bdBAwzy7-mg_DiYbxg.text: I came to this place by being ref by yelp ! I must say excellent customer service !!! Enrique and cuddos to chef paco !! I live in la I really hope they move one to Pasadena !!!! I tried the posole and enchiladas . Thank you so much for making our first time visit feel like we're family !!!

IAU8oPsaRT74eEwu8HgQHg.text: Omg this is the worst mexican restaurant ever. So bland. Who eats here? Drunks from the strip club?

ieK_aBR8rTmcR4SWGK5xeA.text: Super good! Best tacos ever. Robert was the best server EVER!! Super hospitable, friendly & knew everything about the menu. Thanks! Will def come back here next time I'm in Vegas! :)

sPu25EN0VfL45QwLN1fhrQ.text: The food was delicious,  and the service from Amber was great. The portions were generous, so I was even able to enjoy my 3 moles again the next day.

QbO0-ZbI-lsO3xq0VReHHg.text: Do not go here if you want customer service. it is one of the worst restaurant I've ever eaten in Las Vegas since I've been here since 1995. When we first got there they seated us at a booth that was absolutely filthy. Then they moved us to another booth where the seats were full of grease but we stayed then they told us we couldn't have happy hour in the booth we had to go to the bar. when we went to the bar the bar told us that we could have happy hour in the booths no one seems to know what was going on there. Finally after sitting at the bar for 20 minutes the bartender took our food order. But there's one good thing about the restaurant the food  The chef needs to move out of that restaurant and go to someplace where he'll be appreciated at. Because the service at this restaurant is abominable. oh and to top it off the $5 margaritas that were on for happy hour we were charged $11.00 for but we didn't say anything feeling that we never come back here again. As for me and my friend being limo drivers we will never ever suggest this place to any of our customers.

zct9Z70R5o1rolgF3MyhfQ.text: Authentic fresh friendly. Great atmosphere. nice break from the strip. Paco the chef is amazing and friendly. Free flan with yelp check in. Pacos grandmothers recipe. Amazing. (Don't let the adjacent gentleman's club deter you!)

qh2TxKXD4W6Jdnwl_IVNGA.text: I wanted to check this place out because it was on the Yelp top 100. I had some pretty high expectations because of the great reviews. I ordered the street tacos with beans and rice. The street tacos were okay, but nothing special. I wouldn't be able to tell the difference from any street vendor. The rice was soggy and not edible. The worst part was the service. Our server tried hard but it seemed abnormally slow. It became very noticeable when it took 45 minutes to pay for my bill and I was late for my next meeting. Food was fairly overpriced for the lack luster entree.

KpR6Q0kYKPV2vmurLFRdZg.text: Sharing property with the freaking Sapphire's strip club, we initially drove straight passed this joint. That brewing said, certainly not the most family friendly of locations...we gave them a shot seeing as it was just the wife and I. Stepping in right around 5:30 p.m., we were seated without any wait. A quick look through the menu drew immediate attention to the inflated prices throughout the food and drink selections. I suppose it's to be expected in Las Vegas, but their off-strip location would've suggest otherwise. Chips and salsa came out in due time, and we ordered the tableside guacamole after reading the rave reviews. The guac was flat out spectacular; a huge offering, perfectly seasoned, fresh ingredients, and definitely one of the best I've ever had. With the complimentary chips, salsa, an order of guacamole, and a pitcher of perfect Margarita, we were near full, and ended up splitting a Carnitas burrito. The burrito came out already cut in half, and strangely enough some differences were noticed. My half was scalding hot, an obvious microwave job. My wife's came out luke warm, and almost seemed to be prepared differently. We almost questioned whether or not they cut our burrito and someone else's, swapped halves, and sent them out. Either way, my half was solid. Quality ingredients, excellently seasoned, tasty carnitas...my complaints would be they didn't use a burrito tortilla...more of a wrap, and it was microwaved until scalding. Hard to deny the flavor, and some of the quality food and drink we enjoyed. Bottomless  line, keep the kids at home, bring your appetite and checkbook. Solid Mexican food a bit off the beaten path.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas Rajas Burrito
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Guac

ewvm-VwNu8pBTOBocWwaAg.text: This is me and my boyfriends favorite Mexican place in Vegas. We love that it's non-gmo with vegan friendly items and open 24 hours!? We were sold from the start. We've eaten here at many different times in the day and the service and food are consistent every time we've gone. We have gotten many different dishes, but I would highly recommend the guacamole, because I love that they make it at the table, and also the fajitas! This past time we went was on a Tuesday night because we thought they would still have 50% off for industry night. We learned that they had ended that just a couple weeks before :( but at least they still have the Monday locals deal so we weren't mad! We decided to check in on yelp to get the free flan. I heard their flan is good but me and my boyfriend are personally not fans of flan, so our server (I forgot his name) said he could switch it to something we might like and we decided to get the churros. And they were AMAZING! We love this place and always highly recommend it!

vvRZoV0NAe0k40exNbv-Yg.text: Today we decided to stop in at El Dorado Cantina  for a late lunch.  Upon arrival we were happily greeted by the hosts and were  introduced to our server Autumn.  Autumn proved to be an outstanding server with a wonderful attitude and vast knowledge of the menu.  There were no complaints about the 4 different entrees we ordered, the steak fajitas had great flavor and presentation.  El Dorado Cantina was a great decision and one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.

M0oafXjijt1Mlzk4az2PbQ.text: It was just ok, not something I would crave or want to go back to once a week.  Burrito was mostly rice.  I thought it was expensive for what you got. I would go back on a Tuesday or happy hour and try the special, it might be worth it then.

UdKjkm3uKjPdJNeFSCbC2w.text: Love the atmosphere but not the food. The only extremely good thing we ate was the salsa. The guacamole was sub par, bland and flavorless. The el pastor taco was the worst I've eaten. It's usually my favorite at other restaurants. The chicken taco was average. The fish taco was pretty good but I probably wouldn't order it again. I'd  be willing to give this place another try, but I'll stay away from the tacos.

uBAXP_wJq7meUvlmkjOHeQ.text: We can here for my sister's 30th birthday meal. She is obsessed with Mexican food and wanted a huge meal. This delivered on both accounts. Yes, it was totally weird driving into a strip club parking lot with my parents. And the waitress wear bustiers and booty shorts, but you get over it immediately after your first round of drinks. Our waitress had to be the loveliest woman in Vegas. She even brought the chef out after our meal  to meet us and arranged for the staff to sing to my sister (who pretended to be embarrassed but we totally know she loved it). And to top off the atmosphere the drinks and food are insanely good. No one walked away unhappy -- and we were beyond full. Hard for the bottomless pit crew we have. Overall, jump into a cab or your rental car and treat yourself here. If I can pull into a strip club parking lot with my parents, you can do it. Have a laugh and enjoy a great meal!

Tcj3u2eNzVZSqn49aBf-TA.text: Incredible Mexican fare. A gem off the strip, near Circus Circus. The meat is so flavorful, rice so fluffy, tortilla chips so crisp and warm, and salsas so zesty it's worth it to come back multiple times. Highly recommend.

lp4WF9pmQsOuC4LlZnm12Q.text: Great food & service! Celebrated friends birthday with tasty strawberry margarita pitchers!

iAQ2uVKe1GHFEdWnBb8w-A.text: This is not a review regarding the food, only the service.   I am a usually a great fan of El Dorado however, this time not so much. Myself and a group of co workers came there for lunch before a meeting. We expressed to the waitress Ericka, that we would like the bills to be brought out right after our food is delivered. We sat there, 15-20 minutes and we waved down a different waiter to have them remind our waitress for our bills. She finally came with our bills. I handed her cash and my card and specifically  advised her to apply the cash to my bill first and then use my card for the remaining amount.      As I checked my statement, the full amount was charged to my credit card. This looks as though she may have pocketed the cash. (we had a nice sized group and gratuity was charged). I am not pleased with this service.

9_4SMFsklo_dLstZOfzBfQ.text: Excellent food! And excellent service from our waitress Erika. She was very friendly and went out of her to help us out. I do find this place to be expenisive but the quality of food is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this place! The cowboys are in town! #yeehaw #nfr

aZ0uu3AOVxzXeGXOVnoluA.text: Love love love.  I don't know how I haven't gotten around to writing a review of this place yet!   First, let's discuss the location: it's RIGHT next to the strip club...like, in the same building.  This is amazing.  Amazingly hilarious.  Did you know that the dancers order from El Dorado and they deliver to their dressing room?  Amazing.  The food is on point and very affordable.  Less than strip prices, more than a taco shop - it's *just right.*  They USED to have half off for locals every Monday, but now that's a thing of the past. :(   Their margaritas are great - no stock sweet and sour, everything is made in house.  The carne asada is yum, the lettuce wrapped tacos are surprisingly delicious and filling, and their trio of salsas is SO legit.    Whether you're stopping in after a trip to the strip club...or just having a leisurely dinner on a Tuesday night, El Dorado has you covered!

XyIH3C1erOrTU3VQESR1Ng.text: This is the best Mexican restaurant I've tried in Vegas. Their carnitas street tacos are the best! Three tacos loaded with meat come with a side of black or refried beans and the best cilantro rice you will ever have. Their burritos are huge and delicious, and come served with a side of rice and beans. Our server Yvette was very friendly and courteous.  After two visits to this place in only one week, we will definitely be back for more.

IKHBFdypr0t1CEsNP6qlIQ.text: Don't be dismayed by the fact that this is attached to the world's largest gentleman's club (unless that's your thing) -- this place is fantastic. The grilled mahi tacos are legit, and the margaritas are excellent. Ivan and Liz are amazing.

J7RCO6GhB_LRC7HQu_BreQ.text: My friends and I came here for dinner on a Wednesday night. It was not crowded at all and we were seated immediately and welcomed by our waiter. We ordered tableside guac and my friends ordered a few drinks. The guac was easily the BEST guac we have ever had. It was extremely fresh and the flavors were perfect. It was the right amount of spicy. I still dream about that guac sometimes LOL.   My friends got sangria, strawberry mojitos, and a margarita which they said was the best they have ever had as well.   I ordered the Carne Asada Burrito and got it chimichanga style (deep-fried). It was a very large burrito and could have been shared by two people. I really enjoyed it and would definitely get it again. My friend got shrimp and steak fajitas and thought they were really good too.  For dessert, we checked into Yelp and got 2 free flans (2 check-ins) and it was also amazing.   The waiters then escorted us to the club next door for free which was awesome.   Would definitely come back for that guac if I'm ever in Vegas again!

uD5BPaDUb2WdTtaMNsRDhQ.text: Joanna was an awesome host. She was attentive and made amazing magritas. Def a place I would want to come back to

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour magritas $5

EjtimYmaEi7tW3gLe778wg.text: Great Mexican restaurant. Everything we got was amazing... and we got a lot of things. Our server Sarah made our guacamole table-side. Def check it out if you like Mexican food

LuLOmiwrfEnWBt7DBfvhoQ.text: Decent spot. It's next to a strip club, so don't be alarmed when you turn in! It's a little loud, so I recommend grabbing a booth if you can. The margaritas are strong, and the food is decent.

lcVs054pNArm-RsTxOEypA.text: Delicious tacos and great margaritas! What more could you ask for?! Definitely great vibes! Juan is awesome!

Y757jWl9JVn93TGZ0C1xyg.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant!  Amazing food!  Love this place!  I recommend this restaurant to everyone!  I love everything I've tried so far

Zi8tDHwThY4eKVOpTAML1A.text: Nell is the bar tender here she is amazing!!!! Come see her fast and friendly ! Loved her !

TIVzc_zlzxGmoD1C_r73mA.text: Great high class Mexican food! We want our waitress to be a part of our family she is so nice you know the food is going to be good when the chips and salsa are fire, and the chips and salsa are amazing.

LuqOtruvi7Bw2Re8M4r00Q.text: I have been going to this place since it opened and it really comes through 90% of the time. There has been a few times when the service was not great and the food was not exactly flawless. I still do not hesitate when going there.

APv4t3eGLxiMy_QFO-iTpA.text: I came here after reading a friends review (thanks Lindsey) and we we were definitely not disappointed!  I told my fiance I had a new place to try for date night and you could imagine his confusion/excitement when Google Maps took us right to the front door of The Sapphires Gentlemen's Club...  Once he got over the fact that we weren't going to have naked women dance on our laps he led me into El Dorado.  When we walked in the place was pretty empty besides one or two other small groups but when the Host found out we didn't have a reservation she told us it would be a fifteen minute wait? I was truly confused due to how open it was but before I could protest she offered us a seat at the bar since there was no wait and it was happy hour, and I do love a good happy hour!  Our bartender was nice and quick to get us a couple $5.00 Margaritas (strong and decent sized for happy hour pricing).  You have to try their street tacos. There's no other option in my opinion. $2.00 per taco for happy hour and they are so packed full of gorgeous flavors and so full of meat, they were a steal for that price!   Between the both of us we tried the chicken, carnitas, and al pastor street tacos.  Chicken- 5/5 Al Pastor- 5/5 Carnitas- 15/5  Best carnitas taco I have ever had! Probably in my life and I've lived basically steps away from TJ.  I would have gotten another round but my tummy was to filled with Margaritas and Carnitas for even one more bite!  We will definitely be returning for happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AUgg4lCRvD5vfCv37G5qQA.text: Happy hour margaritas and carne Assad burritos are a perfect match. The Paco's Grandma's flan is amazing and so flavorful

go3LopA0v8sWQ2dfnUI2cQ.text: Very handsome and knowledgeable service. Great tacos and right on the strip! Better than anything at Wynn.

P3lhNv0frDTkScOLQG9JtA.text: Have been ordering mostly delivery and take out from here since 2014, the carne asada burritos were our favorite. Lately they have been putting less meat, too much rice as filler and they arrived soggy. Maybe chefs changed but we have been disappointed the past two times.

te5Z6FClYe0G9AHD0qKBtg.text: So good!! Get the  Chapulines to try something new (garlic lime crickets), the Tableside Guacamole for an old reliable, put both on a house made tortilla & eat!!!   Danny was amazing & I'm happy to bring all my friend when they visit Vegas

kOH6Bw3JRSWXWRYw8G5dnA.text: Great drinks, the fajitas are amazing and it's conveniently located behind the strip next to Sapphire. My girls and I usually come here for our own little "Tequila & Taco Tuesday's"

-7GX4fIqawHByBYYpEOTrg.text: The service and atmosphere was stellar. The food was awesome as week and it was nice to meet Chef Paco! I know as a visitor I won't be back soon and that makes me sad.

ZoTq3NZ1MZDl-r4BUGbRKQ.text: So last time I reviewed el dorado I gave them a two. Specifically for their service. As much as I love the food and I love chef Paco their service was horrid. I mentioned how bad it would be whether I sat at the bar or the table. Frequenting the bar to try and be close to someone to get served quicker. But constantly being worse. Today was different. Ostean and Jazz have made a huge difference here. I come very often and I'm not afraid in this review to give praise to these two. I'm not one to talk down and throw people under the bus. But to shout people out Ostean and Jazz are amazing! Their service compliments Chef Pacos food . They'll definitely have me coming back if not just the food. I was hesitant at first to go from two stars straight to five. Was going to give a four. But fck it five stars it is. Hats off to you two!

8IJvs9xnVoQVa6T39Scv1w.text: Just had dinner here tonight. Food was great, definitely recommend the tableside guacamole, carne asada burrito, and Paloma drink. Also for desert definitely try the fried ice cream. Our server was Emily and she was exceptional. Definitely coming here again and highly recommend it.

ssltJHxu4RtyqM5XJpn9lQ.text: Food was AMAZING! Beautiful atmosphere and to top it off the service was SUPERB!  Our waitress was attentive and amazing.  I believe her name was Karen but cant be 100% sure.  We went in on a Thursday night with 5 adults and 3 kids and could not have left happier.  THANKS!

EjvC8t7jwHqKFKdX9UJMmQ.text: Not sure what happened today. Although the restaurant was nearly empty, there were supposedly no tables available.  According to yelp, there were multiple tables open. We ended up leaving after being ignored and then essentially made to feel like our order was a burden. There are Lots of other Mexican restaurants in the area that do not serve their fajitas with a side of attitude.

xU9pDXgBhAMK4S1AfDonBw.text: Such good tacos and the rice was amazing! I had the al pastor tacos with beans and rice which was really good the meat was just a little over cooked but it still had so much flavor and I really enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Al pastor

Mho_Rt8RQJmpD2F64I0EZw.text: Went here at midnight 3 nights ago. One of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to. It's a bit strange when you first pull up and it is attached to the same building as the worlds largest strip club.  Make sure you go into the right door fellas. LOL When we walked in m, the service was great, the vibe was cool and seemed like a cool place to eat. Off the beaten path and felt like we found a secret spot. The chips and salsa were perfect. All of us enjoyed our meal. Chicken and steak fajitas were huge no shorting you on meat like other Mexican restaurants. I got the chicken Feinstein. It was amazing I have never had anything like it. Highly recommended and was the managers favorite. My only suggestion would be to put a third egg on top of it. Overall it's a must go to when in Vegas.

R87DDZ3IiQ2qqPWp7Sn4cA.text: Camille was amazing! She was an amazing server! So attentiv! Never did we have an empty glass! Love the food and ambiance at el dorado!

t399dh3yqrx8A8CRRxTjOQ.text: Thank you Jessica for excellent service for our party of 9!!!!  I'm going to have to visit again and try new options. The food was good but not amazing. The guacamole is made to order table side and was excellent! It's great that this place is open 24/7.  Don't mind the fact that it's next to Sapphires, they have a separate entrance!

eDr7z08ELzihHPZ2kq03kQ.text: This place overpriced and overrated you can get same food at any other Mexican restaurant for 1/4 the price. There is a stripclub next door so i can see why popular. The service was great just not great food and this rated high on yelp I don't get it

zdkpDdCMTqRpdab-ekI0ag.text: Came back, this time on our way back to the airport. Jessie was our server this time and she was great too! I really am going to miss this place and their banging salsa verde!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeno margarita

VebeM7fqamhw-1xq80SROw.text: I had the best meal here, I recommend the shrimp tacos, posole, street tacos, churros and the flan! All yummy.   Big thanks to Stella, great service. Chef Paco thanks for the flan, delicious food ...Viva Mexico!  Doris Siemen....can't wait to say hello from the helicopter!! Looking forward bringing customers to your restaurant.

EKDj4qx6JJMXmnLQZrr-4w.text: What a find. Don't be put off by the fact th at it is attached to a strip club.  From the minute you ate greeted aat the door you know that you are in for a treat.  Warm welcome great service amazing food.  You must have the guacamole made tableside. We had the one with shrimp. I had the duck tacos and my partner had the lobster tacos.  Both were great.  We also had the Mexican street corn and they took it off the cob for us so that we could share. I highly recommend that, the best I ever had.  Everything was flavorful,  great spices and freshness.  The pozole was also very good,  large lots of pork and hominy. Huge menu. Would definitely make this a regular stop on my trips here.

Fg5eIJV781eYACF3uIzGOA.text: Don't let the adjacent strip club throw you off, this is authentic, amazing Mexicans food! Voted one of the top 100 places to eat in the country!  I had the carnitas street tacos with rice and beans and I was blown away at all the flavor!!! So delicious!!!  Table-side guac was so well done!!! We tired the new coffee flan and it was a crazy good twist on the original.  Stella was great!!!

Xqqtp4rE1flL0Edr7graxw.text: GREAT MEXICAN RESTAURANT, try their drinks on Monday $5.00 shot. All tequila shots . Thank you

L24OULR2HOIEq3x5N49STg.text: Was craving a burrito of some sort and was told about this place by my date so here we go.  Keep in mind.... Vegetarian.  Parking is shared but there was a lot of spaces so it wasn't a problem.  The dim lighting that this place offers is comfortable as are the booths that we sat in.  Service was great.. they were quick with the chips and salsa as soon as we sat down and got started on our drinks right away.  The veggie burrito was amazing. I was not expecting it to be that good.. everything was cooked perfectly and I was full off of just eating half of it.. great portion size. The rice is also very good... and it's rice! How can rice make it onto a review lol   To our server Juan, thank you for an excellent evening. Until next time!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R882UGtSyN55uE6q3MyKnQ.text: CAMILLE was INCREDIBLE gave us not only her favorite options but came up with and added to our own thoughts and taste buds of what we would enjoy!!! She was quick professional and highly knowledgeable of not only drinks and specials but also the menu itself 10/10 best experience we've had will DEFINITELY be back 100% recommend

u946ZRQwV4a_1suRzKz66g.text: The food was AMAZING! The portions were HUGE! The jalapeno margarita was DELICIOUS! The atmosphere was CHILL! The service was PROMPT and FRIENDLY! Overall would highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple Shrimp

-BwMq3WQ_BTPNI9t66Oo-Q.text: Delicious food, excellent service and pleasant quieter atmosphere . We really enjoyed the tableside guacamole dish. Surprisingly the yummy cilantro rice was a hidden gem - hard  to stop eating and my carnitas enchiladas were excellent. Thanks

Dvfv4DRZN1xGJT8a3vvVSQ.text: I have been here a couple of times before, and really enjoyed my food! But my last experience was about 2 months ago...I watched a server taste not once but twice, a customers margarita! At first I thought he was drinking on the job...nope! He tasted it from the glass and used his finger to either stir or taste it as well...then he walked it over to a customer and handed her the glass...I was mortified. We will not be back.

XJVnO60MU-oICFPFEkSeYg.text: If your not from Vegas try to get over the fact that this restaurant is in the same building smack dab next to a boobie bar. All this aside, the decor was really neat and the food was mighty tasty. The ghost pepper salsa was way over-priced is the only complaint. My husband had the street tacos- cochinitas pibil (double yum), carnitas (yum), and carne asada (Yummo). The salad with avocado dressing was something I could eat daily. Give this place a try, by the way they are non gmo and mostly organic too!

doHYvvv0_g0a-HQ5HCj3UA.text: Great service!  Great food!  We celebrated a 50th birthday. They brought s dessert. Our group of 9 were taken care of. It is next Tina gentlemen's club FYI.

sKYMZaUCKFLHf3ehyfkE_Q.text: Ditto for what everyone else said. Came for lunch on Tuesday and was at near half capacity. Doesn't look or feel like a strip club inside (even though one is next door).

sT7g_MQ7SemqpRCEbSx9zw.text: Way too expensive for the blah food had chicken enchiladas no flavor salsa's aren't going to thrill you, stay away. Top 50 in US not!!!! Salmon was good but that's not Mexican good.  I have had far better good off of a Roach coach. SKIP this place!

ia9Jzw7Ei8N0O5dHUqur-w.text: What a great little find. Our friends invited us the the El Dorado Cantina. The GPS told us to turn right into the parking lot which is coincidently Sapphires Gentlemen's club. The restaurant is right next door! Always good to start the morning off with a chuckle. We walked into the restaurant which has the walls appointed in a red  motif with wood finishing. It is just funky enough to be cool & hip with big screens so you can watch sports. Ok, enough about that...how about the food? I applaud this restaurant, they are Non GMO and source their food  from sustainable farms. Our server was very pleasant & immediately brought us fresh chips & 3 kinds of salsa. Debby ordered guacamole which was prepared fresh table side and delicious. We shared steak quesadillas & queso fundido. Our friends had the mole combination platter that could have fed the table. Great food! Will return here.

cSOIA1PNySHSqRD3Byb1dg.text: Food was tastier than any restaurant we tried on the strip and more reasonably priced too. Empanadas were delicious and gluten free! Flan was the best I've ever had. Joseph served us at the bar and was very friendly and personable.

lC8viTe_rVAqzaTFd5j4AQ.text: Delicious food, excellent service! Staff was friendly - Rafael was charming and attentive even though it was 6:00 am. Make an effort - get over here 'cause this place is awesome!

dQPGhUQogvEocWu_etaMLw.text: Best food. They always have specials. The salsa is fresh & amazing. Paco makes a mean flan! Long story short: GET HERE!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4Z52HoKowUhVbrPS_dCdbQ.text: Googled best Mexican food in Vegas (preferably off strip) and El Dorado kept appearing.  We just happened to be staying close by so thought we would try it out.  Glad I had read the reviews prior to prepare my family about the location.  Same parking lot and building shares wall with a gentleman's club.  But did not feel that effected our experience.   El Dorado definitely had a Vegas unique Mexican feel to it.  We started with he table side guacamole that was TDF!  So flavorful.  Yummy homemade chips and salsa.  Can definitely get full with that!  We ordered and share the steak/chicken fajitas and the shrimp/chicken enchiladas both with a very tasty green sauce.  The steak was so tasty.  We really enjoyed the food, ambiance of the restaurant and our server. Definitely coming back here when in Vegas!!!!

oKiiac2_hRLWYwiR6_RKyg.text: OH. MY. GAWD. THESE TACOS ARE AMAZING!! Service is great food is so much better. Thursday $20 all you can eat tacos, you can go wrong. You better try it!

cST60R8rdAihlfZhn70vng.text: Ambiance gets a star alone, right when you walk in you forget you're in a sketch area next to a strip club. The set up is elegant with chandeliers and dim lighting but they also have a couple of tvs, the bar is easy to access in the middle of the restaurant.   Service was prompt, our server Juan was nice and attentive, chef Paco even came out and introduced himself as well, very classy.   Taco sampler: $42 comes with 10 street tacos of your choice. We tried them all, the only one that stood out to us had pork & pineapple.   Las Wings: $12.50 for 6 wings, theses were mediocre as well.   Mojito: $13 lacked mint and alcohol.   Flan: Amazing! Creamy, and had the perfect amount of sweetness and a great consistency. I would come back just for the flan.

QNVwlHxaSDdcwYxgUQbHRA.text: Deliciousness! Great service from Enrique and great food from Chef Paco! Gracias amigos!

93ce7DG63bdZuz9Y9bBseQ.text: Awesome Mexican Food, as authentic as you can get, Chef Paco came out to talk with us, can't wait to try other dishes.

e-iupBLCTC1TI5qXk2LNaA.text: Absolutely delicious lunch today. Warmly welcomed and looked after by Erika and Diego. Yummy 'table constructed' guacamole. Awesome cooking by Paco who's flan was as great as we had heard. Looking forward to coming back when next in Vegas.

FBBti2lybUTBrITbhjI5JA.text: Oh man. This place is amazing. I went here with some pals because we were craving something organic and with a south-of-the-boarder flair. The guacamole is made right in front of your table, and the fajitas come out piping hot and full of delicious flavor.  The restaurant itself neighbors a strip club, yes, but don't let that freak you out. Between the great service( shout out to Christian and Neil!) and the amazing food, this place works wonders. Chef Pacos' flan was amazing, and when he (yes, the executive Chef)came and introduced himself to our table he informed us that it was his Grandmas' recipe- how unique and great is that!? Order that flan, then thank me later)  Do yourself a huge favor and request to sit in Rorke's section. That guy is dedicated, positive and his knowledge on the food was truly impressive. If you're lucky enough to have him as your server, you'll get a lot of great suggestions that will satisfy your Mexican cuisine craving. Go here! It's muy delicioso.

DaF8rpaBa7chKfoa-YBLIA.text: So excellent! We are sitting here, wondering how long it'll be before we are comfortable enough to move again. El Dorado's large portions and friendly service are only eclipsed by their Organic, sourced menu.

nh8OqcZ0glxknSErKntuAA.text: Highly recommend this place if you're looking for authentic Mexican cuisine in Vegas. We were here for New Year dinner. Great food, ambience and friendly staff!

cL0VeRHOYNuiVRp909zqIg.text: My boyfriend is Mexican, ergo his standards of Mexican food are understandably high. To our delight, El Dorado Cantina has exceeded both our expectations both times we've visited in the last month.  I cannot emphasize enough that the food here is beyond 10/10. Do not let the gluten free/GMO free promotional aspect taint your vision, if that's what the thought of "healthier" food does to your foodie appetite. We have ordered a variety of food from all over the menu- Mexican corn, imperial shrimp (oh my wow!), aguachile, milanesa tortas, carne asada burritos, shrimp tacos, flan, tres leches, agua fresca, pineapple margaritas...and not to forget the ever so fabulous gratis chips and salsa to start (make sure you request the habanero salsa if you dig spicy). Everything is FANTASTIC. Hot, fresh, super flavorful. Even the sides of cilantro rice and beans are moist and packed with flavor, and we all know how disappointingly bland those traditional sides can be at a Mexican joint.  What knocked off that last star from 5/5 was the fact both times we went, service was a little slow. At one point we had to physically waive down our server as he passed by, which is always an uncomfortable gesture. In their defense, it seems to be a very busy joint regardless of time or day of the week. Nonetheless, we will be back for more soon!

_lwGx_FZ_ayA4_E4hne_Hw.text: Came with my boyfriend on Saturday night and had a pretty horrible experience. The host, who was amazing btw, told us there would be a 10 minute wait so we decided to get a drink at the bar. The bartender was very prompt and made us really good drinks. When our table was ready we waited for our server, Enrique, for 10 minutes, but he never came. Instead, Jesus took our apetizer order. We ordered "chicken sopes" but got steak ones. The food runner brought our corrected order, and still no sign of our "server" ***20 mins later. We decided we would move back to the bar. The bartender was really fast and nice but then messed up in our beans order. Gave us both pinto, even though we ordered black. Enrique delivered our food and said "I see you guys moved from my section, that's not nice," trying to be funny!! I replied " sorry did you take my app order?" And he was like "no, that was my boy Jesus" I was like "oh, because no one ever came back." At that point I lost faith on this place. Kai was really good but I just can't get over the server. We were so excited after the amazing reviews, but we will not be coming back.

x8qyKcrWV6wQwMAUH8429A.text: Loved it! Delicious veggie choices and great atmosphere. Great service just overall 10/10

qSX05Wg8MY62kzqI7JHIAQ.text: Excellent food and friendly and efficient staff. Our waitress, Camille, was very attentive and helpful, especially since we were first time customers. She had great suggestions. Wide variety on the menu. Two of us shared the delicious tamarind mango ceviche and an entree, the mole' sampler. Portions are huge.  The manager, Doris, stopped by several times and was so welcoming. We will be back.

Qm33eVCv_UM_he4YSm32pg.text: Decent Mexican food -- COOL that the place is open 24/7!!!   While I don't think I'll ever be there at 3AM, it's nice to know that it's available.  For being well off the LV Strip, I think the prices are quite high, especially compared to the portion of food.    After seeing the prices in the menu, my friend & I assumed the portions would be large so we skipped any appetizers and just got entrees, plus ate the chips & salsa, which they were a little slow in re-filling -- one of those deals where they're somehow oblivious to the chips & salsa bowls being empty as they walk by you, but do notice your alcoholic drink being empty and eagerly ask if you want another one.   They did the same with my iced tea -- free refills seems to mean you've got to take the initiative to stop a server & ask for a refill at this place.   Obviously, the strip club on the other side of the wall makes a profit by charging customers extremely high prices for drinks, but in-return, the customers get to see naked women -- plenty of customers find fair value in that.  But the Mexican restaurant-side of the wall somehow thinks they can use a similar pricing scheme, despite no windows looking into the strip club or any special ambiance -- Both places are located in a rather grimy & seedy section of Vegas.    I was still a little hungry when we left.  It's not cool to leave a restaurant after paying decent $$ for a dinner and immediately having to think about getting more food somewhere in a couple hours...    The only things that make this place interesting & possibly worth a visit are that it's open 24/7, and that it's built into the side of the Sapphire strip club, so at times, perhaps often, there's one or more strippers/cocktail servers/hostesses there taking a break or getting food before/after their work shift for immature/desperate guys (yeah, me too!) look at.  Sorry kids, the strip club has a totally separate entrance, so you're not going to see any boobies.       PLENTY of better (overall value, flavor, ambiance) Mexican restaurants around, but if you're a 'people-watcher,' this place may be fascinating to dine at around 2-4AM, assuming some of the strip-club clientele leave that place with any $$ left.

_YO8HwCxPcILJkjYDpmrSw.text: My first time. And it definitely will not be my last. The food, perfect. Service, exemplary. Atmosphere, cozy.   I only have great things to say about this place. My 87 year old mother discovered it from the Food Channel. I am so happy she did.  I will recommend El Dorado. It literally was the best Mexican food I have ever had. The food is fresh, tasty, savory, hot, textural...I could go on and on. Oh, and presentation, wondrous.  Chef Paco arrived after dinner with a parting gift. It was a delicious creamsicle like concoction, served with fresh fruit, orchids in a frozen hollowed out orange. Why yes, thank you Chef!  I will never go to Vegas again and not visit El Dorado. BTW, it's next to a strip club. Didn't bother me, nor should it you.  Sit in Grace's section. She is lovely, happy to help and very pleasant. I can't say enough about how much we enjoyed her service.  Until the next time, I'll be dreaming of the shrimp burrito...

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1amzcU7nRK2uwHT3OgSZUg.text: Emily was our server, and she was sweet. Our food was HOT, and delicious. The guacamole they make next to your table was the best guacamole I've ever had, and I'm normally not a fan. Nachos were HUUUGE. I have a whole extra meal and half leftover of nachos. Only thing I would change is the size of my margarita. Definitely not big enough, otherwise very good food.

ZHlc6q3PxkAf_4oOILIDdA.text: Terrible service!! The food is amazing, probably the best in town, but plan ahead cause you'll be there for a while.

MyjMby6TKXgoLDpdVzNHHw.text: Jay jay and Paola were amazing today thank you guys so much ... chef Paco always knows what hits the spot

w6OG8HAyWAt9te5vw1V0WA.text: Camille was our server and was amazing! Try the jalapeno margaritas and shrimp burritos! Sooooo good and filling!

-OkD8tFbKKP-T46JIWHKLA.text: After seeing the 2 year in a row top 100 in the US billboards along the road we ventured over one morning and the Uber drive was perplexed when we pulled into the parking lot of a well known strip club not realizing the restaurant is on the same building.  :)  We were one of only 3 people in the place, as I presume most of the business is dinner/lunch.   Very clean and a nice decor.  The staff was very friendly.  The food, just OK.  I would not return.  I wish after that we had gone with out original decision but and ate elsewhere, but it is what it is.  The food was good, just not what the hype is all about, I am surprised about all the 5 star reviews.  We did not have breakfast food we had regular dinner entree, food was a bit dry, not much green chile etc, We dine out a lot, and again perhaps the ambiance and they hype of the evening makes it better?  Not sure, but there are far better places in my opinion.  Close to the stip, about a $8 Uber ride one way.

getfa7evVazRe34cS5de2w.text: The food was great and the service was even better. Stella was our server and she was super helpful. We got the table side guacamole and she made it perfectly! Chef Paco even came out and greeted every table to ensure that all the food was within his expectations, that is quality control! We will definitely be back!

_ENThiby1_bA5zbNYCx-uA.text: Jeffrey gives unparalleled service every time we visit El Dorado. Today was no different - he makes our day every time we come. Quick, tailored service, with plenty of jokes to boot. We love El Dorado because of Jeffrey :).

j91R90MBdB6u3IuyLdBk7Q.text: I can't believe the high marks this place received. I honestly don't know why. The food was below average; filled with cilantro and cumin in quantities that would make anyone gag.   I can't emphasize it enough - MEXICAN FOOD IS NOT ALL CUMIN AND CILANTRO.   The waiter prepared guacamole table-side. He had bowl fulls of cilantro, and all sorts of other stuff. When I asked him to leave 90% of what he brought out, he took some offense. He said that it wasn't the way they made it in Mexico. Well, considering I've made guacamole (and have ordered guacamole) in a few hundred places all over Mexico - I'm thinking he was referring to the Mexico where his neighborhood Taco Bell is located.  And while I'm at it - let's discuss guacamole. I know the hipster foodie trend is to throw mango chutney, cumin, cilantro, lime, raisins (yes, I've seen raisins) in guacamole. That's not guacamole - that's a mess. Guacamole is EXCRUCIATINGLY simple: Avocado. Tomato. Onion. A touch of fresh garlic. If you're feeling up to it...a touch of green chili (ortega or japapeno). NO LIME. Doesn't need it.   There is no flavor more sublime than avocado. Add lime (tartness) and you're changing the character of the avocado. Why do you have to change it? Of course, I'm also going to hear "but it keeps the guacamole from turning brown". Use the avocado pits after you make the guacamole - they keep the avocado from turning brown already...but don't use lime or lemon. Please, don't ruin your avocado. It's expensive enough as it is. Be kind. Keep your guacamole simple and fresh.  Let's get a little more detailed, shall we? I learned to make mole (moh-leh) from my mom - who learned from her mom, who learned from her mom, etc. You have to use unsweetened chocolate in the recipe - not semi-sweet or even "dark chocolate". Unfortunately, that's exactly what this place uses - semi-sweet chocolate in their mole. Don't bother with the mole. For lack of a better word...it sucks.  Going back? Never. It just isn't worth it. Too expensive for someone's idea of what Mexican food is supposed to be.

VeHhaygea3o6BareMQlIgA.text: Food was amazing. New favorite Mexican restaurant. Our waitress Shannon was top notch. Will be back

TsiL-EFrJCCbaE62hFsOkQ.text: Honestly I don't seek out organic or non-GMO restaurants but it's nice to have this option.    My friend was in town who loves Mexican food but not a breakfast person.  Where do we go at 9:30 in the morning? El Dorado that's open 24 hours.  Plus I enjoy the shock factor of it being connected to a strip club.  Kinda freaks people out.  Walking in during the morning hours give you your choice of seating.  We sat in a clean and comfy booth to enjoy our meal.  Service was great.  Our waiter was so funny and very attentive.    Chips and salsa were brought out immediately for a good starter.  The green and red salsa have great flavors.  I probably chowed down on way too many chips.  Of course that wouldn't stop me from ordering the combo fajitas of chicken and shrimp.  The sizzling skillet is generously filled with meat and veggies.  The chicken and shrimp have a good flavor with much leftover to take home.  Since I am a fan of heat, I asked if they had hot sauce.  Strangely they have none to offer.  Their option is their habanero salsa.  The fact that I have to pay extra for this was another oddity.    Now my friend ordered the Queso Mexicano tacos.  She immediately mentioned how spicy the taco was and didn't see any indication on the menu that these had a flare.  I was thinking to myself ~ she's from the midwest and just can't handle a little spice.  I was wrong.  She had me take a bite and my mouth was on fire.  We asked the waiter about the spice and he didn't know that they were supposed to be spicy.  After his chat with the kitchen he found out the pepper oil in the sauce gave it extreme heat.  Yikes!  If you can handle the heat then this is fine.  Otherwise douse the taco in sour cream to even out the flavor.  The habanero salsa tasted like mild after that.  It does help their dishes are served with their amazing rice.  Maybe just a hint of cilantro which doesn't bother me.  The rice is light with a buttery flavor that you can't hate.    With the Yelp check in you receive their famous Flan.  Certainly this is the best flan I've ever had.  It's the perfect little creamy dessert to finish a meal.    The hours are definitely convenient with great service.  In my opinion they are a bit pricey for mexican food but I won't shy away from visiting again.
