tdY511RZ8t3WeZTcGPDIpw.text: Another good visit to El Dorado Cantina. As always we sat at the bar. We absolutely love the attention the hard working bar staff there gives us. Our cocktails were perfect.  Table side guac was terrific. Created just as we asked, just the right amount of spice. The salsas there are also always delicious.   Dinner arrived. Fish tacos for my husband. He said they were fantastic. Veggie tacos for me. Need some work, plain and nearly raw. Lacking spice. So much more could have been done to make this dish better. In fairness, I did not report this to the bartender as the restaurant had become very busy and we had a show to attend. Hopefully this review will inspire some improvement in the vegetarian options offered.   We enjoyed our experience and look forward to returning many times to come. Highly recommend.

HVmS6UKMNkgWJtbBnTeGMw.text: El Dorado Cantina has fresh flavors, an organic menu and an extensive menu. We booked reservations on Open Table making getting seated a breeze. The restaurant shares a wall with the famous sapphire club but you enter in a different door. Perfect if you have kids coming with you.   My husband had the Mexican Burger and when I asked him how it was, he said "I give it a 9" which is a stellar review for my husband. At other restaurants, his normal response would be "it's not that bad." My husband is of Latin decent so he was happy with the spices and flavors. We had the fresh guacamole which they make at the table. Our waitress is named Grace. We enjoyed talking with her while she made our guacamole and the service we received from her was excellent. I had the lettuce wrap tacos which were very refreshing and ranged around $16.  If you love flan, the flan here CAN NOT be missed. It's perfect. It's buttery, smooth and creamy. I'm our world, it goes down as legendary.

J_irDODAPSYzTfDsKHF0JA.text: Get the tableside guac! Our server Jessica was so lovely and accommodating! The food was great! I ate entirely way too much and regretted none of it. The chef even came out and greeted us, I was very impressed by the service all around! Come through for at least a margarita, and don't forget the guac!

Mt5o0ZHstDSURSH9kJdl2g.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in town, in fact my favorite Mexican restaurant of all time! Love the signature bowl with steak. Girlfriend loves the veggie tacos. Service was great, Manager Martine welcomed us at our table and Chef Paco personally brought our dessert and greeted us, it was a nice personal touch, definitely made us feel special.  I recommend this place to all my friends who visit Vegas.

mV5P__I-N2Cj3p7wv6siZA.text: Food is amazing. Please try the Chicken Burrito and also cant beat a meal that is good at midnight as well as midday.

My first one..nothing more aggravating  then seeing whole crew behind  bar. And no one to help.. only one that acknowledged us was JESUS.  So thank you Jesus. Won't  be returning!

MhL6TXMFPXgpONiPpDMtrA.text: Really? Charge for chips and salsa? Complementary most restaurants.  Whats next charge for napkins and toothpicks?

2AhT625ecbo0JeVBjJprIQ.text: Definitely enjoyed the food here... had a little bit of a problem with mixed up plates and some entrees taking much longer than the others, but in the end they made up for it with great service, and extra attention during the dessert time.  I really liked the Carne Asada plate, which also came with a grilled cactus that was delicious. The dessert was great, the flan, and the churros were yummy.  The location was a little funny being next to a gentleman's club, and there was a scary dude like crying or something in the parking lot, but there was a security guard there.  I like that it's 24 hours.  Also, heard there are locals discounts on mondays, that's a plus in my book!

rICYI7PqQn1gRn0RaBYSLw.text: Finally some good food in Vegas! We started with some table side guac and then I had the Carnitas Rojas burrito, which was AMAZING. So much flavor! The meat, the cilantro rice, the avacado salsa... Just so good! Several at our table had Carne Asada and said it was delicious as well. We finished with some tasty flan, which ranks among the best I've ever had. Great service as well! Our waiter, Neil was super friendly and when half of our table's food took awhile to arrive, the manager generously comped some of our bill. I highly recommend El Dorado!

uCWmewaCr7TBt9bsSTT-kw.text: My favorite spot in town.  They're always having great deals, specials and events. Service is always good & Chef Paco comes out, always checking on his customers and asking about the food. The carne asada is amazing, awesome margaritas and tres leches is the best desert. I find out all their great deals and specials through FB....until Thursday, where I'll post about their tacos and beer for $19.99!

cv69b3Geulr-D7_Nl3arNQ.text: El Dorado, the city of gold and the restaurant of filth. That's great your food is organic an gmo free but it still tastes like shit I've had better Mexican food out of a can, the service is terrible, the beer is flat and the bartenders suck, and how are you gonna charge $15 for guac are you fucking serious get outta here, also they don't wash their glasses, if your gonna eat there bring your own silverware (byos) or just save yourself the $50 dollars and go to Taco Y Taco and get some real street corn and tacos for less that taste better.. The only reason this place has good Yelp reviews is because they bribe people with free desert for a good review..

Ib7Knye3x7yPlM9CVHyLOQ.text: The food is really good here in had the street tacos that were really good. Only negative was that my Margarita was really salty. I even asked for one with no salt on the rim and it was still quite salty to me. But overall a good place to eat. Setting is coo and for us guys makes it even better that it's next door to a pretty good strip club here in Vegas. Service is good as well just kinda slow during happy hour. The Flan is really good and the Chef is extremely nice even came out to personally give us our Flans.

1eYAGzoKoOLpP45Ts5R4oA.text: I took about 20 people to this restaurant for a business function. The food was pretty good, the service was great, and the drinks were tasty. The prices were very reasonable. The only thing to be aware of is that the restaurant is in the same building as the "world's largest strip club". Be aware of this when booking. There are no strippers in the restaurant and doesn't seem to be any kind of walkway between the two venues, but their front doors are right next to each other. Overall it was a good experience once we got over the shock of pulling a van full of business people into a strip club parking lot.

zzypTBBEREJYKp5-QlzLpQ.text: This place was absolutely amazing, our server was Amber and she was fantastic. We enjoyed the Tuesday specials and had the best guacamole I have ever had in my life... we met Paco the executive chef and he served us an amazing flan..  a must try

2iiY9MYLB9QqGx4oMPl2mQ.text: Awesome food...the Chicken Feinstein is outstanding...tres leches cake and fried ice cream was great...taquitos awesome...tequila selection is great...overall, a gem here in the dessert

3GlKkGsxmqhRNpWexF0Q8w.text: Food was amazing! Started with the queso fundido and shared the chicken/shrimp fajitas. All was so flavorful and cooked to perfection. Also, the cilantro lime rice was to die for! Martine checked on us to assure we had an enjoyable dinner and said we should try the flan for dessert... Chef Paco brought it out to us (which happened to be the best flan ever)! Highly recommend!!!

ERy6A98ipJG0e0INFPTlNA.text: Yelp Reviews  Setting: Hidden outside slightly outside of the strip on Sammy Davis Jr Drive. Between W. Desert Inn Rd and West Sahara Rd. It's literally located next to the Sapphire (world's largest gentlemen's club). I'll guarantee that you'll see the sign for Sapphire before you noticed El Dorado Cantina.   Service: The experience started off sour when another party was seated, who came in after us... We were told by another staff member to wait as they cleaned tables up... I would suggest better communication and training.   Greg acknowledge the incident and was a great host. He deeply apologize to us and was attentive to all of our party needs. He provided great suggestions based on our flavor profile and was extremely pleased.   Food: Don't get scared away by the $$. You not only get large portions. They are also a non-GMO restaurant. They also have a huge selection of vegetarian and gluten-free items.   Chip and Salsa - Fresh Crispy chips and flavored rich salsa profile.  Nacho - This is a nacho you need to share between a group of 3+ people. Even in my party of three people. It was a lot to handle  Posole Soup - It was quite possibly my favorite soup, especially on a cold winter night. The deep taste of cumin, bright splashes of lime and cilantro, the light bite of hot sauce, this Posole recipe has it all!   Quesadilla - Extremely cheesy and full of flavor for such a small bite.  Flan - Had such a flavor rich jello.   Fried Ice Cream - Perfect amount of fried ness and crunchiness   WiFi (For Yelpin + Insta): Yas! However, there is low lighting! Hard to take photos of the yummy food.   Overall: I had a good experience overall! I would rate it 5/5. I would highly suggest coming back.

YI6ToMe_8_X1xDETUgsF_Q.text: Authentic & Organic Mexican Food!  Hubby and I were looking for a place to have dinner on our first night in Vegas & with all the reviews, we were convinced! I'm writing this review as I wait for my churros lol  Tonight we had the steak & chicken fajitas, cheese fondue, shrimp tacos & of course the margaritas!  The food was delicious! Drinks had me buzzin it a little after the first one! (Yeah, I know, weak sause) lol  I ordered the Cadillac Margarita, Watermelon margarita & a pina colada! All were super yummy! My husband had nothing but great things to say about his food. The streak was thinly sliced and oh so good! We definitely recomend! Ask for Angel! He was amazing!

fxnAkq0z-egF0gmGEm8TMQ.text: This is absolutely the best Mexican restaurant in all of Las Vegas. I am a local and this is the ONLY place I come for Mexican food. They have vegetarian options like bowls, burritos, nachos, quesadillas and veggie tacos.  The food is fresh & ORGANIC !!  Large dejection of margaritas  Server was Jeffrey & he was excellent. Always great customer service. Aug 1st -- our Server Erica gave us complimentary flan !!  Monday's are locals & 25% discount

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bar

b1-9BwSIUxZbLHreQ7Dnrg.text: I would come back to this restaurant 10 out of 10 times. The quality and quantity of food services here definitely justified the price. The portion sizes were pretty much enough for 2 people to eat one meal.   Let's start with their guacamole. After deliberation with my partner, we determined it was the best tasting guac we've ever had. To our surprise, our waitress rolled a cart over to our table and started making fresh guac right in front of us. We were able to customize the flavor to the spice levels that we enjoyed. The flavors were perfectly parlance and the avocados used were so fresh.   We also ordered the chicken tostados. The chicken had a Smokey flavor to it, which I liked, but it was one of those overall flavors where I could fully enjoy one but two would be too much.   For dinner we ordered the chicken and shrimp fajita and the carne asada plate. Both meals were beyond excellent. The meats were perfectly seasoned, juicy, and tender. The sides were also very flavorful. Only complaint is my fajita came with so much chicken and 3 pierce of shrimp.   The service was excellent.   The restaurant is also open 24 hours so it's a quality late night meal. You can make a reservation online through yelp, which is cool because we were seated immediately.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OIFmrqRXWHL0o8HUMOAYTA.text: Great spot, strange location.....  right next door to a strip club. Must be affiliated.  I went with two female coworkers and they made me walk up first to make sure it wasn't located inside.  Once the coast was clear, we went in and the place was very nice.  The decor is great, the drinks are great albeit a little pricey, and the menu is awesome.  I had the lettuce wrap steak tacos and the flavor was amazing.  They make super fresh table side guacamole that looked delish.  My coworkers had cheese enchiladas with verde sauce and the other had a carne asada burrito. Both were awesome.    Like I said, cocktails were expensive. Three margaritas and three Moscow mules: $102.00!  Yikes!  Definite must hit for the food.  Oh, did I mention they have been listed as the top 100 restaurants in the U.S.?  Well done!

F7FrUZ9IT7-GjSMHskIagg.text: So I'm officially a regular. Tuesdays are great. Can't beat the Don Julio $6 a shot special. Came in and my usual bartender, Whitney, was there. She knew my drink Don Julio chilled and got it right away. I also got chips and water as soon as I sat down. I love the video food menu. It helps in my decision on my order. Whitney as always is on top of everything. Those 1942 shots go down so quickly. Lol. And she's so nice. And, as also, Doris , the manager, is great.   She helps out with making sure the place is cleaned up and looks great. She talks to customers and makes sure they are satisfied.  Can't say enough about this place!!!  This place rocks!!!!  Didn't think I was going to make it here this week. But made it happen. Usually I come here in the afternoon in Tuesday-for my Don Julio fix.  But made it by 6:30pm. This place was busy. You'd think it was Friday night. Everything was amazing as usual. Got the shrimp celantro. Delicious!  I was nervous about the service considering the amount of clientele but was pleasantly surprised. Three words-Jazz, Jazz, Jazz. He was on top of everything. He's behind the bar and makes sure people are taken care of.  From chips to water to just basically making sure you are taken care of. What a stand up server. Please go see him. You won't be disappointed. All of the servers are great but jazz really makes it quite the experience. And don't forget to see Whitney behind the bar during the day. She rocks   So another great time at el dorado cantina. My girl, Whitney the bartender, was there to take of me as she always does. She is spot on with everything. This place has new specials. Lobster tacos are amazing. And as always, Don Julio 1942 shots are the best deal in town on Tuesdays. Doris, the manager, is great. So friendly and accommodating. She said they were featured on local news, which is no small feat. I met chef Raphael. He was kind enough to introduce himself. This place is over all 5 star- staff, food, ambiance. And they're opening a new place in summerlin this fall. I will let all of my summerlin friends know. Don't miss out on this place. Oh and they have happy hour too!!!!!!!

_8HAB23pIAeVhvcLCHAgXA.text: One of my favorite Mexican food places, the location is pretty funny if you're not offended by strip clubs but the restaurant itself is very cool. The dishes are locally sourced as possible and done very well. It's not cheap but very much worth it. My only caveat would be to stay mindful of the heat levels-spicy foods make my face swell up and I e been caught off guard at just how spicy some things have been (looking at you soup!). Service is good, ample parking next to the strip club. Vegetarian options too!!

LoNNHliM1RVcTg2OSUoOQw.text: Skip. We ordered this to our hotel- by the time we got our order it was cold. Would definitely look at more delivery friendly places than this.

fE95zDWcyzXNWmLNMQmj2A.text: We were visiting Las Vegas and had to hurriedly eat dinner en route to a show. We stopped by El Dorado, where they graciously took us despite being in between shifts, therefore short staffed. They problem solved and made sure that our order was taken promptly (training the bus boy on the spot, and he was awesome!). They accommodated my parents' cantankerous behavior, their embarrassing complaining and anxiety about getting out of their on time for the show. But the best part was that their food was incredible! I can't wait to return when I'm free of parental whining and not under time constraints. The staff didn't miss a beat despite our challenging party. The manager even asked us what show we were going to see and gave us some tips!

obqtuCDZHOmX_5dTUU2GCQ.text: DON'T EVEN CONSIDER TAKING YOUR KIDS HERE.  There may be a "separate entrance" from the strip club, but these businesses share the same location.  Thus, the entrances are right next to each other, you have to drive into the strip club driveway, park in the strip club lot, and get an eyeful of all the beautiful strip club signage.  It's a real treat for your unsuspecting family.  The billboards make this restaurant appear to be something very different than it actually is.  Check for pubes in your "tableside guacamole."

bM-zETq2QQPF71MrJGCjeA.text: This place is as good as it gets.  Very original tasting Mexican food and I mean that in the best way possible. It was delicious!

fWKMR0lFzC-V3OxHQLN1pw.text: This place was amazing! Erica our server anticipated all our needs. We came with our baby and right away brought us a cheese quesadilla without us even asking for it. The food was great and probably one of the best Pozole I've ever had! Rudolpho also brought in great personality and kept us entertained throughout our meal!

4cHsGGb0Nz8gHZso6BEcug.text: Food is always good, breakfast is great BUT I am so sad to see the grasshoppers go  They were so good and this was the only place in Vegas you could get them

5oLdikoZMDftfd2fwrXr7w.text: While I'm out visiting Vegas, a family member recommended this restaurant. Willing to check it out I was unsure about it when I pulled up. The restaurant itself is attached to a strip club so I figured it was prob not the best place but still decided to give it a try. When walking in the atmosphere was so nice! We sat in a semi circle booth and right away we were served. The menu had a variety of different options to choose. We finally decided on the table side guacamole, shrimp taquitas and seafood enchiladas. We also ordered the Cadillac margarita which features premium alcohol in a large pitcher, enough to serve 5 drinks.  The best part about the experience was the table maids guacamole. The servers bright along a table and made the guacamole fresh right in front of you and it tasted absolutely amazing! I will definitely come back!

04VelPq5mvchkR1YLUyBXQ.text: Let me just start by saying WOW! This place is an incredible little gem. Amazing food and fantastic service, as well as a great selection of tequila and awesome drinks. We started out with margaritas, which were perfectly made. Nice and strong and not too sweet.  Our server Camille suggested the table side guacamole, and it did not disappoint. It was fresh and delicious, with just the right amount of spice and flavor.  My friend also got some phenomenal tacos, and I settled on the cheese enchiladas, both recommended by our server. We were highly impressed by her excellent recommendations. No room for dessert, unfortunately, but we will definitely be back for more of the wonderful food and service. Thank you Camille!!!

You guys were super busy, the restaurant was at capacity, and she was fantastic! I appreciate a server who does a great job, and she handled our table of 6 adults perfect display of relaxed competence. Well done!  Mr.  Eldorda cantina... if you don't give her a raise I am hiring her!!

The Margaritas were for real - like the kind you would find at a fine Mexican resort, the tequila is not an afterthought. And, when we decided to have a bite to complement our drinks, Erica, our server was not only helpful but consistently checking on us for anything.   We ordered the Empanadas, Oueso Fundido, and a Carnitas Quesadilla. ALL were more than amazing... including Erica!  You won't be disappointed.

-plTM7yAgRLw-9c8tKgx2Q.text: Great dinner tonight at El Dorado!  Quest Fundido, carne asada burrito and cheese enchiladas were fantastic!  Top off with amazing flan for dessert and made for a great dinner!

uS6GwTnh-6wEBIDD82vAnA.text: Tacos cochinitos and Flan was amazing ! Customer service is great. Definitely coming back.

65kW7n6jethPheikXqQ2Rw.text: They just changed from half off on Mondays for locals, to only 25%. Boooooo. ____________________________________________________________________  I almost don't want to write a review, so that I can keep this my own secret place. Loved everything. Fantastic service, starting in the parking lot and ending with a personal visit from the chef. They made the guac and margaritas at the table fresh for us. All organic and gmo free. Great flavors, great prices. I've never had flan that I liked before, until we tried the chef's grandmother's recipe. Yum! A little hard to find, just go to the north valet parking lot entrance of the strip club...open 24 hours. I will be back!   (The only thing I wish was that the TVs not be in the dining room...bar is understandable,  but they distract from the lovely red silk wallpaper and ambiance of the dining room)

4PU_oRPadxiCPpTHnmK2vQ.text: I must begin by saying that be warned this restaurant is part of Sapphire Gentlmen's Club located OFF of the strip but not too far.  I had to share that because it caught my boyfriend and I off guard (More him than me given it was his first time in Vegas).  While it is part of Sapphire it is separate in the sense that it has its own entrance and you are not at all exposed to the scene.    Now as for the restaurant.  Its a nice restaurant, and we were pleasantly surprised by the food.  We started with fresh guacamole, which was a bit more salty than what we prefer.  For dinner I ordered the Chicken Enchiladas with black beans and rice, and had the Torta de Milanesa.  We both really enjoyed our food.  The salsa on my enchiladas was divine.    The Flan we had for dessert was one of the most delicious I have ever had.  It was thicker and creamier than most.  It was simply fantastic!  The quality and portion of the food along with the price, make this a winner in Vegas.  It was easily the cheapest meal we had and for the price one of the best.    If you are in Vegas this is worth your time!

qktjadAJ0v1HKmxLTnmG3g.text: Free chips and salsa was awesome. The carne asada burrito was really big and filling! The Flan for dessert was amazing!  Maria took really good care of us and invited us back for the 25% off for locals on Monday.

ooebytFmJ83Zc65BTi3LxA.text: Stopped in the other day took a seat at the bar and was not disappointed at all. My server Justin killed it with impeccable service and made one killer margarita! Would recommend the cochinita tacos they were spot on, and in my opinion the best I have ever had. Everything here is on point from the staff to the food, so you definitely get your moneys worth here.

HURPz7Qp99_djqRzmWlmfA.text: Las Vegas has finally woken up.  It's about time they have a restaurant offering those of us who have been craving for delicious vegan, gluten free, and pesticide free fine dining.  AND the taste is phenomenal.  My husband is pescatarian (fish and veggies only) so this was the perfect place for us.  Do not miss the table side guacamole and the street tacos they are to die for.  We enjoy those along with some bottomless gluten free chips and salsa until our dinner entrees arrived. I had the Cochinita Pibil and my husband had the Tropical Mahi.  The pork is organically sourced and Mahi is wild caught.  But the citrus habanero sauce is worth going on and on about.  Sweet tasting on the front then be prepared for the long after burn.  The flavor is out of this world.  Oh and the Cochinita is wonderful too.  I am so blown away by this awesome place.  I definitely recommend this place for everyone especially those who have a restricted diet to follow.

CoM5rYXVn1ZhdZ8dAIM-JQ.text: This location is connected to Saphires, but has a separate entrance. It has a cool ambiance with cool light fixtures, tvs, red walls, lots of booths and community tables. Food is amazing and and no GMOs in any of the food items. Panini the server is amazing and sweet!!!! My first time here to this hidden gem. Will def be back.

BAwt1cikwrQuWjlgNfg49g.text: Service was slow and unfriendly. Food was decent, but not outstanding. Margaritas were not properly made. Food was not flavorful, but the chips and salsa were on point.

vFBCy-qaD063BiewgX9jhg.text: El Dorado is my absolute favorite mexican restaurant here in Las Vegas! It has a great atmosphere and the food the best! Their tableside Guacamole is a must. The street tacos are amazing, and don't forget the cilantro lime rice! Our server, Grace, went above and beyond to make our experience one of a kind! We are loyal guests!

SPLwQQH4TFAJr2s7QaqInA.text: Wow.  Gotta ask for Jose.  Don't buy a car from him but do take his recommendation for the food. Spot one!

VKMfQYLH0sNHCQtSiWk5jQ.text: Been here a few times now, and it's been an experience every time! The location is probably the best talking point, as it shares a parking lot with Sapphire Gentleman's Club and is right next door to it in the same building. The service is always fair, never being excellent but they do try their best. They were able to accommodate 12 of us one time with a fold-up table. The food is actually very good, with delicious tacos and most importantly chapulines (fried crickets)! Definitely an experience (you may even spy a stray dancer)!

SoQOwvtALk-DRvuvPpfKTw.text: I moved to Las Vegas in the beginning of the summer. Growing up in San Francisco's Mission District I was spoiled by amazing options for Mexican food. Everything from street tacos to more traditional full plates. I found it hard to find good authentic mexican food once I moved here to Vegas. I tried a few places for just some regular street tacos and was always disappointed.  Well I found my home away from home. El Dorado did not disappoint! Their tacos de Lengua and aguas frescas hit the spot. Tacos de Nopal was cooked to perfection. My son enjoyed their chapulines. And we even fought over the last bite of their delicious flan. My family and I will definitely be back. Thank you Chef for the amazing food and experience.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My son&#39;s first time trying chapulines. He loved them.

IspzU3upmF75NgHqmO-drA.text: Erica was the best server. We had a great lunch here and will definitely be back. The salad wassss huge, tacos super yummy and the guacccc was unforgettable. Must try!

zJ352LVMZ32uTfqp6d1GqA.text: The chips and salsa were good here.  So was the service and the flan.  Wasn't impressed by the entrees though.  I had the al pastor tacos and my s/o had the mole trio.  The al pastor tacos were ok.  However, the meat didn't taste fresh.  The mole was ok, but only one type of preparation.  Also had the mechelada, which was ok.  I would go to Tacos El Gordo for good Mexican.

Also Chef Paco came out to great us and bring out a complimentary flan for myself and family. The best Flan that I have ever had. We need one of these in Los Angeles.

cY2rM_l3xfCGcZ0RDCZ3nw.text: Excellent food!!! Forgot to take pictures of our food. We ordered roasted corn, it was delicious. After that we has veggie taco it was great too bat the end chef pack came to our table and introduce himself  and ask how was everything. Very personal touch. We had complimentary flan from checking in on yelp. I'm glad we did. That flan was out of this world. Yum yum yum. I've never had this kind of flan before. Melts in your mouth. If you r in the area definitely visit this restaurant. Even our server did nice job too. Keep on checking to make sure everything's ok.

YK-Hobdcb4X2irIv1zqLAQ.text: Lovely tasty food, very fresh. Not at all typical everyday Mexican food. Everything six of us had was enjoyed. Great table side guacamole and above average service.

XxUhh3iFO-XTy50at3mnaA.text: First time here at The El Dorado Cantina, we had appetizers, guacamole,chips and salsa, empanadas and tacos de carne asada and beers.service was excellent Thanks Ericka..Paco head chef came out and was awesome..he even gave us tickets to  a Micheal Jackson show..food was on point..very recommended.

uzi_zXqgPemIc1q0o-IR3w.text: I absolutely recommend this place. The service was amazing and the food is delicious. It's always a comforting to know that restaurants are providing fresh ingredients. Chef Paco also came out to meet us and make sure our experience was going great. He is a phenomenal chef with creative creations. He brought samples on the house to try new items which were delicious as well. Even if you're skeptical, I highly recommend giving them a try because they won't disappoint.

Uy9I7dl5cAVJC3gu86bLWA.text: Was great food waitress came by took our order and was gone didn't see her much manager was a kick she was good.  So yes a4is fair and yes will go back

frYWD5bbfqysVVXNeAZFdQ.text: Wow!!  Amazing food - super fresh - everyone in our party loved it.  We order the Mexican chili as an app - super tasty.  I has the pulled chicken burrito, which was out of this world.  Will DEFINITELY go back next time I'm in Vegas

qSQMglQ8bRyzAZB-BRKIuQ.text: Chef Paco is brilliant! We love the organic, non GMO, Gluten Free cuisine! We wish there were more restaurants like this in Vegas! LA could use an El Dorado Cantina! Love the first page of the menu: "We Care Where Your Food Comes From!" They Do! Visit Www.ElDoradoVegas.Com/Farms

V37QXDEq_E-xiEgHkBcrWA.text: Don't let the location fool you!! Find it, find it now, you will not be disappointed. Exec Chef Paco is well versed in a variety of regional Mexican cuisine. The 3 salsas that come with chips are fresh, authentic, and delicious! Great selection of ice cold Mexican beers and one of the best, handmade margaritas I have had in years and I'm from Texas!! Table side guacamole is made to taste and 100% simple fresh ingredients...fab. We had everything from beef fajitas, and taquitos to the more Mexican regional Cochinita Pibil (pork and chilies wrapped in banana leaf), homemade scratch mole (unbelievable...the real deal), and Pork Carnitas.   If you get the chance to meet Chef Paco ask him to tell you about his mothers recipes and do not miss his grandmothers 80 year old flan recipe, it's like velvet. Eldorado is Las Vegas' culinary temple to Mexican food. Well done Chef.  One more thing, service is professional and attentive. Top notch. We had Jesse, you can tell he loves the food too!

D6dGYfjIxSvmRwzl0Rds5g.text: Oh my goodness!  Friendly service.  Prompt service. Everything was so freshly made and full of taste!  Cactus tacos, chicken enchiladas, salads, veggie tacos, chicken tacos were all delicious.  As well as the table side guacamole.  Staff really made us feel appreciated for choosing to have lunch here!

wgqlGAxSF27clEE8wwbDLw.text: Great place! I saw a billboard advertising this restaurant using organic and non-gmo ingredients, so I asked my husband to try this place with me. And we went tonight and had an awesome dinner. The server Jesse was very sincere, courteous and helpful. He started us with tortilla chips and a sample of hibiscus tea. The tea was awesome, the chips was very good. I normally hate chips but I still think theirs was good.  Jesse gave good attention to my intolerance to garlic and went to check with the kitchen to find out what had been pre-marinated with garlic, so that I wouldn't order something that I can't eat. So we ordered the house salad with the cilantro dressing on the side ( as there is garlic in the dressing), but he also brought me one more blue cheese dressing on the side. The salad was very fresh and good quality. The avocado in the salad was very good, it was ripe, fatty and no black color ( which could be commonly seen even in what you can buy in supermarkets). I know it sounded funny but we were really impressed with the quality of the avocado and the other veggie in the salad. I have a very sensitive stomach. I would feel abdominal discomfort if I eat bad veggie. And I had no discomfort but only enjoyment from the salad. So it was great! I liked my blue cheese dressing and my husband likes the cilantro dressing.   For entrees, I ordered the tilapia without garlic butter while my husband ordered carne asada (steak) taco. I was advised not to order the items with steak because they were all pre-marinated with garlic and other seasonings. While I can't  comment on the taco, my husband told me it was awesome. He said it is the best taco he ever had. And I think I also had the best tilapia here too! I never knew that tilapia could taste so good until tonight. I tasted tilapia from other american restaurants before and they never tasted good. But here at El Dorado, their tilapia was made very well! And the chef also made a different sauce for me as I couldn't have the garlic butter. The sauce he made was mango something (forgot the actual name). It was awesome. There was also a balsamic vinegrette on the side in case I didn't like the mango something sauce. And the fish tasted great and went well with either sauce! Their balsamic vinegrette is also very different from what you can find else where. Theirs is very thick, not too sour and has a bit of sweetness. I never like those over sour vinaigrette else where, so I am impressed with their version of balsamic vinegrette.  At the end, the chef gave us a complimentary flan as dessert, and we also ordered a tres leches cake. They were both great. The flan was especially exceptional. Theirs tasted very dense, rich, and I could taste that it was made with all real good ingredients with no fillers like gelatine. It tasted better than any other flan I had in the past (which were very much like gelatine texture). The trees leches cake was good, tasted fresh and the leches sauce has a hint of rum taste. Everything was great and we were very happily filled at the end.  We are happy that we found this place. Please keep up the good work and we are grateful for the big billboard advertisement.

sakQRyJS1gpYucmmu4hShA.text: They accommodated my party of 6 and sat us within 5 minutes. Server was great and attentive. Food and drinks were delicious. The chef came to visit us as well. Excellent and will be back. Neil and chef paco were amazing!

TwKxOga1iwevddD7DZlV9w.text: Great, friendly place. Enrique really knows the menu.  Save room for Chef Paco's flan.

G8iy05RS0BTaTDnNqNllnQ.text: The street tacos were muy delicioso! Both the red and the green salsa were very flavorful with just the right amount of spice. The one and only reason I'm not giving this 5 stars is because all of the wine is organic and $18 per glass!! I'm all about GMO free and organic but that's a little excessive. An $8 or $9 glass of house wine should be offered. Highly recommend. Will definitely go back.

l8FGj08mXnMycQIqbiq0uA.text: My second time to el dorado cantina, requested by many of my friends and it was a success! Only drinking last time (the margaritas are amazing!) So I was excited to order some food this time! I had  one of each of the street tacos and was pleasantly surprised by the range of flavors in EACH taco! My favorite item was the chicken street taco, accompanied by  Cilantro rice &  fresh refried beans really brought the dish together. The fact that my tacos arrived in a doubled traditional corn tortilla, & the waiter prepared my guacamole TABLESIDE, gave this new hot spot serious authenticity! Between the quality, freshness, attention to detail in ALL the flavors, & fantastic atmosphere this will absolutely be somewhere I return again & again!

K-0CunpLG5r6kc4b_bQVsA.text: Amazing service! Great food! Love this place. The flan is exceptional, so are the chips and salsa, and margaritas. I'm so happy it's close to home. :)

Kg1N2XUS54ITgp7AD9Wehg.text: I came back to Eldorado Cantina because my last experience was fantastic. This time I made my reservation for Monday to take advantage of the half off for locals deal, and they were slammed! Even though my server Amber had a full section, she didn't neglect our table one bit! The service was great, and the manager Sean checked on our table a few times and made us feel like VIPs. Thanks again Eldorado Cantina for another perfect night out!

CQ70WwWMeJGO_dHDL16ygA.text: It's an Interesting location, right next to the largest men's club but don't let that influence your decision to try, it's a little gem.  Clean and friendly staffs, my chicken enchiladas was very good.  I liked the ambience too.  Recommend everyone to give it a try.

Aln-8fzscXBrqfS-ez_s7w.text: Awesome restaurant!!!! Nice environment, friendly service and delicious dishes. Juan is our server.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SR80IcCLFlG5dBAt20b3og.text: Just great Mexican food. Completely legit. Service is mediocre but it is Vegas. I did notice something revolting in that the employee in this picture sitting at the bar kept sneezing and touching his hair and then sent behind the bar counter and helped himself to some olives with the same hand. It's flu season FYI...

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LTVRPhMN8vPOpDde4stsgA.text: Grace was fantastic. Best server in the entire world. Promote now!!!  Food was great. Carnitas rajas burrito enchilada style smacked my taste buds like a red headed stepchild... In a good way

xoqxHcXFSydakf-eH9c3rA.text: Love this place! The tableside guacamole is heaven. As are the tacos, all of them. Ask for Juan, and he will give you amazing service.

tflsBlAy5eVW-HJneva7Ww.text: This place has the best cauliflower Tacos ever ! We loved the chips and salsa too . We enjoyed Jess's  recommendations with the food . Her service was awesome

UZwaIWkX8hGt83_35OY-qw.text: Another Vegas place I would not have found if it were not for Yelp.  El Dorado Cantina is a great chill place to have a meal, a drink, or just hang with friends. It is a large restaurant with a lot of open space. Great bar with tons of High def televisions.   The food here is good but not amazing, in my opinion. The delicious items were the table side guacamole, street tacos, and the conchinita pibil....oh yeah the pitchers of margaritas are pretty solid.  I like that they use organic meats and non gmo products...that is pretty amazing.  Service for us was pretty amazing. Our server Enrique was phenomenal: warm, friendly, attentive.....just great.  Prices are not cheap. The guac was $13 bucks, the conchinita pibil was 25. The real deal were those street tacos....I had the carnitas, carne asada, and conchinita pibil ( spicy baby) for 13 bucks...only bummer is they charge for rice and beans....WTF??? 2.50 extra.  What really brought us was that locals get 25% off the total bill on Mondays for locals....and no I did not go next door for a lap dance....although the bouncer wanted me to take a picture with one of their lovely employees....yeah that would sit well with my fam!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look for this sign and you&#39;ve found it....lap dance not included!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres leches cake
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan. Complimentary with Yelp check in.

MaucW-UzN8rRuadK2hPhvg.text: National Taco Day! Husband and I came here for the great deal. We made reservations for 7, but we were sat sooner by Isabella (hope I got her name right) who was super nice and courteous. Service was great as always and the food--yum! Fabiola came up to us to say hi and was sweet as always. We love seeing her happy face! Thanks so much for making us feel so welcome, Staff. We'll be back for our next El Dorado fix soon!

-ah_0RJQJfG3KbfJsklssA.text: We went to take some family from out of town. I've lived in Vegas for about 9 years and never would have guess it was connected to a strip club. The food was good and atmosphere nice. We set in the far back in a private room. That was cool. The decor reminded me of a castle and private. The prices were a little higher than I would have expected but was not too bad.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of great food

FCfGKWnwSOML8BaM9SgVbg.text: We came here on saturday around 1:45 pm. We were seated immediately by Danny whom was our server. He brought us waters, chips, and salsa quickly. We ordered one pozole soup which was one of the most flavorful pozoles we have had. We also ordered the street taco sampler which is not advertised on the menu with 10 street tacos and a side of buttery white rice (delicious in my opinion) and black beans. Danny was awesome, very friendly and helpful.

Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet tres leches cake. AWESOME!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttery white rice. Very delicious.

hiJxAFCYWI-nGnyb1ntxvw.text: Despite their location butt-up against Sapphire, their kitchen is on point and the interior is chic and welcoming. Consistently high quality Mexican fare, cooked by a kitchen staff that clearly gives a damn. Plus they're open 24 hours. This is a reliable place for a great meal, even after midnight.

ZuPKhlOwPq84czhc_VaMzA.text: Phenomenal rice, many vegetarian options, yummie margaritas, strong sangria!  Guacamole is perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEST MEXICAN FOOD IN THE GALAXY!!!!

lX665j-qofJWtnaWl1QS8A.text: The food was great! Our server Juan was great and recommended awesome dishes. The waitstaff were attentive throughout the meal. My Dad got Steak Fajitas which came out nice and hot. My sister had the Carne Asda Platter which was delicious and a huge portion! My Mom had the Carnitas Platter, which was also excellent, and so much food. I had the Chicken Enchiladas, they were big! Super yummy. Also, the desserts were awesome. Overall I would recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Sherbet
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Enchiladas

y49XLnE9nivht1EP2wI3CA.text: The BEST Mexican food & cocktails in town. A MUST have is the jalapeno margarita...OH.MY.GAWD.!!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yvRc5iouWOX59-EuBPnSZQ.text: First time here, and we loved it! Sara gave us great service, she was very nice & sweet. The food was delicious, had the cochinita pibil and it was authentic....

83Z66aCxfs8Nm6Ylj9s0Eg.text: Appalled would be a drastic understatement to describe my experience at El Dorado... I brought my children in to what I thought would be an enjoyable environment for us to have dinner at only to leave completely disappointed.  For starters the staff seemed less that amused to be there and we were ignored for the first few minutes of walking in.  We weren't greeted by anyone until I summoned someone to help us.  The service was slow, yet felt rushed every time the server was at our table.  The food was mediocre when it finally arrived and my middle sons food was made incorrectly; I specified more than once he is a vegetarian so absolutely no meat and low and behold his food turns up and has chicken in it.   Although annoyed I didn't bother making too big of a scene and we had his food remade and then finished our meal.  When the bill came I was surprised to see that I was still being charged for my sons meal that was made incorrectly- whether it was the fault of our server or the cooks there is no way in hell I should have to pay for it.  At this point my youngest had had enough and so had I so I paid the bill and we left.  As if that hour and half of treacherous service wasn't enough, myself and my oldest fell ill that evening and experienced the worst bout of food poisoning I've ever had.  My oldest son is autistic, and when sick he goes into sheer panic mode. Imagine trying to calm down a 9 year old projectile vomiting while he's thrashing around a hotel bathroom, all while attempting to maintain composure while you're fighting the urge to succumb to the violent illness that food poisoning is... keep in mind I still have 2 other children that were in my care.  This lasted 13 hours. It was pure hell.  The next morning I had my assistant call and email the restaurant to let them know what had transpired and got absolutely no response other than "how can you be sure it was from our establishment".  I'm absolutely disgusted that a restaurant could be so careless in the preparation of their food and just as clueless at the front of the house.  I will NEVER step foot into this so called restaurant ever again and will do whatever I possibly can to prevent others from having to experience such an awful place.

YC0UJX3SmvKt13nglDyigg.text: We've been to El Dorado many times, always so fresh & delicious! The waiters are friendly & polite. Tried the veggie burrito this time & it was sooo good. Brought half home, it was huge! Yummmy margaritas too! We love both the red & green salsa, just wish they'd bring it out in bigger bowls!  If you're looking for great Mexican food, not greasy, try El Dorado. Definitely one of the best in Vegas! ***just ate here again 3-4-18 & so sad they have raised their prices, chicken fajita-$26.50! What?! 2 fish tacos w/ rice & beans-$18. The food is still great but we will prob. not go backsince there are soooo many excellent Mexican restaurants in town. Our bill was $70 just for 2 ppl. We ea. had 1 drink, no apps.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie burrito w/ rice, El Dorado cantina

r-8lx4pqR56FPXF2nOp5ag.text: The ambience is great, our server, Ericka was wonderful, and the food was incredible!  It's not wonder that the locals rave about this place!  I highly recommend this place!  I had the Mole Verde and it was delicious. Y'all should definitely chekc this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qf8hwqPq9htk12JRQP3KXg.text: Grace and the other employees were extremely accommodating and patient as this was our first visit.  Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and seated.  The atmosphere is very welcoming and the bar is fully stocked with all the top shelf selections. The food was quickly delivered and DELICIOUS!!!  We will definitely return!!!!!

7m8LlIe_xRqAjmV4d0Fp7g.text: Some of the best Mexican food I've ever had! Highly recommend. It is a little on the pricey side but definitely worth it.

mS-U1Fh04K5a_SzmMvqIwg.text: The mole here is really weird and tastes horrible. It tasted like charcoal yuck.   We ordered nachos and they put a little amount of cheese and some guac. We had to ask for extra cheese.   Also, the prices are ridiculously high. Not sure how this place has such good reviews.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos has tasty meat. I enjoyed them
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pozole barely had any meat and no corn. What a rip off

Th9JefO_3_XjwYru3cD3Cw.text: Great food and atmosphere. Our bartender Joseph had the perfect mix of attentiveness and friendly demeanor.

4HP3KU7oPnfr0jJznUCn4w.text: It is my first time here and I loved it.  The food is amazing as the decor.  The staff is top notch.  I had the pleasure of meeting the chef and the assistant manager and our waiter Rorke is phenomenal.  Thank you!!

vgoOm8qYAFDw1sQ0h4rGPg.text: We had the veggie burrito and veggie taco both were very fresh and delicious! Our service was also awesome! Can't wait to go back!

Uc-9g2TC__jpm-egpbxZvw.text: Great food and awesome service!  Both chef and our server, Chris went out of their way to take care of our vegetarian, spicy food needs.  Thank you!

mSxKb3RQajWmEjwYy2MzUQ.text: Our server, Erika, was very friendly and made our visit run smoothly. The food was great.

-8vD9WFZ1rp3dgRl5EFi7g.text: It's was delicous and would recommend it to anyone. The service was fantastic. The food was really good. It had no good and was all organic.  The veggie burrito was delectable. It had so many great flavors. Are server (Erika) took great care of us. GREAT FOOD IS THERE.

eSpK_pwevJXF0N1kdp8wjA.text: I only came here because I saw their huge billboard ad with "We Hate GMO!" I loved that. I'm anti Gmo and I wish more people were aware and cared. Anyway, I ordered the veggie burrito with a few adjustments. It's was okay, just not enough salt. I don't even like a lot of salt but they were very light with it. They get huge points because they have vegan and vegetarian options and they are GMO free. The chef is very nice. He came out and introduced himself. Also they are open 24/7...which is weird to me. Apparently they accommodate to the strip club next door. I just hope they don't end up losing money. One last thing, I wish the waitresses didn't have to dress so, *clears throat* traditional, to put it nicely. Do I really need to see all of that cleavage? It looks uncomfortable.

y8_C7Ff0Fkvp5kzW5SWKeg.text: Absolutely loved the place - my girlfriend took me there for my birthday and the food, service, and prices were all excellent. The location is a very odd choice - not only is it on Industrial Road (for people who do not live in Las Vegas, Industrial Road tends to be a very seedy access road that runs parallel behind Las Vegas Boulevard) but it is literally right next door to a higher end gentleman's club called Sapphire. Regardless of that, the food is all organic, non-GMO etc, and very good. Considering how that kind of food is normally very pricey, I was surprised that the prices were in line with other non-organic restaurants of comparable style. Our server was very polite and knowledgeable, and the atmosphere was great. There was a little bit of a wait (about 15 minutes) according to the hostess, even though we observed several empty tables. We both assumed it was due to possibly being understaffed, so we hung out at the bar while we waited. In about 10-15 minutes the hostess came over to the bar and seated us. My only objection was that there were large television screens everywhere with baseball being played, but that 'sports bar' atmosphere is pretty much the norm in Vegas now. Luckily the sound was turned off. I would recommend it to anyone - local or tourist, just beware it is beside a 'strip club', so if you tend to be conservative or prudish you may have an objection to the location. But it doesn't really affect the experience in the restaurant at all.

A8vdhL2G7irimeIyNZ18Yg.text: Myself and my sis drove down to this place which was very close to our hotel in Vegas.  It was little hard to find this place since the lights from the strip club beside cover up the place mostly. I liked the ambiance very much and the place isn't very crowded usually at 7ish. Liked the free chips they served along with 3 different varities of salsa as starters and used a coupon from yelp to claim a free margarita. The burrito was huge and served 2 people sufficiently. I am sure this place is one of the good places to eat mexican food while in Vegas.

EKFMNCVIpd60uC-ZW4w8Ew.text: I was really surprised to see all the good reviews they must have been fabricated as stated in some True reviews throughout. Yelp also advises that many positive reviews come from the same IP address (someone is trying to increase ratings for business) sounds desperate! First if your coming with your family know that they share a parking and entrance doors are right next to each other for the restaurant and a gentleman's club so you pass a bunch of half naked sleazy bimbos prior to entering. They had one waitress running around doing everything .... she did good and was really nice despite the stress she must have been under. The food is ok but not worth the price at any means $19 for a steak quesadilla and $4.50 each street taco.... this price is without any side dishes. Our bill was $100 for 3 quesadillas (2 steak and 1 cheese), 6 street tacos and 2 sodas . Don't waste your money here you get better food for your money at Del Taco. We will not be returning.

Zkajhi8lSAO752Yye38p9w.text: This place is shockingly good. I mean its so good it makes you want to cry. It's amazing, far and away the best Mexican food in Las Vegas.

jQu-DEq164UDJCLyt26nZA.text: Great delicious food!! Thank you chef Paco for the authentic taste of the south! Absolutely the best Mexican cuisine in Vegas! Truly a  hidden gem!!!!

C9mmOGq9pO-PWmzDZGbrVw.text: So So So Good!!! I love their margaritas!! My partner loved the fruit slide!!

nDW4ciSl7BWCGvgcUUAIeg.text: Organic, non-GMO, fresh and delicious Mexican food. Great alternative to all the hyped up places on the strip. Our server Ericka was very friendly and attentive; Chef Paco even greeted us at the table to thank us for coming in. Be sure to check in for the free flan dessert!

HM9jppbLTRlmDTUqkS7EPw.text: First time being here.. great food and desserts .. awesome and friendly servers and Cheff Paco... definitely will recommend to anyone !!

uVrQPaZcA-_YmGp4w0dM0Q.text: This review is based on 2 visits.  Went in today hoping to take advantage of the happy hour deal that I had tried a few months back. Since I had kids with me, they allowed us to sit in the dining room, which sits next to the bar. Food was mighty good, service was ok.  Waitress was non existent for most of the time we were there, but the food made up for that.  THAT was then, THIS is now.  I was told today that I wouldn't be able to sit in a booth adjacent to the bar for their happy hour deal.  The waitress asked 2 managers, but they would not accommodate us.  I can understand if the restaurant were busy, but it was a ghost town.  4 adults that were planning to order plentiful drinks AND food was not a good enough reason for management to bend the rules, to their favor.  This time, the server was nice, chips were good, but management dropped the ball.  Ended up walking out.  Drove out to Phat Franks clear across town for some grub. Glad we did.

6aCLFG5_bpa4mKxkCAnDXg.text: One of the best restaurants I have been to in Las Vegas. Love the organic, non-GMO offerings on the extensive menu. Great service, too, which is a rarity these days!

pf6vnMgcS9ZhRzgXG_oD4g.text: We stopped by Vegas on our way home from a camping trip in Zion. Food was excellent! The staff is friendly and attentive. I ordered the carne asana street tacos and they were flavorful and fresh! The salsa that came with the chips were delicious. And you must order the flan! I usually don't order the flan because I'm not a fan of custard, but this flan is unique. It's like a cross between flan and cheesecake. Chef Paco came by and chatted with us. Very humble and genuine. Make sure you come and check out their happy hour. $1 street tacos!!

_WERiDXgLUpwlmBO4_MbMA.text: There are no complaints to be given to this restaurant! The decor and the environment of this establishment is very modern. The restaurant itself is medium sized, but it's extremely clean and you can tell the employees truly care about their customers. The waitress was very nice, attentive, and informative. Management came to us asking about how our food was, including executive Chef Paco! (If you're reading this Chef Paco, the flan, and the tres leches were delicious! Definitely the best my family and I have tasted.) The food was extraordinary. My family ordered steak fajitas, chicken and shrimp fajitas, sopes, posole, and a carnitas burrito. The steak was like butter, so soft and well seasoned. The chicken was so moist and seasoned to perfection. The posole was authentic and the perfect ratio of pork and soup. The burrito was huge, and bursting with flavor with every bite. The salsa's that they give in the beginning was incredibly delicious. It wasn't too spicy and there was huge flavor in it. You could tell that this place has great quality in every way possible, and it shows from the moment you walk into this restaurant to the moment you walk out. Definitely a five star restaurant. We left satisfied plus some!

VzFgiPOrJNvm2RGIljIcIQ.text: We went here the morning of 4/21/2015 and the food was outstanding. We are from Texas and there is no lack of good Mexican food here.  The food at El Dorado was super fresh and super tasty. The service was good, but a bit surly at times. I would say whomever was serving our table is a great employee, but probably needs a different position that does not involve customer interaction.  As others have said, the location is a bit odd, but the food more than makes up for it.

ZbCqovqfPJbfME8JJ_gUSg.text: This place was great! Table side guacamole is amazing and a must. The tacos are also very good. And don't forget flan for dessert. I got 1 free flan when we checked in and it was hands down the best flan I ever had. Was also a pleasure to have the flan delivered by Chef Paco, who was proud to tell me it was his grandmother's recipe. I'll be sure to hit this place everytime I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing flan

fOyHZYXjCnMde5pLjbvOkw.text: Absolutely amazing food and service! My husband and I sat at the bar and were served by Victor who was extremely knowledgeable and made an incredibly fresh margarita. We started with the table side guacamole, beef empanadas, Mexican shrimp cocktail and ended with shrimp and chicken fajitas. All the food came out quickly and was super flavorful. We will definitely be back again soon!

hgP9aaTqyZkNhZteSlrxlw.text: Finally checked out this restaurant.  It was really good!!  Service was a little bit scatterbrained, but friendly.  Food was good.  Would definitely go again.  Only wish the tortilla chips weren't so salty.

8g5pyoV8bHRl7uBSTkcq4Q.text: Perrrr-fection! This place is amazing! If you're into non-gmo and organic food but still can enjoy a great meal this is the place to go. Awesome margaritas and a great atmosphere. Ask for Enrique! He's the best. Great attentive customer service!!!

foPr813X2yohPM9SnTIu8Q.text: Best Mexican Restaurant in Vegas! Enrique made an amazing tableside guac. Chipotle chicken is to die for! Chef Paco you are a Gem! Authentic Mexican flavor!

C2h0EG84svTwRLWyti4SVQ.text: Here for lunch and was a little leery with the parallel entrance...but it was great authentic food and atmosphere. I m so used to using sour cream, salsas, guacamole, but this food was so flavorful I didn't need it. Had 3 different tacos (pork, braised beef, chiles) and they were all awesome. Also had the Brazilian Waxx to drink and it was good but expensive ($14). Loved the place and will b back when in town for business.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salsas. Orange is the hot one!

tCR-Bdp1RLrOphq2opbdkA.text: Trendy, contemporary dining room with amazing Mexican cuisine!! Although it has an ironic location, literally in the same building as the Sapphire strip club, the food was DELICIOUS!! The table side guacamole comes out in the cutest dish! It is definitely big enough for a party of 4. The chicken enchiladas and carne asada steak were flavorful and the flan for dessert was sweet with the perfect amount of chill! Super nice staff and the chef even greeted us at our table! =D

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchiladas
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada steak

Dy5n3yIPdnYwIOQRwDu20Q.text: Pastor burrito is excellent also chilaquiles highly recommended. Sincerely  A Mexican

8GBFqt24HIwJGP5BJ3H3hg.text: This place is amazing!!!! The tropical salad is highly recommended as are the cochinita tacos. The atmosphere is classy and inviting. The chef is amazing!!!! He does a great job on presentation as well. Go here if you are looking for highly authentic Mexican food served beautifully in a gorgeous environment.

yxaeojC2J1g7q4gzxyCk4A.text: What a pleasant surprise!! Certainly don't judge by the friendly neighbor--the restaurant is located next door to the acclaimed sapphire strip club. But to our surprise, we found a family-friendly classy Mexican joint that delivered delicious food with unparalleled friendly service. Chef paco will emerge from his kitchen to greet you himself, representing his independent restaurant in fine form. After a long night of drinking and partying, I came with 3 other companions seeking a wholesome breakfast (sure... It was lunchtime, but no matter). We tried fajitas, burritos and I had the huevos diversado--2 fried eggs lathered in green sauce atop tortillas, with rice and beans. Everything is well seasoned and constructed very well. There is a flan dessert which is exceptional--a family recipe says chef paco.   All in all, I cannot possibly express how much fun it was to find this surprise in Las Vegas, a short cab ride from the strip (we were at the SLS). Give this place a chance. Worst case scenario, you find yourself next door to help digest the meal.

3jbm3SF0iayxzSbqV55MYw.text: Really confused by all the 4 and 5 star reviews. This was atrocious food and service for the price, even at happy hour.   Went during happy hour at 11pm. This is a place that thinks happy hour means "serve half size orders at half the price." You're not getting a deal by ordering the $5 margarita, you're just getting half a margarita.   Additionally, the Mexican chili was nothing to write home about, I had no desire to finish it. The street tacos were definitely worse than Tacos El Gordo or Los Tacos. The carne asada taco was so rare that I wouldn't even call it cooked. The medium and mild salsas were ok, the habanero hot sauce tasted like it came from a grocery store bottle.  I did not eat the fajitas but my girlfriend was immediately sick from eating them and spent the next morning queasy with stomach pains.  $20 a plate for this? I'll go to Roberto's.

ROr_W2ldv8bwJdWPLHJE0A.text: Came here for my 21st birthday dinner with my boyfriend. The both of us have been craving Mexican food so after doing some good research on yelp, El Dorado seemed like a great restaurant - which it was!! You walk in and the restaurant is beautiful. I love the walls and decorations, really sets the mood and ambiance. The service was great as well! Once we were seated we were given waters and bottomless chips and salsa (three kinds of salsa!) plus the chips were so fresh!! Because we both checked in on yelp we also used the buy on get one free margarita deal! Our server helped recommend great dishes. It was happy hour and so we got our appetizer half off. We chose the shrimp taquitos. Then for the main entrees we had the carne asada taco plate and the beef enchiladas plate, which both came with rice and beans. Then, for dessert we got the tres leches cake. Oh my goodness we were filled!! Everything tastes so fresh and yummy.  The only reason for the 4/5 stars is because it was so difficult for us to find! We kept going back and forth on Industrial continuously passing Sapphire Gentlemen's club until we FINALLY decided to pull up the the club's main entrance and found El Dorado Cantina literally attached to the strip club lol. We were a little surprised and thought it might end up being a tacky restaurant, but it definitely wasn't! Loved it!!

6cWn4z_tNT0BRApVYHhucA.text: Very rarely do I give a restaurant 5 stars but to me, this place earned every one. As a Nutritionist, knowing where my food comes from is very important. El Dorado's menu details where all the produce, dairy, chicken and beef are sourced. Along with being mostly organic and GMO free, El Dorado strives to source locally. Now let's get to the good stuff, the food.  El Dorado serves authentic, flavorful, unique dishes. From veggie tacos to seafood dishes to fajitas, everything is fresh and full of flavor. The ambiance has a beautiful Spanish flare with dim mood lighting accompanied by upbeat Spanish music. And for dessert? Don't get me started on the Flan. It is creamy, smooth and delicious. If you are in Vegas and in the mood for Mexican, this place is a must!!!

YxGGeSC_Y9ur-n98udpBtA.text: We almost missed this place. It's a little hidden behind trees next to a strip joint. But once we got in the service was great. Food fantastic! Thanks for a good birthday lunch...... Just what I needed. We'll have to come back to try some of the tequila.

twbJryw7LTrO0D8DbeJSVw.text: This place was AMAZING!!! We found it on yelp and decided to try it. It is practically attached to the Sapphire gentleman's club, which normally would have made us not eat here. But luckily we did. The food was the best we've had. Out waiters was AWESOME!!! We were seated right away on a Friday night and without a reservation. This place wasn't too crowded and looked great. When the hostess seated us as she was handing us our menus a waiter came up immediately with chips and salsa for the table and told us our server would be there shortly. Poof he showed up right away. Jorge introduced himself and asked if we wanted guacamole and took our drinks order. He was very personable and genuine. He made us laugh and treated you like he had known you forever. The guacamole was amazing, Jorge came and began making it right in front of us. He even asked if how spicy we wanted it. It was a little pricey at $16 but it was well worth it. We were a party of four and Jorge had at least five other tables but managed to make us feel like we were his only table. If Jorge was busy with his other tables he always had another person come and check in on us and see if we needed anything. When he came and took our order he was very knowledgeable about the menu. I was going to order something from the small bites menu because I wanted the sopes but he told me it wasn't a large sopes but rather 3 small silver dollar sized ones. He asked what I was interested in and made several recommendations. In the end I settled on the chicken enchiladas which were great. The servings were a decent size and enough to get you full. We were so stuffed we couldn't even eat dessert so we took it to go.   Definitely go try this place it is well worth it and everything is organic and non gmo. Don't be put off by it being so close to a strip club it is an amazing place. I regularly will take a day trip to Vegas from So Cal just to eat at my favorite restaurants and this one just made that list.

T6nh-4FA9gZl-9bt2bZWDQ.text: I absolutely love tacos, so when I came to Las Vegas, I had to ask the locals where I could get some bomb tacos. I found this gem, nestled next to a gentlemen's club. The atmosphere was intimate, dark, sultry and inviting. The menu was full of fresh, delicious sounding dishes. I, of course, went for the carne asada tacos, because #classic. I was not disappointed in the least. It most certainly sated my taste for tacos. The sangria was to die for. You will not regret anything you order.   The only negative I would say is the lack of a la carte options outside of happy hour. I just wanted two tacos and some corn, but was surprised to find that the corn was $5, but the corn OFF the cob was $7. That made me go "hmm" for a bit so I just skipped it. I would have loved to try it, though. Maybe on my next trip. But seriously, go, don't worry about the "Sapphire" sign, and enjoy some delicious Mexican grub.

NhbBN_LPcMG2x1FRrH069w.text: This restaurant was one dessert away from being a 5the food was good we tried a lot of things my brother even ate a whole bowl of the ghost pepper salsa. Unfortunately the fried ice cream seemed to have been fried prior then refroze and served rock hard. But the food quality is great and the flavors are not over whelming if I could do half stars I would have gave this review 4.5.

EY7NqkzqEDkO6H2NbvcUHA.text: Sat at the bar at 6pm on Christmas Eve. Behind the bar, the lovely Nell helped my server Joanna mix me up a wonderfully boozy margarita, with just the right amount of sour.  For dinner I had the Siegel Plate which came with heaping portions of char-grilled steak and chicken. The fried onions that it came with were cooked to dark, crispy perfection without the slightest taste of burning. The bursts of smoky sweetness from the onions perfectly complimented the grilled meat.  The 'cilantro rice' was very buttery, with not much noticeable cilantro, but it was a nice counterpoint to the sharp flavors from the rest of the dish. The asparagus was asparagus.  Even considering I was sitting at an empty bar in an otherwise very busy restaurant, the service was surprisingly attentive. Joanna and Nell were constantly busy running through drink orders, but they still found time to top off my water and salsa, and make small talk.  Overall, the food was a little bit overpriced considering its simplicity, but not at all outrageous for being just off the strip, and sharing a building with a Gentlemens Club.  The flan that I recieved in return for writing this review was dense and creamy and utterly delicious.  You should definitely eat here if you're looking for a place to escape from the strip for a while. Just be careful of garlic/onion breath if you plan on getting too close to the girls working next door.

4224TsP8oLWPeEuL4ap37A.text: Portions are small, expensive, but good. They recently raised prices and now treat everyone like a tourist. Service is friendly, professional and reasonable fast. Decor is awsome but the restaurant itself is attached to a strip club.

xuAMAmavQFQ-CYq0HmanAg.text: So this is the second time the wife and I have been here.  Our first time was Friday night last week after we checked in at the Palms and hadn't eaten all day. Honestly we were expecting a Tex-Mex type theme but were pleasantly surprised to find out that this is the real deal. That's right folks, genuine Mexican fare not that wanna be but never will be Mexican slop. We opted for the mole sampler and the street tacos as our entree. We chose to try the quesadilla as an appetizer and although it wasn't anything amazing it was good nevertheless. Now getting back to the dish I had which was the mole sampler.  The plate has a mix of 3 different types of mole, 2 red and one green. They all have there own unique flavors and characteristics about them but I found myself especially enjoying the green and the darker red of the two.  The lighter red has a genuine mole flavor that reminded me of both my moms and mother in laws mole which are both excellent.  I must say however that the darker one which I understand is made using both Chipotle peppers as well as Guajillo chiles had a very earthy, smokey flavor that really hits the palate and makes you appreciate all the labor that I'm sure goes into making this dish.  The green mole was just as tasty but obviously prepared using tomatillos and green chiles which by the way I totally love green salsas. Combine all three of these with their delicious white rice and refried beans and your choice of corn or flour tortillas and you have a meal fit for a king or queen. Long story short, if you're going to Vegas anytime soon: Don't miss this spot, oh I almost forgot to mention to not be freaked out when your cab driver or Lyft or Uber pull into a parking lot of a strip club. The restaurant and club share the same roof.

Cilantro rice was my favorite, buttery and not over kill on the cilantro.  It is a bit more pricy then most Mexican food places, but the quality of the organic food is worth it to us.

EzCOesR7ruy8H1NGcNyeLg.text: The only non-gmo restaurant in Las Vegas!! They take pride in where they source their ingredients from and how they prepare their food and you can tell. We went on locals Monday which earned us 50% off our entire bill! The only surprising/humorous thing is that they are located in the same building as sapphires gentleman club....lol. As long as you are not super conservative this should not offend you. They have their own separate entrance.  The restaurant is gorgeous. They had a great selection of beers however they were out of the ones we ordered, no worries they provided us with great alternatives. We ordered the gorditas to start with. I ordered the chicken milanessa and my bf ordered an asada burrito.  Both were very delicious, I only wish we had room for dessert  I will definitely be back and telling all my friends about this place!

cx30oi5vIiYnnF-DwgA9uA.text: You have to try the carne asada burrito. It's $15 but Damn it's worth every cent. Open 24 hours and really quick service.

QllaH_2gY0ihFrC8FOKGyQ.text: I want to move in! This place is everything you could want in a Mexican restaurant and more. The name sounds like a strip club where a fallen NBA star might be caught by paparazzi. But it isn't. (It's only next to one, apparently.) I went there because I was looking for tacos on Yelp, this place popped up, and it was located on Sammy Davis Jr. Dr.   I really wanted to do a review from Sammy Davis Jr. Dr. (How cool is that for an address? Can you imagine seeing that return address on your Christmas card?)  Moravian pendants suspended from the ceiling? Red walls? Naugahyde banquettes? What's not to love? It's how I imagine Vegas used to be back in the day.   And the food was good, too. Local, sustainable, and non-gmo are not attributes I usually associate with Mexican food; but yes, it's good to have a delicious alternative that doesn't sacrifice taste. I'd never had an organic strawberry margarita before, but I'm a believer.   And the flan? I don't like flan. But everyone was right. This place is different. It has a much firmer, denser texture that is very pleasing and doesn't feel like a mouthful of separated yogurt. I'm believer.   Go.

faR-vetXDlwnicNrKvZlqw.text: Outstanding, from the food to the customer service..... The food .. Get the table side quac. from Mike, custom made to your heat preference... Wanted to try a carnitas street taco, they made me one.... Nice!!! The steak and shrimp Fajitas... Delish ...... Can't go wrong with anything !!!

_gA3c9QSLNHooxVGtioKCg.text: Amazing food and atmosphere. Maria is a great server. She makes suggestions and is very knowledgeable about the menu. You can tell she takes pride in her job. Chef paco is amazing! Definite 5 stars

Nnmqnm0zAcI-cig6-9vS-Q.text: Great food and great service! Organic Mexican food 24/7, don't be deterred by the location because it's next to sapphires because the place is great! Waitress was attentive and very professional, atmosphere was nice and relaxing will definitely go back!

mdcUdfqJUGgo7sUNGavmig.text: Folks this place is not 5 stars. Its above average but not great. What's not listed in these reviews is that the restaurant is actually attached to a strip club.
