HJL_vkxzYzrC_VW-q7ESzA.text: Food is so great here. Best Mexican food in town. Raphael is the best bartender in vegas too !!!

AZQhRgvXoxsBylTrMCz-Kg.text: Visiting from Los Angeles and we had a wonderful experience. We had a large party and they were able to accommodate us comfortably. The food and service was exceptional. It's apparent they use nothing but best ingredients. Salsa is top notch and the chilaquilles with asada were on point. Our server, Juan, was efficient, friendly, and  simply made every effort to take of our party.

yOxp9LCOM5QjdGlDb_-ZMw.text: We had a great time here. The food was wonderful and so fresh. Our server Enrique was attentive and very helpful suggesting dishes. The drinks were made with fresh juices and delicious! We will definitely be back.

2f9L3dC4wX3_yuDYi0utjQ.text: First and foremost keep in mind most reviewers here are probably writing a positive review after stumbling drunk from the strip club that shares the same building.  The only reason my wife and I walked in was because we took the time to drive off the strip and the reviews were so good.  It was quiet and completely separate from the strip club no direct entrances.  The Food was mediocre and the service was unacceptable.  The salsa was awful,  the guac even worse.  I had shrimp tacos and I will say the chipotle sauce was good but the rice was white steamed rice.  Wife had street tacos the carnitas were good but the carne and chicken were lacking big time.  Overall stay on the strip don't waste your time chasing a good meal.  Yelp is reliable but in this neck of the woods of Vegas I would say ratings will be off due to the strip clubs around.

bcZbzmcCPZbFRB75zM8Rbw.text: Okay, so I found out about this place a little over a month ago and between my fiance and I we've already been there 10 times.   The food is AMAZING, every bite is flavorful and fresh! It's always perfectly seasoned and just simply declious. I've tried the empenadas and gorditas (both beef), guacamole, beef fajitas and my ALL TIME  FAV the steak bowl (I could eat it every second day). Sooo basically the food has been perfection so far and I've heard great things about the flan and the nachos.  The atmosphere is good, it's upbeat and feels young & fun. I like the way it's decorated and they have lots of roomy booths and plenty of TVs to watch games.  Nowwww on to the service. The first and second time (my fav visits) we had a wonderful waiter. I don't remember his name unfortunately but he had light brown hair and glasses and facial hair I believe. He was super enthusiastic and informative and very professional, he made our visit feel extra special.   One of the last times I had food from there, I actually called in for take out. I called 25 mins or so in advance and they said It would take 15-20 for our two meals (steak bowl + beef fajitas). I got there and was told to go to the bar, when I got to th3 bar no one knew about my order and all looked confused. The bartender who was helping me (who has an almost shaved head looks like he hates life) finally walked on the other side of bar and I could see him talking to a waitress who CLEARLY forgot about my order. The bartender NEVER apologized, the waitress never apologized, NO ONE even acknowledged the mistake..at all! The manager came by and said just a few minutes just to shut me up..which was annoying actually.  .....Fast forward 20 more minutes and my food comes, no discount, no sorries ANDDDD they still charged me $2 for my extra side of guac!!! Looool. As the manager gave me my food I told him at least they should have taken off extra guac, the 2 dollars does not make a difference in my life BUT to treat their future customers w more respect. He was like yess you're right..duhh!  I will definitely be back because of the food BUT good food can get old if the plave isn't run correctly over time.

xPipjvgjcUzI_kUkJ8592g.text: I had to give the restaurant 2stars because of the amazing margaritas. On the other hand, the service was horrible. It took almost 10 minutes for us to get water in an empty restaurant. We were trying to figure out who our waitress was. Imagine how floored we were when we realized the woman who walked past our table without acknowledging us was the one who was to serve us. We had to ask for silverware after we were given cold chips. Her explanation was" sometimes they're warm and sometimes they're not." I won't go into long drawn out details but it was one of the worse restaurant experiences I have had in a long time. I frequent higher end restaurants all the time and I am a very good tipper. Our server, Panini, should probably think about a different career.

25Y6EZBV-ccfFcvESkfzGQ.text: Gotta say this was some of the BEST Guacamole and Carne Asada we have ever had!!! If you're ever in Vegas you have to try this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Bowl
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada plate

IJvGdYS6M8m-YR9HQjFM1g.text: Wow they have one of the best flan I ever had. It's a must have. The drinks are really as well. Recommend the seafood enchiladas omfg. They are soooooo good. Atmosphere is pretty chill too. 1st place I visited in Las Vegas and I diffaintely had a great experience.

AU8ROOcUQ1SxVNg-sx3Nhg.text: The food is amazing!!! The margaritas are the best I've ever had! Muddled with fresh fruit! The shrimp, steak, guacamole you name it is just awesome! Ask about their specials. Half price in Monday! Location is not so great but ignore next door!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and shrimp fajitas!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JJkV1mnhj7DFgckgX47NPA.text: The restaurant was within walking distance of our hotel and the good reviews had us looking forward to the guacamole and grass fed beef tacos as well as vegetarian burritos. The food didn't disappoint and the servers were friendly and took care of us perfectly. Make a reservation if you're going - they appreciated us more because we did and we're sat immediately.

muGTFHCJLgj6TbNtxWgBKw.text: We love the food here. The carne asada burrito and chips and salsa are delish! We are local and always bring friends and family from out of town here.  I would of given 5 stars but today we feel like we were taken advantage of. My husband and I ordered a pitcher of Margs but my mother in law specifically said house vodka tonic-- server asked which vodka and once again she said the well is fine. We got the check and we're charged $14 for a kettle vodka. I walked up to the bar and asked what house vodka was after our tab was delivered and it wasn't kettle then I asked how much the house vodka was and was told $8.99. I know it's only $5 difference but the fact that we specifically asked for house and were served kettle really ticks me off just due to principle.

BVTmhtZMYBREQWq1JCJJQw.text: Very cool place if you can get passed the fact it's build into a strip club. Food is really good totally worth the wait. ..yes there's a wait...pricy menu but seems to be that way anywhere these days. I will return Omar the bartender was on point no matter how busy he was

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar fully stocked

WejfHLLTmXac6dsyi9CsCA.text: Danny (Daniel) was a wonderful waiter who suggested the most amazing dishes!  We started with  Two Margarita, Chips with salsa red & green if you venture to the spicy side ask for Habanero orange salsa flavorful and HOT Table side Guacamole was THE BEST I've ever had!!!! You can tell the difference of NON GMO & Organic produce and meats!!! The Pasole was delicious!!  Cilantro Rice was FABULOUS! (Shh the secret is Butter & ).    The Carne asada Burrito THE BEST not hidden with cheese and sauce just the pure True flavors!  To end our meal Chef Paco came to our table and served us his Flan-his Grandmother- Alesia recipe-- flavor of LOVE! Tastes like a cheese cake and an angel made love and produced  this delicious and decadent dessert!   BEST MEXICAN Restaurant in Las Vegas!!!!   DON'T Let The location next to Sapphire Strip Club frighten you from this TRUE Gem  and treasure of a Restaurant!  Call out to Ernesto bus boy was charming too!  FYI Vegas Peep Monday 25% off for locals!

gOzeOG5-jXS7krFre-z2hg.text: This place is AMAZING!! Walked in on a Sunday afternoon. No wait, no reservations. The service was excellent!!! Food was excellent!!! Real quality food. Churros was phenomenal!! It didn't taste like it has been sitting under a lightbulb for hours. There's happy hour everyday! Can't remember what times are happy hour however in order to have the deal you must sit at the bar. Don't forget to check in to get your free flan! AMAZING!!!

DNpa5Op-PIYuIIVXkXVhSA.text: Wow, what a great place to go eat!   Organic, fresh and open 24/7.  The service was great as well.. our waiter was very nice and attentive the entire time and the owner came by and said hello.  A definite must go to place while in Vegas!

nuLgD0iXPhfnryzhn1PE1w.text: Came here for dinner with my family. Ordered the Carne Asada plate, that our amazing server Danny recommended, and it was so delicious. The meat was marinated to perfection, and it was so tender as well. If you come here, make sure to ask for Danny for a wonderful time and experience!

ppxvXSnzdknf7J60C1mOyg.text: November 28, 2015 El Dorado remains a first-rate dining experience. Wait staff is trained to a high standard; they are professional, courteous and efficient without being intrusive. Neil, our server tonight, is one of the best I've encountered bar none. Ask for Neil, if possible. Everything else in my first review of El Dorado Feb '15 remains True; ingredients are fresh, meats the finest cut/grade (and non-GMO) and the jalapeno and cucumber margarita best EVER! Accolades to bar staff, too; these guys know their cocktails. El Dorado remains a Las Vegas gem; authentic Mexican cuisine at its best.

_TLUMQC-r9S3qSXA6IJOzA.text: Not my favorite! It was recommended from some locals but was still very touristy. We had tostoadas and thought the chicken had a weird aftertaste . Service was great both red and green sauce was average . I would rather try  tacos from a food truck instead.

AvDGmRr9rEe_jboAJhvVTQ.text: Service was inconsistent, food was good quality but not to my taste. Bathroom was weird- some things were automated and others not. Felt like details were skipped.  When we walked in, we were asked if we had reservations. No, but the place was not full, and we were told it would be 20 min wait. Okay, so the four of us went and sat at the bar. We ordered water and got menus and chips and a trio of delicious salsas. Not two min later, we were whisked away to a nearby available table (five feet away).   It felt like the first server kind of pressured us to order, in the manner she phrased if we were ready. That was just the vibe I got.   The empanadas were TINY! Delicious though, but lacking much sauce and the side salad was tasteless and an after-thought- it seemed superfluous. Why bother?  After waiting for what seemed like ages, one entree was served- my husband's steak fajita platter. Gradually the rest of our group got served; but my husband had to point out they didn't bring the corn tortilla option he'd selected. So we all sat and waited for those to come, because we weren't going to eat in front of him. Maybe five minutes later the tortillas arrived and we started eating.  I'm an enchilada aficionado. Although they espouse to use fancy organic ingredients, neither variety I ordered was any great shakes, and too spicy for my taste (I like spice too). I didn't care for the refried beans nor the cilantro rice (both bland).  For about ten minutes I waited for the server to come back and ask how we were (those enchiladas needed sour cream). Finally I flagged a server down.   The worst part was having plates cleared from some of us while others were not finished eating, "Are you done with this?". I felt like they took my girlfriends plate away before she was!  After all plates cleared, here comes the ghostly waitress again. Trying to get us to order dessert. It didn't seem like they cared about our experience at all and things were inconsistent and spotty and really not very good at all. Would not recommend. C-

MWtmBUXb43dNjOkSHtee3A.text: Great restaurant for small plates and organic non GMO ingredients. I wish the location wasn't just outside the Strip Club but other than that everything tasted amazing! We had the chicken wings and some of their street tacos: Pulled Chicken Taco, Cactus Tacos and Grilled Mahi Tacos. Very close to Las Vegas Blvd too so very nice to go for drinks afterwords or clubbing.

94EBj-QjM2MbITNNAm_L_A.text: This is without a doubt the best Mexican restaurant in Vegas. Don't let the location put you off. It's not connected to club sapphire, they just share a roof. The carnitas are some of the best I have ever had. And if you can, have Nell make your drinks. she is a wonderful bar tender with a super fun personality.

SSM9AM6FONsR0ToxZjtd9w.text: I went to El Dorado with a group of coworkers. We has a variety of entrees. Everything we had was fabulous. Customer service was top notch. I will defiantly come back to this restaurant next time I come through Vegas.

2NOtJGr1OD-_ps0a-wKyMQ.text: We were encouraged by the heft of the rating and by how many people had eaten here, but we showed up to a mostly empty restaurant. We finished what I would describe as incredibly average, small street tacos (6 for around $30, LOL) and average guacamole.  When the waiter (who was great), offered us dessert, he let us in on the game, "check in at Yelp and get a free flan," ahh, now it makes sense.   Overall I would recommend avoiding this place, the price is not justified by the food, and the atmosphere is like if a taqueria took over an Applebee's. Service is pretty good though.

zWyCLbBAugrZcnN45Dxl8Q.text: cochinita tacos are the best, and 3 leches cake is on point.

p_2qEwdfVz54wtcEmFoCQg.text: Great food ....fresh ,organic the best churros I have ever had . Staff is very friendly and knowledgeable on the menu. Paco the chef checked on us and visited with us. What a hidden treasure! !

sJOUKkh_CMqQY4axoLMkYA.text: Best Mexican restaurant I've been to with their delicious organic menu.

gk2eAz3cUZFvTmD6HdT-IQ.text: Worst service ever!   Went there around 8:30 pm when the dinner hour has passed.  Have been sitting there for half an hour and no one came to serve! We tried to get attention from one of the waitress, she saw us and walked away !  Horrible !

R4y7GWcT3IUh6HdpRCzs3A.text: So good!! Enrique our server was fabulous!!!   The food was so delicious and beautiful!!  The Jalapeno margarita was to die for.  So I had another!!   Party atmosphere !!!   We are coming again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vDm21yvK050HpBGe-vv8Yg.text: Fresh non gmo food that is cooked to the perfection. I liked the fajitas steak and reccomend this place to anyone who likes Mexican cuisine

3F1n3WEp_Ll7kTkkVv5acA.text: Prob the freshest Mexican restaurant using high quality ingredients. I've eaten here several time and here is what I have had...  Chips & Salsa - Quite possibly the least eventful thing on their menu...easily passable.  Tableside Guacamole - Good but not the best i've had  Queso Fundido - Amazing   Chapulines aka Grasshoppers - I aint gonna lie it was hard to pick this up and eat it but once you do its not that bad. It basically taste like a seasoned sunflower seed shell. Would recommend trying once just to try it.   Quesadilla - Fire! If you don't like quesadillas then you need to rethink life.  Chicken Bowl & Carne Asada Bowl - Fire. Most favorite thing on the menu and that sauce is el fuego. Chicken Bowl is better than the Carne Asada Bowl though...  Right in the same building as Sapphire's if you are a guy you have no excuse not to come here...also if you are a girl you have no excuse not to come here....

BoRtxHkFokmM-WwoZmHkcw.text: I hate giving negative reviews but this is necessary. My group slowly trickled in within about a 10 minute frame so we sat at the bar. I sat right in front of the hallway leading to the bathrooms and immediately I could tell something was off. It smelled heavily like stagnant water. I tried to ignore it unless it bothered someone else too.   We sat at the bar for a good 15 minutes before we were even acknowledged by a bartender, additionally there was a tray of dirty glasses sitting in front of us that the bartenders didn't bother to move, eventually someone in my party moved it away from us. It took someone who was working there another 20 minutes before they removed it from the floor completely. Let's also preface in saying they weren't busy by any means.   Eventually our drinks came and we ended up moving to a table across the restaurant because we came there to eat and there was no way i could have eaten in the seat I was at. We're about 45 minutes into being in this place when we finally get our food order taken. Which is annoying.   Only half of our table got the complimentary chips and salsa? So 4 out of 8 people. It's not like we all could have shared because we were at a long table. It was just poor service.   I ended up being 3 margaritas in by the time any food hit our table, which is crazy because it's not like the drinks we're coming at any timely pace. When we were finally done we weren't offered boxes, the server just took our plates away without saying anything.   To top it all off there was some kind of mishap with our bill? They had to bring us 3. By the end of our experience everyone was just frustrated and extremely underwhelmed with our service.   I've been here before and had excellent service, but unfortunately this wasn't the case this time. Based on my experience this visit I probably won't be back, and if I do it won't be for a long time.

r37E0PrzHP-HUYM82YyeoQ.text: Anything cochinita is absolutely incredible! The flavor is to die for! The flan is so creamy, the chef himself came out to thank is for coming in! Happy hour is the only way. And on the walk back to your car, you get to see strippers go to work! Not bad!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan!

VVFJkqdgChZDDeXORlNAiA.text: We wanted so badly to love this place. So much that we've been here over 10 times and each time aside from the first was mediocre to terrible....  Aside from the obvious entertaining costumes that walk through the door because this location is next to a strip club, this place is just average if not below. Every time we come to this restaurant (and we've given this place a HANDFUL of tries..) there always seems to be a problem no matter how well the staff know us. Almost every time, we strenuously express our food allergy towards avocado and even after 5 minutes of explaining and expressing our allergy, they STILL serve avocado on whatever we order and have to take it back. If you LIKE to be fed whatever they want to feed you with NO say so over what your allergic or sensitive to, this place is wonderful...  The ambience is nice. The service is TERRIBLE and VERY CARELESS. The Mexican food is almost one of the best in Las Vegas but that's NOT saying much if you know original Mexican food or even Tex Mex.   I'm sitting here writing this review as my fajitas are getting cold because they had to take our sides back...  Ugh... Would have rather gone to a more well known place on the strip...(not saying any names). We thought the STRIP was expensive but fajitas for ONE person here are $26.00... and on the strip they are $20.00. At least on the strip the food is higher quality and the waiters don't try to send us to the hospital every time we show up...  I eat Mexican food everywhere I go and never have I seen a place put jalepenos in everything and avocado on EVERYTHING...very annoying and working with a careless staff for a normal Mexican meal completely ruins an appetite that's for sure.

GoopsgDo4V7jBH041_WsUQ.text: The perfect place for an Organic meal to please your mexican cravings!! So delicious! Friendly staff and did I mention AMAZING food!? Top recommendation!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WFJWmojtam9nM71uvJTSMQ.text: So damn good, too damn pricey to eat here on the regular. Wish they had deals for people that want to visit the establishment regularly. Or even a happy hour for their organic dishes since you can't really get much organic Mexican food. However if you want to treat yourself to high quality good tasting food definitely visit this spot

GyRMfHH4UhdIdr_Iv897Vw.text: This place is a hidden gem right next to the Sapphire strip club. It's literally right next door but it is not inside the club. It's completely it's own place. Visited on a Saturday afternoon around 230 and we were seated right away. First round of chips and salsa were complimentary and they were good. Guacamole is good too. Ordered the Mahi mahi tacos with rice and beans. Delicious. The rice is so fluffy and it had a sweetness to it. YUM. The fish in the tacos was tender and was complimented nicely with the fresh chopped mango and cabbage slaw. Other order was the carne asada burrito. Delicious. Perfect ratio of meat and everything that goes with it. The burrito was huge too. I LOVE that this restaurant is Non GMO and organic. Definitely recommend and definitely will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi Mahi tacos deeeeelish!

4lJDuePlqKCwMFo0wINPNA.text: El Dorado has genuine authentic food bling, inspired by several regions in Mexico!! Emphasizing organic, sustainable ingredients and hormone-free meat.   The Cochinita Pibil platter is large chunks of slow-roasted achiote pork shoulder, the best I've had in Vegas and I reminisced a scene in the movie "Once Upon A Time in Mexico" as Johnny Depp ate this similar meal describing how the pork was too good, that after he paid the bill he had to shoot the cook to maintain balance. I didn't do that I'm not psycho but my stomach was left feeling happy.  The staff are friendly, courteous, and in general nice people to chat with. The decor is quite unique its all red decor, but its nice classy restaurant/sports bar.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Enchiladas
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cochinita Pibil

77c2WJG0NVSHTAuq33hksQ.text: The food is always on point, their guacamole is delicious and the drinks are also just as great.  I will be back and I will take anyone visiting here who likes Mexican food.

W1c9D5s6OB8CKY-MZY5S0w.text: Ordered vegan. Food came out not vegan. Wouldn't refund because "I took your order and you didn't order it vegan". Swallowed $20 and ordered another one... vegan. 100% positive there was butter on it and they sent it out with a side of mayo. Cute.

pVgyOTD6IRjEN-r4U8Wzfg.text: This place is amazing. This is off strip but not that far, it was a quick uber drive. The only gripe I have with this location is that it shares a building with a very large strip club, it just seems weird and attracts a different kind of crowd than a normal restaurant would. Once inside though, you would never know. The atmosphere was really pretty. My table ordered a pitcher of their jalapeno margaritas and they were really good! The chips and salsa brought to the table was amazing, i could eat the green salsa every day! I ordered the signature bowl and chose carnitas as my meat. It was $18 which was cheap compared to the rest of the menu. It was a very large portion for the price, well worth the money!! The carnitas were flavorful and tender, the white rice it came on was out of this world, i had to choose that instead of the brown rice because i had heard such good things about the white rice. It also had guacamole, refried beans, cheese, pico and lettuce. There was a queso sauce on the side, it didn't taste like queso or any cheese to be honest, but it was not bad. I was glad it was on the side, i wouldn't want it on all my food, it was good to dip a bite or two in. This is a small place that didn't seem busy, especially for a Friday night, i will definitely be making this a dinner spot when i am in Vegas next time.

d1tNIG0XzQimQ7J9zesq0g.text: 2nd time eating here back to back nights and I have to say this place is amazing! They have the best carne asada tacos, the chips and salsa is amazing and the desert is even better! The host was really nice and greeted us to our table right away. Our server Grace, was amazing! & even the executive Chef came out to say hello and comped the desert for us. Highly recommend and I'll be be back when I'm in town again!

4QCXnP8S1e6SuJmPLVjEGw.text: Really nice Mexican food... the best Flan I had too.  Location is right next to a strip club but if that does not matter best Mexican in Sin City

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W4JVQaZMzexWkCuqQxwLhA.text: Great food and great service. Our server Grace was phenomenal. I had the seafood enchilada and was very pleased. Others in our party had the mahi tacos and another the burrito with red sauce. Margaritas are top notch and the fresh guacamole is to die for.

zhFf7tlsp-0jM62oiHwAVw.text: Signature El Dorado Margarita lives up to it's name.  Everything about this restaurant was excellent.  Our waiter, Decio, was knowledgeable and delightful!  Appreciated General Manager, Brian Halfhill, stopping by our table.  A gem just a little bit off of the Strip.  I would highly recommend the lettuce wrapped tacos...YUMMY!

s7W54qVVXNNZ4arSqjDMbA.text: This is always a must stop place when we come to Las Vegas.  The food is consistently award-winning and out of this world and the table side guacamole is to die for. The service is a 10 out of 10 every single time. Don't be discouraged by the business next-door, it is totally separate.  Come for the guacamole and stay for the flan.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Danny was our server and did an amazing job for us all with delicious food, table top guacamole, and a world-class service attitude!!!

cdqz4D9EAvJFUSaa5oha1Q.text: Absolutely wonderful food always fresh, hot, delicious, a must have!! Yvette is the best and will take very good care of you when your there. Enjoy!

9rcXDCj2oyOiRchzFX51Hg.text: Some of the best local restaurants are off the strip, just like this one.  Next to Sapphire Club, El Dorado is a large and lovely restaurant with food that I would call gourmet Mexican. (No sloppy sauces or refried beans here). Had lunch here with a friend but I'm thinking this would be a great place for group happy hour or a dinner with a small group.  Tried the table side guacamole dip (their nacho chips are home made on site too), the waitress made the dip without onions per my request! Gourmet shrimp taquitos were what taquitos should be. The flan was s u p e r b (brought an extra one home)!

uupcna-ETpb-MwXz2LI0TA.text: Such a great dinner! All the ingredients are fresh, organic, etc. and you can really taste the difference! My family got: the table side guacamole (so good), pitcher of margaritas, white sangria, Mexican chili, chicken enchiladas, signature bowl and carne burrito and honestly everything was delicious. No complaints. Service was impeccable as well... everyone was so friendly. It is located next to a "gentleman's club" off the strip but no big deal and definitely worth the ride. Wish we could come all the time but sadly we live in Maryland. Will keep it on our list for future trips to Vegas!

MBn7_6M2Kg9DUkYGqca0yA.text: Best food I've hand in a long time. Non-GMO and the best desert. Beans were different but tasty and the first lace is very nice. We had a new girl who was training and very slow but everyone must start somewhere!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So great!

LtnfRMlEw06SRaKCcdxeGw.text: The food is on point- even my picky girlfriend loved the food here (which is saying a lot). Will stop by again when we are back in town!

cMC4lod4riTuVLen_So8aA.text: Great food!!! Service was wonderful.  Yummy margarita! Will definitely return when we're back in Vegas.

8N6LvkjbsjS0_TgKwzSz2w.text: By far the most incredible Mexican restaurant in Vegas! The Sopas are my favorite appetizers

UpB0SxM5A_9piiWo7udC_A.text: Looking for an organic Mexican restaurant?  This is the place!  They even describe it on the first page of their menu.  Usually have the taco platter as the carne asada, carnitas and al pastor are all great choices!  Full bar is great and love the locals discount on Mondays.  They sure know how to take care of the locals.  Nice late night spot if you're looking for a place passed midnight!

5ggESTifL-9rvhKsRIIn8Q.text: Enrique took care of us and we had a great meal. I ordered the chipotle chicken and it was one of the best meal I have ever had although it was a bit spicy so be prepared for that. Everyone at the table was very pleased with their dishes!! Would highly recommend, just a heads up it looks like your pulling up to a strip club and we almost pulled away. The entrance is right next door so don't be scared away they are totally separate, and to top it off free flan!!! At the end for checking in!!! 5 super stars!!!

DM-AdtJVcHtpzwVNz2SjvA.text: One of the best Mexican restaurants I've ever had. The interior decor is gorgeous! Try the Carne Asada Burrito and the Mexican corn! Fast and great service!

7PSfc1PH-KqoPGTXDkSy9g.text: nice, peaceful atmosphere . We came here for a early dinner around 6ish and it was the best. I got the chicken bowl & let me tell you, it was so amazing compared to ANY other chicken bowls I've ever had....the chicken is so tender and you can tell that they prepare the food to serve quality and quantity . The price is totally worth what you get.  Paco, the Chef, was so friendly and visited every table to make sure that people were satisfied with the food..what chef does that! He actually cares. the waitresses are also very friendly !  thank you Rosemarie for being a awesome waiter! I do suggest you TRY this restaurant ... you won't regret it!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan inspired by Pacos mother

iznu9Nfc47op3BuyTKEeKw.text: This place was soooo good! Best Mexican food I have ever had! My only complaint is that it's a bit pricey. Otherwise, service was wonderful, and we were happy. Carne Asada burrito was stuffed with so much meat! Even the free flan was good!

Klx6HodS_U0pyaWJCUIYgw.text: This place was incredible!  The Quesso Fondido was amazing!!   With that and splitting an enchilada plate was so much food!   Best Mexican food I've had!   Awesome service.

Y9P2iMB8HVQBydJ0udrapA.text: Best best Mexican food in town not only is it organic but it's GMO free and super authentic. I enjoy everything I eat whenever I go the staff is amazing as well. Prices are not that bad but it's sooo Worth the price  Thank you guys you always have great service

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BBHqRnzkdSEGZHCUY2sedA.text: This place! Screaming food-gasm written all over the menu. WOWSY!!! Forget the strip club next store. From walking in the door to getting served, this place has it all. Ambience, sexyness, and service is top notch. It's the hidden gem of Vegas. Get your ass in the door and I guarantee you that you'll make this place a must when in Vegas. Pics to come.

pv5NEZd5vLEkbeJAXl-dig.text: The best in Vegas! So many people sleep on it because it's hidden away, but Chef Paco is the best.  Make a plan to come check it out!

gg6IWpKy9QualVESPuIroQ.text: Amazing food and great decore. Friendly staff, would highly recommend the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

21U_NkMMdR4dbLzXpgKGCw.text: Amazingly yummy food n great dining experience..  got free chips and 3 kinds of salsa to start with. We ended up eating 3 servings of those between two of us. We ordered shrimp taco and veggie burrito.. Very fresh and delicious.. Also the chef came to the table to check on the food.. Very sweet waitress Annabelle.. Cannot ask for more.. Highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Shrimp tacos

ljptZhBDbO8R-Uh7HSHjKw.text: Everything was so tasty. We ordered a few small plates to share. Imperial shrimp is off the chain! Came around 2:30 .. Great timing! We were the only ones in there for a bit. Fantastic service from Chris & Chef Paco visited the table. Classy decor. Open 24 hrs. Local food done right. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chips &amp; salsas!

l8tllOjU7gVsdfQg7IOppQ.text: When you first walk into the dim lit area, you are greeted by a friendly smiling hostess. Odd place next to a strip club, but come to find out the restaurant is owned by the same owner of Sapphires. The decor is a great hip new look that seems to flow nicely with the vibrant red color. Was there to support the three squares restaurant week. Price fixed menu that included table side guacamole, three street tacos, and a dessert. The chips and salsa was good. The orange habanero salsa was, well you guessed it, HOT! The table side guacamole was awesome. The pork street tacos had slices of pickled habanero peppers on it. Was a good flavor! The Tres Leches cake was excellent. The best part of the dining experience was the waitress. Phenomenal service!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salsa trio.
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table side guacamole.
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak street tacos.

94UVOewnMzGp0raNoauOjQ.text: AMAZING FOOD!!!! We went with a big group for a friends birthday and we were blown away. I recommend the white sangria. Can't wait to get back and stuff my face

_zyZr9L5grwLczmHUHDHPQ.text: I want to like this place.... I really do. I have heard the food is pretty good! I like the concept of non gmo and  organic. I don't mind paying a little more for that either.  The table guac and salsas are amazing.... However that's all I had after an hour and a half! Not joking. Not even a refill of water. Finally had to leave. No dinner, and my drink that took 30 min to even get ordered never came. When I told the waiter that finally came around to take orders after 1 hour and 25 min being there that my drink never came and that I had to leave because my ride was on their way and couldn't even order now he said "ok" and went to the next person. That's it. Wow. Instead of being able to order a dinner at that point I asked him for at least more chips and water since our table had our salsas and the whole order of guac just sitting there with nothing to eat it with and all of our glasses empty... And had been for quite a while.... Nope, never showed even after another 15 min. No one ever once came by to refill water, to check on us, no one watching the fact that there was no chips to eat the table guac...  Never saw a person to even ask. Watched another table get seated 30 min after we were seated get ordered and served their food before the waiter even came around to take our order. Ride came, Had to leave.  I am beyond disappointed as I was starving both when I got there and also when I left. Service is awful, no staff to be seen. Waiters attitude was beyond terrible.  Btw, this was a party of 20. Special bday celebration. They knew we coming, and this was the service that was provided. Not cool.  Second star is just me being courteous.   ***FOOD IS COLD!!!!***** can I take away a star please!?!?  Yep, went back again only because the girls I was meeting chose the place.... Again the salsas and table guac was great. This time our waiter was pretty good.  Party of 3, ordered margaritas and when they came, woah! So much lime juice and "agave nectar" but little to no alcohol. Second one came in a rocks glass instead of margarita glass because they "ran out of glasses" really? I'm certain if I poured the amount of liquid in my glass into a shot glass it would not have even filled it. So much ice and, yep, more lime juice! Ugh my stomach! Ordered the street tacos. One shrimp, one (spicy)pork. Plate came a la cart. Would have been nice to know that. Shrimp was very strongly fishy smelling (I know better than to eat anything that smells fishy) and cold and my pork taco had exactly 2 pieces of meat in it. One piece was approximately 1/2 inch of actual meat and the other was an equal amount of complete fatty nothingness, inedible. Neither taco was even remotely warm. It is beyond obvious that all food is prepared well, if not days, in advanced and then only partially warmed to order. I'm not sure with how many multiple reviews of this place complaining of the same thing it is not yet rectified. And honestly I'm not sure how the health district is not yet aware of the problem. It's amazing no one has gotten sick yet.  Our party moved to the bar after dinner for one more round and even after asking for "light on the lime juice" was served an extremely acidic margarita again with no alcohol. When I asked for a solution, the bartender handed me a shot glass full of more "agave nectar" as the solution with no explanation. I tried a drop or two of that and then added more ice from my own water glass to try to solve the problem but really it was just way to sour and acidic to drink. As of now, 5 hrs later, my stomach has still not settled either from the "fishy shrimp" or the acid margarita I'm not sure but ugh.  So basically this place just has consistently given me a bad experience. I will not be going back. And I will tell and share my experience with others. Disappointing to say the least. Again I will say the idea of a organic and non gmo would be nice.... But not this place.  Save your stomach and go to any other hole in the wall for a better plate to be sure. And guaranteed it will be cheaper too! I didn't even go there, but our bill was $87 for 6 street tacos, table guac, and 6 drinks (little to no alcohol!). Pretty Pricey dontcha think!? Robertos and a six pack would be step up from this experience.

9PCpKDt3UZIOv4MIgIVPRw.text: The flan is so good I literally shed a tear. This is the most authentic, delicious Mexican food in Las Vegas! I have already been three times and can't wait for a reason to go back! Service is awesome and accomodating...we had a large party and were seated very quickly. Just writing this review is making me hungry!

kcmLb8riVvRrkS7PACEwdg.text: We weren't even acknowledge sitting at the bar. The manager pretty much served us. And the bartender never provided any service. My burrito had zero chicken until the very end, they need to learn how to roll a burrito. Not sure if I would even give that place another shot. But on the upside nice decor. 2.5 stars

maO8B_O132v3Z2VmAB_wPw.text: We stopped in El Dorado for lunch today.  The wait staff was exceptional.  We were greeted by a new host at the door.  Eric our waiter did an excellent job of explaining the menu.  I had a cup of the Pazole and the Carne Asada burrito. Joanna had the usual table side guacamole with a side of rice and beans.  And then the Flan.  Yum.

9rqoJs3VfuwDGGUqAvdeTQ.text: No, no, no!  I've lived here for 12 years, and have never heard of this place, except through Yelp, so I thought let's give it a try.  The food here at this restaurant is not good.  Most of the people that are here come from the club, (sapphire) and are intoxicated, so yes, anything is good.  I'm Mexican and I know Mexican food, and this stuff is far from authentic, sorry Paco but your food is very bland and boring.  Never again.  Oh yeah, our bill was $90.00 for (1) queso fundido, (3) beers, (1) margarita, and two enchilada entrees.  Not satisfied at all.  However the service is great.

L6dcrahWdZMpAU7PdLWLVg.text: Don't let the fact that it's in the same complex as a gentlemen's club scare you away, this place is FANTASTIC!!!!! I don't give 5 stars easily and this place was hands down the easiest time I've ever had giving a 5 star! From start to finish this place was the best... Everything is incredibly fresh and well prepared. Even the chips and salsa were wonderful. I had the chicken enchiladas and black beans and it was completely amazing. We finished with Flan which was the best one I have ever had. Chef Paco and the whole staff there are so special! The queso fundido was outrageously delicious and our friends got the steak fajitas and they said the steak was exceptional! We will be back every time we come to Vegas!!!

MJZtO7dY6iQlafW0qYeypQ.text: The only reason this place is getting 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the location. It's in the same building as Sapphire Gentlemen's Club, which I got from reading let reviews, but even knowing this I was still super confused. They don't even have a sign anywhere near the road or anything to help people out so if you don't know it's in the same building you're kind of screwed.   But other than that, it was amazing. I only eat organic so this place was awesome. From all local farms with no added anything. Had the table side guac (except we didn't have it made table side since there were only 2 servers on and it was pretty busy, they might want to staff better) but none the less it was amazing and then we all had enchiladas, so good! and the house margarita was huge and delicious! definitely will be going back soon since they are open 24 hours!

8PUR53heyyk7e0hSu_d1cg.text: Truly great, classic burger with crispy fries. Had several wonderful breakfasts here but never lunch. This is now my burger destination too!

5HjLps8U-rvUANad9ptiUA.text: Kinda hard to find because it shares the Gentlemans Club bldg, but worth seeking it out. We shared a platter of tacos. I enjoyed the carnitas and chicken the best. Flavorful juicy pork with cilantro and avocado sauce!! Yummm! Because we checked in, we got a free Flan. Let me tell you, it was the best I've ever had, anywhere!! Except of course, the one my aunt made when I was a child. Normally we don't order dessert , but even my BF still talks about this Flan.  We will go back next time in Vegas

VAPgrzkSFMugmwNnTriSew.text: Had a great meal. Seafood enchiladas were awesome. You can order a small version of the  $16 table guacamole for cheaper.

MqkGyeZ73fyC1Pcy5zTsqg.text: Food is decent .. restaurant atmosphere and cleanliness is a 5 star , although kitchen area looked kinda dirty when I went to bathroom to wash my hands. Kinda grossed me out

neMCzZ-NHp6pEovWAwbRYA.text: As we pull up, I gave my wife a bit of a shock, when she saw we were pulling up to a strip club, "Michal, Where are you taking me!!". I should have read the reviews more carefully so i could give her a forewarning, haha. We were later approached by a promoter selling strip club entry passes as great "couples therapy", which made for another laugh.          Apart from the questionable location this place was awesome!  Service was quick and friendly. We found out that our server was also a Michigan native  and long time globe trotting waiter.  Hours are are 24/7 just like it's neighbor the sapphire GC. Great for us as we were looking for a 3:30AM dining spot after a satisfying but tiring time at XS nightclub. Food was excellent. We started with a traditional complimentary Mexican appetizer of chips and salsa. We especially liked the burnt chipotle sauce. The guacamole was made table-side with generous peppers, garlic and onion mixed in with a mortar and pestle. The best dish was the Carne Asade street tacos, these were truly above and beyond.  One downside was that our server was very slow to get our credit card at the end of the meal, we had to just put money down and leave. It was also entertaining though because we saw that he was preoccupied serving a stripper which kept him distracted.

NSYL9kenXQTyPpBmeyfl3g.text: Food was very good I had street al pastor tacos with the rice and bean option very tasty, my fiancee had a carne asada burrito which was equally tasty. The place was really dark making it hard to read the menu, but other then that it was really good. We also had the flan, wow what can I say it was delicious.

lG0lMKlwaSoB9DsLAbLwQw.text: Delicious!  Friendly staff, great food!  Don't let the location scare you off!  Had tacos, margarita and flan.  The executive chef even came out to greet us.  Highly recommend!

7gkDYYA0B7NeU675v9TMXg.text: The food was delicious, and our server Danny was AMAZING! Great atmosphere and beautiful restaurant.

OJSy66kZxqYxuvSUwU5w9A.text: It's so much fun to trick your friends and say that you're going to the strip club and then just go to the place right next-door. The food here is surprisingly outstanding. Organically sourced ingredients and great flavors. I highly recommend the flan.

etidUQq2xWsjM0JAqI07uA.text: I ordered a $32 fajita platter and was shocked to find out when I asked for extra tortillas I was charged two dollars, like $32 wasn't enough. Jesus God how do you treat customers like that and brag that you're this number 28 company on yelp.  I question the waitress about it and her reply was we charge extra for everything even a side of butter.   I also ordered a bean and cheese burrito it was pretty much kid size and was $10.50 I know we're in Vegas but hey its a 24 hour Mexican spot next to a strip club.  Probably won't be back

B2yCAbjMEJflaaLTB8wqZg.text: My new favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. We had the shrimp tacos and the carne asada street tacos. Amazing!!! Tender and so flavorful! The refried beans were the best I ever had! Last but not least the flan! Melts in your mouth! A must try! Erika our server was on top of it. Never missed a beat. Martine the Assistant GM checked in with us throughout our meal. We will be back over and over!

GIbNB1VuZCvKmG1L2zTbNw.text: Non-GMO and Organic are important to me, as I eat this type of food back home. So while in Las Vegas, I had to try this place out because it fit the bill. Pulling into the parking lot on a Saturday night - it was confusing. Where do we go in?  Finally seeing the entrance on the side of the building, we knew we were in the right lot.  Walking in, we weren't sure *IF* we were in the strip club side or a restaurant. Realizing after the fact, a wedding had occurred and the wedding party was in the bar part of the restaurant, all dressed up making us feel like street bums.  Being escorted to the back past the DJ and the wedding party, there were a few small tables.  It was still very loud, but we gave it a try.  The food is AMAZING. Very good Habanero salsa, and we had the Al Pastor Street Tacos and Chicken Enchilada. Both had great flavor, good portion sizes and all the salsa you wanted to put on the food as well as eat with the chips. The food really is amazing. That's the reason for the 4 stars. I think next time we'll opt for carry out, and hope it survives the trip back to the hotel.  The only redeeming quality of this entire experience was our server Miguel, and the quality of the food.  But I have to say I have never been seated by a person wearing fish net stockings and lingerie. Hours later, I still can't shake the most bizarre dinner experience I have ever had in my life.  Blaring bad 80's music, drunk wedding party antics, Nascar on the big screen, and women walking around in lingerie? I guess that's why they say what happens in Vegas......

_k0d3OF7qhwievmg1ReoZw.text: I'm confused...I came here based on Yelp reviews, but I am not impressed at all. My mom, sister and I arrived on a Wednesday afternoon around 4:30, and there were barely any other people in the place (not unusual for this time and day). We each ordered a margarita ($11) and they were huge, but they didn't do a lot for us. Not much different than other places.  The food is where it got bad. The chips come with three salsas, and it's $3.50 for a refill. The salsas are okay, lacking in flavor. I ordered the tacos al pastor(which admittedly is never very good in anywhere but a taco stand off the beaten path), and the meat was extremely dry and hard. The rice and beans had no flavor. My sister ordered the seafood enchiladas, which were supposed to have pacific shrimp, mahi, and scallops. What they came with was tiny bay shrimp, literally zero scallops, and the mahi was more like canned tuna. The sauce on her enchiladas was quite tasty though! My mom ordered the mole platter, which was the best of the three dishes. It came with three different kinds, which I haven't seen done before. All three were very flavorful and different from one another, and the portion was HUGE! Two or three people could have split that one dish. There only issue was the meat was a bit dry.   The plus side is the service was actually excellent! Our waitress even offered my mom ice for her injured knee :)  I'm glad I tried this place, but I definitely would not go back.

GqHGI42impJeCaWcfsQPjQ.text: This place has awesome food and super friendly service! There's a wide variety of authentic Mexican food to choose from here. They use non-GMO and organic ingredients.   The most memorable food I tried was the Oaxaca delicacy chapulines aka grasshoppers. At first I was scared about eating grasshoppers. Yes, they look like actual grasshoppers. No disguises here. Luckily the lighting in the restaurant was a bit dark. It helped not to see every detail of what I was eating.   In the end I was pleasantly surprised. The barbecue flavor was quite good and the grasshoppers were kinda crunchy. Like an exotic gluten free snack. My boyfriend and I couldn't finish the whole plate. It was a generous serving, especially for us first timers! What a fun way to try something new and exciting!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchy grasshopper!

FcwOABrZP3e5psC6zDjkKA.text: My first time here and I want to say that everything from the decor, to Chef Paco's food to my server, Angel, are among the best in this city. The interior has the fancy Palacio de Bellas Artes style mixed in with the traditional Aztec/contemporary decor! It is a bit pricey But, you definitely get what you pay for, great Authentic Mexican food served by a great server, Angel, gracias!!

gDXRxAySgGM0eoK5E7fvww.text: Delicious. Fresh. Good size portions. I definitely recommend you get one dish to share with your significant other. There is a kids menu. Kids menu comes with churros for dessert. Margaritas are delicious. Everything was fresh and flavorful.

3iSxmWs0xXivYx9H_xjvAA.text: We chose this place for our lunch in Vegas today. Neither of us had been to Vegas, but we only planned to have a meal and then resume our road trip. This place did not disappoint. The food was excellent, as well as the service. The chef came out and chatted with us for a bit, which was really a nice (and unexpected) touch. We both tried the new sangria recipes for spring. Definitely recommend the red or white. They are loaded with fresh organic fruit, so ask for a spoon!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious food, great service, must try the new Sangrias . . .

ZLLmmNyk9AAbIBCqRdMAqg.text: The place is pretty hidden and the entrance looks like your entering a strip club lol but don't let that deter you from coming in. It has its own entrance and the food and customer service are excellent! I've been here three times and everyone has always been more than satisfied with their food choice.

SW-BfSzgOHUrFU45oV0VdQ.text: Shrimp tacos are the best!!!!  Great jalapeno margarita  Must go!!! Ashlie is amazing and so attentive. We've been going for years, birthdays, celebrations. 24/7 it's my favorite!!

2M-T-Bm7A1oh1TEPdCqOJA.text: This was the worst service I've ever experienced in my entire life of living as a human being. I don't know whether they were trying to steal my Diamond VVS grill,  but a little bit about myself this cost over 1000$ per tooth , y'all do the math. So when the bill came I walked out. True story the waitress, manager, and dishwasher along with 2 sapphire security guards and bouncers care after us thinking I was trying to dine and ditch.  No it's fall disrespect. I tore my Achilles' tendon I'm not running from anyone. Long story short I paid the tab no tip because they cheap ass ownership / management/ chef was going to stick it to the waitress so I paid it obviously didn't tip. No one apologized the manager wanted to cool my next meal I said comp it now but he wouldn't. He only been manager for 5 weeks so I feel bad. The tacos you get upcharged 2$ for cheese extra for Guac too which is industry standard. Food was good but doesn't allow you to deliver the worst customer service and experience I've dealt at any restaurant. You expect to violate me, my property which is $8000 whether it was accident or stolen and then expect me to pay for $40 dollar tacos???!!!?! Y'all are crazy and I'll make sure word gets out about this. It sounds like the chef is charging everyone for everything Nickle & diming customers. Even the hostess orders food at sapphires instead of eating at 50% discount employee discount she gets.  The hostess encouraged us to write a bad review on yelp as well. She was only nice and understanding person within the situation. I told them to call the cops and they would probably side with me. The level of disrespect I've never seen in my entire life. The manager asked me to come back for a comp meal... there won't be a next time even though it wasn't his fault.

6iDbaRgoaectOJF846ZZmA.text: Erica was amazing she was very accommodating. Our food was so delicious if you come in ask for her!   Also recommend coming in mondays for 25% off with your local id.

AQzvVHaZFm-WgS6dMhK9yw.text: I came from a family where Mexican food was a norm and I hold restaurants to high standard for authenticity, quality and taste. El Dorado Cantia and Chef Paco's creative dishes will have you wondering when you are coming back. I have been there multiple times and always get great suggestions from their servers on new things to try! This place is excellent and a definite MUST for locals and tourists alike! Service is one thing that separates good establishments from the busiest and most successful ones, they are have a customer centric staff. Love it there!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nN8PZbxZ4V7iNMjIEtwp8g.text: Hands down the best authentic Mexican food in Vegas for me! Don't let the sapphire strip club make you think it's not authentic because it's probably the most authentic Mexican food I've had that is as close to my mommas cooking. I love this place I've tried almost everything on the menu and have yet to be disappointed. People are very friendly as well. I recommend anyone local or visiting to give this place a go, I mean if you don't your missing out so it's cool if you don't I'll still be there enjoying every bit of this place. I always have a different server and they never do me wrong. This time I had Grace and she made me feel like a Latin king. She reminded me of a adorable baby panda bear riding a rocket to  Mexican dreamland where everyone is drinking they're favorite drinks and bouncing on red white and green clouds.

pJBadS2Cw6fe2IUjn2kWsw.text: Fresh and yummy food. Our server Camille was fabulous; even brought out flan for our birthdays.

GHsTweiL1v89LpTAGvWx9Q.text: So this place is open pretty much 24 hours and has organic made mexican food. On their menu it has a written bio of what they strive to achieve with their quality of food. I like the idea of organic ingredients in my food! yum! Its in the same building as Sapphires so you can also come next door for some fun entertainment!  So the restaurant is large and has plenty of tables and a huge bar area.. where a lot of people like to dine at after-hours. The staff/bartenders are pretty good in service..  So the chips and salsa they provide upon seating is very yummy! the chips are colorful and the salsas are spicy enough with a kick! I normally order the 3 tacos plate with rice and beans! Its so good and filling! guaranteed to make you nice and full as the servings is plentiful.  Overall it has tasty food with a nice environment. Its not the best mexican food Ive eaten but it seems to be quite healthy in its ingredients! fresh and organic! Come try this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c7R7C2hu9dG1bF95astNSQ.text: After substandard service on 4/6/2019, I received a response from the GM,. I decided to return with a guest. Chef Paco personally came to our table and apologized for the poor service I received during a previous visit. He then gave a complimentary 3 course dinner! Great food!

cALu7c0QuTuRYTggSJQdxA.text: Food was good our servicer was friendly and nice,  Vladimir was excellent GREAT customer service and knowledgeable.tjat is why I gave 2 starts instead if 1. The manager Doris was at the entrance when we arrived, we greeted her and she didn't even look acknowledge our presence, so rude. She then came to our table and hover over our table to change the TV channel, didn't even look at us, again we were totally ignored. The chef then came in, didn't look at ANYONE just strolled past us and other customers. Peeps there are plenty of good food and friendly staff restaurant in Vegas. Food is good, drinks average. Think twice to pay premium for this place.

CO2s6wUcF4a8XJUctDhaYQ.text: Great service, authentic mexican cuisine, and please Ask for Misty she will take care of you guys. Best of the Best at El Dorado Cantina

Cz9iJN7m3g-22WXVoxLIEA.text: Come to El Dorado Cantina and ask for Jefferey. He is awesome waiter. Took care of us and my 7 year old daughter for her birthday. Order the Mahi Mahi Burrito and ask for the fabulous drinks. Thank you Jeffrey for an excellent visit.

Nmcs-jIAx8phv04thqOScg.text: Start off with the table-side guacamole.  It's fresh and delicious and customizable to your tastes.  Tonight we are having shrimp tacos and Mexican corn. Yum! Service excellent. Food is delicious.

5khxwHFtPF8-ZlkakWMVrA.text: My friend took me here and unfortunately we had a bad experience with a server and left before ordering. Much to my surprise, management reached out to both my friend and I the following day. They not only apologized but invited us back.  I'm glad I gave it a second chance as it absolutely blew me away. Doris and Chef Paco were very kind and exhibited top notch customer service. Their passion for their business was apparent.  Not only that, the food was beyond amazing. Everything we had was delicious and of the highest quality.  They turned my initial negative experience into one I'll never forget. I visit Vegas often and will certainly return.

Sl7gBnI_PfOZeMVGswUEBw.text: Love this place! It's hidden off the beaten path but definitely worth coming by. I definitely recommend the fajita bowl! Their steak is amazing! Our server Ericka was so awesome and the hostess was so nice! Definitely coming back on taco Tuesday!

tKxyuJA1G4LcAPys2NoD5Q.text: Love the decor & my friend had faved on about how great it is!  We shared the Street Tacos, which were carnitas, carne asada & shredded chicken & the Chicken Enchiladas w/ Green Tomatillos Sauce.  I like how they shape the Cilantro Rice in a flower looking mold & the margarita's were good!  However, the sauce was good, but the chicken was dry.  The chicken half of my meal was not good.  The other half was ok.    After eating at lots of Mexican restaurants, I have had simple chicken enchiladas & tacos come out moist & much better.  Since my friend loves it, maybe next time I'll try whatever he loves or maybe our palate is different.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Enchiladas w/ green tomatillo sauce
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas, Chicken &amp; Carne Asada Street Tacos

f4ThWgKx9sigMOJcHjvOsQ.text: This was disappointing for the price. Ridiculous amount of money for house guacamole but it is good. Vegetable enchiladas a different story. Way too much red sauce that seemed like it was sitting around for a while as it was no smooth. Most of the vegetable in the enchiladas were huge chunks of carrots. Cheap way of doing things. Hardly any mushrooms or squash. Way too much money for a very disappointing meal. Not sure I'll go back

P3Kvv2G1E1fvUd--KxDB3A.text: Juan was excellent! Great service! Really dark ambiance.  Loved the Mexican corn, tableside quac, and amazing rice! Really love the flan!  The fried ice cream was ok, but could have more texture and taste.

YcQQQS1f01vUSZiyGxMkTg.text: Great food and service no matter what time of the day you go.  Been here multiple times and always stop in while in Vegas.

F5ubBE0WUzim1IpVSF5nxA.text: Wonderful service and great food! We were on our way to Area 51 when me and my friend decided to hit up a local organic restaurant, since we missed out on some Nicaraguan/Spanish food back in LA, we decided to check this place out.   Let me start off by listing some negatives about this restaurant, the parking and location. My friend and I, are very new to Las Vegas so of course we were somewhat surprised to see a strip club,gentlemen's club or adult store in every corner of Vegas and this restaurant just so happens to be directly in the same building of one of these gentlemen's club. We were confused on whether this was a restaurant within the facility or entirely on its own as the parking lot strictly stated that parking was for VIP club members and that non VIP members would be towed. Even though the restaurant is directly next to the club, we did not see any designated parking for the restaurant. We took the risk of a parking ticket and parked our car further down a mini parking lot for another adult gift shop even though we weren't going to shop there.   Besides these two problems I had absolutely no problem with the food at all. We took advantage of my yelp membership to get a free flan and it was quite delicious. The main meal we ordered was the Carne Asada Burritos and they were quite delicious. The chips that came with the salsa was also delicious and there was no problem with the serving portions as it was enough for 2 people to eat and we still had some leftovers from the chips! So there's no need to worry about serving sizes for the chips as usually free chips with priced refills are served underwhelmingly but not at this place! If I'm ever at Las Vegas again I'll be sure to come back for more as this was one of the best organic food options out here in Las Vegas! Just please work on that parking issue!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quite delicious!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Non-GMO and Organic! Sign me the fuck up!

Me01R9LHj-Ve2iCA9PVADQ.text: The pictures are awesome and made us come out of the way to try it. It is in the same building as a strip club but has a separate enterance so I wouldn't bring the kids.   The Margaritas are top notch but the food is so so. I ordered the chilaquiles and sent them back twice. Soggy and hard eggs. No flavor other than raw corn tortilla.   I would stick to the happy hour and you will be OK.

YZT6QIXEXsJCa16J0n1ACg.text: 24/7, Non-GMOs, organic ingredients Mexican food. Mexican food was a bit different than Tex-Mex I am used to, but it was defiantly way better than ordinary Mexican food.  Cheese enchiladas, carne asada tacos, rice, salsa+chips, al pastor tacos and flan were selected.  Al pastor tacos $3 each were very tasty, the tacos were filled with meat, guac, and onions. The pulled pork was very juicy and enough fat balanced the fresh and greasy side.   On the other end, carne asada was too dry. Very hard to swallow. But good portions.   Rice was very unique. Tasted a little bit coconuty with buttery taste. I finished the whole plate of rice, which I had never did with red Mexican rice.  Flan was my favorite. It was very rich and thick, but not too sweet at the same time. Just enough of sweetness and enough of milky taste.  Service was fantastic. Our waiter was very attentive and smiley. Patiently waited for us while we were browsing through the vast selections of tasty Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese enchilada

sQFJ9JKEC7yZkKR8HMqfGA.text: We saw that el dorado had great reviews so we decided to check it out .for lunch . We took a 5 min cab ride from the Wynn and the cabdriver pulled into a strip club. We just looked at each other and said let's keep an open mind...lol. We are so glad we did. Chips and salsa are to die for and green and red salsas are authentic n yummy. We ordered the steak lettuce wraps w guacamole, pico de gallo, etc and the refries beans n rice came with it . Food was so tasty and authentic Mexican cooking . Ambience laid back n chill . Place is open 24 hrs . Loved it. Would def call me back PS. Margaritas are the real deal awesome  and STRONG :)

t_P1U7fskHDtxPyUWUn8fA.text: LOVED it! The food was amazing! We got the steak and chicken fajitas. The meat was tender and so delicious. The service was great! Juan, our server, was so kind. I watched Chef Paco on Chopped, that's how I found out about this place. I'm a huge fan of the show! And Chef Paco came out to meet me!!!!!!!!!!! And brought me this delicious orange ice cream dessert. HIGHLY recommend!

Id94y08la--8pe41ReBmmg.text: Yvett, and the entire El Dorado Cantina was amazing. The service and the freshness of ingredients made this place extremely enjoyable. Like the ambiance and definitely intend on returning !

Mc5_U0T_Yk034wltchWbag.text: We were flying to Las Vegas from Los Angeles,  and one of the passengers started telling us about great places in Las Vegas to eat.  He said his favorite Mexican food anywhere was El Dorado.  We decided to try it as we love Mexican food.  Erica served us and was really friendly and gave us great service.  The food was awesome too!.  We checked in on Yelp,  and they gave us a free flan which was to die for.  Paco the executive chief delivered out flan.  He was really personable.  To top it off,  he brought us another flan!  I highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the flan!  Lol.  I was going to take a picture of the second flan they delivered,  and my friends are it while I was writing this!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Erica,  she was terrific!

ADPjtafFFf3pwSrwFxKQKw.text: Late night vegan food was sub-par even for late night vegan food. Maybe veggie enchiladas were too complex for late night crew. Perhaps sticking to the beans and rice and tortillas would be a wiser vegan option. Decent salsa although I would've expected a lil more kick from how it was described on the menu. I would recommend asking for extra salt salt and hot sauce if you're stuck with this option.

JGqAgz6lph1G-0rQOo88EA.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  If you're tired of paying for overpriced small portions, come here.  Normal prices...which is odd, because all their food is organic and non GMO.  I don't usually care about that, but it usually increases the price.  It doesn't here.  Large portions, and very high quality food at normal, realistic prices.  Try it.  You'll love it.

61k7LP_WNR5VPj0u4LeTBQ.text: So... I used to come here a lot more often when the locals discount was 50% but I came back for the 25% locals discount for my birthday. I had the amazingly perfect steak fajitas and got the free flan for checking in on yelp. I've never gotten the flan before but decided to go for it. It was perfect; the best ever. So on top of the amazing food, we had a wonderful server as well. He is SUPER adorable and has a fun personality. His name is Chris, but he likes being called Bob.  Thanks for a wonderful evening Chef Paco, Chris, and El Dorado!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ate the flan too fast for a picture... oops.

L1MlA_LgmPVIh54UzJWngQ.text: I've been here several times, but I will never come back.  Service was absolutely horrible.  We had a sizeable party, and were completely ignored by the waitstaff.  It took 45 minutes after we sat down before they even brought us water.  Drinks took forever.  The bills were are mixed up.  Food was decent if markedly markedly overpriced.  To add insult to it, we were of course charged 18% gratuity.  I'm assuming that since we were already going to be charged a sizeable tip, why even bother with service?

ko4t3soDJYCFVcggrkUxpg.text: The food was savory and delicious. We ordered a chicken burrito and a veggie burrito with black beans and they are very big, no skimpy portions here! The flan we had for dessert was quite possibly thee best flan we have ever had! The service is awesome and our waitress Erika was very attentive. We will definitely be back soon.

1ukgXtd1of_ZfzoHg4RyZA.text: Real care has been put into the menu and the ingredients. Very authentic and top quality meats. Worth the drive from the strip

oTZEaWCjHS97k_7lEN8bFg.text: 24/7 and all organic food! Our waiter Greg was really helpful in describing the way the food was made. Also the hostesses in the front recommended the table side guacamole which was amazing!

gzGyohh4x8LJ1RpbCwnZqQ.text: Despite sharing a wall with a gentleman's club the food and service is excellent! Great Mexican food and very friendly staff. Ambiance is fun and the menu is very robust. A lot of organic and gluten free options. We'll be back!

1aftQQqNut60XNB4SuR2fQ.text: Definitely one of the best restaurants in TOWN, can't beat non GMO and ORGANIC!! If you're looking for top quality Mexican food, I recommend El Dorado Cantina and the best thing about it all?!?!?  IT'S 24/7, holidays.. no problems!! The atmosphere is great, good customer service. I'd come to this restaurant a million times more!! I gotta give it to "Chef Paco", he makes the magic in the kitchen... I couldn't ask for a better Chef :)

xr7NiOr0200vTRh0Z6turA.text: Our waitress Erica is amazing! Would definitely come back as this was my first time in Vegas.  The sipes were delicious and the steak tacos I had were so very good too.  We were seated promptly and it wasn't too busy for lunch.  I'll be back!

hqKZrEnoz7yGEeIpSzMkjw.text: My first time here and the food and the flavors were marvelous. I have driven past on my way to work for 2 years and never stopped until an out of town friend wanted to come just for the cilantro rice. Our server Angel Reyes was good at letting me know what was good. I will be back soon to try more on the menu.

pMx5RrANBKoALd2TsfyNCQ.text: Everything was delicious. Food was fresh and made with love. Can't wait to come back. $6 don Julio 1942 on tuesdays! Can't beat that.

F7YabdKtGb6TjnxvYMITtQ.text: Good food and the bartenders there are amazing .  Definitely recommend to other people .  They have good tacos . With a wide variety including vegetarian options .

pLKTT2xyD3J5rZl1V5jDaw.text: My favorite Mexican Restuarant .. try the margaritas ! Best Guacamole and salsa...the tacos are amazing.. I can go on ! Paco the chef will come out to see how you liked your food.. awesome customer service .

I am not a huge fan of Mexican but the burrito was amazing and HUGE! I ended up eating the second half plus the rest of my rice and beans the next day and it was STILL good.  Definitely will be back once I return to Vegas.

eYWuxMRANptFzyikNeLHAg.text: Excellent food!!! It is so good! The green salsa is the best ever! You probably need a reservation to eat here on most nights. We didn't have one and ended up at the bar which is first come. Saw on the tv that the chef was on the tv show chopped- super cool! Service was slow, but expected when they are full.

J9BSbdsUaBERmBhdtXZvFw.text: What a great Mexican restaurant located on Sammy Davis jr Dr.   The guys and I were our late last night and came across this 24/7 restaurant.   Great food, service and prices plus obviously great hours.    We enjoyed some awesome drinks, enchiladas, tacos and burritos.

VlLI3I-_trJ4X5ZyWMeokQ.text: Sometimes a precious pearl can be found inside the most unlikely of oysters. Such is the case of El Dorado Cantina. Located in the building that also plays home to the Saphire 'Gentlemen's Club, this gem of a restaurant has near exemplary Mexican fare. I came for the mahi-mahi taco (an interesting choice given the adjacent business), and was not disappointed. The Mexican street corn side dish was the perfect mix of slightly burnt and creamy. High marks also go to the chunky table side guacamole, which had just the right amount of cilantro. Our server, Erica was a delight.

19B2AtkN6BwnTpQqAJBUvA.text: We started with the table side guac which was expertly prepared by Stella, our waitress. It was so yummy that we almost considered ordering tons of it. We then moved on to the tacos. Since we are vegetarian, we got the cauliflower tacos which were amazing. The chef personally came and made sure we are doing fine. I feel Chef Paco should be renamed Chef Taco cause he is sooooooo good!  Dessert recommendation: Nieve de Naranja
