LRyQFtwpqAKdbefOflmDnQ.text: Juan was awesome, as was the food. This place came highly recommended by several close friends and now I know why. Best damn Mexican food in town hands down. I'm not easily impressed, but the freshness of the food, the homemade quality of the dishes, the beautiful decor and the exceptional service impressed my socks off. Tip - get a pitcher of margaritas if four of you are dining - they're spectacular.

Rox0xWAf5lqI-655Qf3PtQ.text: Food was good! Well made and tasty. The four stars instead of five is for the service. Our waiter was inattentive and distracted. The bartender and the support staff were nice, but we sat and waited for our waiter the entire meal.

3bKwrsExG-VrB_LPQVRCXg.text: Best street tacos I've had since Mexico. The Chef is from Mexico City and it shows in his food! Host was friendly and welcoming. Dez was behind the bar and gave us great service!

_lR_OjEvo5ByyaHsBDPtXg.text: Worth the trip over from the strip. Real food; organic , non GMO. Chips and salsa starter was just the thing. Fun vibe- Enrique was friendly and the service was great!

Z7HRhKQIOffazC9tUZnbFg.text: I don't even know where to start. This place is amazing! From the atmosphere to the plating. Everything in this place is top notch. We received a free sample of "Aqua fresco" the cantaloupe flavor and it was fantastic. Then these amazing chips and salsa (three amazing flavors). To top it off the chef came out and greeted us, gave us a free sample of flan. You could tell he was very proud of his hard work and you can feel it too. Oh and checked in for a free margarita!  Don't pass up this place. Lol oh wait we almost did. It's inside the gentleman's club parking lot. But don't let the location fool you, this is a must top.

EvKjw3fNC11369to6vLNog.text: Though located in an obscure location next door to a strip club, this Mexican restaurant serves up delicious food and potent drinks. Their busy but accommodating staff is at your service. The juicy tender Carnitas plate is fantastic and the Margaritas complement with an welcoming extra kick. Definitely recommend this, open 24/7, festive dinning experience.

SQTAhFFNjJGb1RgCI2kkpA.text: Wow! Best Mexican food in LV!! Organic differing as well as gluten free and free range meat. So delicious!

y_LN5xdKh2O47tZt8MAqbA.text: Best Mexican food this side of the border!  Sit at the bar and pray Dino is working.   He's the main reason we're coming back.  El Pastor street tacos, Raspberry margaritas are organic with fresh fruit.  No purees.  Tres Leches and seared Mahi tacos and steak bowl were all fabuous.

sa4AW9oDPVsRfZDxXNw3eg.text: Never write reviews but had to for this place. Anything next to a strip club, especially food, should be considered suspect... Being that I'm more into food than Strip Clubs and the great reviews we decided to try it out. Cool vibe and Amazing food! Chris (Native/Mexican/Merican/Angeleno/witness protection program) server was awesome! Iv been in Vegas 25yrs and on of the best Mexican places around!! Come check it out!!

U-jKrXIHaSXY1dG2PF1moA.text: Don't really understand all the 5 star ratings as this food does not really taste better than a lot of the Mexican food I've had in California. Don't get me wrong, the food is good, just not good enough to justify the prices they are charging, I had the carne asada burrito and it was good but definitely not better than the carne asada burrito I get for half that price at the local Alberto's behind my house! Also thought the location of this place was a bit quirky as it shares its walls with the largest strip club in America. We had to pull over and ask a parking lot attendant where the restaurant was because the strip club was pretty much covering it up. Service is good and at the end of the meal the chef came out and spoke to our party for a minute which was nice.

j3jre_RrDMKJpdq7vHID6A.text: Great food 24/7.  Rafael provided great service during my first visit.  I arrived at 1am to sample their happy hour menu.  Will definitely visit again

knVB4WehSSdLv2_efkfegw.text: I had heard all of the rave reviews and finally got to try El Dorado Cantina myself and it is all that it is cracked up to be. We were greeted by a friendly hostess and seated immediately. Our server came quickly and took our drink order. We were served fresh tortilla chips and 3 different salsas, which were explained to us by our server. We ordered the Tableside Guacamole. Our server explained all of the ingredients while he prepared it. It was super fresh and flavorful. When the margaritas came my brother joked to our waiter that they were big enough to go swimming in, and there was no shortage of alcohol. For the main course my wife ordered the Carne Asada Burritto and both my brother and I ordered the Siegel Plate. The amount of food was overwhelming and everything was seasoned and cooked to perfection. The part I loved the most is that there were no heavy beans to fill me up. For dessert we shared the flan which also was amazing. Chef Paco came out and introduced himself and his passion for this restaurant shows through his unbelievable recipes. This is a must try if you live in Vegas or are visiting the area.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is a special sneak preview of Chef Paco&#39;s Valentine&#39;s Day dessert. It&#39;s a combination of flan and strawberry cake.

ZF1sI992S1h7XNrxS_nHeg.text: I has dinner here with a friend who was visiting and saw a few signs for the place.   The meal was delicious and the service was great.   I'd go back

cQZ7ZD65k7TNDzgMm4ENBg.text: Fun atmosphere and really good food. This is much better than you might imagine. Our server Chris (aka Cinnamon), was excellent. He had a great sense of humor and he knew the menu. His recommendations were spot on and he directed is to Yelp for a free flan for desert. Chef Paco came to the table to make sure we had a nice meal and enjoyed our experience. We will definitely be back.

UO80QV-jGNiftL8l6PkAQw.text: Great food and service! Our server Grace took great care of us! I got the shrimp tacos and they were delicious. We also got the table side guac and the queso fundido and they were very good too. 10/10 would recommend.

DmyEWpD8zrFgJctCP32XoQ.text: Love this restaurant! My husband and I are from San Diego California and have been living in vegas for sometime.  We have not had the best luck finding good Mexican food that serves yummy salsa. But finding this place was so exciting for us, on Monday they have a good deal for locals, margaritas are fresh and made from scratch and the fajitas are my favorite.  Would recommend to anyone looking for fresh food for a great price!

jB4Q9JEGGB4XPqc0LwAEmQ.text: This 5/5 rating is due to their phenomenal service and amazing quality of food.   A friend visiting from out of town requested authentic Mexican food and this place was at the top of my list due to its high Yelp rating. We were lucky enough to be there on The day when stars aligned - National Taco Day and Taco Tuesday happening at the same time. Also, El Dorado was offering $1 Tacos from 4p-6p in honor of some new menu options. We'd made reservations for 5:30p, but due to needing not only a high chair, but also room for a stroller, we weren't seated for a few minutes. (Of course this place was packed on such a special occasion.) But the manager came by our table within the first few minutes and assured us that we would get our $1 tacos even though time was running out.   We ordered guac, which is made table side. You can make it as spicy (or not spicy) as you like. We went with no spice, but there was still plenty of flavor - definitely a lot of lime and garlic came through.   We each ordered five tacos as well as sides of beans and rice for the little ones. My favorite taco was definitely the short rib because the meat had so much flavor!  When dessert time rolled around, I was quite surprised that they let three of us claim our free Flan with Yelp check-in. Frankly, I ordered the Flan simply because it was free (I was far more interested in trying the Deep Fried Ice Cream and the Churros). However, the Flan ended up being my favorite of the three! (I guess I've only ever had mediocre Flan). This was a beautiful custard - not too gelatinous in texture (I hate that), but perfectly smooth and creamy. The flavor was sweet, but not over powering. This will definitely be my top pick for dessert when we come back!   But don't get me wrong, the other desserts were pretty awesome, too! The Ice Cream's Fried exterior had the perfect chew and crunch and was absolutely dripping in hot fudge! And the churros had a crunchy, sugar-coated outside and chewy inside.   The chef also sent out two VIP, off-the menu desserts for the little ones - it was a pumpkin cheesecake topped with whipped cream. Talk about about delicious!  I couldn't believe that in one evening we had the chef and the manager come by a couple times to make sure everything was to our satisfaction! And the Chef sent special desserts for the girls? And he gave us $5 off coupons to encourage us to come back and try breakfast?! AND they manager let us know that on Mondays locals get 25% off their entire bill?!? This place is an absolute steal. Especially considering the quality of the food and the artistry and flavor that comes out of the kitchen.   If you haven't been, go! And make sure to ask for Chris as your waiter. If he can handle our crazy party of seven, he can handle anything. And he does it all with a smile!

hwRCdWX6DXmbU5XA_Kqn5w.text: I had ZERO clue about this place until yesterday. Little did I know it was right next door to Sapphires Gentlemans Club til we all arrived lol   They have some great art outside of the building. When you walk inside it's a lower lighting w/ a good amount of open space. We had a large party so they placed us in the back. Their menu is about 4 pages long that consists of tacos, burritos, fajitas and a few other things. We got the mild, medium and spicy guacamole. They do it right at your table which I always love. The spicy didn't have much spice IMO. I got a burrito w/ carne asada, shrimp and rice. It was great!  Everyone in our party was happy w/ their dinner. Drinks were on point.  I can't believe this place has been around for quite sometime and I'm barely finding out about it. Def worth checking out again!

UhUXM4yAiTtSEY5X36Ra6A.text: Came here with a big group, and unfortunately they didn't have our reservation on file. BUT they immediately pulled together tables and accommodated our group. The food was delicious, and our server Grace was wonderful. She was friendly, and made the most amazing guacamole. Thank you for a great night!

9fhUUQ63JQs3miBXlMEuRg.text: Excellent! Second time here and the food is wonderful. Our server was the best and I recommend that everyone eat dinner here. Choose the door on the left and not the entrance on the right!

mJzf3ZSb-xy73cF-wW78bQ.text: Excellent place. Customer Service was great thanks to Angel Nunez. Would recommend 10/10 also would come back. Shrimp/chicken taquitos and nachos were delicious and they weren't stingy with the guacamole!

raG9PNN1MwWEPuaqxVBJSQ.text: This place is GREAT!!! 24 hour classy joint next to sapphire . Make sure you ask for the waiter ANGEL, Great service always takes care of any needs to enjoy your evening.

I was disappointed bc I don't get to have Mexican often and expected more given the reviews.  We had guacamole, a carnitas burrito, and chicken sopes.

BUSz06g-iUqd69W5CezHKw.text: While I wouldn't say it's a common occurrence, there are times when my experience at a restaurant is just the complete opposite of Yelp consensus, but I'm not sure that's ever been the case to this degree. El Dorado Cantina comes in at a prestigious #28 in this year's Yelp Top 100, but my experience during a Saturday dinner was one that's routinely eclipsed by both contemporary and traditional Mexican restaurants across the country.    Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?  If you're not already aware, El Dorado Cantina shares a building with Sapphire, the world's largest strip club. That's not at all a strike against the restaurant, but it's just something to be aware of.   Once you're inside the atmosphere and service at El Dorado are both excellent, with attentive servers who bring the food out quickly. Star Granted.   Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?  So it was here that things started to get a bit off. After downing some mediocre margaritas I reviewed the menu, and was a bit surprised to find that an order of three street tacos came to $12.00, or $4.00 each. That is, by any standard, expensive for street tacos, which even at sit down spots often run me no more than $2.50 or so in Dallas or Los Angeles or elsewhere in Las Vegas. I think I might better understand that price point if El Dorado were on the Strip, but they aren't, and at the end of the day these were still pretty basic and normally portioned street tacos. That's simply too expensive a price point. No Star Granted.    Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?  I opted for three street tacos: one carnitas, one pastor, and one carne asada. All three were good, but none of the three were great. The meats were clearly of high quality and the peripheral onions and cilantro were well portioned, but the tortillas (flour) didn't taste as fresh as I've had elsewhere and there was a lack of salsa options to accompany the trio. Had these been cheaper or larger I think I'd have a different opinion here, but given that they were neither, I can only define these tacos as having been 'okay'. Single Star Granted.   Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?  Maybe spending the past four years in Dallas has permanently skewed my view of how good tacos should taste and cost, but I'm honestly just confused as to why my dinner experience was in such contrast to Yelp's consensus. For now, there are better Mexican options in Vegas in my opinion. No Star Granted.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos (3): $12.00

RCUcWEQmJihpiAlc9sJH4A.text: One of our family's favorite spots! The queso fundido is absolutely AMAZING and a must have!!! Jalepeno margaritas are fire!!! Juan made us awesome tableside guacamole! We will always  be returning customers!

ofOP9coopbNvSTic3AsDSg.text: Been here twice in the last week.  We really like this place however during the last two visits something seemed to be off with the food.  Don't know if Chef Paco was not there the last two times or not?  The service was good the last two times, we walked in were seated right away and offered drinks.  On this very last visit when the chips and salsa were brought to the table the chips seemed hard and stale tasting which at first seemed odd as we've never had this before.    The rice, normally amazing buttery flavor with cilantro both this time and last week was really dry and not flavorful like it used to be.  Last week I had the steak fajitas which were seasoned really well, the rice was bland and not like usual.  Last night I got the ribeye deciding to try something new and it was cooked to perfection and tasted amazing, however the rice was again dry and bland, not like it used to be.  Also my daughter got the fajitas this time and the guacamole they brought with her dish looked old and dry.  My wife's dish which was the soup and a sandwich, also did not taste like it was seasoned the way it used to be.  I really like this place but my wife was not happy the last two visits which is really sad.  The staff is amazing, on top of everything, it just seems like the kitchen is not the same.  I hope we will be back but it's up to the boss, two bad visits for her normally does not go back for a third disappointment.

c4A5zupEaRMLDe7culjuTg.text: Always a good time! Always FREE flan.  This is one of the only places in Vegas that is always consistent in taste, freshness and service.   Chef Paco visited our table to ask for feedback on our meal. That was a nice touch.   Offered us a discount when the service saw my military ID! A+ for military discount!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary cheese quesadilla for the kids!

Mr_GCV-bFkImWSJDP8hX4Q.text: This is a uniquely Vegas experience with great food and great service. Uniquely Vegas because of the location. No fear for the shy, El Dorado has their own door so you don't have to walk through a strip club to access the restaurant.  Our waitress was very attentive and was always around when we needed something. Our water glasses were refilled often and empty dishes were cleared quickly.  The salsas that comes with the chips to start were really good. That definitely set the tone for what was to come. Both the red and the green were fresh and flavorful. We also started with Beef Empanadas. They were good, but not out of this world flavorful.  The Chicken Enchiladas were really good. I loved the sauce on top of the enchiladas. The rice and beans on the side were nicely seasoned. The Mexican Corn had a nice flavor. My husband enjoyed his Short Rib tacos as well.   Dessert that evening was the Flan that is free with Yelp check-in. Flan is not my preferred dessert, but this was really good flan.   I'm glad that I didn't let the location keep me away because the food is great!

TAOWiV9YTVw-I5lEB79QUQ.text: Unfortunately this was not my choice but I wanted to meet up w/some of my radio station co workers & this was picked by one of the other guys. It was basically empty -went @4:30pm & when you're at a restaurant at an off peak time...I expect excellent service simply bc we are almost the only 6 ppl there! Service was awful-one guest waited 20 min for a come and finally gave up and walked up to the bar himself to get a refill a HUGE no no in the industry! We waited way too long for our meals, one was a salad, street tacos, appetizer quesadilla which didn't taste like any "steak" I've ever eaten. Rhen the churros one person ordered weren't even hot. They were sent back and obviously just re microwaved be the whip cream was taken off. The inside was filled w/what looked like an orange filling which later they said was Carmel. Well he didn't eat it and therefore had nothing bc that was all he ordered. We came home and made dinner. They did the 18% and it was more then he deserved bc he disappeared for 90% of the meal but proceeded to hover around when it was Check time. Argh. None of us Not impressed overall. Not to mention the extremely weak mango margaritas small size for $14?! Yikes -nope not again.

rKqlAIy9pi1bo2bBs_F7OQ.text: In Vegas for CES, and as I often do, relied on Yelp to look for a good place for dinner. The El Dorado Cantina did not disappoint! TGnE2fCatrkZw-NrrnvMvw.text: Had such an amazing time here! Came in with a few of my girlfriends and not only was the food amazing but the staff was as well. They took the time to get to know me and give me their personal recommendations. Thanks to Miranda, Amber, Daniel and Chef Paco we enjoyed the amazing chicken tinga, quesadilla, and the most surprising the GRASSHOPPERS! Everything was amazing and you could taste the time and effort put into each dish. I'm so glad we decided to try something new! We will be back for sure :):)

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vfaSYVtVWv3yvm0XS8JbfQ.text: Excellent service, excellent food! Reasonable and delicious! The table side guacamole is the best I've ever had.  We also had the steak bowl.  The place is all organic and GMO free - a nice bonus! To finish up - the fried ice cream - amazing!

NDN1s5Sj-Foi-7pNl6hmgg.text: Food was very good, I had the street tacos and my girlfriend had the Mahi tacos. We ordered a margarita, Very good. You get free flan with a Yelp check in and it was very good. The service was amazing, the whole experience was topped off by wonderful customer service by the general manager! All in all a great experience. I will be back.

ZOHWr5WYKlL5Zdu33UX2kw.text: If you like Mexican food, and are in Las Vegas you need to visit El Dorado Cantina, located next to the luxurious Saphire on Industrial Road. The atmosphere is friendly and elegant, the service is outstanding, so are the variety of dishes prepared by Chef Paco, who gave us a fantastic service..He came out to chat, and made us feel part of the family. We ordered beef burritos and cocktails. The dish was delicious and came with three kinds of salsa including "Rico" Guacamole, and the best chili habanero I have tested in Las Vegas. We were there on a Thursday, and Latin music was playing in the background. We will soon be coming back to El Dorado Cantina. This place is Awasome!!

evlCzz2_kMDVNyelwvNmSg.text: First, they actually share a building,  not just the parking lot with Sapphires, but don't let that stop you from checking out this restaurant.  The ambiance and decor is great. There's a cute bar in the center, but didn't check it out since I was there for lunch.  The chicken empanadas were delicious as our appetizer. Their chips were really good and definitely homemade.  They have a trio of salsas and all 3 were delicious.  The peach colored is extra spicy,  so if you don't like really hot food stick with the other 2. I had cheese enchiladas as my main course - they were good. I didn't try the rice or beans because I was already full. Service could be a little better though, as we did have to wait a long time to get refills on tea and soda. Prices were in line with other restaurants nearby and the portions are big! I would recommend this to try if you love good Mexican food.  I also noticed a wide range of gluten free options.

VZhxiegq6CPii1wT3HQDJA.text: Here we go!  So I'm in Vegas for the weekend, came to visit this guy I met online. The guy works at encore, Wynn, and he decided to bring me to a restaurant off the strip rather than take me to a steak house at the Wynn...  This restaurant is actually pretty great overall, but common, a girl travels to Vegas just for you and instead of wining and dining her u bring her to a random Mexican restaurant off the strip in a dark street? Oh wait, did I mention there's a gentlemans club next door? Well there is, and between us, I rather be there. Brb my food just got here.  Ok so I just finished my meal, the margaritas aren't that good, but the food is honestly amazing. The best part of the meal was the cilantro rice, it was soft and had a sweet touch to it which made it really appetizing. The server was great, his name was Mark, very nice guy and would check on us very often to make sure we're happy with everything we ordered and he made sure that our experience went well. I ordered the steak burrito and it was pretty good, we also got shrimp tacos and they were amazing, the shrimp was grilled so it was a light meal. For dessert: I hope you like eggs bc the flan tastes like a day old omelet.  Adios!!!! ;)

QvtJ6SSB9_i8oW8Fz1qsVw.text: This restaurant is amazing I'm so excited they have a gmo free organic restaurant in Vegas :) The bartender Kai was extremely nice very helpful and knowledgeable on ingredients on the menu.

X7lf2RbBRhVPwC70dbesAg.text: I love the food here! extra bonus they use quality ingredients.

FBQw1noETiMFm8pjs0IH_g.text: Awesome food, awesome service, awesome prices. It's really hard to find a restaurant that cooks with organic ingredients, makes it taste amazing, and does it affordably; this is one of the few. Went there 3 nights in a row with my work team, we loved it and brought clients there as well. Sean (the manager) is very accommodating, and his staff is the same. Beyond that, it was the best Mexican food I've ever had!

jQqtESbm9cc4jZfDA7xRnw.text: Delicious food and great service! We were however disappointed when we ordered the "tableside  guacamole" and were told the "cart" was backed up and asked if it would be ok if they made it in back and brought it out to us, we were looking forward to watching it be freshly prepared at out table. Again the food was superb! And the chef even came out to greet each table and introduce himself. Try this place you won't regret it!

pAuRx7t0z95Qbjl8IJ2kLA.text: Very clean and well decorated. Food is nicely presented and you can tell that the chef cares about the quality of the food. The carnitas tacos were the best out of the several we tried. Our server, Jesse made excellent tableside guacamole. he was cute and friendly and attentive. they also serve watermelon juice with free refills. I will certainly repeat when in the mood for Mexican fare.

O-FvM7PsapHMjCp4mSs5qQ.text: This is definitely one of the better places for Mexican food in Las Vegas. This restaurant's location is a little off putting but don't let that fool you, you are about to have great Mexican food.  First let me discuss its location, it is on Industrial Road about 3 minutes from Fashion Show Mall and shares a parking lot and building with the Sapphire's gentleman's club. (Please Note: This is not the same business, they only share the same building.)  Once inside the El Dorado Cantina, you will be impressed by the decor and friendly service.  I would to discuss the food; the server described the menu as all organic and GMO free.  We ordered appetizers, entrees and a selection of their happy hour street tacos. The food that arrived so far exceeded my expectations that I was compelled to write this review. Let's talk about the street taco sampler platter, six tacos for six dollars... This has to be the best value for happy hour in all of Las Vegas. The Chef, came to our table (Chef Paco) to ask on the quality of the dinner and insisted that we try the Spanish Flan with his complements. If you like don't like flan you will be surprised and if you like flan you will be amazed.

dQa-f7gY2ZYc7TWAPhTwoA.text: We had a wonderful dinner at this well decorated authentic Mexican restaurant. Kai, our server was informative and hospitable. Chef Paco came by and greeted our table and promised a recipe for his excellent cilantro rice. One warning, it's right next to the Sapphire Gentlemen's Club, so there's that. But other than that, you'll have a great time 24 hrs a day.

xG0bXDr1c3KZIWzUYsbTww.text: The food was amazing!  The icing on the cake was finding out the ingredients were organic.  Chef Paco was wonderful and having him come out just sealed the deal for me.  Great service!

ocGEAxI3LxTyd8doR5S4IQ.text: We decided to go here for a quality Mexican meal and it did not disappoint. I had the steak and shrimp fajitas and they were amazing! The service was also very good. I also recommend their house made guacamole, some of the best I've had.

XkgpUnKf7j-acPD32F-PsA.text: You have to try the jalapeno margarita and the chips and salsa. The ingredients are fresh and you can taste the difference! Didn't try the desserts though.

CvPwS-RrgR5EYz4O5k845w.text: The best authentic Mexican food this side of the border! You can't go wrong with anything that you order. I am spoiled when it comes to Mexican food because my grandmother from Queretaro cooked for us the majority of her life, she was 102 when she passed, so you know her cooking was traditional and authentic! The food was absolutely delicious and the aguas frescas were perfect after a long, hit day, they took me back to my days in Mexico when I was just a kid.  I will definitely be coming back! The chef is amazing!

9hldKEEa4C_EdOQFH5yHrw.text: Stop reading reviews and just go!!!! Hands down the BEST Mexican food we've ever had at a restaurant! Please open up a location in LA!! The fact that it's organic and non-gmo is what makes this place a gem...we honestly wouldn't have gone if that wasn't the case. The location IS next to a gentlemens club with the same parking but it has its own entrance and it's honestly not that big of a deal. Our server was Amber and she rocked it! Gave us good recommendations that weren't your standard "this is popular BS" that a lot of servers do to push certain items. She checked on us often and made sure we had everything we needed. We ordered the Carne Asada Burrito and 3 Tacos ( Al Pastor, Chicken, and Cochinita). The burrito was absolutely phenomenal. The beef was so tender I though I was eating short ribs! The tacos were all really good too but Cochinita was the star! I also ordered the Strawberry Margarita was which so good and so much! It's practically a fish bowl drink and it's not full of unnatural simple syrup or triple sec. Everything but tequila is organic in that sucker and they're even working on getting organic tequila too. We then met Chef Paco when we got our Yelp Flan (which is no small portion) and he told us about his grandmas authentic recipes and the importance of organic ingredients. It's no wonder that the food, especially the meat, is so tasty! We will definitely be back every time we come to Vegas!!

JhvrhW4lQissUAQ2B8ThkA.text: Great food. Went on a Sunday so the place was kind of empty, which made the service spectacular (not sure how it would be when they are busier). The food was fantastic. Very organic and "real". The main chef (Paco) came out to our table and visited with us (again, it wasn't packed so not sure if that is normal) but that made the experience even better. Don't be discouraged that this place is attached to a gentlemen's club (as others have noted, it has a separate entrance).

Zk_Zvz4KQb1zXLuHCxKa0g.text: Awesome dinner in a strip club...not really in the club but in the building.  service was outstanding and everyone of us loved the carne asada and carnitas.  I'd go back just for quest fundido with mushrooms alone,  really enjoyed the experience.

arSbEzjMmIlwJYU-GWb3pg.text: Service is amazing. We had our food in no time. Kai is on top of his game and knew food items in detail, from the organic ingredients to the organic meats. Delicious food, we even had chef Paco bring us a plate on the house. Would I recommend this retaurant? Yes, yes, yes.

B9Y9EB-0HQcaYBTGs8TKTQ.text: Our meals were delicious! Kai's service was exceptional and chef Paco personally came out and greeted us. The presentation of the food was simply beautiful. This place is a hidden gem!

TDBKEzcnM5O0wtlDkJn5Sg.text: This place is now at the top of our Mexican food restuarant list.  We were hesitant about it being next to a gentleman's club but do not let that stop you.  The food is cooked with veggie oil and they have vegetarian entrees as well.  The booths are large and comfortable and you  don't have to compete with ambient noise to have a conversation.  Our server Kai was very friendly and the service was great.  The flan is amazing!

F38JYVtKTNeXzTSt63-yBg.text: The food was wonderful!  The chef and Jesse were great.  We came in with my friend and we tried each other's food.  So tasty,  great flavors,  I finally had seafood enchiladas that didn't taste fishy but only tasted great!   We loved our chicken empanadas and make room for deliciousness with their churros.  Happiness!  That is how we left oh and crazy full. Thank you for opening up!  My boyfriend and I will be back!

pfsXPHUxnNILj-GQ9pG-VQ.text: This place is EXACTLY what I needed after a night of dancing and drinking. I can't rave enough about this place. I had no idea this place was located next to Sapphire so it was pretty funny rolling up here since my ladies for sure thought I tricked them. Our waiter was a sweet and patient man. We listened to shakira and ate good. Their rice!! Omg their rice tasted like it marinated in butter. I got the three taco platter but to be honest, all I remember was the rice. And I'm definitely coming back for it. Best place to be opened 24/7.

JOOxKqQ5l3MzoExr3c5O-A.text: We went in the middle of the afternoon. It was not busy. It took at least 15 minutes to get just drinks (water and 2 margaritas). Both margaritas had dead fruit flies visibly floating on top. The waitress offered to remake the drinks. Between the dark, dirty atmosphere and poor service, we left.

YXHiwi17AssvfqGMLfxFzQ.text: Hugo served us up some shockingly good Mexican food.  Being from Texas, I was skeptical of what I would find, but after the Mexican shrimp cocktail I knew we had found something special.  You should not miss this spot.

lRhHYzL3DPzlnCTpEFtfYg.text: One might think that a taco place attached to a strip club might not be the highest of quality but in this case? You'd be wrong.  It's pretty damn great.  The first time we went, we shared a pitcher of margaritas that are full of fresh flavor & there is NO skimping of the tequila - they are amazing.  The chips & 3 salsas that are brought to the table are super yummy.  We also ordered the queso fundido with mushrooms which was tasty.  Then there was the street tacos.  I ordered the carnitas tacos which were delicious.  The rice that came along with them was good (typical mexican side of rice).  We ordered a dessert to share - the fried ice cream.  It was really good.  I've had better versions but it was tasty.  Especially the banana sauce on the side.  The service we had this night was great.  As for the 2nd time we went, we happened to show up during happy hour.  Surprisingly enough, it was not as busy as the 1st night we went BUT the service was so much slower & worse.  It took forever to get drinks, to order, to get refills, our food, etc.  That was the only reason for the 4 star review instead of a full 5.  I'm hoping the next time we go, the service will be as good as the food is!

VvPt0m1dDDersdbPAE6a7w.text: The food was amazing and the service was fantastic. Enirique was the best! Give him a raise!

xq8ORWA1cnYgPB7HyeQwqA.text: Excellent restaurant authentic Mexican food street tacos are the best.  The bar Cadillac margaritas have a generous tequila pour

9I5fRTLbZ546MF_M75Cwcg.text: Conchinita Tacos and Mahi Mahi tacos this time around. Hint to the locals, Mondays is 50% off for ALL LOCALS!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful authentic Mexican decorations all around

AGpHZA1r271oBbsa8bsqZQ.text: Food is good timeliness of delivery to the table could be better as my breakfast entree was barely warm throughout.

4dmedJGStmtuhmXdJ0hKHw.text: The food was delicious and it came really fast. The chips at the beginning are the best part!!! Enrique and the rest of the staff were awesome! Great place, would definitely come again!

CQ3znztd9kw5h6JFIl1d2g.text: This is the best Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas. They have the BEST Chiles Rellenos EVER! The salsa & chips are delicious. The watermelon water is so refreshing. I love this place and I would highly recommend it.

wGTQFnhhCssrAls86Vlprw.text: All the ingredients are farm raised, organic, and fresh. This combined with a brilliant menu makes for a divine dining experience. Highly recommended if you enjoy Mexican.

kNOcsg_Z2O-al0EaHKslHw.text: Everything is to die for!  Cadillac margs a plus.  Seafood enchiladas a plus. Flan yummy!  Thanks paco!

VvBWWXuIaWeKYZLKg3XH9w.text: Food was great, service (Erica) was even better. Street tacos were flavorful and well prepared which washed down well with the house margaritas.

acAhpzv0iHYRothbnhdSkw.text: Absolutely a great place! I've made a nice decision choosing your restaurant for eat some traditional Mexican food. We were attended by Enrique, he is the best waiter! because he's very attentive with his customers, even he speak Spanish! That's a nice quality in a person who works in a restaurant like this, I think. The food was delicious! My compliments to the Chef.

JkSP5SsdV_nyEFSdz_O5Ow.text: Great margaritas! All it took was a quarter of one for an auntie to become super fun. I enjoyed the guacamole, which was made table side by a waiter. I ordered the cilantro garlic shrimp; made with wild gulf shrimp. This was succulent, buttery and juicy. The rice was different. Was that glutinous rice being used? There was coconut milk in there for sure. It reminded me of a South East Asian dessert, which may be why I thought it an odd pairing with my main course. Oh and there were no vegetables with the meal, weird. Service was great; hence the 4 stars.

NVqGbx_wdWhVrqqsJetDig.text: This food is amazing! Chef Paco you're the man. Thank you for taking care of us the "Montebello Angels"

7hKPtvg-tptQ_RjM2NJnqg.text: A go to spot for excellent authentic Mexican.  Chef Paco delivers organic, high quality ingredients in savory dishes so fresh each blend into a crescendo of flavor in every bite.  Our handsome waiter Eddie, styling Elton John red eye ware, created a table side guacamole so good it seemed to melt in our mouth.  Entrees of mahi tacos, shrimp tacos, and street tacos, carne asada and carnitas, were delicious and very filling.  We topped off our lunch with Chef Paco's grandmother's recipe of the most delicious flan I have ever tasted.  Definitely a new favorite for Mexican in Las Vegas.  For those so inclined, the Sapphire Gentleman's Club next door offers a pleasant respite from the summer heat.

IgzfaJ2LXEkS8VZjo0canQ.text: Sat at the bar. Service was great. Nell served me and was very friendly and attentive. I had the octopus and chorizo tacos which were good. Chips and three salsas also good. The cilantro and lime cocktail was exceptional. Well balanced with coconut, cilantro and Casamigos tequila. Good value if you're looking for good food at a reasonable price in Vegas.

gGekkZgNAi3N0LbMs7JROw.text: Excellent pork dish! More than enough for two. Some of the best flan I've ever had. Great off strip find!

bOGX3tFPpP1JxzYFcbF15Q.text: I can't get enough of this place! Finally a good margarita and an even better waiter. Neil was an excellent server. Friendly, efficient, knowledgeable on the menu. Everything that makes service great.

ZnauxULlXEtnrMMreB-Mvg.text: Great place to come for authentic Mexican food Juan was the best l.. you have to try the table side guacamole.

-51JdlazCLANJMZnXRiheQ.text: De-lic-iOus!!!  So very glad my cousin bought us here.  Great service and the food was absolutely Devine.  Non-GMO organic food that tastes like grandma is in the kitchen!!!   The head chef Paco came out and greeted us and confirmed that the Flan is his grandma's recipe!  Two thumbs up and my bougie pinkie too!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!!!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Margaritas

g0iTid1Td7rryakyoDpEqQ.text: Its a good option for mexican but i have had better. The chips and salsa were very good and the corn was the best. The tacos al pastor were decent. They do not carry mexican coke or jarritos.  Staff and service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos al pastor
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pozole.. It was ok
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn. Delish!

HrN6qTAlV10I1-iEm9gnag.text: Husband and I stopped by today and everything was absolutely delicious! We had the chicken nachos (big enough for 4) and carne asada street tacos with table-side guacamole. Erica was a top notch server! Will be back soon!

I9GwfaFfcwf8F4oybb2-Yg.text: How refreshing to enjoy excellent Mexican cuisine without GMO's!!!!! Fresh chips with 3 Salsa's - Habanero is hot but so tasty. Just take it easy and is great for a added bite to your dish. The Chicken Lettuce wraps were  so refreshing with the perfect combination of flavors accentuated by a bit of the habanero salsa. Clarence raved about his seafood enchiladas as demonstrated by a truly empty plate.   OMG- The flan just rocked my palate so I had to do a quick edit! Save room for this magnificent dessert!!!!!   Get off the strip and enjoy this great Mexican restaurant. Don't be deterred by the location as it is nice, clean and we had awesome service!

9TzqbYfeyglbjVrVsRKzHw.text: We discovered El Dorado Cantina last year and we've made a point of stopping in for breakfast or lunch every trip since then.  The steak and egg burrito is the best I ever had.  Raphael was our server during the first visit and suggested the flan.  I like flan well enough, but I don't go out of my way to order it.  I'm so glad I tried it here.  I think he mentioned it was the chef's grandmother's recipe and it's wonderful, definitely make sure you save room for dessert.   I will say I was a bit disappointed with our waitress the last time we were there.  She seemed to be more interested in talking to her friends than serving us.  The manager checked on us though and refilled our drinks, etc.  But I love their food too much to take a star away for the service.  Hopefully that was a one-time thing.

P6t5G8SaWgbuvq7Bes91iQ.text: I always eat here when I am in Vegas. The food is top notch and the service is amazing. Forget the fact it shares a wall with a strip club, I would still take my daughter to eat there because the food and service is worth the memory. I highly recommend.

GQFy2orVhdUKXMt89lIGEQ.text: The food was amazing! And our waiter, Juan, was spot on with his recommendations. I definitely recommend eating here.   BTW, it is located next to a strip club but it is completely separate from the club. My wife and I had reservations when we pulled into the parking lot but saw some other reviews that said it was separate and decided to give it a try, and I'm glad we did.

ZeTBTfCwjh4IAAbuDb6o6g.text: First time customer here, and I'm in love with this place! The fact that it's next door to an adult club is hilarious but awesome! The food is fresh and the service was quick and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp burrito and queso fundido

bDFCoJMsevRCqoa4GdZEUA.text: I love non-gmo/organic food. I'll pay the extra cash when I'm at the grocery store, and I realize that non-gmo food is definitely NOT the norm when ordering from a restaurant. so this whole non-gmo- Mexican- restaurant idea was appealing to me.  I had no idea until we arrived that this place is  located directly next to a strip joint. but it was no problem. I didn't have trouble parking at all. I arrived on a Monday (Presidents day) around lunch.. I  decided to try this place, as it was on the 'Yelp's Top 100 Places to Eat in the US for 2016'   The food was just ehh OK. I buy corn tortillas that are non-gmo from whole foods, and even those are handmade with better quality/taste.  I ordered 3 tacos: 1 chicken, 1 carne asada, 1 cochinita, to get an taste of the array of meats/seasonings they offer. Also had carne asada burrito and albonidigas soup. None of these items were spectacular enough to return back here for. Maybe this place is more of a lounge than a restaurant, but it appeared quite the opposite.  It's nice that this place is open 24/7, but I'm sure there are more Mexican restaurants where I can get exactly what I ordered for better flavor under  $45 bucks... (That's how much our total was, not including tip) And unlike any other Mexican restaurant I've been to, chips and salsa refills aren't free.  I just don't understand the hype of this place. Using non-gmo and organic ingredients doesn't mean the flavor need be sacrificed.  If you end up at this place keep in mind it's 25% off for locals on Mondays and checking in on Yelp is necessary as the free flan was the only highlight of our visit. Usually flan I've tried from Mexican restaurants are a waste of calories, not the case here.

eVbYyU5BzMAv8CGKqlArAQ.text: Everything was excellent! Erika our server and all of the waiters made us feel very well taken care of. Definitely coming back for the langostino tacos:) and the buttery rice was perfect!

KC2-r3dGCWY5BCOxD2ol9Q.text: Service great very helpful with r questions, Erica was very friendly, always smiling. Food amazing great choices on Mexican food . Definitely a comeback best place in town. The chef also came out to greet us very courteous.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7i1J-XHL6VI3yAw8R0C7gQ.text: Other than the fact that you have to enter right beside a huge strip club, it's alright.  Burritos were excellent. Spendy though.

_cDJeuuqmN66tmBHzaHdBQ.text: Extremely good food and service. The last couple times I visited, the quality of food and service had declined with the new management and I haven't been back since (about 8mos?). Hopefully things have gotten better as this place is a go to after a late night, a long day at work, or just on a date, but my last couple experiences didn't justify the high prices.   Basically everything on the menu is great but some of the best are the fajitas, chorizo appetizer, the steak bowl (forgot the actual name), cheese enchiladas, corn, any burrito with the green sauce on top, and any of the tacos. If I had to pick just one, I'd suggest the steak bowl for a single person or the fajitas to share with someone else. Make sure to order the side of corn as well.

a7DKbnpU0O79VPjx_1HVNw.text: I rather appreciate everyone who works here. They have all been nice. We go to this restaurant fairly weekly. Sometimes we watch football here too. My fav dish is the Cedarwood Salmon and they have the best Flan in all of Las Vegas, maybe the world.   El Dorado staff and management has proven that they care about customers with special dietary needs and allergies in addition to health.

ozJNF6YPHq25VvMyWfZpHQ.text: I had the Mole Chicken enchiladas that was to die for! The Margarita was the usual and the service was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Mole Chicken Enchiladas

Sf61reDGNFwAIidc7bpkjA.text: This place is a gem. The food is very high quality with a many options. Very accommodating to food allergies. It was a very busy night and our waiter was running around to serve everyone as quickly as he could with a smile and got all our orders correct since we have very specific food issues. We got worried that the restaurant might in the strip club that is right next door as we approached the building but it has nothing to do with it. Don't let the neighborhood hold you back.

7p8yM16J-ls8T7vzb-R7Pw.text: My family recommended this place and let me tell you ! It was well worth the 30 min drive from Boulder City, food tasted fresh and was outstanding, environment is beautiful and the Service was top notch, also the location is amazing as well....lol. 10/10 would recommend.

5Lun8LQFrdASh767W4z-ng.text: All hyperbole aside--this joint has to be the best Mexican restaurant on the planet! I've been to this place three times now (large group, wife and I at a table and this past weekend, wife and I at the bar) every single time it's been Lights the F out! Bacon wrapped stuffed shrimp, table side Guacamole, conchinita pibil, chicken enchiladas, asada, burritos--all have been fantastic!   If you're on a budget and looking for street tacos, hit Buen Pastor--otherwise, you have to try El Dorado!

gFisU8EAKpCgRTdJ1fY5Qw.text: Saw the solid reviews and figured it was worth checking out. Hostess was friendly and seated us promptly. Nice booths surrounding a U shaped bar. Main issue was service tonight, busboys and water service was solid but strangely waiter was nowhere to be found most of the meal.  When we did see him he was checking in on other tables in the close to empty restaurant. Check in for drinks and to order and didn't come back until after we were done eating. Could have used some tapatio..... luckily bar tender / bar back helped us out in getting check etc. Food was ok and drinks ok, service was the weakest point.   Pros: average food Cons: service and paying a premium for average food off strip  Much better Mexican food to be had off strip in the Las Vegas area with better service.

18I-2mrkVUAJz4aPJ0inqQ.text: This place is amazing! The service received by Erica was top quality and the food hit the spot especially after a night on the strip.  Additionally, it's not too far from the strip either. There were six of us and they sat us in the back which had 2 huge 70"+ Tv's showing the euro cup games. We ordered a variety of food which included beef and chicken fajita combo enough to feed 3 people. Checking in to the restaurant through Yelp also provided us with a free desert flan!!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side dish included with fajita plate
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and beef fajita hot plate

ABfA7nUf3Yf7C1RJHx1flw.text: The place is fuckin good plus u add the fact its organic makes it even more beautiful... And best part of it all they have fried icecream

SUkg8raiiqLhLEzXydOUOA.text: So good! Our fav was the table side guacamole. Some of the best I've had. We were intimidated by location but it was super family friendly!

PRGgYD61IuKcKtuKoXbxvA.text: Overall, a decent Mexican restaurant, but nothing special.  First of all, it's location is kind of hidden and a little awkward, being in the same building as a strip club. I have a lot of experience eating at Mexican restaurants, and I have to say that the food was overpriced for what it was (even by Las Vegas standards), and that it is much more of a Californian Mexican style than traditional Mexican.   We tried the table-side guacamole -- very fresh, but needed a lot more spice and salt. The complimentary salsa was similarly bland and lacking heat.   I have always wanted to try Mexican corn, so I was very excited when I saw this on the menu, but unfortunately I was not a fan. It was covered in chipotle spice, which is something that I very much dislike. But my father ate it instead, and he liked it.   Overall, the whole thing was good, but not great. My shrimp burrito was meh and flavorless...dad's street tacos were fine, but nothing amazing. We both liked our cocktails, though -- frozen strawberry margarita and jalapeno margarita.  I'm sure that there must be a better Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas than this one!

MtsSZuYkzt_SWoUdeB1eqQ.text: Had dinner here with friends during CES. The place shares the building with a nightclub and is generally in a dodgy area - don't let that deter you! Food was excellent, we had a variety of enchiladas, quesadillas, and burritos. Margaritas were great, and don't miss the tableside guacamole, very tasty and also fun to watch.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole made to order.

dEgx2WRqQrhU3UE1isVyEQ.text: Solid food and fun atmosphere! Don't let the location next to the strip club deter you! Or for some, it might actually be a selling point ;) Must have the table side guac and jalapeno Marg!! All the plates were great but my favorite was actually the grilled Mexican street corn and cilantro rice! Finish with the churros, perfect for sharing...but you might not want to.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño Margarita

dJu-gWICpQKCsGofn68m5A.text: Located literally next to the main entrance of Sapphire Gentlemen's Club, it might look daunting at first.  But once you're inside, it just feels like a really nice restaurant.  Items selected: - Signature mahi tacos - Signature shrimp tacos  Both came with rice and beans, and the quality was great. Chips came with three sauces - habanero, roasted tomato and salsa verde.  As seen on the billboard they tout no-GMO ingredients, but it doen't mean anything unless it tastes good. Good news is - it does!  I'm impressed - now they are officially one of my favorite Mexican (though Americanized) restaurants in Vegas, on par with Imperial Tacos & Beer.

6YJT4Mxc7V0uXGyARJ6Fiw.text: This place is a hidden gem off the strip. It's hard to find healthy organic food in any town, especially Las Vegas. This place is fully loaded with non-GMO and organic. The staff is great, and the food is some of the best Mexican I've had. We will definitely be coming here every time we're in the area.

UeidB0kcuxmosc5R7R5-fQ.text: Great service! The food came out really fast, our server Juan was great. We had the pork carnitas platter and the chicken enchiladas- both were really good.

hoZ8IYza90RczTF2pMin5A.text: We love this place and have been trying to get here for taco & tequila Tuesday for awhile but it didn't workout until today!!! Everything was perfect as always and we tried every single street taco and decided we would definitely get the Carne asada, cochinita and al pastor again!! Chris was our waiter and he was awesome and full of knowlege!!! This is the place to go if you love tacos and Mexican food!! The house margarita is also bomb!!! Chef Paco even comes to the table to deliver the flan that tastes like Creme Brule.  Oh and it's next to a strip club if that's your thing, if not just don't be alarmed this place is legit!

Y0FH74ntu7juyuByH_6UFg.text: 24/7 delicious food and great service. Bartenders and waiters are down for real conversations and the food is the bomb. It shares a building with Saphire strip club so there are pretty girls going in and out all night. Locals get a 25% discount on Mondays. Food is fresh, nonGMO   Go for the tacos!

kMS74oyKWMGmFhpYOenZQA.text: El Dorado Cantina is the go to spot for awesome organic  Mexican food. The mayweather (aka mcgregor) burger is also delicious! Grace was our server and she was super sweet and accommodating. Definitely recommend this spot if you're local or visiting Las Vegas

_k0G6dS9fWUyJJKnOfwnWw.text: This place is amazing!  Best Mexican food in Las Vegas!  Ceviche shrimp app is awesome and grilled fish tacos were great and salsa was fabulous and shrimp burrito was fantastic!!!  Exactly what I wanted!!!  Hit the spot!  Two cadillac margaritas were huge and delish!!! Flan & tres leche for dessert was spectacular!!! Yum I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jesus is the best bartender!!!  He served us out whole meal at the bar!!!

-BjeDfNT6dDgAyQuzhyUZA.text: Great food!!! Great atmosphere!!!! Danny was an amazing server, came here with a group of 9 and we're able to get a table for our party easily. Portions were fantastic for the price !!!

wyKx26mnRxmJFW3hI-o-IQ.text: Love the whole setup....should you choose the the door on the left or the door on the right?  If you want great Mexican food, unbelievable black beans, table side guac, three tasty salsas, and on point queso fundido; go left!.   Service is excellent, shout out here.   Went there last when they were filming some Food Network program that will come out sometime soon and I am sure they will get slammed.  Love the vibe.

Bravo  you have a customer for life keep up the great atmosphere and good food people will come I guarantee it..amazing!!!

QbOr3Cdfd2u0Q3haqTFlGw.text: So damn good. Love their salsa and burritossss! Fast service. Mega sweet folk. And it's organic!

-l3uFnL5640m_dkmK8S4KA.text: This is place is delicious!  Our server Erica was super friendly and helpful. We couldn't decide on a tequila and she recommended a flight, which was spot on!  Shrimp and Cochinita Tacos are real authentic and delicious. Do yourself a favor and try the Flan!

Llpj9Xe_PTg8liIdpvzQ7g.text: Everything was spot on-guacamole, street tacos and mezcal cocktails were excellent.  Service was great and make sure you get the flan!

7C3IMrfNNvZP6812dgQHBw.text: Being one of the very highly rated Mexican restaurant in Vegas, our group thought of trying this place for lunch. I somewhat had pretty high expectations given the rating but I was disappointed. As a complimentary they provide chips and salsa which were good. For the main course  I ordered the vegetarian burrito but it was just ok. Also the price I felt was a bit on the higher side. With lesser money I usually get much better burrito in SF financial district area.

4AfpvYSyEXnZfYLBeu0wDQ.text: I was not really ready for this place to almost share an entrance with the "World's Largest Sapphire Gentlemen's Club" (wondering who keeps the list of the top ten) so I was just a little hesitant to enter in fear of what I might see or worse, what I might NOT see. I did find the place to be very good and the walls adorned with all kinds of "Voted top 10" in several poles including yes, even Yelp. Having read earlier in the day that the we're know for their fresh, wholy organic guacamole I just had to give it a try and WOW it exceeded my expectations. I actually ended up only having that and a Bourbon on the rocks for my dinner. I must say the entrance did add some intrigue and some pretty good "people watching" after I got over the shock of it all. Don't get me wrong, I'm not a prude, I just once again didn't expect tit, I mean IT...... Question; am I fixated on this item? One small suggestion to ownership. Get yourself or make yourself some heartier tortilla chips or make them yourself. You need some good supporting base for the great, table side, home made guacamole....trust me. At least make thick chips an option! It is a good place, one large room and you better like the color red!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The exterior artwork. Right next to the Gentlemen&#39;s Club Sapphire.
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A big lamp outside. Don&#39;t know why but it&#39;s there.

bgMv_f6ucBHnM9W2R8QIpQ.text: Don't let the fact this is in the same building as a strip club fool you. The food is good. I had a mango salad which was great, the nachos were good; the staff knows what's in the food. Warned me about the porn in the refrained beans, this was nice considering my wife is vegetarian.  The quantity is too much for any one person. The nacho can serve at least 6 people unless you want to consume 3500 canaries in one sitting. The mango salad with chicken is good for 3 people.  My request is to focus on the quality of the food, cut the quantity

E_wSSr9yich8D5SQDJurpQ.text: This place was awesome! Authentic and a great atmosphere.  Erica made us the most amazing guacamole right at our table. Be sure to get tequila shots.Ole! I will be back for sure.

Yxi12n045H1l2oJVzQsR3w.text: Upscale, Authentic Mexican Cuisine next to a Strip Club! Open 24/7 HAPPY HOUR; EVERYDAY- (4pm - 6pm) & (12pm - 2am) ***Drinks 1/2 Off All Wells and Domestics ***Food $7 Food Menu, $3.50 Street Tacos MONDAY- (12pm - 12pm) ***Drinks 25% Off w/Local ID ***Food 25% Off w/Local ID  FOOD - Come hungry as the portion sizes are generous and can be shared! Meals range from $9 to $28. They also have vegetarian and gluten-free options available. I ordered one of the house favorites, Siegel Plate; it came with their award winning cilantro rice, free-range chicken and steak, crispy onions and grilled asparagus. Very flavorful!! We also order the table side guac which tends to always be a favorite of mine at restaurants. WHATS UNIQUE HERE? Chapulines (Sauteed grasshoppers). You can order them either w/ a garlic lime or habanero flavor. I have yet to try them, but if you are feeling a little daring these little critters are on the menu.  ATMOSPHERE - I was immediately impressed with the decor and ambiance! The deep red, rose-textured walls, w/ wrought-iron chandeliers and colorful decor really pulls you in. Decor seems to be inspired by the Dia de los Muertos (Day of the Dead).  SERVICE - Impeccable. Not only did Erica provide prompt and exception service. Both the manager and chef came around and introduced themselves. It really made the experience memorable!  And lastly, dont get distracted on the fact that Sapphire is right next door. El Dorado has its own ambiance and vibe that's independent of the gentlemen's club!   MUST TRY!! Why not stop by during happy hour, bring a few friends, order a few tacos or share the oh so delicious tableside guac!?

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ciko6UKaWHLOuevWgygbkQ.text: One of my favorite spots near the Las Vegas strip. Great atmosphere, amazing food options for all dietary restrictions, and the service is outstanding.   Stella was our waitress, and her customer service was truly wonderful and genuine. I work in the hospitality industry as a concierge agent, and this is definitely one of my top recommendations when it comes to Mexican cuisine in Las Vegas. Never a disappointment.

TSB-3olwUTg-noBf83s5Wg.text: We made a reservation due to the great reviews. Our group was a family (including a toddler) and you wouldn't even know it was next to a strip club from the inside.  Very fun environment - it was hopping when we arrived and the service was great.  Our server managed our group plus two others in the back room.   And food - top notch!  I loved their rice, too!! which is not something that most people rave about in Mexican restaurants.

4KObrYnpTxEv0q9aZbLLqQ.text: Let me start with the table side guac that our server Ericka made for us. Well balanced and the perfect amount of salt! We went during a time where they make a special spicy guacamole and it's totally worth it... easy to share for about 5 people. This place isn't cheap but well worth the money. I love establishments that have fantastic service and great food. Find me another place in Vegas that's 24/7, this tasty, and this enjoyable. Again extremely greatful of Ericka's great service!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FLAN!

KCymZC7REftm2_o8dpk5LA.text: So.. a restaurant attached to a gentleman's club that's open 24 hours.. hmm.. Well let me tell you!! I'm from L.A. and if you're looking for a place to have margaritas and some of the best Mexican food you'll ever eat, don't hesitate to give this place a shot. There's a reason they already have so many good reviews! My favorites are the table side guac (to die for), cochinita pibil and the carnitas plates.

nlZgvQ5UQdYTY3J-Ni-xqg.text: This place is a must have when visiting  Vegas!!! The food was delicious at reasonable prices! The staff went over the top and the atmosphere was one of the best we found all week long!!! If I could give more than 5 stars I would!!! Thanks guys!!

wL3ousxHciGbaE8vScYS3Q.text: By far my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas!!! Food and drinks are all delicious! I love the atmosphere of this restaurant and the employees are very friendly. Erica our waitress went above and beyond for me and my friends. We will definitely be back soon!!

QjIIevrzKQ_eHOVQSu8cBQ.text: Second time eating here  I had Jessica serving me both times and let me tell you... HER SERVICE IS AMAZING! she recommended that we should try the jalapeno margarita and mango margarita and it was phenomenal! She also makes an amazing table side guacamole Definitely going to keep coming here for this wonderful service and delicious food!

Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mango margarita

By-YQX__kwtl0sfz8-FHPg.text: This restaurant was recommend to us as the locals #1 favorite. It was so refreshing to get away from the noise and high prices of the casinos. We could have an actual conversation! The service was amazing. The pineapple  margaritas are priced for a pitcher. Our server, Danielle, offered to make me a single. I had the halibut with black beans and rice bowl. Hubby had an amazing steak burrito. Danelle told us all ingredients are organic and no GMO's. The recipes are handed down from previous generations. Definitely a worthy experience.

DzEA1cZHtaUKrPRxj4ofpw.text: My husband and I went here last night to meet up with a group of friends. We went to the bar to wait for them, and spent about 10 minutes there without receiving a drink. The bartender was friendly enough, and someone brought us waters, but we were not asked for a drink order after that amount of time. By that time, our friends showed up and we went to their table. I don't know if the waiter was new or what, but the whole experience was horrible. It took me 45 minutes to get a margarita that I ordered as soon as I sat down. Chips and salsa took about 20 minutes to arrive. We had to ask again for both the margarita and the chips and salsa after initially ordering them. The server informed us that he could not begin to take food orders until everyone in the party arrived. Fair enough, but didn't really make sense since he had already taken drink orders. Plus at the end of the meal he asked everyone individually what they had ordered to split the checks, when he was so adamant in the first place about needing to write everything by seat number. I arrived starving and two hours later finally received chicken tacos that were so bland that I only ended up eating one. I would eat a chicken taco from Del Taco any day over these. Also under the street tacos section of the menu it states that they are $14.50 and gives several options....chicken, pork, carne asada... I asked the server how many tacos came in the order and he said 3. I asked if I could mix up the meats and he said that I could but that it would cost more. That makes no sense. If I ordered 3 carne asada tacos it would be $14.50. If I ordered 3 chicken tacos it would be $14.50. You get the point. But if I ordered 2 chicken tacos and one carne asada it would be more expensive? Ummm what? Anyway, two orders of tacos, 2 margaritas and one beer later, we received a bill for $100, with gratuity already added. I get it, I work in the industry, adding gratuity for a large party is a thing, but I can tell you that I would NEVER have tipped 20% for that service and food. It's safe to say I won't be returning. We had been there once before many years ago and sat at the bar, so we were excited to come back for Taco Tuesday, but what a huge disappointment! P.S. Our entire group works in the service industry....bartenders, servers and cocktail waitresses.

qmtARcSimxT7ZVx7yzgZ2g.text: So...this place is located right next to Sapphire, lol. Make sure you go to the right entrance, or you'll get a very different cantina.  There's a parking lot, but we just walked to the restaurant. They're open pretty late, which is rare for Vegas restaurants. They have a bar area as well as nice seating areas on both sides. Looks pretty fancy. We got the shrimp tacos and something else, which were OK, somewhat overpriced. You get a free pumpkin flan with Yelp check-in, which was just alright because I'm not a big fan of pumpkin (maybe people would like it if they like pumpkin cakes etc).

q2HN8FTVTf_YuubI_Un39Q.text: Good not great.  Came here for dinner with friends and I was kinda disappointed because of all the hype about this place. The drinks were super inconsistent. My wife has the jalapeno margarita and it was made differently both times. Once it had spicy pepper on the rim and in it the other time it did not.  I had the skinny margarita made with Don Julio Blanco and it was super sour tasing.  The table side guacamole was a neat gimmick but it almost had too much citrus in it.  I had the mahi-mahi  tacos and it was good. It had a lot of flavor and was enjoyable but for 16 dollars for two tacos I would expect it to come with rice or beans. If I wanted rice or beans it would be 4 dollars more. My wife has the carne asada and that was delicious by far the best thing we had on the menu. The service was good nothing special but it wasn't poor either.

270WW1ciG6BJFPdF4LzVDw.text: The filet mignon tacos are amazing. Lol I crave them. I will definitely be back to eat here. Thanks.

ojfaoEixHYHaI7VbaL1s-w.text: When: Saturday 1:30pm Server: Danny Service: Quick & Friendly  Great food, organic and tasty. Service was awesome. We got a Pozole ($9.50) and taco sampler ($40.00) to share.

MKeuWv0_b0vKYJ9iLgCw-w.text: I have a strong Mexican cuisine heritage. I have to say this is the FIRST time I've enjoyed authentic Mexican food. I am including pictures of what we tried: guacamole; panuchos; tacos: chicharron, asada, cochinita; corn. Their salsas... everything was just the way it should be.  Would love to see more desserts in their menu. Something authentic just like the food.

HH03oL43pZCOJsREGly4BQ.text: Wow - it is been about three years since I've been to the El Dorado Cantina. I went there for Cinco de Mayo this year, and was extremely disappointed. I cannot believe how slow the service was. We sat there for 40 minutes before we got our first margaritas- even after I asked three times where they were. The food then came another 15 minutes later. It actually was not very busy for this popular Mexican holiday - which made me wonder how this could have happened. The manager did take off a bunch of charges, but still it was a big waste of time. The El Dorado has to get their act together before I would ever return.

L6BuYVAg9mq-6TN0hpPSqA.text: Although prices were a little higher than I had anticipated the food was solid. If you are a local with a NV ID, they even have specials on certain days. Don't be discouraged as this place is within the same building as Sapphires Club (my favorite) yet separate completely.   Executive Chef came out and greeted us thanked us for coming and actually provided us with dessert (in all fairness one of the gentleman were with was a professional pastry chef and I think they overheard us speaking about why he was in town. Nevertheless, a True class act & gentleman for coming out and shaking every one of our hands. Any of the tacos were delicious but the guacamole was exceptional! A must have.   I would go back just for the professionalism. Nevertheless the food was very good and I'll be visiting that place again.   Oh yeah on Taco Tuesday, they have $5 1942 shots. WHAAAAAAT!!!  Thanks El Dorado Cantina Team. See you soon.

w8hlBjpVKN02RXIsZ8u49A.text: Burger review incoming.   Rating 6.2  Might seem like a low score. But maybe it was persuaded by the fact that the burger was cooked fully well done when I asked for a medium.  Plus the burger didn't have very much flavor. Honestly it was saved by the fact that the bacon was very crispy or I'd probably give it a lower score. This was labeled as the Mayweather Mexican burger. Was too try to be a Mexican burger.   Sorry @eldoradovegas , not  a great experience. Though I did try the tacos al pastor as well and those were decent. But I've had much better in town for a better price point.   Thanks for the food. But Probably won't come back here again.   Read more reviews on foodingwithbobo on instagram

VBro9FMR4740oSE4lD79ZA.text: I am so happy we chose this restaurant for our date night. I have always heard so many great things about it and now I believe the hype! Table side guacamole was absolutely delicious and plentiful. El Dorado Margarita was just right. Excited to try their other margarita options. Couldn't decide between queso Mexicano tacos and the grilled mahi tacos. Went with the mahi and they were amazing. The fresh mango salsa and cilantro rice made the dish. I'll try the queso next time. Husband loved his carne  asada burrito.  Happily surprised when the bill came. The food was worth every penny. We will definitely be going back!

JqerQZf7VvxeVQJvK9DCPQ.text: Great atmosphere! The staff is very friendly. The best part...The most AMAZING CHICKEN TACOS I've ever had!  Happy hour the tacos are $3.50! Tuesday Don Julio $6 shots!! WHAT! New spring dessert!

1euqB_dS0gsC6-TjIRSHZw.text: Don't let the location fool you (its next door to a huge "gentlemen club" aka strip club --- but truthfully what's not next to such a thing in Vegas?). It's NOT part of the establishment next door and well worth the trip. The authentic Mexican cuisine is 5 stars. The hospitality is 5 stars. We had a business event with about 100 people and I would recommend it to anyone. The loss of the star is ONLY due to the heckling I will need to endure from my colleagues for not knowing the adjacencies prior to arriving.

cFnzbZHmrDz1D-p3xn3qOg.text: At first was concerned next to "gentlemen club. But our food was great I had steak tacos and my husband had steak fajitas. Margarita was strong but so good. Chef Pack  personally stopped by our table to check on us. Fantastic meal  Decio was our waiter. Explained and answered our questions fantastic job to all the staff. Even got free dessert.

Wq3jI3-6zHNZIj_WNpMcvQ.text: Would have gotten five stars if not for the slow service. I got a fajita bowl that I thought was really good. My husband got enchiladas but he didn't like them. He said they were too sweet. Otherwise we got chips & salsa & guacamole & a whole bunch of other appetizers that were delicious. It just took forever to get everything.

owxfezbgojia_ic9NZ3kQQ.text: 2nd visit to El Dorado Cantina after 2 years. The taste and freshness of ingredients is still the same. I am glad I came back!! We ordered Cauliflower Tacos and Shrimp Burrito. The veggie options were unique and tasty. Though I am not an expert, in my opinion El Dorado Cantina is a good representation of urban Mexican food!

wx0nMikmnmQKH33UWvl3Tw.text: This place was great. Went there at 3 AM on Monday, and got the best service. Angel and Oscar were very attentive and well mannered. Food was great. Torta was very delicious. Cocktail was magical.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Mojito

WyCja_9Cxq47C1Ix7Y3SbA.text: Update: Tonight, Chef Paco personally called me to apologise and invited me back to his restaurant to make up for my experience. He seems genuine. I will go back as soon as I move into my new house this weekend. I'm not one to make a business lose revenue.    Original:  Took a friend from Switzerland for Mexican. This is the highest rated Mexican restaurant. Horrible location near a ton of adult clubs, gentleman bars for strippers. They share a parking lot with a nude "adult" club.  Please don't take kids around here.   Margaritas ordered were difficult to drink out of a straw because of the pulp.  Overcooked steak enchiladas, and I'm pretty sure they nuked it.  Why else was the red sauce dry as a bone on the enchiladas? Refried beans tasted tired. What's with white rice? It's Mexican food! Serve Spanish rice for God's sake! I have no idea if my friends chicken quesadilla was any good.  The best part of the restaurant were the tortilla chips and salsas. 1 star for tortilla chips.  Otherwise, it's quite American. I'm Mexican descent. Oh, and afterward my bank called to say someone skimmed my debit card.  Thanks, no thanks! No bueno!

Gjb9tc5wxBgOPrF9mYxc1g.text: Service was great drinks bomb and steak burrito deciduous! The head chef paco is amazing, thank you Jeff for great service

_RfjdDy98MHdjUkptHnuqQ.text: This is my second visit since going two years ago. The one thing that stood out was the table side guacamole which I had back then and was excited to order again. We were a party of 4 that were seated behind the hostess door/entrance. Quite cold that evening but it wasn't an issue.   Let's get the location out of the way super quick...yes it's right next to the strip club. Done.  To make this review short and to the point, El Dorado is good Mexican food that's quite forgettable and won't have you craving another bite. The table side guacamole was made by our server quite perfectly. At $17 it is what it is. At least it was fresh and made with the requested spice level.  Our server seemed to make things awkward when ordering or requesting something. We asked for lemons twice and didn't receive anything on a slow night at the restaurant. I then proceeded to go to the bar and ask for lemon wedges that was taking forever. The server quickly ran to the bar to question what I was doing? I thought to myself, "your job". She didn't even offer to take them to my table to make up for it. The other guest at my table was very mad and brought it up and she said "maybe I should share my tip with him." Awkward? Unnecessary?   I'm a server myself and it's stuff like this that would get us seriously in trouble at work. Anyways. Food order took forever. Still I believe we were very considerate and patient considering her slow pace. I ordered the Carne Asada entree which was good just a bit dry. My girlfriend ordered forgettable Mahi and Shrimp tacos (spicy). Two other guests ordered the chicken enchiladas which seemed good but that person was angry at the server. The other ordered tacos which were just ok.  Look, this is a Mexican restaurant next to a strip club joint. I get it's a casual fun environment but the wait time along for what we ended up paying should have resulted in better service and more exciting flavors.   I was pretty upset they refused to accept the Yelp Flan Free dessert for checking in, and even more surprised she didn't make an exception and just offer it to us because she made us get up and get lemon wedges at the bar.  I don't think I'll ever come here again. There's other Mexican restaurants who don't charge excessive amount of $$$. At that rate I was expecting a stripper to serve our shots of tequila, lol.  What should you do: SKIP IT!

FBWGK7VVfAhs4lVAt0DYfQ.text: First time eating here, we ordered the green chilaquiles with black beans & it comes with a side of carne Asada. We also ordered some Asada tacos and flan. The Asada is really good! The green sauce on the chilaquiles was not my favorite (I like spicier sauces) but it was still good. Our server was named Erika, she was supper friendly and patient while we were trying to decide what to order!  (As I'm writing this my husband proclaimed "best flan ever" lol)
