9-k6Z9slJgs2GDVeMSr0ag.text: Interesting choice for a restaurant location. It's right next to Sapphire, but it has it's own location.  The price is a little high, but the food is amazingly good. They provide some chips and sauce which had a nice kick to it and it was good. I ordered the chicken burrito, which was good and my friend ordered a steak burriot which I highly recommend. They also do table guac which is a cool show and taste great!  The staff are fairly nice and will help you if you need any assistance. I would definitely come back here again if I'm in Vegas again.

sOsuzyImyCzdXYOnBzS1ZQ.text: We had amazing service with Camille. She makes amazing guacamole. The food and drinks were fantastic. I highly recommend coming here. You won't regret it!

nPEHnOUplTFaxdtJJzc7Qw.text: Food is amazing. Chef Paco came by himself to check on us. His flavors are on point with different texture. Recommended to all that are in town. Don't miss out on this hidden treasure

DvGtcYLJubIWQAo_LLNGwQ.text: Generally I would never rate any place this low... especially since the food, service, and atmosphere at this place is stellar... so hear me out.  This past weekend, my friends and I went to this restaurant before seeing the puppetry of the p*nis show at a nearby venue. We ate, and decided to go back after the show and before going to the sapphire club BECAUSE the wait staff were so awesome.   We were eating and saw "comedian" Eddie griffin at the bar... he is the WORST, especially for a has- been. THATS a story for another day---  I'll likely blast him on FB if you need to read the full run down. However, the Executive Chef Paco was a total turd to us. He gave us attitude, invaded our space, and made us feel like we were not good enough to be there when he had a "VIP" customer at the bar.   It just goes to show that one bad apple can spoil the bunch... and unfortunately it's one of the highest leaders at this establishment. I would suggest this place as long as you can avoid the chef and his attitude. GET IT TOGETHER, dude!

nfo7PWNlaODuyaH6djKjiQ.text: This is great place to come for flan.  Best flan on the planet in my opinion.  Their food offers a new variety...it's not typical "Americanized Mexican" . They offer a fresh, new variety of flavors...environmentally conscience too.  It's good...but not our favorite.

IDMmYdXY9574Skoewad-7A.text: After numerous visits pre-yelp career and they have always been A-OK in my book.  Service: 2 years ago it was kind of hit or miss, but the most recent visits into last year have been great.  Servers were consistent with getting the orders in and drinks fresh.  The times we ordered fresh guacamole at the table, it's always been made well with a smile.  They kept their bottomless Chips and Salsa promise at the table.  Mexican eats:  If you have time, get the table side guacamole that's made..wait for it.. table side. =)  Social media friendly but most importantly it's very good.  I've sampled burrito and taco dishes throughout my visits but my El Dorado #1 is definitely their "Signature Bowl" I rock it with: Carnitas, brown rice & black beans.  They add guac, queso fresco, pico de gallo and mexican 3 cheese blend.  It makes for a very good bowl.  Ambiance: Very classy high end decor that provides a great date vibe.  Intimate leather booths, dark wood, red walls and contemporary lighting make for a very chic dining experience.  The center bar has all the premium bottles and there's flat screens throughout the open dining area usually playing sport channels  El Dorado Cantina is open 24 hours and I've wandered in here really late/early morning and the food was still on point.  The interior is pretty and so is the food presentation and the portions are fine.  However, know that you are paying strip restaurant prices at El Dorado Cantina.  Vegas is officially a foodie city and there are many Mexican restaurants that can offer what El Dorado offers but significantly cheaper.  You won't get the ambiance or 24 hour convenience but that's what's out there.  If you know this, then that won't stop you from visiting El Dorado especially at 3 AM in the morning because you know the premium you're paying.  Enjoy...=)

X7T5wK1mEOpesSdRj4b36A.text: I withhold all five star votes for fine dining I was wondering why this place was 24 seven and then I found out it's next-door to Sapphire's gentlemen's club so that explains that. the food is great and the service is great and the music is great ,it's kind of expensive though.but considering their next-door to The titty bar that explains that.

57kBJbOyVCUg1E9LdyIAbQ.text: Had dinner here last night with Jess as our server. She recommended two items that were spot on delicious, the Chipotle Chicken and an Al Pastor burrito (wet) which was not on the menu. I wish I took pictures!  Great experience, great service and yummy food

9rWUAF-DnztWKrpH8d-NRw.text: Awesome dinner! Juan our water,has taken gear care of us.     The whole experience was killer.. Best Ever!

9vWnVc23X88kGXI20ztkfA.text: I will update my review as far as service goes. The management team reached out to me and wanted more in depth reasons for my low ratings. I can appreciate a restaurant and chef/owner wanting to resolve any discripensies regarding the food. It is refreshing for a business to take immediate action. I did say in previous review that I only rated what I had previously eaten. I will give thus restaurant another shot since it is a diverse menu.

pXEV4EvJ39t9lsibzMQoXA.text: I was skeptical at first with it being attached to Sapphire Strip Club. After I kept hearing multiple people saying how great the food was, I finally checked it out. I love the look and feel of their interior. The chips/salsa weren't salty and the salsas were perfectly delicious. $3.50/refill. The amount of food for the Cactus tacos dish was filling. Best Cactus tacos I've ever had! The rice was amazing as it had butter/zest flavor. Beans were on point! Every bite of their corn was heaven. Our chips/salsa were taken away while we were talking, which I was sad about because there was still half left. The manager came to our table to check how things were and she was very kind and we will be back very soon. Loved this place!!! So good.

f_jUL8XgLbUZRlOB49-zlw.text: The table-side guacamole is the bomb, ask for Greg, he's amazing! Steak quesadilla was delicious! This place has the best Taco Tuesday with $5 shots of 1942 all day! And you are a local, then on Monday everything is 25% off

9Z9QGXAgO1SXWLrN_cCoMg.text: Went for national taco day. Place was packed but we had reservation so we go right in. Taco was very good and flavorful. Our server Juan was obviously very busy but still gave us outstanding service. My favorite taco was the chicken don't skip!

ROaM0elrFzqdYmFS-hA5PA.text: Kinda hard to find if your not familiar with the area but the food was delicious the customer service was prompt and the resturant altogether was a great experience

0XaoYojMhP8-uqgZsDFsLw.text: Second time here, love it! Enrique is fantastic, food is awesome! A++++++++++   We ordered Steak and chicken Fajitas and Chicken Feinstein, so delicious!   Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love these!

YbInbLc9Mt7MXcXvVIv8tA.text: First time visit and the food/service was great. The rice is a must! Jess was amazing and suggested great margaritas. Definitely would come back.

L6roWhrZEWuNd1B1YmvNVg.text: Juan our server was attentive and great all around.  The decor feels like you're in an authentic Mexican restaurant, but not one for children.    There are many vegan options.  We had the Veggie tacos w/ rice and bean platter and the corn Rajas street tacos.  Fresh and healthy taste to the ingredients, not heavy like a lot of traditional recipes.   The desserts on the menu are not vegan, but you can request fresh fruit with chocolate.  Open 24/7 for any late night vegan cravings .

U5wTV8IwoxnOofZZj1zRlw.text: The shrimp burrito is fantastic. The chips and salsa are pretty good. Recommended!

7whyuC4itkfiFSx_RO4oYg.text: Table side Guacamole was delicious!! Favorite part of our lunch. Sarah was a great server! Very friendly

Wj6IoFjclK6_ZRG-WPSUNw.text: Awesome food and great customer service ! The organic margaritas are just insanely good !!!!

NGXyGyuKrGj1X08ldHFWnQ.text: Grace was an excellent server. The food and service was excellent. We had the Mahi Tacos, they were fantastic, so was the tableside Guac.

UxCGITo-5sCyRR-HL7I3Bg.text: I have been to El Dorado 4 times so far. I had different meals each time so I feel pretty confident about what I'm saying. Every mouthful was delicious! The staff was warm, friendly, super helpful, and the music is from my era so it was the best of all possible worlds all around. We went with pretty large groups, between 6 and 10, and everyone enjoyed what they ate. We had gone to another place in Henderson and even though the view was great, lets face it, you don't eat the view. Portions at El Dorado are very generous and the price point is great.

E-xsOuUVD82dewe31hAMkw.text: I was actually surprised how delicious these tacos are!! This restaurant is located right next to a strip club but my cousins and I had to try it because of the location.   Upon walking in, it is full of red velour walls and booths. The restaurant is nice and clean and the staff were extremely nice! I got lettuce wrap tacos and for 2 tacos, it was $13.00. I think it was a little bit pricy but when you check in on Yelp, you get a free flan and that was amazing!!! The meat on my tacos were nice and tender- cooked perfectly!!   The flan was AMAZING!! One bite and you're hooked! It was nice, creamy and pretty dense but oh so heavenly!! My cousins and I all agreed that it was probably the best flan we have every tried.   All in all, I will come back here to get some more tacos if I'm on this side of town!

yln-E_OR-_xAB-s4hm44CA.text: There are plenty of reviews on this place already, so I'll keep mine short:  1. First, Industrial Road is now called Sammy Davis Jr. Drive -- don't be confused! 2. Their margaritas = knockout. Always on the strong side. Mmm! 3. Don't be fooled by the gigantic strip club nearby. In no way are they connected. 4. Check in to Yelp for your free flan. 5. Locals get 25% discount on Mondays. 6. The taco trio is a good place to start. I get the al pastor, carne asada, and carnitas. It comes with black beans and their signature rice, which is amazing! 7. Chef Paco personally introduced himself to our table. That was pretty cool.

nWTDzqf5cMHI4gggO5kSVg.text: Wanting to get away from the Strip and check out a local gem for lunch, the wife and I checked out El Dorado Cantina.  We both love Mexican cuisine, the more authentic the better.  So, we were easily sold on the place by the very positive reviews from the local Yelp community.  There's really nothing new or different that I can add on top of the nearly 1000 reviews of this place.  Service was fast, friendly and attentive.  The first round-gratis chips tasted fresh made and were crispy without oiliness.  The salsas were flavorful, spicy, and were True standouts.  I applaud the fact that they had Chapulines and our server's recommendation to have the garlic and lime over the habanero was a good call.  They were delicious.  I love pozole.  El Dorado Cantina's pozole was the best rendition that I've yet encountered.  I'll leave it to the wife to recount her experience, but suffice it to say she left completely satisfied.  Prices were reasonable and portion sizes were a solid value in relation to its price.  El Dorado Cantina was the definition of a local gem.  It served up some of the best, authentic Mexican food that I've had in a long time.  For tourists, it's a worth a trip off of the Strip to eat here.  For locals, thanks for not keeping this place a secret.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Lime Chapulines
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pozole

QjQKtd4OWq22r3gU08owBA.text: Best margaritas I've ever had. Hands down. My hubby and I shared a pitcher of the El Dorado Margarita and it was enough to get a good buzz going on. We wish we came when we were hungry because the food here is apparently amazing, but we made the mistake of having Bacchanal's Buffet earlier in the day so we are stuffed.  That just means we'll be back next time though! Great service here too. If you don't mind the fact that it's next to Sapphire's, definitively check out this gem off the strip.

q3l25bd-ObEevouThAI7Tg.text: Food was okay! I liked Nacho Daddy better by Planet Hollywood...the host and the service was good...I would eat here again if I'm staying at the Wynn but better driving there instead of walking

My favorite is by far the Cochinita street tacos. They SO good, but super spicy, so be careful of that if you can't handle spice.  Service is always spot on and for such a busy place I've never waited long for a table.

We immediately received delicious chips and salsa and the food was great and arrived shortly after we order it.   Our server Mike was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed.  Two other servers also came by to check on us. Wonderful customer service!   Will definitely come back again!

BlqtsR-_6SvZIcsUpm9OJQ.text: 4 stars - food was pretty good, but prices have doubled since the last time my native dining companions were there last. -1 Star- we got there on a Tuesday around 7 and were told there were no open tables and we had to sit at the bar.  Ok, not really cool but whatever if they are busy.  Checked open table, reservations available every 15 minutes all night long.  Tables sat empty nearly the whole time we were there.  Save your fake hype and give us a table.  - 1 Star- Apparently there are Taco Tuesday specials?  Wouldn't know by anyone in the restaurant telling us, just happened to see it on the website.  Margaritas are $5.  Awesome!  Oh wait....they're actually $7 and haven't updated their website  -1 Star- service behind the bar is awful.  Waited without any drinks (finished my Margarita several minutes before and drained my water waiting for acknowledgement from the bartenders), waited for our check without anyone asking if we wanted more drinks or anything else, to the point that I had stacked all of our dishes on the edge of the bar hoping someone would notice and come offer us service, watched several other patrons waiting, and waiting...and waiting for service.   Sooo, TLDR version- this place is overrated, overhyped, over priced.  We won't be back ***FUN UPDATE: All three of us got sick from this meal.  So really no stars would be more accurate.

qlr7vgHW3Kyzru4BaBWnNw.text: The Moscow Mule was the worst I've ever tried!  :(  I was so excited to try the pozole - hugely disappointed.  It was too brothy - hardly any meat.  My girlfriend's chicken enchilada was terrible - really dried chicken and the mole was the worst!  Probably will never go back.  The best part the was the spicy salsa, but they charge you $2 extra for that.

kDqcMO8QC8mP9gAUIXdoKw.text: Love this place....first visit after being highly recommended! Jess was so right on with her menu choices!  Thanks Jess!!!

7krRw0WtSTfsa_LXquu2qg.text: Sitting next to the gentlemens club Sapphire is a 24/7 restaurant,and it would be awesome for those patrons that come out of the clubs after 1 too many....... However we as a family of four with minors drink a lot of water and the palets are working well.....Now tableside guac was probably the best ever had, but that was the end...Enchilada sauce ruined the enchiladas.  Too much I suspect Lime in the sauce made it bitter.  Signature bowl needs a new Signature.   Steak Burrito was lacking and Steak and Shrimp fajitas lacked seasoning... I am a big fan of street corn,but not when it is roasted especially burnt....atmosphere was cold and uncomfortable...so I leave this establishment to the late night crowd after 1 or so too many.....

IiLRgM9BIVPdvPcN39O-3w.text: Really nice place.   Living  in San Diego for 14 years this place has that vibe.   They have $5 shots of Don Julio, on Tuesday.   That alone is a reason to visit.  I had the carnitas tacos and 1 carne, they were very good.   Juan was a great waiter too.

d7MihKdBonL9-YYRqDlolg.text: Our waitress Maria was perfectly pleasant. I ordered a margarita which was strong and yummy...unfortunately i spilled it after only a few sips. I ordered the steak and potatoes and the sauce was bold and smoky. We also ordered the pozole. It was hot and flavorful. The best part of the meal was the creamy flan. Winner!!!

Tonight was dinner with our daughter, her boyfriend and another friend all visiting from Australia. Grace was great and her guacamole was the best we have here so far. Thank you Grace and El Dorado!!!

X0Kh41StC_Ip9xUVPKz32Q.text: This is my favorite Mexican food in town. Quality is amazing. The manager fabi always makes sure we are satisfied.

nepeiKSjns3-VTktIZ4uAw.text: Hands down my new favorite Mexican restaurant on the city.  Best flan I have ever had.

gXPfFK3y1FtikBiKzcnwTA.text: This place is located in a very strange location. Actually i thought jt was in a strip club. So i would Particularly say it was kid friendly. We were shuffled in and a party of 6 so we were placed at our table. I am local but my friends and i stopped on on the way to the airport before they left... on a slight time crunch but not to the point of missing flights etc. so, we sat for a long while before the waitress came Over. She was very impersonable but she was ok. The appetizers came out before the 3 margaritas we ordered. Which were delicious. The empenadas came w only 3 and we're a little bland but good. The food, took forever! It was Monday night and not Busy and it took about 45 minutes..... in the mean time i asked for more chips and was told that refills on chips cost money. I was extremely Surprised and  annoyed w that response so i opted out (what Mexican place doesn't give free chips and salsa refills)  At this point the time is pushin it. My sister is super frantic about missing her flight so she orders and uber. The food comes and half of our party has to basically inhale it before they need to leave. I ask the waitress to box my food and add a fried icecream to our check. I am a bartender... i know splitting checks is a pain in the ass but when asked U don't roll your eyes and make it obvious u are annoyed. Because i am in the industry i try to avoid Multiple checks but given the circumstances we had no time to split it up. She says she will get us a box and put a fried icecream in. We hand her our card and tell her we are walking our friends out to say bye. When we come back my table has been cleaned there's no box. And what appears to be icecream W no waters or anything else left. I take a bite of The most stale fried icecream ever. I tell her she took our leftovers and now she's really Annoyed w us and it's obvious. A busser walks over w waters for us and she tells him in Spanish not to give us water (i speak Spanish but look white). I take another bite of my icecream And there's a fly in it. At this point, I'm done. The manager comes w our food they took away. She can tell we're upset. I tell her about the fly. She removes the icecream from he check and swipes the card. The waitress never comes back. Needless to say, i won't be back....

D5cfwIDqGbArUwOsiX42Og.text: We were hesitant when we pulled up because it's located right next to a gentleman's club. I'm glad we decided to stay! The food was amazing.  I had the chicken fajitas but everyone was extremely happy with the food. The orange ice cream was delicious as well.

_siN8TUvX_auak8VYvBWtQ.text: Omg! What can I say I've been here twice and both times have been such a blast. First time was for my friend's wedding. We didn't know what to expect, but we had great service and great drinks. Food was really good. Second time we stopped by a couple hours ago and by far exceeded expectations. It was so much. Better than the last time. I ordered what was basically ceviche lol. It was amazing !!! I've had so many and it makes the top of the list. We sat at the bar and were helped by Ben. He is such a great bartender and is very nice. He made great suggestions in regards to food. He made our experience fun as he conversed  with us throughout our meal while still working of course. Ivan also made our experience great. He definitely knows customer service. It felt so comfortable with both of them there. By far they are some of our favorite people. We love to go to a bar and feel welcome and at home. The food came out in a timely manner, and the flan is beyond delicious. By far one of the best! If I could have it everyday I would. We also ordered the sopes and they were the perfect size. I love the size. Every restaurant should do this lol. My friend tried the albondiga soup which was new. It was perfect for this breezy weather. Thank you Ben for the amazing customer service we sure will be back. Hidden gem for sure.

YcmxrY2OeUnyi9u0LLQLgA.text: This restaurant is very wholesome. We were welcomed and seated right away. Juan, our server, was attentive and very courteous. The only thing is, don't play an alcoholic when you put more sweet and sour than tequila in my second drink. Other than that, it's an awesome atmosphere and I recommend this restaurant for large parties.

xgkVuUMaT5cklhLYKnA9QQ.text: El dorado how I love you. I literally had one of the best burritos ever here. Our friend works right next door and she recommended we try the food here. They started us off with chips and salsa. The red salsa was so good. My boyfriend liked the green one. We got a round of drinks some micheladas and some mixed drinks. The micheladas really good. I had one with a corona and the other with a modelo, both equally as great. When we got our food my burrito came with a side of white cilantro rice which was especially tastey! The chicken burrito I got was the best. Shredded chicken, cheese, and black beans. It was a big burrito I only ate half. I ate the other half at night after being out all day and it was just as good as it was earlier.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UmKC0ymAcJbftudlVy_vaQ.text: This is my second time here and I have been thoroughly impressed both times!! I was skeptical about all of the great reviews... I mean, how can simple Mexican be so good, right? I was happily proved wrong!   The location isn't super ideal... Right next to a giant strip club in an unusual location, not too far from Circus Circus. Still... Make the drive, take the uber, do what you have to do to make to out here!  I ordered the cheese enchiladas and they were cooked to perfection. They don't skimp on the cheese one bit, it was loaded! It was really well-seasoned and the breading texture was just right.   Juan was our waiter and was really great. I never waited for a refill and he was super nice and courteous. The food was served relatively quickly (maybe 10 minutes after ordering).  Las Vegas food isn't as great as I thought it would be, but this place is truly a gem!

wtQAWfgHHn6Buv0NNeFTdA.text: Best Chili Relleno in town! If you are a spice-a-holic like me, try their Ghost Chili Margarita  So good!

Pewtb9zk9c2ZdxMpoiKnhw.text: Awesome food!!! Amazing Experience. Our server Lindsey took very good care of us & recommending the ten taco tray!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmmmmm

LevZvFPAjlLiDYOqsInsiA.text: This place never disappoints. Start to finish, great experience. Great chips & salsa, carne asada burrito was fabulous then we finished off with the flan.

Rzrb2Z7Na2Q8MRIUITI3Yw.text: My lovely wife are locals and we love this place! We recently went on a Saturday night and forgot to get reservations, however they were able to seat us at the bar. My wife ordered the Carnitas , which was excellent. I order the Carne asada burrito and upon the recommendation of our bartender (the very nice and funny Nell) order it wet. It was perfect!  This is a wonderful restaurant that serves excellent, authentic Mexican food.   Get the Guacamole, it is divine, made by Michael.  I highly recommend to all.

srszSqYsLpszlN4kxTEXZA.text: Let me first say I am a regular here and I have ordered food or dined in several times over two or more years. The service is mediocre, but the quality of the food is usually excellent and delicious. This review is specifically for the system of placing a TAKEOUT order (NOT a delivery service such as Postmates or UberEats).  El Dorado is open 24 hours, and to my knowledge should be able to take a to-go order by phone. I've noticed several times that no one picks up the phone during late night hours (after midnight). Very annoying. It's a real inconvenience when we've already decided we'd like to eat here and there are limited dining options at that time of night.  This most recent time, we called in around 9:30pm. The person on the phone asks me to please hold. So I waited, and waited, and waited,... more than 10 minutes, and no one came back. I hung up at that point and tried calling again, only to get a voicemail. I was driving and was almost at the restaurant at this point so I decided to simply walk in and place the order at the bar. Seeing how much of an inconvenience it was, I had asked to speak to a manager. The bartender just gave me a brief explanation like "A lot of people just walked in".... So what? I had to request to speak to a manager more than once before an attempt was made by the bartender. Very unprofessional. On top of that, it took 25 minutes to get my food. Not the best when I have a 5 month baby at home who just woke up and needs my attention. Owners: PLEASE figure out a better system for placing a Takeout order. There should be a way to do it online through the website, or through a mobile app such as BeyondMenu. Thank you for taking the time to consider the needs of your patrons.

P7zTGRXsxOYkhV-K2TuPfw.text: Non gmo and really great authentic Mexican dishes !! Pozole was simply fantastic.  Also, local discount.   Decor is cute and I really like the dim lighting, makes it more intimate. Had a great time here with my girlfriend!  Will be back. Will recommend.

CRouJbdrzdUwV8RM4Li31g.text: So I'm changing my review based on my return visit. I ordered a shrimp quesadilla. Would usually get the seafood enchiladas but wasn't so hungry and did not feel like spending 20.00 on lunch. So I opted for a quesadilla where it said 10.99 or in that range and next to it add shrimp 14.99. Not so bad. When I got the bill for 25.00 I was sure a mistake was made. Apparently the shrimp add on is 14.99! I could have got my preferred meal for less. This was deceitful through way it was written. Use caution when ordering. The pricing is not clear and I feel like this was done everything purposely. Check out the menu, you'll see what I mean. Beware.

37EqTqa_hQ_4QYIhZotkvA.text: Don't be scared ! It's next to a strop club but it's safe ! We got the chicken burrito and it was muy rico! Fuuull of chicken :) The service was awesome too ! Thanks Hugo you rock!  Love that it's 24/7 too

hNMRRYEC8ovOSJfqHJ__Aw.text: Short Review : GO! You won't be sorry. It's fabulous. Directly next to Sapphire strip club, so you have to actually park in their lot and walk towards that door, and then you will see the door for El Dorado to the left. It was slightly confusing for us at first, but we are so glad we went, and you will be too!  Long Review:   We ended up here because of the good yelp reviews. Had a little trouble finding it, but I'm so glad we did. Very cozy inside, kind of dark, nice big booths, great atmosphere.   Started with a Jalapeno Margarita, which was to die for if you like spicy. It was HOT, and also huge, so totally worth the $13 price tag, imo. I also loved the green salsa that came with the chips and trio of salsas...that was super yummy and my favorite of the three for sure.   Hubby had beef enchiladas, which he devoured. He did say they were slightly sweet, which was different for him, but he still really liked them. He also loved the rice, which also came with my order and was DELICIOUS! I've never tasted anything like it! SOoooooo good!  I had the veggie burrito, which was just fantastic. Veggies cooked to perfection and all the flavors blended together so well. The best veggie burrito I have ever had for sure. And again, the RICE, oh my goodness, so good!  The service was very good, and, what I am assuming were, two managers came to check on us and were constantly walking around checking on people. Also, I overheard one of them being questioned about combining items on the menu and she broke down the a la carte prices and said we can put it together however you would prefer to make you happy. I thought that was great. We were also next to a table of 8, and the waiter asked how they would like to break up the check and they wanted 4 checks (2 people each) and he was very nice and accommodating about that, which again, I thought was great service.   I ended up checking in on yelp (first time!) because there was a free flan offer even though we are not big fans of flan and were already pretty full, but I am so glad I did because it was awesome!! So delicious, and I found some room for it after all ;-)  A very well deserved 5 star review. Great prices, great service, fantastic food! I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño Margarita. Spicy!! But fabulous! $13

38IaviUDwC19zmXFAcagDA.text: Honestly was skeptical because it was next to the gentleman's club however super shocked at how great it was. Wonderful margaritas and delicious food.  Military discount of 20%!

S75kBKDtiLl5DrmjPry5Hw.text: The absolute BEST Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. If you have not tried their tableside guacamole, you are truly missing out on the best guac in this city. Everything I've had on their menu tastes authentic, fresh, and full of flavor. My favorite is the yemedijian plate, it's the best lettuce wrap taco you'll ever have. This is the best spot for a margarita too, I've come here just for margaritas and guac and left so satisfied. Definitely recommend the guac, margaritas, red sangria, and yemedijian as top must-trys at this restaurant.   Also have a really good locals and industry special on Mondays and Tuesdays. Not sure which day is which but we qualify for both so it's awesome.

jN51g7Gq0Gi3-FaBIfzi8A.text: So again my husband and I stop by for dinner and it was once again disappointing. He ordered the carnitas plate with rice, refined beans & veggies. Well the entire plate of food was ice cold!! We sent it back and Maria the really nice and only waitress brought us a different plate. This time it was the carnitas tacos well the rice & beans were still cold and so were the tacos. My plate was like warm but eatable. I ordered the chicken Feinstein and I'm sure it would taste a lot better if it was a bit hotter, temperature wise. I'm so disappointed that both reviews I've given this place are bad.  Maria did not charge us for both cold plates which was nice but when you go to dinner and are hungry and this happens it just ruins yours dinner.

Big Plus is it's open 24/7.  New Vegas favorite!!! Want to give a shout out to our server Enrique. Super friendly and knowledgeable and took great care of us.

stc9OAwHDNEc3X-Sop7P0g.text: This is an amazing find on the Vegas food scene. Fresh ingredients, skillfully prepared with TLC in a beautifully decorated locale. The price point is excellent for organic, gmo-free ingredients and the flavor palettes are so much deeper and nuanced than you find at most mexican influenced restaurants in the United States.  The creamy tomatillo sauce on the seafood enchiladas was brightly flavored, rich and balanced without any hint of heaviness from the cream. Chef Paco was happy to accommodate a substitution of corn tortillas for wheat in order to keep this celiac's stomach happy and even comped us an incredible strawberries and cream dessert when they ran out of flan. He's a sweetheart of a guy who happily chats with customers when there's a lull in the action.   The second visit (the very next night) to sample the 24/7 breakfast menu was no disappointment and we were well taken care of by Rafael, who demonstrated genuine concern for my gluten issues and was an all around delight. I hate to say they were better than the version I had in rural Morelos Mexico...  But frankly, the traditional huevos divorciados were elevated to new heights. It's amazing how the chef takes a common dish and turns it into something of memorable execution and presentation.  We're headed back over for round three before reluctantly returning to Denver in the morning. I'm not a gambler, but I'll be back to Vegas sooner than later just to get another taste of Eldorado's top notch cuisine... Because the quality here is NO gamble!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The secret recipe for flan from Chef Paco&#39;s abuelita is to die for!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hands down best flan I&#39;ve ever had. It&#39;s like upside down Mexican cheesecake!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The style is gorgeous and elegant without a hint of pretense.

3SGXwOOkFq7tczTnFuWmeQ.text: *THIS IS A GLUTEN-FREE REVIEW!*  As with all my reviews, this review is based on the fact that I have celiac, and I love to eat food.  Right off the bat, I could eat the tortilla chips, which I can only ever do at half the Mexican restaurants out there, so that was a good sign - I was immediately stoked!  I can only assume this place lists gluten-free next to many items because they are, in fact, gluten free!  Our server was confident in answering my questions about ensuring gluten-freeness and that everything was safe for someone with celiac, not to mention she was totally fun and friendly.    I ordered the pulled chicken street tacos with rice and beans and it was excellent.  The chicken was super shredded and juicy and tender.  Delicious!  Also, the rice was really good - it wasn't the normal orangey "Spanish" style rice you get at most places.  I really liked it.  Everyone at our table thoroughly enjoyed their food and I gotta say, the restaurant has a pretty nice atmosphere too.  Who cares that it shares a wall with a strip club?!  I'm from San Diego, where I believe all the best Mexican food lives, and I think this place was on par with some of my favorite spots down there.  Definitely going back to El Dorado next time I'm in Vegas - can't wait to try their empanadas or sopes!

Pt4H4PTFkzUVS-rUu3T-bw.text: El Dorado Cantina is a very good Mexican restaurant. The table side guacamole is the best I've had. Fruit margaritas not so much. Amazing wait staff.  24/7 in Vegas! What could be better?

18p9XO68DKrAbK0Gj50cWQ.text: To have such complex flavors AND to be organic and non-GMO?  No wonder the wife and I spend so much time sitting at the bar at El Dorado Cantina!  I love everything I have eaten here; but, the Pineapple Shrimp stands apart from nearly every Mexican dish I've had here in Vegas.  Presentation alone trumps most spots!  Service is GREAT at the bar; so, don't hesitate to pull up a chair.  The bartending power duo of Tiff and Nell won't fail to impress!

b0-l0gBpCG4sE2SGDkPX4w.text: Best Mexican food that I have tried. All fresh, organic and healthy. Wonderful service!  Loved chef Paco!

-Ixd8Sr8_BXHlkSYMGczKA.text: My husband and I came in with no expectations and were absolutely mind blown.  Food was amazing, but the service was impeccable!  Ivan and Liz were very friendly and they made us feel cheerful at a time when we needed it the most.  Will definitely come back!

eNYC6Cjb4AHDXu88uYsh_A.text: Erika was a great server! She was very kind. I got the Carne Asada plate and it was soooo good! The guac was bomb! The desserts are great as well..got the fried ice cream and flan.

zhU9ebGhwAq0W3c-HJ-JpA.text: WARNING FROM LONG TIME CUSTOMER: THEY HAVE CHANGED THE MENU IT IS NO LONGER GUARANTEED TO BE ORGANIC MANY MENU CHANGES AND ALWAYS NEW STAFF NOW!! THEY CHANGED BASICALLY EVERY THING I CAME HERE FOR FIRST THE WINGS THEN THE STEAK BOWL NOW ITS NOT EVEN ORGANIC!! I will probably not come back but I might give a second chance but I'm pretty outraged.. literally chipotle is now a safer choice. I'm saddened by this because it was my absolute favorite restaurant but I won't be back anymore after my experience tonight!! This is the same place that joined in the march against Monsanto and fed the protesters the same eldorado that had then we hate GMOs sign that spread awareness through the valley..now changed I am sad to say... but Fabiana the manager is the absolute sweetest and best and has always taken care of me as she did this time as well

Yz5nzEUncXUchRgclm6opQ.text: Best farm to table Mexican food ever! Happy hour tacos for a buck can't be beat however, we wish you would find a new location. We feel a bit intimidated walking into your place 'cause you're connected to strip club. But please don't let that stop you from visiting this place because it really is a cut above the rest of the Mexican restaurants in this town. The chef works diligently creating new dishes and he is on hand and in kitchen six days a week so you can't beat that! I always try to eat in a place that has the chef in the kitchen. If guacamole is your thing, you can't get any better than here and they make it right there table side with your own personal heat factor!

n-HHfvNekQbsFfwrXmEdsg.text: My server Jeffery made the experience at El Dorado Cantina memorable! He was fast and sufficient. Knowledgeable about the menu and very friendly. The margaritas are to die for ! We had the chicken enchiladas this evening with refriend beans and white rice. Amazing !! I will definitely be back and requesting Jeff !

LtBY5HO6NXR_fTSFSPLacA.text: Wow! This place is incredible! My husband and i sat at the bar because we didn't make a reservation which was totally fine by me.  We met the best bartender in town!  Her name is Tara, she's knowledgeable, funny, makes incredible margaritas (she's the master!) and made our night. I got the seasonal raspberry Cadillac margarita and my husband got the classic Cadillac margarita. The food is some of the absolute best I've had in town.  I got an al pastor taco, cochinita, and asada taco.  They were all delicious but if i had to pick a favorite it would be the al pastor.  The tacos were flavorful and not greasy. My hubby got the carne asada burrito xmas style with half green half red sauce.  Of course I had to try it, and it was awesome! For dessert we got the nieve de naranja and it was like eating an orange creamsicle. Everything is made with fresh ingredients and you can really tell.  I definitely recommend this place and i will be back.

YFVPSQ1JdxZhdjkSFZ0rIw.text: Great restaurant and Emily was a wonderful server. The food was delicious! They offer complimentary food (cheese quesadilla and churros) to children who eat off of the kids menu as well. Definitely visit El Dorado if you're in town!

Our server, Jess, was so sweet and made our night super fun. Would highly recommend the guacamole (made table side). Overall a great place for a group dinner or a birthday celebration!

23RpZNNTEI1RqEye3kSmcQ.text: The best Mexican food ever! So authentic amazing  flavor!! Sean thank you for your awesome service! Your friendly attitude made our breakfast even more delish! You're an awesome waiter!!! The entire staff just awesome people! Thank you and we will be back soon!

hKzgFSmLzjI-9UpLIGhDtA.text: Enrique! Best waiter ever. The food here is authentic Mexican with locally sourced ingredients. I would not hesitate to recommend El Dorado to anyone.  The shrimp, cauliflower, and mahi tacos were the best we've ever had. The table side guacamole is excellent. Very fresh and they ask what level of spiciness you'd like.  We're glad that we found this place and, even though they share a parking lot with Sapphire, a strip club, don't let that dissuade you from supporting this local, family business. Paco, the chef, came to our table and asked how our meal was and shared that the flan is his grand mother's recipe.

-9kpos1t9P5YbJMmUp5IRA.text: We use to come here quite a bit when they first opened. They use to offer half off to locals and industry on Mondays ... I was never sure how they managed this... But I never complained. I believe they offer 20 percent off to locals now, although... No one has ever offered it or advertised it to us in recent months...  I love that they offer organic, non gmo food and have an array of vegan options:) however, their price point is kind of ridiculous for the location and the atmosphere. $16 for guacamole? I'm not trying to be a jerk, but where are they getting their avocados? The mark up is ridiculous. I paid $19 for two vegan lettuce wraps with black beans and rice. If you go with a friend, only one of you should order the beans and rice. They upcharge and there is enough for two.   The drink prices are reasonable, and they offer a wide variety of different tequilas. Their service is okay... not overly friendly... not overly quick... however, they are efficient and that's good enough. I really use to like to this place, but I've had better Mexican food at lower price points. The biggest plus... they are open 24/7 and offer healthier options than bar food. Give them a try for their happy hour.

dwt5nMbtRNXc80m4wQqFJg.text: We planned a party there for 35 people last weekend. We booked their semi-private room, which was mostly private.   It was awesome! The food was delicious and the staff was gracious. I'm not sure what they put in their rice, but I'm still thinking about how delicious it was. The street tacos were also delightful. The drinks were also really good.  I spoke to Martine to plan my party and she was so accommodating. Everyone in our group loved the restaurant. The decor is beautiful. odouUID7pdRt1BbnySC2qQ.text: Back in town, which means carving out time to go to my favourite Mexican place - El Dorado!  As always, the food was fresh, delicious, and authentic. The margaritas were ON POINT, as usual.   There are vegetarian and gluten free choices as well as the usual omnivorous options.   I had the corn street tacos, my friend had the beef enchiladas. We also ordered the table side guacamole and put the spice level to a 7 - it was amazing - had a solid kick but wasn't overpowering or too hot & I found myself having to refrain from licking the bowl    We had the churros & the house made orange gelato for desert - the latter is new since my last visit & it was a refreshing palate cleanser.  It's also free if you check in and review the business on Yelp (as of 9/2018; subject to change without notice.)   I love this place; the food and drinks are excellent, the pricing is what you'd expect for a 24/7 restaurant in Las Vegas - did I mention the food and drinks are excellent? - on the way out after finishing & I'm catching a cab back to the hotel, the cabbie mentioned - without prompting - "that's the best Mexican place in the city."   You know you've got something when a local cabbie tells you it's the best without prompting!  Love this place, hope it's very successful & I can continue to visit every time I'm town.   TL;DR - Consistently excellent & interesting food & margaritas at reasonable-for-what-you-get pricing. It's off The Strip but absolutely worth the cab ride over.

qznHXgLz0GY53jpkl0op-Q.text: The carne asada burrito is my favorite thing on the menu. The vibe is super relaxed and the service is great! Their next door neighbor will show you a good time as far as the entertainment portion of the evening goes. Incredible place to visit, I highly recommend it! Enjoy

-lOan05YLBVO7tCP4ro-5g.text: The location is a little skeptical being next to a strip club but the food makes up for it, came here with my gf and we ordered the organic tacos they were amazing!  and the complimentary chips and salsa were really good too. the very friendly chef even came out to greet us and offered a complimentary flan dessert, great service great food a must try@

On a repeat visit during EDC 2016, I ordered the same meal and had the same religious experience. The food is organic and the rice is buttery ... And I don't even like cilantro.
