ypAZUBZb3SuxzpykckGfcw.text: That food is great.  Our server Juan is was fantastic.  We didn't realize they have a private back room that you can reserve for parties of 20 or more.

3DTukVbxyHNXq37dHOnblw.text: Autumn was a outstanding server, I am a server myself so my espectations for good service was far beyond met. I disliked the location, however it was a family friendly place and my seven year enjoyed it. I had the veggie tacos and they were great, but the veggies were a little undercooked to my personal liking. The kids menu options were only $6 which was awesome pricing. Autumn informed us on the amazing vegetarian options for us and how they use non GMO ingredients. I also loved her presentation on the table side guacamole. It was the best guacamole I have tried and went home and made it myself extactly how she made it. Overall my experience was pleasent and we will be back to eat again. Request Autumn to be your server, you won't be disappointed!!!

kjYM5jZsyIPVqu-mjP4FBw.text: Enrique our waiter was awesome, great atmosphere, comfy seats, fast service, great drinks, ORGANIC FRESH FOOD, simply awesome. I will be back.

ONCEHc3S2lP3xCDfm7ZXJA.text: The imperial shrimp was very good and the sauce was excellent. The salsa was the best they gave us a variety of heats and the chips were home made. Very good food. Traveled from L.A.just to try this place, worth the trip.

pAQoGWdm_3caKn6ltHXQOQ.text: This place is AMAZING. My husband and I are travelling from Texas and have yet to come across an authentic mexican restaurant that serves clean organic non gmo dishes. Even the desserts are clean. I ordered the carne asada burrito with green sauce and goodness it was tasty! We live very close to the mexican border and this food tasted like home. So happy to have found this place and wish we had one back in South Texas.

G68kcdHlLzUTKOQmiay-kw.text: This place is great the food is amazing and the environment is way more family friendly then I expected! And chef Paco was a great host!!!

kjVOKyzdR9wVX5M5zLYlcw.text: This restaurant has an interesting location but don't let that deter you from giving it a try.  I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the set-up and decor was as I was prepared for a dive.  It was clean with a good size bar and comfortable booth seating.  There were many options for drinks and food but it wasn't overwhelming.  I was very happy to see vegan, vegetarian, and gluten free items were clearly identified as I recently started following a gluten free diet.  Everyone in my party ordered tacos and we were not disappointed!  Tacos come with a side of rice and black or refried beans.  I got the carne asada.  The meat was tender and seasoning was very tasty.  I didn't mind not having Spanish rice at all because the white cilantro rice was so good along with the black beans.  My only complaint was the temperature of my food was not hot.  I almost sent it back but was starving and tired so I happily ate away.  Didn't have any alcoholic drinks but my sisters did and they both liked theirs.  I'd definitely go back!  If you go, don't forget to check-in on Yelp for your free flan.  It was flantastic.

y1HHzuQycs_XEASgz4eKKg.text: First time here, delicious!  My fiance has celiac and our server Amber was very knowledgable about which dishes were suitable for highly sensitive folks. She recommended the albondongas soup which my fiance loved.  Great Mexican food, and being a Tucson native, that's high praise!

xEpwrhytKD4DpY4TndPHWA.text: Finally!  We have found good Mexican food in Las Vegas. Open 24 hours. The dining room is big, clean and a nice ambience. They have a big bar with more tequila than I could list. We started off with the table side guacamole which was so fresh, it was like eating a garden. Large portion too! We also had the Mexican corn (why have we never had this?). It was like cream corn on a stick. Yum. I could eaten two but wouldn't have had room for the main course. I had the grilled mahi tacos and my GF had the Mole sampler. The tacos were great. Only two tacos but I wouldn't have been able to eat three. The mole sampler, well I'll just say that the traditional and the chipotle mole were to die for. My fave was the chipotle. The mole verde was.......different. Not the best thug on the plate. Something just didn't go together.  All in all this little place is a "find" and worth the drive. Even though it's right next to a "gentleman's club", so what. Try the jalapeno margarita. We'll be back!

tvyTUGukJqQG1FY9oCtmIQ.text: Best flan ever! Best mole ever! A must stop if you're in Vegas. Chef Paco and our server Enrique were sincere and simply awesome, not to mention wonderfully bilingual. Gracias!

uMJJnaPw5XtN8Mwet-oFLg.text: Jesse was a great server! The food was delicious! Chef Paco's flan was amazing. I definitely recommend trying the chapulines (grasshoppers) if you're feeling adventurous. The chips and salsa are complimentary and they make table side guac

YilOWrgX0tPUSl7dXVQsxA.text: 4.5- the food was outstanding , wait staff attentive though service was a little slow. Would come back for sure.

SsVTfSsGMqVxSqiI7YXwdw.text: Splendid lunch - The Fajitas are really good. Definitely coming back to try other dish!

pJDhhEjH7slqxA0B492YNw.text: I'm sorry to say we were underwhelmed. The chicken was dry, the enchilada sauce and beans tasted like they were from a can, and the salsas were mediocre at best. Had I not watched the feature on the food network, I would have passed it up due to the fact that they share an entrance with a strip club.

QH2mDlfMsuFTxKB9JTvX9Q.text: amazing food and service!!! Raphael is truly a pro! I loved everything I got!

yaUx5eFxf-rqgWtHqbDabw.text: This place hands down is amazing .. Been here twice and every time I come to Vegas it's a must have.. Chef paco personally came around to the guests to make sure everyone is happy and gives out his biz card and number... Personal attention to service is unheard of today.. World class place at a very reasonable price... I wish this guys nothing but the best...

Irh1WtYLFBY3s4G5jdCLAA.text: Stopped by for lunch and we were not disappointed. Food was fresh and delicious. Highly recommend the flan. And service was nice too.

fX6tDLNW_T2V86Z6y2qCcg.text: Just had early dinner at El Dorado Cantina - it was great.  Food delicious and service marvelous .  Enrique was our server, he was attentive, informative and a really nice guy.  Would ask for him again. Everyone had a different entree and the were all great.  The table side guacamole was made perfectly and the pitcher of margaritas were spot on.  Can't wait to go again.

laAkdRNuCutPE7IofI4qZQ.text: Excellent food and service here! Kelsey, our server was great and super helpful. The chef is very gracious and we were lucky to meet him here. The salsas, guacamole and tacos are the best ever. Also, you have to try the delicious flan here. The recipe is  80+ years old and just unbelievably good! Totally made our trip to Las Vegas complete!

IvT7YDpHylXkCPF1Fos0vg.text: We went yesterday after reading numerous positive reviews. It's True that its located next to the Sapphire club but don't let that dissuade you! The food is really excellent! Had a delicious Mojito; the at table-made guacamole is good and they will make it to your taste. Our server Erika was excellent and gave us good advice as we ordered. The Pozole soup is delicious- a bowl is a a meal in itself! Chicken enchiladas were great, wished we'd been able to try the Mahi tacos...maybe next time! When we told the waitress that we read excellent yelp reviews she brought us a free flan for dessert which was superior to any other flan I've ever had- super creamy! We were there for a late lunch so it wasn't too busy. We were surprised that Paco the chef came out to say hello! (He's been featured on Food Network's Taco show.) He told us his recipes are his mothers and grandmothers - all GMO free. It's just off the strip but this place is worth it!

0AQJ-QTu7GtxaP4SoD07yA.text: Beautifully decorated restaurant. I love the floral fabric walls! The service provided by Kai was by far one of the best we have experienced. Food was delicious and so fresh. The portions are great sizes too. We even met the genius behind our dishes today, Chef Paco. We will definitely returning soon!

GCa764gWxvC2CP5l7q3swQ.text: Super cute atmosphere, great service, very clean restaurant.  Ivett was a wonderful server/bartender, great margaritas and very accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oA9fqwTYVcUlV8PRESZyrg.text: The Price is very steep for being a basic Mexican restaurant. And the service is terrible........  Came here on a Sunday morning at 12pm. Super disappointed.... There are amazing reviews but nothing was a 4/5 star for me at any point.....  The restaurant wasn't even busy, yet we had to wait 20 mins before getting seated. We were so stoked to try this place after seeing so many good reviews and the food looked so good.  The waiting area was a bit awkward because there was a table right next to it. I felt bad for the people eating there because I can only imagine how uncomfortable they were. We finally got seated. This is where everything went downhill.. The hostess and waiter was recommended dishes we should try so we went ahead and got some dishes they recommended. They set chips and salsa on the table right away which gave me the impression that it was going to be a good experience.... We ordered 2 drinks, 1 pineapple juice , and 3 pineapple and watermelon drink, along with our ice waters. We started with the fried shrimp (app dish), Carne asada plate, guacamole, 1 chicken , steak, and shrimp fajita. steak and chicken fajita plate.  3 tacos al pastor, and a shrimp burrito.  So ill go ahead and break down our experience... The shrimp app came out and we were pretty impressed. The dipping sauce was light and tasty. Next, the guac was being made right in front of us. We told our waiter we wanted a level 7 out of 10 spicy level.... It was mild..... no spice what so ever. The fajitas came out next. Oh the disappointment. $28 for the steak and shrimp, not bad... $34 for shrimp added, but guess what!? only 3 shrimps.....  They forgot the tortillas. (it took 10 mins to get the tortillas out.) The burrito came out next.... this was my dish. I wanted to get the pineapple shrimp, but the waiter recommended the burrito because i'd "get my money's worth." I bit into it and there was so shrimp to be found.... I opened up my burrito and not surprisingly, only 5 shrimps...What a waste of money!!!!! It was full of rice and beans.  The carne asada plate came out. We were told it wasn't as good, but the plate ended up being the best of everything...  At this point, the drinks still didn't come out.. we were still waiting for al pastor tacos....  Everyone was almost done eating and our waiter asked, "Did you ever get your drinks?!?! and is there anything else I can get you?" Ya...... we never got our drinks, and were still waiting on our tacos. The tacos and drinks finally came out.  I felt so bad for my friend who got the tacos. It's the simplest dish out of the 6 dishes but came out last. Our waters did not get refilled throughout our entire stay.....  The food is not good..... The 4 stars must be from people who don't eat mexican food, or drunk people! Perhaps I came on the wrong day?!  Never again... Def do not recommend.

W-3gJzURM_iDhtY1_O-Rpw.text: Best Mexican restaurant we have found! Stella was a fantastic server and the food by Chef Paco was amazing! An absolute must for locals and out-of-town guests!

kwuDJVo4Fmh9_ePPcU6P4w.text: Excellent service, delicious food , huge portions , definitely one of the best Mexican food restaurant in Las Vegas, they have a nice floor supervisor named Fabiola , the best , me and my wife love her , she is the best , and our waitress very sweet and very polite . The food was excellent, the mole authentic Mexican mole , the salsa and chips very tasty, the Mexican shrimp cocktail, delicious, like in Mexico with a lot of shrimp!! The only think they need is fish ceviche and more brands of draft beer , like xx and budlight , well is my opinion , overall this is a excellent restaurant. I recommend 200 % I am a mexican and I know when the food is authentic Mexican food. Stop by and say hi to Fabiola .

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UB57CPgJ5Hw5nXvW6Ju4xA.text: I am visiting from Virginia and couldn't wait to eat here!  My sister comes here all of the time and it was our first stop. I ordered the carne Asada street tacos. I asked for a substitute of flour tortillas and they were happy to accommodate!  The food is fresh and tastes so good. He margarita was perfect. Not sour, smooth. Emily was very attentive and the other servers and food runner help clear the plates and refilled waters. Thank you for a good experience.

Q9mBukZbtJAy1ik7O3sidQ.text: AMAZING!!! The food was phenomenal and the service was excellent. Daniel was our waiter and excellent at checking on us, refilling our waters-all without being a nuisance. The rest of the staff stopped by periodically to check on us too. I usually don't care for all the check ins but they did it without interrupting. The food...ok, was unbelievable. We got the table side guacamole and it was fresh and delicious. We decided not to get serano peppers or tomatoes in it. It's 2 whole avocados which was too much for us. You get 1 free basket of chips and salsa, the green Verde salsa was awesome. I wanted to buy a gallon of it. My wife and I split the carnitas street tacos-3 on the plate with beans and rice. The meat was so juicy and tender; very delicious. We saw all the reviews on Yelp about this place  and decided to try it. We were very excited that they disclose where all their ingredients come from and that it is very "clean and healthy"....we are ALL for that. We will be coming back. Thank you El Dorado!!!!

LhzEl_eHXlamRTegsUUpVg.text: The food was good, the ingredients were fresh and the portions were perfect. Not too big not too small.   I looooved the desserts! That's what won us over. I would come here any day just for the desserts.   The Flan was very creamy and had perfectly balanced flavors. The caramel sauce was sweet (no burnt bitter flavor) and the flan did not taste like eggs. Highly recommend.   Tres leches was delicious too, the milk has a great vanilla and rum like flavor.   The orange sorbet is both sweet and tart but not overwhelming.   Would highly suggest the desserts!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M5g9gpH-Cni0eqGUq183sg.text: The food was very comforting and full of flavors! Been a long time since l have had such good Mexican food. The tacos were not only just spicy but had actual flavors.   Loved the service too!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good food and great service, Ericka you are the best server!

NtlgPV93lXB6JZUhp9ZY9g.text: We visited for my birthday dinner and enjoyed ourselves. The food was AMAZING. the atmosphere was nice and lively. I loved the decorations in the place. Our servers were very attentive and friendly. I would recommend this place

pQTUodNKDoI1uQGp0gtXXA.text: When you drive up to this restaurant you may be turned off by its location, as it's right next to a gentleman's club, but don't be!   The inside of the restaurant is decorated nicely. My family and I were sat at a nice booth and a waiter immediately came over asking us what drinks we would like and yelling us about their most popular appetizers. He was very knowledgeable on the different dishes and described them in great detail. My family ended up ordering a few appetizers and they were impressed with all of them.   When it came to ordering main plates they got a couple things to all share, also recommendations by the waiter. He knew that I was vegan and was very helpful in providing options for me and sharing his opinions. I got a veggie bowl and it was even better than I thought it would be. It was so big I couldn't eat it all on my own and I was very impressed.   If you're wanting some Mexican food when you're in Vegas go to El Dorado, you won't regret it.

4CiCi7xWIwZ9ggCuw7ri2g.text: From the moment we walked in the hostess took care of us. Then Danielle our server was so attentive and made sure we had the best time since we are visiting. We had a concern about our bill but David the manager resolved it within seconds and we were beyond appreciative. The food, & drinks were incredible. Best joint in Vegas.

TF5GaawEbaBA8EvB2L7BLQ.text: The food is always delicious and service is great!  Must try the table side guacamole and chefs famous flan!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry flan for breast cancer awareness.  Yum!!!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole so good it&#39;s gone!

1TGUiNACnA8Dx2t9xJy_aA.text: Great night after work. Jael took great care of us. She deserves to be more than just a hostess! The only person who attended to us. Took our orders and made an awesome guacamole! Made our night.  The food was great as well. Definitely recommend the food. The only thing bad about our experience, was the drinks took too long.

SJp-5utsMBJ9iOfgCDmX7g.text: My first time in Las Vegas and now my favorite restaurant in Vegas. Really delicious food. Our host, Emily was super kind and patient. The other waitress were constantly refilling our water cups. Emily was also constantly asking us if we were fine or needed anything else. My Green enchiladas were delicious and the presentation of the food was Gorgeous! Totally recommend!

bbPCqcdz0nnrTEETVdH9mA.text: A HUGE fan of this restaurant!!! We have been coming since they opened. We haven't had a bad order yet. The Table Side Guacamole is made to order. You have the option of spicy or not. It is amazing. We get it every time! My favorite entree is the Shrimp Taco plate!!! It comes with the best cilantro rice and black beans I've ever had!!! My husband and daughter love the Carne Asada Tacos. Chef Paco makes the best Flan also!!! I wish I could have it everyday! This place is a must if you like Mexican food... Also, a big deal for our family, it's ORGANIC!!!! And it's amazing!!!! Try it!!!!    Add on, years later, still #1 in our book! Jalapeno margaritas are amazing. Seafood enchilada was my pick for Mothers Day. Thank you Chef Paco a million times.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kGBXn9LP9UanmobYaURVxg.text: If you're looking for good food and friendly staff I would recommend. However, their service is terrible. It seems like the staff is more worried about completing their duties then tending to the guests. We waited 30 minutes for our food, then asked our bartender (we were eating at the bar) 2 times within 15 minutes for more salsa, I had to remind him a third time for him to get it. It is also an up charge for another dish of salsa that really has so spice or flavor. At the end of the meal the bartender seemed so rushed he actually dropped the dish and splashed food all over my fathers arms. The food we ordered was good but it was room temperature, which was weird because the plate was very hot. Again, friendly staff, but extremely long service.

Y19kQ0pE6rACNru73sFVPg.text: Ive been here before and had amazing food, but this was many months ago. Something isn't the same here. Service was quick at first then slowly disappeared as the employees were hanging out behind the bar with few tables to wait on.   The food came out late and cold. The cilantro rice is usually buttery and soft, now dry and cold. The burrito also dry and cold. Table side guacamole and salsa was the only pro tonight. The margaritas weren't worth it for the price and the cucumber jalapeno was not good. They comped my buddies burger for cooking it wrong. Then went to comp us a flan for good measure, only to see they put it on our tab until we asked them to remove it. Also included on the tab was salsa that is supposed to be free and a side of rice and beans, to which we never received the beans.   So many good memories here in the past but very unimpressed especially for bringing new friends to finally try out.

aot7Ir1esqKDy-C_XRVesg.text: Juan was our server for the evening & did a really good job making sure all our needs were met. Great food, Great Service & Great Association!!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El Pastor yummmmm
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I absolutely love this place... if your in town and want some delicious food, I highly recommend this place!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cokEFYj13nmoyksaRqD0yA.text: Delicious food with awesome happy hour deals (see picture). Our server, Erica, was an absolute delight and so accommodating. You would never know that this place is connected to a strip club (at least at lunchtime). A clean and classy establishment.   The street tacos were my favorite... definitely do the El Pastor!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_Yx5GGiRkiqrUH7albMeiQ.text: Great atmosphere, great decor, and the tacos are great too! Crazy busy today with it being National Taco Day but everyone was really nice,  approachable, and helpful. Come try them out and make sure you make reservation Friday or Saturday.

XyyF2Fo6Kf-T8ZEk9ZvbIA.text: This is a must when visiting Las Vegas. The food is fabulous and the staff especially Grace is spectacular!! It's fresh good quality Mexican Food!!! Don't be fooled by the strip club next store.

R0BpqJ_F3a0iCbdc98_XXw.text: Enjoying the amazing flan from the gm Martine Jordan and the sangria is bar non the best!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t3Ggrw6je07-g36Ck_Y_Qg.text: It's Monday, the place is totally empty and the costumer service is horrible. We walked away cause after waiting 40 minutes we didn't get our order. The waitress didn't bring us silver ware napkin. She gave a terrible service. A waste of time just for getting stupid tacos that we never get.

IcXYByw15LhFs2Q3LfqikQ.text: My gf and I can here since we saw how many good reviews this place had. We had a tough time finding it since they don't really have a sign up. When we walked in the staff greeted us and we got seated right away. Free chips and salsa! The food was delicious. Our waiter being from our home town San Jose did a great job recommending items on the menu. My gf got a margarita and she said it was the bomb!  Plenty of TVs to watch the games/fights!   We will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada tacos!

0XX6ESO6FNfek8A8xp0UAQ.text: When looking for this place just look for Sapphire Gentlemen's Club which is pretty hard to miss. Pull into the parking lot & you'll see the restaurant attached to it with a separate entrance. Happy hour has some nice food selections for $5 & street tacos for $2. My husband & I ordered the carne asada, carnitas, & chicken street tacos along with a chicken quesadilla ($7). Portions were all a nice size. It came with complimentary chips & 3 salsas: habanero, chipotle, & tomatillo. We enjoyed everything & you certainly can't beat the price.  I had a margarita that was also very good...fresh made no sweet & sour mix.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OG-wWQPNIEzQEwUN5i8OYg.text: My favorite Mexican spot in Vegas! I'm from San Diego so I am very particular about my tacos and this place never disappoints. The sopes, taquitos, tacos and mole chicken are some of my favorites and don't forget flan for dessert. Aaaaaand the best part is it's open 24 hours AND organic which is a super bonus!! Be sure you come see Ivan at the bar, he's an amazing bartender!

gwSz4P9KtLNNEMOFZS7xpA.text: The food is great but I don't like going in there. What they do well, they do awesome at. All of their burritos, bowls and tacos are awesome. Their signature dishes and entrees leave a lot to be desired.  It's far too dark in there and it feels very cramped. There is also a lot of noise coming from the kitchen constantly. Not a good place to go if you want a quiet or intimate evening. Better to either take the food to go or go during a quiet time. They are open 24/7 so you can get awesome food whenever you want.

wvlS1KxiALqHBuvinuiHzw.text: Came here for taco Tuesday! Street tacos for 3.50$, all fresh organic non gmo ingredients.... I'm all over that.  I got one carne asada, one al pastor and one carnitas - so delicious!

MJVwYUDa-GpZE9Pa4wnTfg.text: This place exceeded any expectations we had! At first we laughed walking in because it shares a building with sapphire gentlemans club and we had my daughter with us, but it is a legit restaurant. Super nice inside with a friendly staff. The food was good. I had the shrimp tacos. They have black bean refried beans, which I have never had! I loved them! I can't wait to try the sauteed grasshoppers next time!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tacos with black refried beans! Yum!

Gg288zARFc9HwQ4EqjYy6A.text: Great food and Martine our greeter was very nice. She called over a guy to make us fresh salsa. That stuff was killer! Great food and will be back!!

cDG_GMCYGobhVToMZ5pwIw.text: This place is great!!!!Amazing food and sangrias!!! I really like the restaurant and the atmosphere!!! Glad my friend recommended it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0z7g8cO-A723snio3JVW2Q.text: Wooooooow!!!!  This place have the best  Mexican food ever, I travel all the world including mexico, and I have different flavors but chef Paco knows how to put a great menu together, from table side guacamole to grandmas flan, quality ingredients ,non GMO and organic foods are really appreciated! Bravo el Dorado, great job chef Paco I'll be back with all my family and friends!!!! We love you

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing churros and fried ice cream

GkpnNkVm-C9NygbAKR1GJg.text: Super good, a little sketchy upon arrival, it's like next to a gentlemen's club and wasn't sure if it was inside or not, maybe specify on the page for future? But super great selection of alcohol and huge menu, great for vegetarians and lots of gluten free selections! The table side guacamole is killer.

98Jfi4dmhb2U5q0JqUd7lw.text: 1st time in Vegas, definitely recommend this place even tho it's off the strip.  MUST TRY THE CORN worth the $5!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deliciousness! Very satisfied

Gry1zCx2rmEiqVOIUGVEvA.text: If you like authentic Mexican food, do yourself a favor and eat here.  Do not be thrown off by the fact that it is next to a Gentlemen's Club; it is right next door.  The Guacamole is made fresh, AT YOUR TABLE!!!  Oh, it was so good!  I had the Cochinita street tacos, which is Achiote marinated slow roasted Hill Meat Company's pork with pickled habanero & onions. There is definitely some heat with the pickled habanero, but they will put it on the side for you.  If you make your reservations online through Yelp, you get a free flan for dessert - which is delicious.    If I ever go back to Las Vegas, I will definitely stop here again.

DPYIUwupSaWusotVXYOo_w.text: The best Mexican meal I have ever had.  No joke..and I've traveled to Mexico. The real difference is the fact that they use only fresh, organic, non GMO food in prep.  Presentation is great.   Taste is superb.  Not a fan of it being attached to Sapphire Gentlemen's Club because I'm not into the club scene...but this is Vegas.   Come in, order a Margarita and the Cactus Tacos and you'll love them.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cactus tacos
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xeKcEygr4Nf5iR8BqfvLxQ.text: - Interesting location.  Pretty sketchy area and being next door to a strip club makes it a little odd - Service was very friendly - The space is nice.  Well spaced and doesn't get too loud  Overall, the food was pretty good. - The chips and salsas were excellent.  The green salsa was slightly sweet and had a little heat at the end - The pozole wasn't that good.  Ok flavor, but pozole should be overflowing with hominy.  There might have been ten pieces of hominy in my cup - The table side guacamole was excellent.  Chunky, salty, and just the right touch of lime - The shrimp taquitos were pretty good.  The shrimp was tender (and I could taste it) and the plate had just the right amount of salsa, guac, and cheese - The carne asada street tacos were average at best - The carnitas street tacos were great  I probably won't be back because the neighborhood skeeved me out a bit, but I could be forced back if someone really wanted to go.

QCjg9Z2Q_Ds-uNvKi1rPSA.text: Thank you el dorado cantina for providing us healthy eaters with an UH-MAZING option!!! Not only was it the healthiest meal of our Vegas trip, but it was also the best...

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fajitas come with organic tortillas!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Veggie bowl is so yummy!!! So happy to have an organic non gmo option in Vegas!

VK3nGa-dHqpRTa9niv44VQ.text: Delicious margarita's, excellent happy hour choices. We had the chicken sopes and he chicken taquitos, both excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent margarita&#39;s.

uwqnxsdG7WKe06NDCJ624w.text: This will be the first time I write a semi-negative review. I take no pleasure in it, but I have to be honest for my fellow Yelpers. I really don't know what restaurant everyone is raving about, but it's definitely not El Dorado Cantina.  This review comes after a second visit, the first was equally unimpressive.  The highlights: friendly staff and the queso fundida. The lowlights: confused staff, bland entree, bland side dishes, and runny salsa  I can't stress how disappointed I was in my entree... tacos al pastor, one of my favorite Mexican dishes. Heavily seasoned, sweet and spicy, a little crusty outer layer of meat with juicy, tender insides, layered with the complex flavors of chilis, pineapple and onion. Well, that's not the dish I was served. I must have accidentally ordered bland, rubbery disappointment.  If you're looking for good Mexican food near the strip, spend your money at Tacos el Gordo or Tacos & Beer instead.  Otherwise, save your visit to this restaurant for when you're drunkenly stumbling out of Sapphire nextdoor.

8o4XbdefU5-HAEsGtF7MSA.text: This place was amazing. We had the chips with 3 types of salsa, loaded nachos with chicken, and a braised pork belly taco. We also had a Margarita on the rocks and a strawberry Margarita. Everything was amazing and the bar keep was amazing as well.

49ZmSZp5M7AdYLPa31PuCg.text: Enjoying another wonderful meal to celebrate! Our server Ericka is always attentive and a pleasure! Had the Lobster taco special with Cadillac margarita and these were the best. Chile relleno de camaron was awesome too!

S_C7ps1V6-QGwUSijKmDfA.text: Great food and prices. Grace our server made the best guacamole right in front of you.

uQY4o2GoiBuRav9p7wF8NA.text: Very good service server Fabi was very pleasant and attentive... food potion was good I even had left overs. The drinks were also good.. everyone was helpful and friendly...

eS345yUfcGEoAoz73A5esQ.text: That's right five stars. Because any restaurant in Vegas that is willing to stand against using GMO food deserves five stars! There's so much organic food on the menu, I feel like I'm eating at a whole foods.  That's the catch. The location of this restaurant is not ideal. My mom flew in to town for my birthday and of course she wanted to take me out to dinner. I chose this place because Mexican food is my favorite! My husband was driving us. I see the gentleman's club, Sapphire. I say, "where the heck is this place? We should be close." My husband shouts out, "it's here!" And he turns in to Sapphire's. I thought he was joking. My mother was mortified. She even evoked my middle name and asked what I was thinking!  Long story short, we went in to the restaurant with our eyes down for fear of what we might see. Low and behold, we saw a restaurant. Even though it shares a building with Sapphires, the two are separate.   The food is extremely delicious! Fresh tasting-which makes sense when the food is GMO free. Their mole sauce... No words can describe the richness. Try it! Pay no attention to the building next door.  Oh, and the service... May be a little slow at first, however, once you let them know in a way that you've been waiting, they won't be slow the rest of the service. Did I mention the mariachi music?

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A plate of fresh and organic ingredients- made me and my tummy happy.
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Organic chicken and grass fed beef fajitas!! That happened!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious is what that was!

6aYMILsB7lAFmeX6ph2OVw.text: Great food but they charged for a coffee refill. It was just plain old coffee!  We've been there several times because the food is so good. But we think the $2.00 for a coffee refill was ridiculous. We may have to think twice before subjecting ourselves to be nickel and diming of this restaurant We've been to many upscale restaurants in the area and never charged for coffee tea or soft drink refills

JfS7rJVYZRHWRZSwe55pXA.text: We came on recommendation from a friend specifically for the chapulines (crickets). The staff was great and the manager was equally amazing. The food....not my favorite, at all. Now, the drink I ordered (pain killer) was strong but very good! And my husband LOVED the chapulines! Chips and salsa were also very good. I ordered mahi and I can't really describe how gross it was; unseasoned, charred on grill, super fishy smelling and tasting, with a dry mango salsa on a bed of rice. Literally, I took a small bite and it took a lot to not spit it out. I told my waiter my food was awful and got asada tacos instead. The manager came by to ask about the fish and was apologetic. The tacos were ok, much better than the mahi. My husband had a asada torta that was ok. We ordered flan that was thicker than I'm used to but good (manager comp'd my dessert for the mahi mishap). The entrees, I feel, are not worth the price BUT drinks and appetizers are where it's at here. We'll return for the appetizers and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chapulines garlic and lime
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pain Killer

v6tlzmYTj9SG8d1onhoL3g.text: Liked their octopus taco and mahi tacos! Flan was also great. Best one I've had. Sweet and a little heavy but the texture is good.

_WI91jhPsGF09l18Gfx4Gw.text: El Dorado offers the best Taco Tuesday! With amazing service by Grace and $5 1942 shots, not to mention their delicious El Pastor tacos!

pFfVppx-BtCxweAlxybqqg.text: Chef paco was the best! Thank you for the amazing service ! The orange Cream Dessert was TO DIE FOR   the food is THE BEST !!! Coming back again very very soon !

Eu9p1JUBJFVL8RjP0-XK5Q.text: We came here because it was highly recommended by a friend. I'm not usually near the strip during lunch time, but I had just dropped some people off at the airport, so I figured i'd give it a try!  I was happy when they offered us a kids menu and some crayons for my 3 year old son. I wasn't sure if it was going to be that kid friendly, but I felt very welcomed. Like most Mexican restaurants, you get a complimentary basket of chips, but these are house made and baked in sunflower oil, and you can really taste the difference. Plus you get three different salsas to dip them in with different spice levels.  The food came out quickly, was hot, flavorful and filling. What more could you ask for? I know, a Summerlin location!

Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The rice looks like the pyramid on the logo!

ie0OKDwkaGTA9kOu-tZBfg.text: Amazing place. Awesome food. Friendly staff Came to celebrate my brother birthday for lunch and their burritos are to die for. Drinks are even better.

iFKM79tHwTazKx3Kg_mk2w.text: Never going back, the food and service sucks.everything is over priced. $3.50 For chips and $1.50 For a salsa refill.

3LT-rY9Rl3KTqGOu2e-q2Q.text: The service is outstanding. Food delicious. All in a good atmosphere. We came here 3 years ago when we first visited Vegas. Here we are again, will come back again next time too. This time, the Chef even came out to greet us and gave us a complimentary dessert. Highly recommend.

Ssdr9fslYYprxP9Ga56POQ.text: The ambience, service, and menu has made this a culinary delight. I've lived in Las Vegas for 15 years and am so glad we found this little treasure for date night. The ingredients are fresh and just the right amount. The fish tacos are some of the best I've ever had. We are making this a regular go-to when craving delicious Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5gENh5uLCHVT6TcNiEdH0A.text: This was a great find! Conveniently (depending on your perspective) located next to Sapphires gentleman's club, El Dorado Cantina serves very fresh, very tasty Mexican food at a reasonable price point.   The service was friendly, although there was a bit of a mixup regarding who had taken our drink order and the delivery of said beverages.   The chips and salsa were fine, nothing too remarkable, and served with 3 different types of salsa. The hottest sauce had a lot of heat, but not tons of flavor. The others were good, but nothing special.   I ordered the shrimp tacquitos, which were a good portion size, and filled with lots of shrimp. One standout was the guacamole, which was some of the best i have had, and there was lots of it.   My favorite part of the meal was dessert! Thanks to my Yelp check in, we received a free order of churros. They were amazing. They had a banana filling inside and the dipping sauces were the perfect complement.  I would definitely return- and maybe next time I will stop by and visit the ladies next door!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tacquitos

UT1KGs1JmWuoQH2l5Nc7Wg.text: Best Mexican restaurant I have been to in town. Everything our group ordered was fantastic. The avocado, although a bit pricey, was delicious and every bit worth the $16 they charge. Their rice is outrageously good. I could have been served a huge bowl of it and walk out happy. Huge portions so 1 plate may be good for 2. No complaints about the restaurant. Very good food. Will be back.

DcDuFwug8yMcDqtpB2eL4Q.text: Amazing service! Friendly staff, amazing time! The food is authentic. Great food, amazing bartender Ivan! Thanks for a great Las Vegas experience! Would definitely come back!

0Bwn4no_hjTeU4nEZWD0RQ.text: Food was great! Basically anything carne asada was awesome. Our waiters name was Juan and he was very attentive and sweet!! Micheladas

OaPFMPiM9vJSSkT9VL5CHA.text: Had a great meal here!  The two green and red smokey salsas that come with the complimentary chips are amazing!  We had the Street tacos, Carnitas, Carne Asada and El Pastor and all were very flavorful and the cilantro rice, even though looks simple, had a nice seasoned flavor.  Would definitely come back!!!

5VLDnb1cKyHL6TRN_Iv_dQ.text: Yes, it is next to a gentleman's club.  I passed by it twice before I saw it.    The dining experience was great.  We ordered the tableside guacamole.  It did not disappoint.  It was spicy, creamy, and satisfying.  As a table, we shared the fruit cocktail.  It is a large platter with various fruit.  It had the sweetest pineapple I have ever had.  I ordered the vegetable burrito.  It can be altered to be vegan.  In fact, there are several vegetarian or vegan food choices.  The rice was so well flavored.  I liked the beans as well.  Everything tasted fresh.  We also shared the sangria.  It was potent but sweet.  The waitstaff was friendly and very accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit cocktail

LeIZzYTQxYITNCs4J42_Jw.text: This place is decent. Only tried this place once, food was ok, a little awkward that it is next to Sapphire, there were men standing around the door staring at us as we walked inside. The entrance is so small compared to Sapphire's big entrance that you might not see it if you weren't looking closely. The place is pretty huge, but dimly lit, had large booths and tables, good for large parties.   Guacamole is wayyyy overpriced..but that is because they bring out a sexy lady to make the guac at the table. We ordered Imperial Shrimp which was tasty enough, Pozole which was alright, Taquitos which was pretty good, and Chapulines (grasshoppers) which really didn't have any flavors. You can get better foods elsewhere for cheaper.   Maybe a nice place for men to go have some drinks and snacks, would not recommend as a dinner date place.

uq3fJeTAV2YPaouzQnw9_Q.text: This is probably one of the worst Mexican Restaurants I've been too by far. The Pozole had excessive amounts of oregano and the prices of the food did not match the quality. This place has thousands of reviews only because every American that comes and eats here doesn't know what authentic Mexican food tastes like.

0LbOHEK9m-8TmjkjZayuBg.text: The food was so wonderful at dinner last night, we came back for lunch today on our way out of Vegas! We will be back!

dfmlgDPjTZZdUzMGJF-IoA.text: Amazing blended drinks by ivan! Great atmosphere and a nice happy hour selection. Would definitely recommend it for something close to the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour at El Dorado Cantina!!

w3akb6YO2w5I391-37sD-g.text: I love this place, I love their food, especially their chilaquiles. Good service. It is not in an "easy to get to" area, and it is right next to a very busy strip club...but for us, that just adds to the flare and fun of the place. Took my cousins here for late dinner after a concert one night and they loved it too!

RPnzP3uHlaISyRBziWQisA.text: This place was an absolute home run.  Went here with coworkers and we all loved it.  Food was fast and fresh.  5 stars.

E_qe_iZDphWWHxFrdqroxQ.text: This restaurant is one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas! I really appreciate that it's organic. It's open 24 hours and serves breakfast too. The service is all around great. We really loved having Grace serve us.

15y7qgauUEqav5ooqadoWQ.text: If you aren't looking hard enough, you just might miss El Dorado Cantina. It's in the same parking lot as the Sapphire gentleman's club, though not the same entrance. You enter just to the left of the gentleman's club.   Our waiter Chris was very friendly and helpful, he made good recommendations including the jalapeno margarita and brought samples of both the pineapple and the watermelon Agua fresca to help make the decision which to get (both super good by the way).   You could easily come here and just feast on appetizers, they are so good! My friend and I ordered the guacamole which is custom made table side, as well as the Queso fundido, and we should have probably stopped there because that's more than enough food for 2. However, we didn't stop there. We also had an order of the Al Pastor tacos and finished it off with an order of flan (free with your first yelp check in!). We were pleasantly stuffed when we were done, and even had some dip to spare!   Seems like it could be the perfect spot to start a guys night out, or a bachelor party since it IS right next door to a gentleman's club.

1aXvdycOV8WJgcWLJpFplg.text: Yummy food! I loved the octopus and chorizo tacos so juicy lots of flavor! The rice is really good black beans are delicious:) great atmosphere! So convenient that they are open 24 hours! Will be returning!

qIGDCVaJb7EBGUXeuTyLQA.text: First timer and super enjoyed their food.  Had tacos al pastor, the meat is so tender and full flavor. Juan, our server was very attentive and nice. :)   Have the flan and churros!!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos al pastor with cilantro rice and refried black beans

WA-b_-jwKwnqBoSJTpBMDQ.text: I was just there this weekend with my Family and the food is amazing delicious  Everything that we ordered was cooked perfectly  Pozole, Cedar Chipotle Salmon, Cochinita Pibil & Siegel plate The deserts are very yummy flan & Fried ice cream The service is excellent, Hugo our waiter was very polite and friendly making menu recommendations. I will come for sure next time I'm in town.

QJBZbreid4L3inZh6pOIyQ.text: Umm... I swear I'm not ubering to a strip club. I'm only ubering to the Non-GMO & Organic Mexican restaurant inside it...  Everything at El Dorado was delicious and definitely order the $14 guacamole.  Maybe that sounds crazy and yes you can make it at home, but it's a live demonstration of fresh guac to your table.   Best. guac. I've. ever. had.  I also had a shrimp bowl, which was healthy and flavorful. I had a bite of the carne asada burrito and didn't skimp out on the meat (use their habanero sauce, burns so good).  Free custardy flan with a check-in. Open 24 hours.

kyeaFCwZ62i8ZNAiiIRsMQ.text: Always the best food. Enrique was our waiter. Very polite and funny. It's nice to see a person, like Enrique, who really enjoys their job. Thank you Enrique.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their new dessert. The presentation and taste is amazing. Delicious! No other restaurant can top El Dorado Cantina. The best!

Vo0TvaiYJli0UvC_e7KPXw.text: What a little gem in vegas!  Located right next to sapphire gentleman's club, this Mexican cantina prides itself on gluten free, organic, and gmo free protein.  I personally loved the cheese empanada and their cabeza Tacos.  The best thing about this place is that it caters to the gringo taste along with the real traditional cuisine that you won't typically see in a restaurant.  Go check it out!

T5jhLELxJKUP0FCUiRvbjw.text: $15 for a burrito? Lol. I'm sorry what part of Mexico are you from? Yes the food is pretty good but please no burrito is worth that bye. Back to Mexico I go where the food is better and they ain't False inflating street food

FssKQJ8wvB4OGKnwGX97ug.text: Mexican food?? VEGAN Mexican food?! YASSSS PLEASE! The herbivore and the carnivore come together here! This place kept popping up on my Instagram and I think I yelped Vegan Mexican food and it came up. I looked the menu and was instantly intrigued! They have quite a few options they are able to make vegan, and gluten free dishes as well if that's an issue for you as well! Mexican food veganized is one of my favorites these days!  The restaurant is nice inside, very spacious and has those round booths so you can just cupcake in there or whatever  They automatically start you off with chips and and a salsa trio too. I love me some authentic salsa. The mild was actually my favorite as far as taste goes but I wish it had been the spicy one! The spiciest one was just like FIRE. Not really too much flavor in it, just HOT. I ended up ordering the Veggie Bowl with brown rice and black beans. Unfortunately the cilantro rice isn't vegan otherwise I would have been all over that!  They use the freshest ingredients, NON GMO products thank you very much! My bowl with FILLED with veggies and I'm eating the leftovers right MEOW!  I love restaurants that have really opened up to being able to cater to all types of different diets! I also love that all the vegan dishes were fresh veggies and didn't include meat substitutes. NOM NOM NOM! If you're feeling some Mexican food, definitely go try out this spot! This is right next to Sapphires so go eat and then get your stripper fix! They have female AND male strippers for you to drool over!  HAHAHA.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Bowl!
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and salsa trio. Veggie bowl (V). Enchiladas.

Q73naci8Vbou2YjnUpX1ag.text: Food was organic and delicious. The pineapple juice was delicious also. If you like watermelon then you will also like the watermelon juice. It tastes just like watermelon. Our waiter was absolutely fantastic. He had great recommendations. The portions were big enough to share. Went during early evening so we missed the late night crowd. Geo will take you on a real tour. This restaurant is located directly in the lot of Sapphire strip club.  The buildings are connected.

QgTnxCDxjld3D2XzPz8ltQ.text: I absolutely love this place! I had a veggie fajita platter and it was remarkable! Love the bartender Ivan and Teauge!   Upscale Mexican delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

57z012Ebl5EAVJTX4F5XEw.text: First time here, but won't be our last. The location is a little strange like most people have reviewed, it is in the same building as a Gentlemans club but has a separate entrance. Enrique was our server and took great care of us. Very attentive and explained items on the menu, we weren't sure about.  I love that they have so many gluten-free options!  We had the carne  Asada  and al pastor street tacos. Very good and full of flavor.

Gi9mHTe9lpfDjC47bNVtmQ.text: Place looks nice and great ambience, but all the rest wasn't good. Rude service, rice is flavorless, just a plain white rice with no flavor and some cilantro leaves in it. Chicken fajita was only ok. We got charged $2 extra for cilantro dressing that was ok and the waitress didn't even said that in advance. Not worth it. Disappointed.

vimVaImHaOscRN-QAA1nUw.text: came for happy hour, seated ourselves at the bar. We got there at 5:30 on a Friday night & it wasn't busy yet, music wasn't too loud/people that were there weren't being obnoxious so the atmosphere of the place was really nice. Aesthetically the place reminds me of "old Vegas"  The walls are a deep red rose material, dim lighting. Modern light fixtures & huge, rustic looking mirrors on the walls.  Our bartender, Ben, told us he was new but he did a great job. He had a good balance of checking on us/leaving us alone. Our drinks didn't go empty & our food was served fast.   We ordered everything off the happy hour menu which is everyday 2-6pm at the bar. I had a margarita ($7) My husband got the shot of patron & a 16oz modelo draft ($10)   For food we had the cheese quesadilla($7), chicken empanadas($7) & carne asada street tacos ($3.50 ea)  Everything tasted excellent!

o5_F_qkPrpE6sbIIAb2XvA.text: Stella gave us great service! The food was good as always. Steak is very good and my favorite is the cilantro rice. My go to for mexican food. Locals get discount so mention that!

nUqhJ3OuuKXyezIl_rRMiw.text: I love this place! Local Mondays are awesome.   I took my parents here for the first time and it blew them away. It is on the more expensive side but hey, you cant cheap out on quality.  Some of my favorite dishes here,  Queso fundido (awesome) Chips n salsa (yum) Chicken enchiladas  Steak fajitas  Strawberries con crema

Iu4uph-BA2u92WqHYAdOzw.text: I came in today to celebrate my friends 21st bday. We had such a great time. Our server Danielle was amazing. She offered us a giant pineapple margarita which was super tasty and fun. She also recommended some delicious dishes. I can't wait to be back!

l16pV_Dn53xUod2CVROdwQ.text: Leaving Vegas but decided to stop and have lunch. Eat like a king and was served like a king.  This was a great taste of so homemade Mexican food. In the middle of over rated food and restaurants in Vegas, but this place holds its own for sure. A must try next time your on son city.

UPIi8Bs2qVJTObtBNKML9A.text: Our Hostess was so understanding as we seemed like Goldilocks trying to find where we wanted to sit. We all laughed our way to the third choice we made.  :0) Juan was the best server ever! He was very friendly, attentive and answered all our questions with a smile.  My roasted vegetable tacos were wonderful and the black beans with rice,such a great finish to the combo plate.  My guy asked Juan to recommend 'something with eggs' ..he did and it was a delicious looking plate of steak strips and eggs (not sure the menu name).  I think my guy liked it because his plate was totally cleaned. We are happy to find El Dorado and their healthy ..organic..non-GMO chef prepared delicious foods .

3gODnJoSz9Ep_17hjnxnuQ.text: Off the strip, the food was very good and the service was excellent. I've been twice and I'd say it's some of the best Mexican food I've had in Vegas or Southern California. The staff is extremely professional and super nice. Worth going if you're in the area.

wvxnTWGElHDd1Hs2W2XmYg.text: To be honest... hands DOWNNNN some of my favorite food on the west coast! I'm here wayyyy too often. This place, is just so happy. Great service, great drinks, Delicious damn food!!! &&& after your done eating, you could maybe see a little booty Twerk next door  looooves it

lMrCXQF9mDNa6gaGW08gyQ.text: Good food. Great time. Table side guacamole is great. Tried the taco sampler very good. And mojito was good.

tJ9h_QqFJgBn2U3BVuqYQQ.text: We had a great time at El Dorada. The service was excellent and the food was very tasteful. Right after setting, the waiter brought nachos and salsa. They even had the Don Julio 1942 tequila for 6 bucks. We had enchiladas, quesadila, sandwich with pulled pork. All very tasteful and at a great price too. Would come again.

tdWtBX7jqeUP1Vj3u9TFQA.text: Flan! Flan! Flan! Flan!  Also the burritos are incredible. Very clean, sleek restaurant. The best burritos in Vegas and it's open 24/7!

jVoO1WUBHDk-vRf82bxqFw.text: Excelente service and amazing food, Emily our waitress was very nice and helpful, service and staff were incredible nice and friendly..

BmH5sL7m-Ggi48YxsRhuNw.text: My boyfriend and I are visiting Vegas this weekend. We had a reservation which we were a little late too but we called and still got seated as soon as we got there. The service was great! Would recommend the pineapple margarita for sure! The steak fajitas was AMAZING. If you are eating here you have to try it. Only downside to our visit was that we didn't have room for dessert lol but our server was great at recommending desserts.

Bo3BQ859n3aZiqNtnIKf2A.text: Favorite place in all of Vegas! Jess is a great server, all smiles and very attentive. Best Mexican food I've ever had, hands down! When we're in town, we always come several times.  Gluten free friendly.

xQRD_e7UtFPC2_Llw2f_Zg.text: Really great food. Healthy choices. Great staff Osteen, thank you!  Off the Strip. We're native Los Angeles, so we know good Mexican food. No, you don't have to go into the strip club. Anyone familiar with Vegas knows that the greatest food is found next to strip clubs. Seriously?  Best Mexican/South American food in Vegas.

D4mkPUaEMGtpIF0kjCDcTw.text: This restaurant is great!  (Don't be deterred by it being next to a gentleman's club they are soon to open a second location in Tivoli Village). Service couldn't be beat....Emily was our server and was very attentive even with it being a busy lunchtime.  We ordered Albondigas soup and split a pulled chicken burrito and of course had a house margarita.  Soup was extremely hot but once cooled down was very good.  The burrito is a quite generous portion and was excellent, their rice is buttery cilantro and again a very generous portion.  When they ask if you want black beans or refried and it comes with guacamole, they are inside the burrito which makes it a wonderful combination of flavor.  Came home with half of the burrito to enjoy later.

BIvAMTb_gz9Ksaj4lvlDcg.text: Ok, get past the fact that the restaurant shares the building with a strip club.  Once you walk in, you'd never know!   The food is excellent, as is the service.  We had Vladimir as our waiter, and he was very attentive, as well as interesting and engaging to talk to.  My husband and I both had chicken enchiladas, and my son had empanadas and a carne asada burrito, which was served chimichanga style (fried).  It was so big, he took half home!  Best Mexican food I've had in a long time!!

pFi9rGAESV3lRfmbjnQnog.text: My go to joint for a sit-down mexican restaurant. I know the food is always on point here. Today I tried the "Cochinita Pibil" yes from "Once Upon a Time in Mexico." Maaaaaan... I should've tried this dish a long time a go. Ericka was super attentive and a joy to have serve us.

AuPk6FtWI6_wU1SZNd0_GA.text: OMG, a must stop whenever we are in Vegas. There is nothing on the menu we have tried and did not like. Serving sizes are very large and helps with the sticker shock of prices in the menu; totally worth it. All the staff have always been friendly. You cannot go wrong with a visit here.

g4fU5N3KUbFN4o8zMcjduA.text: Our waiter (white guy, sorry forgot your name while drunk!) was SUPER friendly and attentive. Gave us check in for a free dessert for a flan, which was super bomb.  Hard to find entry next to strip club, but we walked from Circus Circus and we're sat immediately on a Friday night. Boyfriend and I split a veggie burrito which was very filling combined with free table chips and three kinds of salsa. Would return! Three stars because parking lot was filled with taxis and strip club people were very rude at entry

62Kt4yKDnlc4QQXxrYZi9g.text: If you are looking for authentic mexican food using organic ingredients then you have found the holy grail.   The food at this place rocks.     We were quickly greeted at our table with chips and 3 different salsas.   Beware, the habanero is hot.  Watch out before digging in.  We started with the guacamole, made at the table.  Delicioso.  Next onto the shrimp cocktail.   Prepared perfectly, and dont think twice about taking a chip and getting the pico from the glass.   You will thank me later.  Fresh and tasty.  You can really taste the differnce organic tomatoes make in all of their dishes.  Next up....taquitos unlke any we ever had.  Usually these are a hot mess at the crappy mexican joints, but not here.   The chicken was perfect with a smokey taste.  Yummy!  Finally, you can't and shouldn't walk out of this place without trying the flan.  Unbelievable!  Chef Paoo stopped by the table to ask about our meal.  Nice touch.  You can really tell from talking with Paco, he cares about th quality of th food.    Dont let the locations fool you.   Sure, its next to a strip club, but we felt safe the entire time.  This place is awesome and worth th effort to find.  ps....open 24 hours for those late night munchies!

Zs90v0uwxvEA16dbBssuhw.text: I saw the billboard for this restaurant on the way to the hotel my family and I were staying at.  What caught my eye was " Organic and GMO free food. We came in that evening. We ordered the table side guacamole, made by the manager, it was delicious! Fresh and perfect to our liking. For our meals we ordered the carnitas platter, beef sopas, chicken enchiladas, and veggie tacos. The carnitas platter is huge, enough for two or three people and so moist and delicious! Everything was out of this world!!! Hands down the best Mexican food I've had anywhere!!! The rice, by the way, is heaven !!!! The owner came out and said hi and gave us flan !!! The flan was perfection on a plate and in my mouth!! Here's my final say on this wonderful place- WOW, WOW, WOW!!! I love it here and consider this one of my favorite restaurants on the planet!

W84Gsexycc-wHbkhQ3HxUA.text: What a wonderful dinner  we had here!  Enrique was our server. He was full of good information about the type of dishes and where each dish was from!  The food and the service was wonderful.  We had the pleasure of meeting the chef and finding out about the delicious flan that was from his family recipe!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BHwQo41J3bNWC97y2Ir4mw.text: Went to LV to meet up with my friends who I hadn't seen in a long time. We had dinner here...the service and the food were really good. My only complaint is that they share a parking lot with a very busy strip club. Parking was confusing b/c some of the lot is reserved for buses & taxis....also there isn't a sign anywhere so u can spot the restaurant as u are approaching....even with a arrived notification from the GPS I was confused because all I could see was a huge strip club. The restaurant which is small is located right next to it & not visible from the road, at least not at night..

HqvY9C7wwBQPHQ1GTCYtqw.text: Reid gave us excellent recommendation of the chipotle chicken and mole sampler. Both were excellent choices. The chipotle chicken was like creamy chicken fajitas, so tasty. The three moles that came on the sampler were out of this world. Would highly recommend both dishes. Also tried a blackberry margherita on his recommendation as well. Another excellent choice. Not too sweet. Nice complement to the tequila and lime.

38G38hO7tnKDNmcj6uZV9g.text: We were lucky enough to come during happy hour, and a version of their great margaritas were $7 apiece, and their Street Tacos were $3.50 apiece.  The table side guacamole is very good albeit $16 being a healthy price.  The chef came and checked on us during our stay and wanted to make sure that we were happy!  Don't miss El Dorado while in Las Vegas.

ItGT0L-DFhzRe3fW0Rx03g.text: Great food (especially the guacamole and the Specialty bowl), Great service! (thank you Neal). the location is a bit off but its definitely worth it!

ZqxXEL43QpkVx77D5Oj4Jw.text: I came here for a quick dinner before a show. Service was good. I had their street tacos. I only ate 2 and gave one to my friend. She had empanada and they were really small. The free flan was delicious. However, this place is not good enough to come all the way from your hotel to try it.

Pcf0spwyndAYd8vJHiTUVg.text: I do love this place not only is the food to die for the service I got from Enrique and the Chef Paco were amazingly great and wonderful experience!!!!

Dd-K3Uenn_-YYCGGCJjvxA.text: By far the best Mexican food I have had since leaving San Diego. Service is amazing.

-C_VRGqJ1EYa-_RWYFOW7w.text: I had the mole enchiladas which have a traditional non-sweetened slightly bitter taste. The tacos al pastor my husband got were ok. Meat was slightly old and overcooked. We came at an off time during lunch. The rice and free flan from Yelp were good though!  Not sure that I'd pay $40+ for Mexican food.

PE6zVxMYdqpCcdWmU27zAQ.text: I ate here a few weeks ago when I was in Vegas for lunch. It came highly recommended by quite a few people. It was so good I came back the next day with some friends. Almost all ingredients they use are organic. You can taste the quality of the food and don't feel bad after you eat here. I had the fajitas half steak half chicken. I also tried the enchiladas. Everything was very good. The chips and salsa made in house are also great. One of the best things was the flan. Probably the best I've ever had. The head chef / owner brought it out to us, explaining that he still uses his grandmas recipe. I thought that was a nice touch. He is a great guy and seems to work very hard and care about the quality of his food. Service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half chicken half steak fajitas

7ztU4CuREA1rATIHekFIeg.text: Great food, friendly waitress, and not too crowded at lunch time. Our waitress, Ericka, was fantastic as well.

sjCReaCyT1qtzlXStFGLQA.text: Really good and authentic non-GMO/ORGANIC Mexican food. Our server, Danny, was great - he was attentive and walked us thru the various options. The drinks were good as well.

zHZ2wniFK_yWilYIBlIaZA.text: I Absolutely love that this place is NON-GMO! One of the very few places in town. The location is kinda sketchy since it is sharing the building with a "gentlemen's club" but don't be fooled, you're at the right place.  I do want to say that the prices are a little bit on the pricey side, but it can be expected because they use NON-GMO ingredients.  Overall the food is good, but the service is awful. The waitresses have their boobs hanging out of their shirts in these tiny little spaghetti straps as if we were dining at Hooter's or something. Yeah, it is located next to a gentlemen's club, but that shouldn't mean it has to be associated with it (I understand that it may be a uniform, but you might want to reconsider bringing your kids with you). The few times we have been there the waitresses hardly come to check on you or even seem like they want to be there, but who knows maybe they were just having a bad day.  Chef Paco is great, my family and I met him at the March Against Monsanto this past year and you can tell that he is dedicated to the restaurant and providing the best ingredients.

fPLWjwj4Kg-kFq6hSD95Dg.text: Great place with a wonderful staff.  The food is absolutely amazing and the chef Paco is very attentive and friendly.  The table side guacamole is a must have and Pacos mole has the most amazing pork that just melts in your mouth.  Everything has a bit of a kick to it so be warned if spicy things put you off.

sVNW9SVt5fx71g_rKYNLsQ.text: The food is good. Service is amazing! The flan was delicious and I loved the mahi taco

JTsSJDujDlvGS9h4n7HUXA.text: I am a local of Vegas and el dorado is a weekly visit for me. I absolutely love it! It's open 24 hours a day, all organic, and there staff is awesome! Kai has helped me many times and always gives me perfect service! Anyone wanting amazing Mexican food should eat here. I love the Mexican corn and the fajitas. Enjoy!

phugTFxYOyR1VVrV10-72Q.text: My favorite Mexican place. 25% off on Mondays for locals. I go at least once a week. Keep up the good work !

50frSellSU3GXXuVl3k14A.text: Where do I even start! Well first off this don't let this place put you off by being right next to a strip club. They have their seperate entrance and it's no problem to bring your kids. The first time we visited I had the tropical salad. By salad standards it was so delicious. This second time dining here just surpassed all my expectations. It was National Taco Day on taco Tuesday so they had a promotion on their signature tacos for ONLY  $1!!!! I actually found this posted on Facebook. You really can't go wrong with dollar tacos anywhere, especially when El Dorado is promoting it. They had so much to choose from. However the promotion only allowed 5 tacos max per person so I had to choose wisely.  SIGNATURE TACO CHOICES:  - Queso Mexicano - Short rib - Salmon - Lengua - Cactus - Cabeza - Chili Verde Pork w/ chicharron FAVE - Octopus & Chorizo - Langostino  My husband and I choose differently so I got to taste them all and they were all absolutely scrumptious. Cooked and made to perfection. When we got them the manager (I want to say) presented them all to us. Which is something that I appreciate.  For dessert we ordered fried ice cream and flan. The chef, Chef Paco came out and presented the dessert and personally gave us his card. He was such a nice guy. He even gave our boys churros filled with dulce de le he. Free of charge. Lets talk about the desserts. Fried ice cream... it's fried! duh! of course it was delicious. The boys churros! Their lucky it was for them. 2 seconds it woulda been gone had I had my way. And the flan... TIP: check in with yelp and get a FREE FLAN!!!!  Don't miss out on this incredible offer. Incredible because their flan IS THE BEST I have EVER HAD!!! I'd come back just for the flan. No joke!  What I forgot to mention in the beginning was that we ordered margaritas on the rocks because it was the only happy hour drink they were offering away from the bar. I hate to say this because I love this place but the drinks were really disappointing. To me it was more of a limemade with a hint of Tequila. Hopefully in the future they can get the Tequila and mix ratio right.  Our waters were always filled and our waitress Ericka was so sweet and always made sure we were ok. Service like this, sadly isn't everywhere I dine at, so I really appreciate and praise when a business shows that they really care for their customers.  You can count on our family and friends on coming back for more of the phenomenal, organic goodness this restaurant has to offer. Thanks again to the staff at El Dorado Cantina for taking care of us.

rc7-b3epLLUe80E3VpC8Fg.text: This place is amazing! There are not many organic Mexican restaurants in San Francisco and I definitely didn't expect to find such a gem in Sin City! The food is great! Margaritas are huge! The flan is fantastic! And shrimp tacos and mahi mahi tacos are to die for!!!  Highly recommended! If you like quality Mexican food and want to stay away from cancerous GMO's, pesticides, herbicides, hormones and antibiotics this is the place to go! :)

j6jbip8yAol2fc1k8L8B5w.text: The hostess was wonderful and had a great personality, very welcoming. Our server, Grace was awesome as well, very attentive. The food and drinks were fantastic as always! Best Mexican food in Vegas! Locals 25% off on Mondays!

p8ffH4m9TUo_H3W9TzeVVA.text: What an absolutely delight it was to dine at this restaurant!   This restaurant serves what is truly authentic Mexican food. Beyond that, they serve local, organic, free-range and hormone-free ingredients. WOW!   The sangria was absolutely unbelievable, refreshing, tasty and amazing. The carne asada tacos were juicy, flavor-rich and authentic. The chips came with three different sauces, each delicious and unique.   The flan (for dessert) was hands-down the best flan I have EVER had! And I have had some darn good ones, believe me.   To top it off, the executive chef (Paco) came to our table to talk to us and spent several minutes engaging us. We were truly gratified and wowed. He shared with us stories, including how the recipe for the flan belongs to his grandmother. He gave us his card, which contains his personal contact info. WHO DOES THAT?!   We are happy to recommend this restaurant to all of our friends and everyone else, and we can't wait to return and dine!

WSx7dqEakh0eTfoGgsTGqQ.text: Do NOT let the entrance scare you off! (It shares a building with a gentleman's club) Amazing Guacamole fresh made at your table, and don't be afraid to try the fried Grasshoppers they are incredible. Our server Chris was amazing and Chef Paco did an incredible job. I would come back here again in a heartbeat!

PSMM3EJ20msO_BKedxAGDg.text: Best Mexican food on the planet. Holy crap.  You may want to make a reservation. This restaurant is boomin! My fiance and I were lucky enough to get the last walk in seat they had.   They offer free flan with your yelp check in, so you should go for that reason alone. The flan, along with many other menu items, is gluten free.   The street tacos are the most reasonably priced entree on the menu and they are DELICIOUS. They come 3 to a platter and you can totally mix taco types, too.   Friendly server. AMAZING food. Strip club next door. Free flan. What more could you want?! GO!

Uk3hapJbpG2JyF6oJ5SQ3A.text: What a great experience for lunch, the food was great as was the service!  I got the combo fajitas which was easily enough food for two, my wife got three Tacos.   The food was served promptly, we also got a free flan for checking in on Yelp plus 20% off for a military discount on our bill.  I'd highly recommend stopping in here for great (non GMO) food, at a very reasonable price!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp, Steak &amp; chicken combo  fajitas

fj0S-Nk-GaYIznrXvufQqQ.text: El Dorado Cantina is one of Vegas' Most popular Mexican restaurants.  Although they can not guarantee it, they strive to provide the most Gluten Free vegetables, Organic and yard feed Chicken and Beef.  Their banquet room is great for dates special occasions such as birthday parties, wedding receptions, etc. A plus is, the provide catering.  Their  menu has a wide variety of food which ranges from seafood to poultry, beef, veggies.  My flavor, Chicken Taquitos - Gluten Free, made with Mary's Free Range organic pulled chicken, topped with organic romaine lettuce, salsa cascabel, pico de gallo, organic sour cream & queso fresco.   The cost is reasonable 10.50.. fits my pocket book just right.  What caught my eye was the fact that they carry over 100 types of Tequilas and a larger variety of wine, beer and spirits.

6tgI5ndFkcnxIyHkuL5FjQ.text: Everyone has been talking about this place and I have been meaning to stop in. The entrance is literally next to the Sapphire's doors. I was pleasantly surprise with the decor with the rich reds and dark woods, trendy and chic. You get the typical chips and house salsas which were three and all very good. We ordered Guacamole, prepared table side this was good, Chiliquilles with Carne Asada which was delicious the green sauce was perfect, Chile Relleno, fried just right that the batter soaked up all the red sauce and cheese was melted, Chicken Enchilada, the taste and seasoning was good it was just dry, lastly the Flan, so rich and creamy I had to box what little piece was left.  I informed the wait staff about the dry Enchilladas and Chef Paco came to serve our dessert, apologized for the mishap with the new cook that forgot to add sauce inside and offered to make us a new one to take home. we declined and told him next time we will take the offer. He gave me his business card and coupons for our return. That was a pleasant surprise and it really shows that as a Chef and owner that he cares about the service and quality.   I definetely recommend this place for the great food and exceptional service.

They could slap you on the way in and way out but if that deal is on the table you take it. The food portions are massive but average in taste. On food alone I'd give it a 3.5. The service is attentive so that's a 5 but considering you get $6 42 shots the entire place is a 5. Can't speak for any other day but Tuesday gets a 5.

KuJbWk2HENgDCnIj_4FhWw.text: This place is definitely a diamond in the rough. Located a couple miles off the epicenter of the Las Vegas strip, this Mexican restaurant is easy to miss as it's located in a seedy little parking lot literally right next to a strip club/"gentleman's club."  I came to eat here before heading back to California and I had my two, little dogs with me. I was waking up to the restaurant and was going to tie them to a tree outside while I had lunch but the manager Doris Siemen saw us coming and opened the door for us and allowed us to bring our two dogs inside and immediately offered a water bowl to them. Extra bonus points for that.   The ambiance is really nice. Dim lighting with almost a vampire-ish black and red themed interior. Full bar with TVs around so good for watching games.  You get chips and salsa right off the bat. Yum and always a plus. I ordered a mango margarita to start: it could have been better, it was a little too syrupy with too much ice. Then we ordered the table guacamole and they make it fresh in front of you and you can tailor it how you like. That was awesome. For my entree I got the chicken enchilada plate. It was DELICIOUS. The pulled chicken was so flavorful and tender and it comes with a side of cilantro rice and beans but I'm not a fan of beans so I always sub for a side salad. I left this place stuffed and satisfied and recommend this place if you want quality Mexican food and don't want to deal with the hassle of finding parking and walking a lot!

srhRF16z6oZQFNPcD9vx9A.text: This is a gluten free review.  Gluten free menu: No, but GF items clearly marked.  What I ordered: Tableside guacamole, chicken taquitos appetizer, and chipotle chicken with rice and beans.   Gluten free options: 5/5 El Dorado Cantina has one of the most extensive gluten free menus that I have ever seen. Practically 80% of the menu is gluten free and all items are marked using a legend system. If you see the little wheat symbol, then the item is gluten free. Simple yet effective.  Food: 5/5 Food is always delivered hot, flavors are out of this world, and portion sizes are not small, so definitely come hungry. The tableside guacamole is a must-order. Chicken taquitos were large and juicy. They drizzle a cilantro avocado sauce on top with a little sour cream...ohh myyy. I usually order the chipotle chicken entree because I always remember how good it is. Thinly fileted grilled chicken with peppers and onions in a creamy chipotle sauce.   Service: 5/5 Tonight our server was Danny, who Has served my table in the past. He's attentive, shows up right on time, and makes sure you have everything you need. Food is typically delivered pretty quickly. It's amazing how fresh the food is, even though the wait isn't very long.  Location: 3/5 Not really a "family" friendly location, as it is literally in the same building as a very large strip club. But don't worry, there is a separate entrance to the restaurant. However, parking is ample and the restaurant is not hard to find. Just look for the glowing neon blue lights of Sapphire.  Ambiance: 4/5 The booths are very comfortable, as well as the high tables with barstools. Comfortable environment.  Overall score: 5/5

xh0cKWK786wG3j_YpTvIuQ.text: The location did not deter us from trying this place.  Came here mid-week at around 7 for dinner.  I must admit I thought that based on the cars in the parking lot the place would be packed but, nope, one other table and someone sitting at the bar.  Who knew Strip clubs are so packed on a Tuesday night.    I had the sangria and the steak fajitas.  The best part of the meal is the rice that has been mentioned in other reviews.  It's not that my meal was bad but it wasn't mind blowing, which I expected based on the 1200 plus reviews.  Also, a turn off for me is being charged for chips after your first complimentary bowl.  Their price point is high for what you are getting so free chips should not be a problem.  Also not a fan of how they present the receipt.  The tortillas showed up as a an additional charge even though they appear to come with the meal.  The mango in the mango margarita also showed up as an additional charge as did the the wet burrito.  That's the only charge that makes sense to me because that is an order modification.  Maybe this is just the way their computer system works but they should fix it so it doesn't look like you're paying extra for everything.  That was a turn off to me.  I do love how this place is decorated, and when we finished with our meal the waiter advised that if we checked in on Yelp we would get complimentary flan.

-ruiXIBzGl9PD2taIgXRJQ.text: Still amazing as always with a great atmosphere and wonderful staff! The food is delicious and the portion sizes are perfect! Thank you for always being so accommodating and just on point when it comes to myself and my guests
