Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These salsas were pretty bomb ! Complimentary
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bohemia &amp; classic margarita tajin rim

s1RzYIy0TYj02OOAby86cQ.text: This place was such a treat and exactly what my friend and I were looking for after a long day on the strip! My friend and I were craving Mexican food and it was clear on Yelp that this was the place to go! We had an amazing experience.   The food was fantastic. The drinks were great. But I think stood out to us most was the customer service / hospitality of the staff. Everyone was so welcoming and made the overall experience extra special. Taylor was an outstanding bartender that made great recommendations and made everyone feel well taken care of! I was impressed he even made our guacamole from scratch! It's impressive at the bar watching the staff handle so much with ease.   I def recommend this restaurant.   On a separate note, don't be too confused when you get to this location and see it's next to a gentleman's club. My friend and I were surprised, along with other strangers outside of the door lol. But seriously, don't let the location keep you from going in. I saw some people almost back out which would of been a shame! It's separated from the other establishment would be a shame for you to miss out on an amazing experience from ambience, food and company! :)  So yes - get yourself in here and enjoy!

0y7TjERQrbmyLK6QAVgjQw.text: It's been too long since my last visit! Doris, the amazing GM is still here. So good to see.   The menu has updated with three new tacos, the Filet Mignon, duck and lobster tacos. They have also added a 10 ounce filet to the Signature Dishes.   I'm craving the house salad. It has this eye opening Ranch Dressing. So cool, fresh with a big garlic mouth to finish. I added to it with a wild caught salmon.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So basic but so good...

gvMPEfDUYEHtoJHhCSO_pw.text: I got the mole enchalada and upgraded to flank steak which was the right choice (I personally can't stand chicken....ewww, ate too much growing up or something) and this is the best! I love mole, don't always love meat in general but the flank steak was cooked perfectly and compliments the rest of the flavors and textures to create an incredible dish tonight... yummmmm!!!!!  As sides it came with rice and beans, for which I opted for black. Only had the1/2 my enchalada and will look forward to eating this for a couple days lol. Portions were good because even my husband slowed down on his towards the end of his carne asada wet burrito with the same sides. He'd give his a 4.5/5 but I'm 5/5 on mine. So delicious! It's also after 1am so to find such quality food at any time of day/night is such a gem :)   They also treated us to the flan dessert which was a total surprise and my husband dropped the spoon and kind of drooped down from the deliciousness which was very amusing so I'm psyched to try it haha but it looks delicious and I'm going to get to it. Overall everyone here was pleasant, our server was Stella and we'll be back when we're back in the Vegas area in the future and recommend it!   Tip: its separate from the strip club called Sapphire or Sapphire's (?) but only by a very sturdy/luckily sound-proof wall because we thought we were lost when we arrived in the parking lot and saw the "gentleman's club" sign and crowd haha. They're door is close to the entrance to that, just to the left. Whether you're in to that crowd or not I suggest you give this restaurant a try and know you're actually in the correct place when you follow GPS directions haha. Surprisingly the crowd in here was quiet and.... Not hyped up like the crowd next door which helped this pleasant, friendly atmosphere separate from next door haha (not that I'm against it for that but just to share in case people have doubts about coming).

mOV8waEcIi8cQ956tp_wMA.text: Needed to have some Mexican food and it was found!  No mind that there is a Gentleman's club right next door.  I was enjoying my dishes.  It was delicious and a nice big serving.  Next time I would split it with someone.  The pork was delicious and soft and it went all so well with the garlic fried rice.  Quite the find and made with organic ingredients.  Most of all...the leche flan was the best ever....had me thinking of my Filipino aunties' flans of the past growing up.  Soooooo good.  The service was great..had Shawn helping us through the menu and he guided us well.  Would I come back?  Yup yup yup...every time.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan....must have
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious....pork dish

rrvdxRm9PwUpuvJAApMahw.text: Stopped in for a late dinner (midnight) and saw this place had a good rating. We were a little skeptical because they shared a building with a strip club, but we were went ahead and tried it anyways. Besides, one of the best restaurants we've been to in Vegas used to be in a very sketchy neighborhood.  We're definitely glad we came in. Service was friendly and the food was really good! I ordered the Carne Asada Burrito enchilada style (they call it wet here) and it was served with Cilantro Lime Rice. I really liked the rice. The burrito was good, I just wished it had more sauce though. My wife ordered the Mole Enchiladas with steak instead of chicken and she absolutely loved it. For dessert we got the Flan and it really hit the spot. So delicious! We will definitely come back here again when we want Mexican food and we're in Vegas.

Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Burrito enchilada style, served with Cilantro Lime Rice.

XeuFH4smKP-H_Q208Po4nw.text: After finding out that "Bandito's Latin Kitchen" had closed, I was in the mood for some Mexican food. We looked at some options and "El Dorado Cantina" popped in our search.      The Place: The restaurant is off the strip, next to a Gentleman's Club. The outside of the place make you think it is not going to be that pretty, but you will be surprised how cute it is inside! Red decorated walls, dark furniture, and lamps hanged from the roof.  They have counter high tables and seats, booths, and bar seating. We were a party of 3 and sat in a roomy booth.   The Food: The restaurant is open 24 hours and they feature Mexican food and tapas; they have breakfast available too! I was happy to see "empanadas" in the menu. We ordered tableside guacamole and some beef empanadas as an appetizer. We also got some drinks: I had the "Amazon" margarita with pomegranate juice and sugar rim. Later, I had a "Las Sirenas" cocktail and I thought it was better.   For main courses, we had tacos al pastor, Cochinita Chile Relleno, and chicken enchiladas. I liked the tacos; they were flavorful! I loved their rice; they serve white instead of yellow rice.  For dessert, we had churros and fried ice cream! Yummy!   The Service:  The service was great! Jessica took good care of us during dinner time. I could notice they were a little understaff: as more people came in, the tableside guacamole and desserts took longer.   Overall, a nice place for dinner at reasonable prices. Yes, I would come back.

5dyjB3BLnhBTnD0WSO9HZg.text: Went for the Pina Colada, stayed for the shrimp enchiladas. My husband and I were in the mood for Mexican food and decided to visit El Dorado because of its rave reviews.   We were seated immediately on a Saturday night, without reservations. I ordered the shrimp enchiladas with green sauce. It came with cilantro, white rice, and black beans. The first round of chips and salsa were also complimentary. My husband ordered the carne asada burrito, which was super filling. Everything tasted delicious and was reasonably priced. Our total came up to about $35 with tax and tip.   The restaurant shares its parking lot with a strip club, so depending on which night you go, parking may be a bit of a hassle.

xtdLk7BaCFguxHzvMrJuxQ.text: We ordered flan and veggie burrito, the burrito was bland and flan was average according to me. Ambience was good.  The server Camille was good. They give free dessert for a 5 start yelp rating, I guess that's why the good rating I suppose.

5A-9jFN0yN5Uif9CEDE1xA.text: Wow wow wow seriously 5 stars for this place. By far the best Mexican food in Vegas. To be honest probably the best Mexican I ever had.   First off don't judge a book by it's cover. Yes it's next to a strip club and off the Vegas strip but I promise you this is so worth the trip here.   Jess our server was amazingggg!!! She is such a sweetheart and was so pleasant to deal with. She offered us some great recommendations and when we had one minor issue she was quick to correct it.    Now to the food...Corn get the corn and get it on the cob gawd damn it was seasoned and tasted amazingggg!!  The chips and salsa were good and complimentary. I ordered the chicken fajitas, my Husband ordered the steak and shrimp. They were both seriously out of this world delicious. So flavorful and juicy. Not dry at all and the best part is that the veggies were cooked to perfection they were not too hard and were actually sauteed nicely.  I highly recommend this place. Service on point, food on point and this is my go to spot when staying in Vegas.

5VcIY2scxo0BqSngK_YEHA.text: Alright ya'll listen closely when you first pull into the parking lot...strip club and you are like where is the restaurant? Look next door it's right there so don't stress just keep in walking in. The ambiance is dark but in the right way and beautifully done. The food though...off the chain!! My friend enjoyed this delicious shrimp enchiladas and I had these to die for lobster tacos. Everything is fresh and hand made. Ericka our waitress gave some outstanding customer service recommending the table side guacamole. Thanks for the great food, excellent customer service, and excelling our expectations!!

Lighting is dim. Hard to read the menu.  Staff is super friendly and helpful.  Definitely order the tableside guacamole! It is fabulous!!

iRfUoWMajDNOUQ_N9_p4gQ.text: Amazing. Margaritas were really good and my steak delicious!!  Danielle was an amazing waitress and very attentive to our party in the entire night we will definitely be back

2cc6wikS0flUiaspZ-cmXw.text: You may ask how good is El Dorado Cantina???  Well it's open 24 hours a day. In my book you wouldn't stay open 24 hours a day if you didn't have customers now would you?  When we got there around 3pm we were the third group of people in here. Then afterwards, people started coming in and half the place was packed. So I guess it must be pretty busy throughout the day.   We started with the Caesar Salad ($14). Instead of chop romaine lettuce, it comes out in spears so it's cut lengthwise. It has fresh queso fresco and toasted pepitas tossed with their fresh house made Caesar dressing.   Street tacos with carne asada ($14.50). The steak was so tender. It had cilantro, onion and was supposed to have guacamole but I didn't see nor taste any. It came with lime wedges which we squirted  it on the tacos and it sure made every bite pop with flavor. This is one of the top street tacos that I have ever tasted. It reminded myself of the time I was in Mexico.  Side note it comes with double flour tortilla and lots of steak so you can actually make smaller tacos.  For $4 more you add cilantro rice and choice of refried or black beans.   For all you vegetarians you can try the Chile Relleno ($15) as it was perfectly made. It is stuffed with roasted poblano pepper and a three cheese blend and topped with tomato sauce. It came with cilantro rice and you have a choice of refried or black beans.   Everything everyone had was a wow moment. All you heard was oh and ah. At the end everyone's plates was empty.  I really wanted to try the refried ice cream but I was too full. Is that even a possibility?  I hate to say it but I was too full. This is a must do for Mexican food for sure.

I really appreciated the fact that the music was loud enough to enjoy but not too loud that you couldn't have a conversation.  If you are in Vegas this is a must do!

Wt5Jd0z25RiY95l5HtPG4A.text: Delicious and high quality food. We make sure El Dorado is always on our list when we visit LV. Yummy margaritas and everything is so fresh and delicious. More authentic Mexican vs. TexMex. Services always prompt and servers are friendly and knowledgeable. A Vegas hidden gem!!

VOn5tmKIL7OW0MlM8PJL1Q.text: Wow.  At a first glance, it feels like you're about to eat tacos at a strip club.  But then, you eat said tacos and they're AMAZING, but yes, sadly, you are at a strip club, but only next door so it's cool.  And hey, it's Vegas baby!  I tried the carnitas, al pastors, asadas and chorizos... and DAMN.  There are a couple local Mexican restaurant in Buffalo that sling great tacos, and another in my "second home" in Southeast Georgia, but El Dorado has bested them all in my tongue's point-of-view, and if my tongue could talk, it would tell you it has tasted A LOT of tacos.  Now is the point when I pick out something to say negatively to put my review in perspective.... The choice to have lime rice served in lieu of Mexican rice will fall into the realms of legend.  Hmm, didn't work out the way I would have liked that one, but that rice, like the tacos here is amazing.  Did I mention that Yelp listed El Dorado Cantina one of the top 5 Mexican restaurants two years in a row?  Anyone that writes/reads a review on Yelp is obviously awesome, and they're impeccable taste shan't be trifled with.

mO9Mudc6Tf4VstfjvFuF0g.text: Awesome food and decor! I love the chilaquiles with carne asada. Agua frescas are the real deal, not a mix. The flan is to die for. I love flan and get it everywhere I can and this one was amazing. Creamy and thick custard (not jell-o like some places I've been). The staff have been really friendly and attentive.   Our waiter was Chris and he was really nice and told us his recommendations and checked on us often. Executive Chef Paco came out to our table to introduce himself and ask how everything was which I think says so much about him and this restaurant.  Great place! 3rd time here and will definitely be back!

rA2sVFWwSYSsotRKh3KYjw.text: Upon our arrival to el dorado I was a little nervous as it is right next to a strip club. As we ventured into this gem, I was pleasantly surprised! The decor is very hip, modern and clean. The menu is full of organic food. The raspberry margarita was so refreshing and tasty! Table side guacamole was phenomenal! The seafood enchiladas were to die for! Our server, amber, was so attentive and professional! We never had to ask for anything! The flan is incredible! I ended up ordering two for our group so that I could have my own. The raspberry margarita was so refreshing! Highly recommend!

Place has tourist prices so skip the lap dance next door so you can enjoy a full meal.  Queso and guacamole are gr8 starters.

zcUuIMGhzOULH2M63A0Z1g.text: The best Mexican restaurant in Vegas for sure the carne asada taste just like on the bbq the best taste ever. The restaurant atmosphere is 5 stars. If you're visiting Vegas for sure check this place out, i know i will next time im back.

91RJqukcRd57hTD2FPrUew.text: Amazing experience, even late at night. Customer service was great, polite and friendly staff. Drinks were excellent, and food was beyond what I expected, and I went in with high expectations to begin with. I would definitely recommend to a friend, and will probably be returning myself in the near future.

wKMOPqqrcf5mUP2D4CJWbw.text: Excellent Food!!! The quality is top notch! Everything I've tried has been delicious and the service was amazing! I could eat there everyday!

9rDSuKrwaEv-RK2X3kuQ0A.text: First time here tonight! My husband & I took a trip to Las Vegas & I yelped near by restaurants that were open late & El Dorado Cantina pops up. I have to say this place is phenomenal! From the nice ambiance, nice servers to the amazing Street Tacos, let's not forget the flan! It's a MUST have. I'm a Latina & I know what flan is supposed to taste like, and this was AMAZING!! Chef Paco was very sweet & took the time to introduce himself to us. I will definitely be coming back before I head back to the OC.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Paco&#39;s grandmas original recipe for this delicious flan!

1DhWRq9_adNZUJiaGSCULQ.text: We had our best dining experience here while we were in Vegas. I had the grilled Mahi tacos that were delicious, but a little less red cabbage would be good. My favorite item was the Imperial Shrimp they had a tasty seafood stuffing and were wrapped in crispy bacon .When in Vegas I would go here again.

zvmVZPGlWYlGro3tiEv8jg.text: The food was delicious!! Sat at the bar w Ms. Liz and she was great. Everything was good overall. The fajitas were surprisingly expensive compared to the other items that utilized the same ingredients.

JGtg1KrU0upiF_8ya18_8g.text: Great customer service. Excellent food and most of the menu has organic ingredients.  The atmosphere is great and all the entree were excellent.  The service remained personal and very attentive  especially Dominique.

mAXJCNo4-h9fsNVl6eY8zQ.text: If you like Mexican food,  you will love this place...  everything there looks good...  eveything!   Great job guys...  The food and service was excellent

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snapper and Chilaquiles

OjIRyiNqZ6s2TNjTx2TCNQ.text: OMG, the food is so good!  Crazy location too next to Sapphire's Strip Club.

UyLmwuDsWDLKfX01u348Bw.text: This was an experience to remember! From the first course to the last everything was just jaw dropping. Chef paco really out did himself. The salsas were completely different from other restaurants. It was if I was eating a home cooked meal. We ordered a variety of tacos and was not disappointed. The portion was so generous I feel as if I got way beyond my moneys worth. After eating the appetizers my boyfriend and I were convinced we were on a show on the food network channel. The staff was very welcoming and the chef himself came to check if we needed anything else. Definitely my new hangout...I loved it!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ma30B1Ax0hqgeiizDVVmzw.text: Love it! Love it!! One of the best Mexican restaurant I have been. Ordered some queso with chorizo and it was very good. My hubby had the chicken enchiladas, daughter had the skirt steak and I had some street tacos...everything was delicious and fresh. Bonus points: everything is organic.

MTxgVKSs2VrvAkJuSF0Dhw.text: A new modern twist to Mexican food in Las Vegas. Finally I have found a restaurant that serves NON GMO foods!  I have been disappointed in the quality of Mexican restaurants that we have in Las Vegas. Usually if you want good Mexican food, you have to go to California.   This restaurant takes the cake. Probably one of the best Mexican restaurants in Vegas.   We ordered the table side guacamole, carne asada and carnitas street tacos, chicken enchilada,  and deep fried ice cream.   Wow. Foodgasm heaven! I still am thinking about the ice cream... lol.   Everything was fresh, had enough kick to it, and tons of flavor.   The ambience was amazing. A cool Gothic Spanish feel with a modern twist.   Service was great as well.   The only negative is that it's next to a strip club. But for all the parents the strip club is not connected. Also the rice lacks flavor and needs more like and salt added to it.   We will definitely be back!

sHNn8busfk_VW5lNs_vjog.text: This place does not deserve 4 stars or even 1 for that matter. Heed Yelp's warning about the inflated rating and glowing reviews from 1 IP address. Any good reviews of this place might also be coming from intoxicated patrons next door. If you are going here for good fresh Mexican food, you will be disappointed. The food is terrible! I ordered the tacos al pastore. The meat was dry and very salty i could not eat it. The black beans, also very salty. The beef enchilada my husband had was terrible. The soup was just ok. We ordered a fruit bowl that was just watermelon, cantaloupe and pineapple for $15.00! You can have Mexican food at Cardenas, 100 times better for less than half the price.

HZ6QxNkwx0CFq97qCj8xYg.text: I was worried about not being full from a high end Mexican place.  I was full!  I had the carne Asada burrito and it was delicious and huge.  Salsas were very flavorful and my wife had the enchilada and said it was as good as our Mexican friend mom's!  The waiter was friendly and helpful in making our lunch selection.  We met the chef and he was very nice and told us about the locals special and happy hours.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars was because we were seated next to a dog.  I hate when restaurants allow dogs (it was a pug not a service animal). 2nd the food runners went to 3 different tables to drop off food.  Other than that the quality and flavor of the food was outstanding.

UXl6UVHWLLsU10-u96zb2A.text: Was good not great. Service was good , very friendly but not detail oriented . Location is same building as the strip club . I ordered the street tacos and they looked fantastic but the flavor was not there . Rice and beans great . Margaritas were good but had to ask for a extra shot to taste and tequila . Also way to much ice so cheap on the drink itself . Cute decor and was busy . Overall it was fun but would go somewhere more authentic for Mexican to get good flavored food .

OA-QlFjC94Qqbc0KCVtsnA.text: I have never used Yelp before, but after the amazing experience I had at El Dorado Cantina, I knew I had to write a review. From the moment our party entered the place we were greeted with a smile from Laura the hostess. Neil our server could not have been more accommodating. He offered plenty of recommendations for our party and was more than knowledgeable about the menu. Great food, great service. The icing on the cake was the manager Martine stopping by our table multiple times during our meal to ensure that everything was perfect. This was my first time at El Dorado Cantina, but it absolutely will not be my last.  5 stars, well deserved.

jMAk1SoTogEoGkC1ZsFZFg.text: What best stands out is the service. I have been here twice and service has been consistently amazing. I would recommend starting with the table side made guacamole and chips. Nothing beats fresh made right in front of you guac! We also had the house margaritas (highly recommend it). For dinner we had the enchiladas and new york strip steak, both were really tasty and well cooked. I feel like you can't go wrong in anything you choose.   Finally the best part of this place is that they are 100% GMO free!! What more could you want!

W53U4dbz1P-q3ulG4D__WQ.text: Food is so good here and very consistent! Always fresh and delicious. Great tequila selection. The Executive Chef, Paco, is so knowledgeable and very friendly. He is always greeting guests and checking the quality of the food. Make the trip! Well worth it. Pic is if the best flan in town!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dOjtaY6MPsOaHf_4_x4Z0g.text: This place is fun, the servers are friendly, enthusiastic, knowledgeable. Chef Paco is super sweet and friendly.  Food is great and I definitely see myself coming back for more and more and more.

H57-DqKzYwE2jD53I3fYrg.text: Do not be thrown off..it's next to a gentleman's club and off the strip - but it's by far the best authentic farm to table/organic Mexican food around! We were very impressed and simply took a quick uber from our hotel. Must go!!!

uyBBsKBPiFDam6ntm7BIWA.text: Everything was awesome and more!!! The food was amazing. Chef Paco came to greet us while finishing our dinner. My husband and I were celebrating our 1st year wedding anniversary in Vegas and wanted to go to a nice place for dinner and saw it had great reviews so we decided to go there. The flan is AMAZING. We had the pequeno feast and it was to die for. The taste was AUTHENTIC!!! The margaritas are also delish. Not to mention our server Rorak was very knowledgable, friendly, and courteous. When we come back to Vegas in the future this will def be our go to spot. They are opening another one in LA... Cant wait!

JNftvFwHbZDR3i5ViLqhdA.text: Honestly, after researching the heck out of restaurants in the Las Vegas area and deciding on this place as our Mexican stop, I was kind of disappointed.  I can get past the fact that it's next door to a strip club, but the food didn't blow me away.  Certainly not the worst stop during our trip, but I doubt we'd return, and I would not recommend going out of your way to go here.  The empanadas were actually kind of sad, but I did enjoy my chicken fajitas.  BF was not impressed w/his burrito.

aL7y6M07ikRwC7TsE8i_Mw.text: So to be honest,  the fact that it's attached to Saphires almost scared me off. I'm so glad i decided to try it anyway.  Mondays is half price locals and the food is the best Mexican we have had in town (honestly!!!). Atmosphere is classy and sleek.  You SERIOUSLY could bring your kids here. Great margaritas....not a single complaint about this place.

qBYO6rceHW8-77yB1NrOzg.text: Amazing food, great drinks, and hilarious bartenders. Don't be scared away by the gentleman's club next door. Reservations recommended!

Fvkf5OkyWj6My3JXPETGGg.text: Me and my girlfriend wanted a place to watch monday night football a friend recommended this place.. We sat at the bar orderd two drinks one margarita and my vodka tonic. The bartender Joe was scattered and not attentive we got up to use the restroom left our drinks and coats on our seats.. Came back to find her margarita gone our water gone and someone sitting in our place. We were gone literally 2 minutes. We pointed out her drink was gone he made another.. All in all i would come back as long as i get a different bartender that actually pays attention to his customers.. Didnt really eat much food my girlfriend was irritated and wanted to leave.. Maybe ill convince her to come back and eat another time.

nyQMGCEb4gBNiJj_kAZnKw.text: Excellent service, great food. Get out here and don't be afraid of the location! We had the tableside guacamole, a few tacos, posole, and we took the "Chapulines Challege." You gotta do it. All the food was absolutely delicious and the margaritas were tart and yummy. Super attentive staff and Kai was fantastic; he guided us through the menu and surprised us with a few recommendations. The ambience is modern, chic and inviting. Chef Paco treats you like his own child. Will return on our next trip to Vegas.

EJx2cz3X_Ai4bmKrraZafw.text: Flan is the best one I ever had! And the tacos are great also! Great environment, highly recommend!

gSlxxP5HxITvN7fid8Ji1w.text: The healthiest and best tasting Mexican food I've ever had.

g_8X_R-AVp7KXhgfCLhUtQ.text: Easy reservation , good guacamole,drinks and entrees ! I would go here  again !!drinks were strong and amazing !

KK3ozvKAzRkMP-QtO503rw.text: Awesome!! Not just the best Mexican food in Vegas...the best food period!!  Delish!

FG6DCog9W4sjIy7rsZLpXg.text: I love this place!! The food is amazing and its all natural. The chicken tinga tostadas have a nice rich flavor and you get 3, was enough for a meal.

hBnD5Z-yLfpiJCooQ7OAlA.text: Food was really good would 10/10 recommend the enchiladas!! Service was also very good! It's next to the gentleman's club but I still think it's ok for kids to come..at least during the day (:

ZJC_ygWig85XEioTqHi8qw.text: Amazing food, lots of great choices, but ALL of it was AWESOME!  Good service, fair prices and a great atmosphere.  There's lots of great places to eat in Vegas, but if you visit and don't try El Dorado then you'll be missing out.

OEOKJ5j2avbQc3opX0FXdg.text: I don't review much on yelp. I'll preface my review by saying that I am Cuban and grew up with my grandmother making carnitas and flan. I also have family in Miami, and when I visit we always hit the best Cuban restaurants. All that being said my meal @ El Dorado was one of the top 3 Mexican/Cuban meals that I have ever had. The carne asada tacos and the burrito were simply incredible. And the Flan. Oh my god the Flan. The Flan was the best thing I ate in Vegas this trip. Better than anything I had at delmonico and joes seafood and steak - which are no slouches. Eat here, you won't be disappointed!  And for the love of god get the Flan!  :)

ct8Q_VNsID0C6qnCaNwP1Q.text: Ok. When it's the witching hour, where do you eat? Mexican food is always a go-to, right? The 24-hour element is only the beginning with this establishment (and yes it's attached to a strip club, no I didn't visit, I was there for the food apparently). Being new to the neighborhood, I asked my local bartender where I needed to satiate. Regionally, this is still technically the southwest, so good Mexican food is readily available. However, it's hard to find good sopes. If you don't know what that is, google it. Good food, good drink (and I don't usually drink margaritas).

OdsdUiBnicePYHabJ2aN_w.text: Food was good, although pricey.  +$100 for 3 of us, that included a pitcher of margaritas.  We were there for lunch, but the lunch and dinner menu is the same. Albondigas Soup, Short Rib Tacos, Carnitas Burrito were very tasty.  We will pass on the Chicken Mole Enchiladas next time.  Free Flan for checking in via Yelp. Erica, our server, checked on us several times.  Service: 5; Food: 4; Price: 3.

BPY1h6T4xE1G_othxWObOw.text: Just had the carne Assad burrito and a plate of carne Assad tacos, Burrito came with a small salad of shredded cabbage and slices of radish and a side of rice.  Tacos came with rice and beans.  Everything was amazing, rich taste, nothing overpowering.  Will definitely come back when in town.

PbC0jb4NOqUxC9aMov0wOw.text: I am beyond shocked that the manager on site "Kim" came to our table and very unprofessionally approached my friend regarding a negative comment she left on yelp. He took the time out of his busy day to come and harass my friend. I have never seen such level or unprofessionalism! Very unfortunate. It will be the end of this restaurant if this man keeps managing this place! Kim has no respect for customers.   Our waitress Maria was amazing and she is very knowable about the menu.  The location is very beautiful inside. They have an extended drink menu. Overall good place and good food.

_ZBA0kNFKaV6HO1YHv9wTA.text: The food is good, but management service is bad.  My friend wrote an honest review while in the restaurant and the manager came up to her confronting her about the review. He was rude and unprofessional. Waitress Maria was very nice but I don't think I'll be coming back to this place. They need to replace this manager ASAP!

kfR8gRKhFpO8-vmiJPNxMg.text: I tried the queso fundido(?)..not good. The carne asada burrito..pretty Damn amazing, and got the carnitas street tacos with rice and black beans for my wife. Also amazing. Well definitely be back here.

nNGm6TOocUvP2ADMJTRIQw.text: I am glad we found this place while spending a day in Las Vegas  The carnitas was fantastic and so was the margarita   The  server Amber was great   Will come back again

fiStZpvAaPtGYcnQa2WGQw.text: Found this place on Yelp when searching for healthy food. And it was! I had the fish tacos with grasshoppers as a side dish. Both very tasty! Light fresh food. Nice staff who asked in the kitchen if I could have the grasshoppers with both available seasoning. I definitely recommend this place!

jw6UA-5rbWUWJRX7BEsDTQ.text: Seriously haven't had such a great experience at a restaurant like this EVER! Marco & Paco are the best! At the end of our meal they hooked it up with complimentary flan, Pacos grandmas recipe! Thanks for the great experience will be back soon!

WQ5sgBdzWqDZ-QwYPKw_lQ.text: This place is amazing!  I've been wanting to try it for a while because they serve non GMO organic ingredients.  I can definitely tell the difference.  The service!  The food!  The best Carne Asada! Joseph & Joe gave great service!!! Thank you!

CUEFj7TT3iSunr_ozliKAw.text: My brother and I came back into town from a long day of snowboarding in UT and wanted some wholesome healthy Mexican food, so we hit up El Dorado Cantina on a recommendation.  We were not disappointed.  The food was top notch and the staff is super friendly!  Our server was Annabelle and she was super friendly, professional, and took care of us until we left!  Many thanks!  We also met Jesse (manager) and he was super cool and made sure we were well taken cared of.  Melanie (the GM) also swung by our table to make sure everything was in order.  Chef Paco also came out and greeted us!  The flan is his grandmother's recipe and it was so creamy and delicious and I definitely recommend it to finish off your meal.  No matter what you order, you will not be disappointed.  On top of that, everything is organic!  I'm definitely coming back when I go back to Vegas!

UXEWgXTgBAomZc403VOz7Q.text: Fantastic new spot!  Loved it. Chef Paco was great. He came out to our table and introduced himself and chatted for a bit. Give it a try. You will like it.

aL47B2m_B6HH-ax7ewU8qw.text: I was pretty skeptical of a restaurant right next to a strip club but this place is amazing. The food is so good and for being certified non GMO it's actually very reasonably priced.  I had the jalapeno margarita and the carne asada plate... Both are must try's in my opinion!!! The staff was so friendly and knowledgable and I loved Sean the manager. He came by our table, awesome guy.  Highly recommend this place !!!

9eeL9TiTCbuCghJ0OkdMGA.text: Beautiful churches, inside and out. Extremly clean, cleaned by the members every Saturday. Very inviting to non members. Do not presure you.

6rfjXghZ9tTmjn7f1AaF-A.text: Best spot in LV to get your late night Mexican food fix. Good food, good service. Bartender Rafael hooked up some good drinks. And the chef, Paco, came out to make sure my gf and I were enjoying our meals. And there's some quality entertainment just next door.

FteAiZRGEdhx92kZFrRntQ.text: Rebecca Guzman was absolutely wonderful. She is the assistant manager and she was very welcoming. The food was amazing.

vfv0wGSUPPLeqZrcETn_kQ.text: Our bartender Sarah was amazing!  The street tacos were delicious!  Thanks for the hospitality!

HhfBroIbwJ-Rmm4X6QQjIQ.text: T Brothers Tile LLC is HIGHLY Recommended for ALL your Remodeling projects, from Floors to Tile Bathrooms, T Brothers Tile can't be beat. The Professional, Courteous, and Quality Workmanship is Second to None, and I definitely recommend giving them a Call, whenever your projects are ready to go. Their Tile Installer is a definite Artist, and a 1ST CLASS 5 STAR Professional, and ask for Greg, it does NOT get any better, period. Normally I would never give reviews, but this is definitely one of those Exceptions where I am so very pleased with Total Satisfaction, that I needed to let everyone know, that there is a BEST, and its T BROTHERS TILE (702)221-8453. *****5 STAR EXCELLENCE, call me, I will send Pictures of their XLNT workmanship and my newly remodeled Kitchen. Steve Ross (702)478-9211

gLGFv43IUYxujxOqjiXkDw.text: Great happy hour.  Buy one get one free margaritas and a dollar tacos.  I had tacos in Mexico and this place does it very well.

bNwqyThX-14l2-1NBqQzBw.text: Delicious food! We had the pastor tacos, fajitas and chilaquiles. Organic wine and jalapeno margarita were amazing! Our waiter, Enrique, was knowledgable and accommodating for our gluten free needs!

2YeIMVQ6GO-jferLiIi5oA.text: Amazing Food!!!!!!!! Chef's Paco Grandma's flan was IT!!!! The best flan I've ever had. Our server Joaquin was very nice and helpful.

QbGE5raTB0ezDfV8ypz4Fg.text: Authentic Mexican with regional signature plates. Over 100 Tequilas as well. The food is exceptional quality with organic, GMO-free, and consideration of dietary restrictions/choices like Vegan and gluten free. May I suggest the Pulled Chicken tacos or burrito or the Signature plate Pork Mole Verde. I tasted the best sipping Tequila I have ever had in US or Mexico. It was so nice to eat great food served up by super friendly servers and find a restaurant in Las Vegas that has a conscience. Support this movement, and if you don't care where your food comes from or the impact it has on our planet getting to our over full mouths, then go here anyway...THE FOOD IS OUTSTANDING!!!

tKOwv4mePG6zU37lYmbx_Q.text: Wonderful meal. I had the Rajas Pork Burrito. Extremely flavorful with cilantro rice. Only downfall was the slowest service.

XPp0Uu1uYFnBCj9NVUXMdg.text: Great food and drink.   Staff could be a little more knowledgeable- especially about what differentiates their food choices from all of the other places in town.,   Get the corn appetizer for sure.  Vegetarian fajitas are enough for 2 meals.   Love the margaritas!

s_pamf_OUZa2HXIR8myZzA.text: AMAZING FOOD, even better service! The chef customized special veggie dishes for us, our waitress was awesome and the food was the most authentic & amazing Mexicano food we've ever had, move over dos cominos!

s2my54due_tlH_wL2f6aYg.text: Not a huge fan, not sure what the big deal is about this place. Carne asada was a really thin flank steak with not much flavor, tacos were basic. Overhyped for sure.

JfwSdQBdsZHIeXiMxyw0GQ.text: Love this restaurant! This is my number one pick when anyone comes to town. Ask for grace, she's great!!!

oMHs9sXeN5olhpaZQzlMxw.text: Definitely best Mexican and margaritas in Las Vegas! Service top notch, very attentive! Made my custom margarita perfectly! Ivan rocks!! Salsa Verde is best we ever had!

mVKPjOji9xcxCM2ecaDUAg.text: This place is stellar Mexican food.  So far I have yet to find a great Mexican spot, but this might be it.  I have had several dishes off of the menu which were all tasty.         However the garlic shrimp was bomb, I love the beans here also.  I had the fried chicken I forgot the name, it was good however if it came with sauce it would be better so I added there chipotle cream which made it right.  Taquitos and imperial shrimp apps are delicious.  You have to order the lemonade agua fresco, so bomb I had about 5 glasses.  I'm not a big Sangria drinker but even that was tasty. Desert the churros are so good, they come with a little cream filling and a banana foster sauce to dip them in.  Flan has a cheesecake like consistency which I like, because I don't care for traditional Flan and the eggy taste.  I will definitely go back. So many good dishes and Chef Paco can custom make dishes to your taste.        Some dishes are $25 and I think they could be a little cheaper however on average dishes are $10-$17. Its good for groups and even coming in by yourself has a nice open layout and friendly staff.  If you come to Vegas for Mexican food near the strip or just good flavors, try it.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipotle cream chicken
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood enchilas
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada plate

7dHJkfr-gbbpWP7v2RCl8w.text: We looked them up on Yelp and saw their amazing reviews so we decided to come out and I'm glad we did!  After hiking it was great to have a margarita and an amazing dinner! Enrique was fantastic and made some great recommendations for us! ;) The jalapeno margarita, street corn, and tacos were so yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular margarita and jalapeño margarita
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos 3 ways

A01nETjWQXj5vIrpLe6DKA.text: The flan was what made our initial 4 stars turn into 5 stars! Seriously the best flan I've ever tasted. So thick and creamy!   We got the chicken signature bowl, shrimp tacos and the steak sopes! The portion was perfect! (A lot so we had to take some home!) It was delicious!   Service was wonderful! Very nice ladies work here. We would come back for sure.

qeUvRKy1UJCkDfXktc8Nug.text: I ordered a torta here and it was delicious! The empanadas weren't as big as I thought they were going to be but they were still really good! And our waiter Danny was really helpful and nice. Also the pina colada was delicious!

KsBUb0u0Ua6nVgTwUbajvA.text: The chef (Paco) came out after we were done eating and offered us his card as well as some coupons. I thought that was a very respectable gesture.  Yelp recommendations lured us towards the tableside guacamole and it did not disappoint. Also, the street tacos (I did carnitas, pastor, and asada) were bomb.

lif7hkDNeyIO3qo9GOplag.text: As much hype as this place has gotten, I figured it would for sure suck! But to my pleasant surprise....it was A M A Z I N G !  The best part about it is that it's in a strip club -- keeps all the super-pretentious squares away. It does have a separate entrance, so you don't actually have to go in the strip club...but you still have to park under the electric blue neon glare of the Sapphire signage, among all the strippers, bros and pervs. Not a big deal, tho!   The second best part is the food -- I had carne asada tacos, and they were OUT OF THIS WORLD! The black beans and rice that came with them were also EXCEPTIONALLY delicious -- they had a delicate flavor to them that I can't even describe, but I could have eaten  10 plates of each :-) I also had a house margarita, which was basically like any other margarita...only presumably GMO and organic, blah blah blah.  Prices are a little high -- for my 3 tacos it was around $15. But I don't mind paying a premium for bad ass food, which this is! Service was OK -- everyone was friendly and helpful, but our waitress did fudge my friend's order twice. (Minor stuff, and my friend did not even bring it up, so no harm no foul.)  I'm only docking one star because of the chip situation. They bring you a basket of chips and some salsa when you are seated, but then the waitress gives this weird legal disclaimer-type spiel about how the first basket is on the house, but additional baskets are $3.50 each or something like that. I thought that was kinda miserly -- for $5 a taco, ya can't throw in some friggin' tortilla chips? The fact that they announce this at the very beginning of your experience kinda creates an awkward vibe.  Other than that, a GREAT place and I will be back for sure!!

or8sZfBdXrZjQz3XzSA1Gg.text: Bottom line with any dining experience, customer service, nice atmosphere, and good food. The atmosphere is dark, tv playing video of loud Mexican singing makes it hard to have a conversation, and seating was not the most comfortable with high table and low seating. We had a group of 11 and our servers were initially attentive, taking our drink orders. We ordered 3 nacho plates for the group but found 2 of them to have what seemed like plastic pieces in them. This was brought to the attention of our server and then a manager. The server came back from the kitchen and told us it was hard unmelted cheese, not plastic. The next piece was then brought to the manager and initially she said it was plastic but after talking with the kitchen, changed her mind and said it was hard cheese. In either case this was not edible and if consumed would have been harmful. No apologies from them. The dinner entrees were huge and tasty, no issues here. My problem is with the lack of concern and attention given by the staff and management with a food issue. They charged us for the nachos despite knowing there was a problem. No way do you ever treat your customers like this. We won't be back and I wouldn't recommend you dine here with so many other choices for good Mexican food.

PEaMPaGhmQxPjLqVuw_-bw.text: Location: this restaurant is a part of the sapphire strip club, however you do not have to enter the strip club to get to the restaurant; it's a separate entrance.        Service: good  Food: dry and tasteless. We ordered the enchiladas and tacos. It was overpriced as well. $18 for two enchiladas is ridiculous.   However, if you have a gluten allergy this is the place for you. There are no GMOs or gluten at this restaurant.

3TbkuJiJ-gWhzazyDhdyjw.text: My girlfriend and I went in for a quick bite before a movie tonight and as always, we were treated great. Jason was sure to take great care of us and made us some awesome jalapeno margaritas! As a bartender myself I was impressed he was only a bar back, definitely was surprised.

UWOGsfgD2Qv-tD47tHtQZA.text: This is next door to the Sapphire, not in it.   Wow, wow, wow! Street tacos were amazing, conchinita, asada and carnitas. Table side guacamole was also really good. But the flan, ohhhhh the FLAN! Do not leave without having it. Even if you're not sure whether you even like flan, you must have it! Also, the customer service was so impressive. Paco, the chef, brought us our dessert personally and Eric was very kind and knowledgable. Ambiance was really nice. I will definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas.

1EmQjDzNinvcBGGIOLSEtw.text: OUTSTANDING atmosphere, cocktails - blackberry and jalapeno margaritas!! Our friendly and informed server Reid also recommended two excellent entrees. Our favorite was the Chipotle Chicken. GREAT service and the manager Martine even checked on us twice to be sure. Place is busy right now for Sunday dinner with a neat mix of patrons, including families with kids. Don't let the location scare you (adjacent to Sapphire) as there is easy access parking in a very convenient location. Finishing with the flan. DELICIOUS!!

OSUo02lWdvmTtvTUc3lqug.text: I used to love this place. I would give 5 stars because the food is excellent but I think they changed management and you can no longer get 3 different tacos on the taco plate which is crap considering if you order them a la carte they're the same price. My boyfriend always gets the mole chicken enchiladas which are excellent and I definitely recommend the cochinitas Pibil tacos. Definitely give this place a try.

obaa0m3mqZpxj4dYhgx0OA.text: Whenever I'm in town this is my go-to place. Not only the food is fresh, their cocktails delicious and the tequila selection wide, but also the staff is very friendly. If you come late in the evening ask for Maria to prepare a Tableside Guacamole, it's one of best I've ever had. And leave some appetite for the amazing flan! Highly recommended!

vdmGiPujJeYSlhU6p6ls2w.text: Excellent pork carnitas. A little hard to find but so worth it. Street tacos were amazing and the table side guacamole was delicious. Very clean and great service.

q37DXf97Mnuk3a0WQlgR3w.text: I was here two weeks ago I can honestly say it's still the best mexican food I had in Vegas, food was amazing! Would definitely recommend this venue for any special occasion or just for a night out .. thanks Chef Paco

apuFcOQWHZq4KK0H3UotGQ.text: Brought my very picky Mexican family in and they all loved it. Food is super hearty and not greasy at all. I had the Cochinita street tacos, super spicy, exactly how I'd sauce it up myself which is rare for me.   Even the sides were really well done. Attention to detail is high. Our server Erica was really accommodating and super nice, very informative too. Thanks again!   Will definitely be coming back to go more adventurous with my menu selection. There are so many interesting choices I need to sample.   Great look inside, love the booths, super comfortable and slick. If anything the tables are a bit too small but it works out since most plates aren't very big. Really cozy bar area. I went on a Thursday afternoon, nice and quiet, quick service.

0vWJwf3-vc6r9L7yxqVXMg.text: The queso fundido was good ordered withthe chorizo. Aguas frescas of the day were watermelon and melon. Very delicious.

9VzpiYgsKN15noi8ZueThw.text: Excellent Mexican food with friendly and prompt service. Complimentary cheese quesadillas for the kids.  Wide variety of vegetarian options - we got the vegetarian enchiladas and corn rajas tacos. If you like spicy food, ask for the habanero salsa. Excellent mezcal cocktail ... forgot what it was called but it had "smoke" in the name.

0hRuiavdGOkQMX9yUKeqdw.text: Ask for Enrique as your server, and that sums it all up, suggested, the 1 pound carne Asada plate, wow, tasted like I was at home barbecuing carne Asada in my back yard!  Came with chorizo and cactus ( that's Nopales for my latino friends) Very authentic, a must to come back to! Only complain, wife wants to know how I know about Saphires strip club, next door, hahahha! No comment!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1lb Carne Asada Plate! Enrique Rocks!

hMdcE-YUNCaZFioCtJbT3Q.text: First time here. I was relieved to find out it's only next door to Sapphires and not part of it. Very nice decor and atmosphere.  Amber was our server. She gave impeccable service.  Chef Paco came around and introduced himself, asking if we needed anything.  We tried the Imperial Shrimp for an app. Seafood stuffed shrimp, wrapped in bacon... yum!!! I had the chicken enchiladas and he had the pork carnitas. Amazing food. Definitely recommend.  They have free salsa lessons on Tuesdays and it's Latin night on Wednesdays. Great service & great food. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5WLH187LnYaM4x4Hc0RLKw.text: Awesome sangria and the ABSOLUTE BEST flan.  Paco, the Executive Chef, came by and told us it was a family recipe.  I wish I was part of his family just so I could eat the flan at family gatherings.  Great service, and incredible folks.

-Qonma0DDomf1Yh2KPVhOA.text: This place was nothing short of amazing. Everything was delicious. And the service was absolutely incredible. We talked to Paco (the chef) and Hugo our server (it was his first day) and you never would have known. We also met Enrique and what a friendly guy. They make you feel so welcome and everything they recommended us was just incredible. Definitely come try whether you are a local or not it's well worth it. Not to mention all organic and non gmo

AbBumZK7VwnhkMXWye6KcQ.text: The food was awesome, the services was great! Thanks for such a good night of food and fun. Shout out to Neil and Joe! You guys are really attentive and fun. Keep up the great work!

aKHH9joTMa_s1mmP8RWpNw.text: Best Mexican food in town.  Great drinks and a very attentive staff.  Oh, the prices are great also.  You might be unsure if you have arrived in the correct place, since it is attached to strip club and share the same parking lot, but it's one you should try.

vau8NjuHGdc-hu0gTgdZqw.text: I've been wanting to go to this place for a while because I try to eat mostly organic and I absolutely love Mexican food! I've eating at over 100 Mexican restaurants and have had many Mexican friends families' cooking. This is said to be the best and most authentic Mexican food in town, but A. I wouldn't be surprised if the chef/cooks aren't Mexican B. Although they claim to be organic it is not good. Chillis is 10 times better and it's a chain restaurant (which I don't generally like chain restaurants). The only thing I liked was the salsa verde, but I wouldn't say it was authentic lol.  The service was also horrible and the place wasn't even busy. We got there and I ordered a water and my girl ordered a juice. They brought us chips and salsa. The chips were mediocre and the like I said I liked the salsa verde. I drink a lot of water but the only time my water and I finished my glass before the food came out but I only received more water after the bill came and we were leaving. My girl doesn't eat a lot in the evening for some reason and we ordered chicken and shrimp fajitas($28/1 before tax) together to share which came out fairly quick. Usually fajitas are full of flavor but these were bland. The tortillas were no good. The guacamole was not impressive, the black beans weren't good and I love guacamole and black beans! The server seemed nice at first and spoke to us in another language which we spoke fluently too, as well as English fluently. They brought out two plates of fajitas and dropped them off quickly, said they'll bring plates for us to eat on and ran off and I didn't see our server until we nearly done eating. At first I thought oh that was nice of them to split the order which some real Mexican restaurants have done, but then we realized it was a lot of food and we realized they brought us two orders of the exact same thing. We just ate one of the plates until our server came so we could let her know that we only ordered and wanted one order of fajitas. She didn't come check on us until we were almost done. They never brought plates, filled water, asked if everything was ok, asked if we needed anything, etc. and it wasn't even busy. When we were almost done our server came and we nicely let her know that we just ordered one order of fajitas like we said initially. She started yelling and arguing, saying we are wrong and basically calling us liars saying that we said 2 which we never said the word two at all. She said, no you ordered two. Then she's like I'll get you a box and you can take it to go, at this point I'm thinking I don't even want it, but ok maybe she'll be nice and civil and take it off the check. She boxes it up and then comes back with the check and I thinking positively, since she made a mistake it would only make sense to nicely correct it on the check at least. Sadly she didn't, so I said again that we only ordered one plate of fajitas and she yelled and argued (illogically) with us although we didn't want to make a scene she had no problem making a scene. She said that she was also the manager last night. This is by far the most negative review I've ever written. My girl and I are pretty positive people and although we were unhappy and upset, we joked about it the rest of the night. Needless to say I will tell everyone to not go here and I was expecting the opposite especially since there aren't many organic restaurants in town besides maybe the Fremont area. Save yourself and don't go here, it's a waste of time and you can find much better places.

XTdb9yy-PNv01WbJn14fkw.text: Every part of our experience was excellent.  Our waiter Chris made some awesome suggestions.  Food was super fast.  The manager and the chief came out to our table to check on our meal and if everything was to our liking.  It was the best dining experience of my life.  Flan was amazing and if you feel like some adventure try the grasshoppers.  They taste kind of like nuts.  It is a little odd that it is in the same building as a strip club but once you find the restaurant it is totally worth the unsavory location.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hqdfSdl5b2pRL2IkZhWwxw.text: This was the best dining experience I've ever had, and I've been to some very upscale places.  The food is fresh, delicious, and made from scratch; the service made you feel like part of the family; and despite the unprepossessing location (in an industrial area next to a gentleman's club), the ambiance inside is relaxed and comfortable.  I grew up in AZ and live in SoCal, so I'm pretty particular about quality Mexican food, and this is absolutely first rate.  From the friendly hostess Martine, to server par excellence Enrique, to chef Paco, the staff could not have been more welcoming and pleasant.  The delightful soaps were a tasty start to the meal.  I don't eat beef, so a substitution was quickly offered for my chilaquile plate (just trust me, they're amazing).  The chips and salsa were fresh; the margaritas were delicious, and the surprise ending of flan made with chef Paco's family recipe pushed it right over the top.  I may be in a food coma for the remainder of my Vegas visit, but I do plan to return this week.  Do not miss the opportunity to dine here if you're in town!

6AXC58hiijZ0Aed19l0dug.text: Carne asada taco is the bomb!  The pickled habanero is yummy without blowing away your palate.  Beware it is the same parking lot as a strip club so espcially around night time.

ItJ6JRI088wsX09xeWNpTQ.text: Don't waste your time going anywhere else in Vegas for Mexican food.   This is without a doubt...the best food, the best service, and open 24 hours with great deals.  Go to El Dorado Cantina  Food and drinks are awesome.

t8ituElY-1kuu_FWKufjGA.text: Tableside guacamole, jalapeno margarita, habanero salsa, all excellent! Cool decor and the staff was fantastic. So much organic, gluten-free goodness too!

Vd9TwodStPqs0LXC_7feZQ.text: Food was great and the service was even better! The chef even came out and introduced himself, he was so sweet and because we checked in, we received complimentary flan. Come on a night they're having a special

31H3ypmvvmuaLl5247ellA.text: All around very pleasant. Great atmosphere, service, food and drinks. Keeping this simple, but this place is AWESOME. GMO free and organic is a +++!!!

9PPOMmZwhgigbwVQifmIMQ.text: Great service. Juan was our server and he was perfect. The food wasn't the greatest but the portions were huge. The flan was amazing! I would come back just for the flan.

sFa8KMkMnADtPcgiVlRVfA.text: Food was excellent!!!  Service was even better!!!  Ask for Chris he was the best server we had all week in Vegas.

7t_A5cRQ7wyhCOR4LjjtHw.text: i have to admit when i first yelped this place and then drove to it... was to creeped out to go there because it looked like it was inside Sapphires the strip club... lol so i didn't go... another time... i was ironically IN Sapphires... was hungry as hell... and remembered that it was just next door... i went over there and ordered a chicken quesadilla... it was THE BEST CHICKEN QUESADILLA OF MY LIFE... it was life changing.  I can't even describe it... it was like as i was eating it i heard birds chirping and unicorns were running about on tufts of grass... lol anyways... try this place out... for it being next door to the club...and even sharing walls... you cant at all hear all the noise.

PW3O2stWl01QZhZm32Eoyw.text: Found this place on yelp, and it was everything that everyone was raving about; absolutely awesome and delicious! We were a little skeptical at first because it's right next to Saphire (a strip club) and we were bringing our 3 year old niece, but there was nothing to worry about. They even have a children's menu, where the meals come with churros for dessert!  The chef even came to our table, chatted with us, and gave us his business card. Five stars all around: service, food, drinks, atmosphere, vibe! We will definitely be going back!!

s0lUw_ALAWtW3HmmL8-7xA.text: Nell made the best margarita!! Not to mention the carnitas burrito was amazing. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

g96DLTCpRDne_1AmS_VhHQ.text: Small hole in the wall, but as soon as you walk in it is full of energy! The chili is epic and drinks are yummy!

PTk2vzNAkQpDft5BXP3zLA.text: Totally off the beaten path and a little deceptive at first but don't be mistaken by its size or location! The service was timely, the drinks were strong, the food is fresh and prepared to the "T!" We started with the Fresh guac and blueberry margaritas, had the "Cochinita Pibil" and was extremely satisfied! I will be back with larger parties than the 10 I brought with me tonight!

7M0-_qVx-zOM-am63WF9Cw.text: We love El Dorado Cantina!  The table side guacamole is absolutely delicious and the corn on the cob is a must, I even get one to go.  We love the cilantro lime rice and all the food comes out fresh. We are never disappointed. Chef Paco is amazing and came to say hi to our baby Kaden! We ended our lunch with some yummy Flan.

AelhIXxb60nlIoEfPjhY6g.text: Expensive, ($14 for a Tostada Salad,. Want Meat? Double the price)BUT Oh so delicious!  Definitely will be coming back! There Table Side Guacamole was Spot on, and their Chipotle Ranch, I would buy it by the Gallon. Everything was a Super Size and nobody in our group finished their plates.  That the Cantina is next to a "Strip Club" is not a problem for us. This is Vegas after all. Service was great, Lounge feel, they're open 24 hrs. Enough said, loved it.

Un35cBDyY5E-2ekSyLdnkA.text: OMG...amazing food! Wonderful Margarita. ..so good! I'll definitely be back! Sean rocks!...ok..just got dessert...the flan is the best I've ever had...I usually don't like flan but YOWZA! Bring on the derp fried ice cream! Compliments to chef Paco!

Fqb7inhufviz2OhZkpxKFg.text: This place is the best. Large parking lot. Food awesome and organic. Staff is friendly and the place is clean. I know all about it being attached to a strip club. We bring all our out of town guests here, have a chuckle about the "neighbor business", and we always return for the wonderful food.

-M6Xu9MRitYLx8M7N9V7Zg.text: I haven't eaten at a Mexican food restaurant since 09/13 due to fear of gluten/cross contamination. This restaurant, without a doubt, is one of the best I have ever eaten at. The food is non-gmo, organic, and majority gluten free. I had the steak, chicken, shrimp fajitas, my wife had street taco's and daughter had tostadas. Yelp reviews are right on. The food was excellent and our server, Enrique, top shelf. The food was seasoned exceptionally well. I didn't know rice could taste so delicious. The Executive Chef, Paco, made a visit to our table twice as did the manager. I love a restaurant that understands the importance of locals. There was no rush to place the bill in front of us halfway through our meal like so many other eateries. The Flan, an unexpected treat from the Executive Chef, was excellent. As a person with Celiac disease is often afraid to try a new restaurant, or any for that matter, I was confident that my meal was gluten free. We made a reservation and I indicated that I have Celiac disease. Enrique, our server assured me that he understood my situation. He also informed us that if I wanted to try a gluten menu item the chef would do what he could to make it gluten free without sacrificing quality. We will be back. Monday's=25% off total bill. The restaurant will begin honor in military with 20% discount. They got me for good.

sf_z4wGD_hJK0FLro5wpHA.text: The food here is wonderful and have real Mexican flavors, I take my family for a baby shower celebration and everyone on my party have a great time .   Chef Paco created an special menu and work with our budget, organic and GMO free food is really appreciated . Your effort will take you far away , was very nice to talk to chef and know some of he's family traditions.   Now this is our spot for family reunions and celebrations .   Thanks to all we'll be back soon   Ps  Try the mole sampler, imperial shrimp and flan.

MlDkJZjXsoNxWHygIlDlrQ.text: This place is delicious. Erica was our server. Everything was amazing. Chicken de tinga was AWRSOME. Great amount of food for the amazing Price. AWRSOME shiiittttt.

Y967I0lBDhevHYxoJwFwog.text: Is it a bad thing when your favorite thing at a Mexican restaurant is their rice?  Bland, generic, blah would describe our experience there tonight...and we were so looking forward to this meal, based on the reviews and the fact they are organic and non-GMO.  After sitting for several minutes, ignored by several staff members, we were finally acknowledged by Omar, who was actually pretty nice and as attentive as he could be, as it was really busy.  The empanadas, guacamole, and mole sampler were all just...bland.  Clumsy.  I should never have huge chunks of pepper in guac!  And the chips and tortillas are not homemade.    Two stars for the ambiance--it might be a nicer space if it weren't so crowded, loud, and next to a strip club--their commitment to organic and non GMO, and our waiter.  Otherwise, pass.  Thank goodness it was 50% off for locals or our night would have been made even worse.   For a really good Mexican food experience, travel north to Viva Zapata's...still my favorite!

RSGhl8GaiA3lvB9QRSmokw.text: Mango jalapeno margaritas made by the best bartender at el Darado Raffi are a must ...he has a sparkling personality  !! Chef paco killing it with the carne asada burrito. And Kai the other bartender is tall dark and handsome &):)&"$(?&(;)&8):)&536864)$87

cRZV-UzZFaE28VHtz2ByMg.text: The BEST in Las Vegas by far.  Biggest supporter of this restaurant.  Everything is delicious here.  Executive Chef Paco is the BEST !!!  I really can't say enough about this establishment.  Must try if you're in Las Vegas.  Pozole is the best I have ever had.  Flan is amazing.

aYDl-_l2wUg7qpX0XeGa-w.text: Atmosphere is great other than TV every where :) Enrique is a nice server. Food is ORGANIC !!! You should come and try. I will write more after my food arrives :)

vRqHnwQBUvkRtTyOTpkChA.text: This is one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. If you want authentic Mexican food that tastes delicious every time come here. They have good customer service and a good menu with a variety of choices.  Try this place you'll be happy that you did.

4oEiyQ3tabv-ztizfvan1g.text: Let's get real.  This is the best Mexican food you can get with flavors that most resemble True Mexico cuisine. The tacos are out of this world and the rice bowls are teeming with flavors I have never experienced.  If your looking for typical American-ized Mexican food this is not the place for you.  While your here make sure you leave from for dessert. Flan or Fried Ice Cream are a must.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Ice Cream and Flan. THE BEST FLAN I HAVE EVER HAD.

tQa-ZeZPFXHYxGNzMLYKAA.text: Loved this place!  A little tardy on my review, but had to make sure I got this one in, especially after how well we were treated.  First off, this restaurant is NEXT TO the Sapphire gentlemens club, not in it.  So don't let that spook you away.  We took our 10 and 13 year old there and were a little scared walking up to the place since the huge Sapphire sign was screaming at us "are you sure you wanna take your kids here?".  Answer: YES, YES WE DO. They have a kids menu and the server was more patient than I've ever been with my OCD and ADHD 10 year old.  So don't shy away from this place because you have kids.  Second, BEST FLAN EVER! Got the free flan with Yelp check in deal, and I'm really glad I did. Although this may be a crack dealer trick because now I'm going to have to go back there every time I'm in Vegas to get that damn flan. I believe the chef said it was his grandmother's recipe and it was awesome. It's got a very creamy texture as opposed to the usual vanilla jello stuff I get everywhere else.  Third, I've read some concerns over the salsa here.  Not sure if that's just an old review and things have changed since then or what, but they gave us 3 different salsas to choose from and all of them were very good.  The two more mild salsas weren't that hot at all, but very tasty.  The habanero salsa, too hot for my weak butt, but I'm assuming it's right up your alley if you like your salsa spicy.  Fourth, I wish I was a local.  This place has great locals deals on Monday (everything half off), and Thursdays (all you can eat street tacos and draft beer $20). They get pretty packed for those nights, so either go off peak or make a reservation.  Lastly, the service was really very good. Like I said before, our server was very good and awesome with our kids. The chef came out at one point and spent a good 5-10 minutes just talking with us about the food, our visit to Vegas, and future visits. I believe the manager also came over to check on us as well.  All around you could tell they were making the effort to make sure everyone was having a good dining experience.    -If you're going to Sapphire anyways...GO HERE -if you're a local...GO HERE (especially Mon or Thur) -if your visiting and want something off the strip and different...GO HERE -if you enjoy a creamy, custard-like flan in your face hole...GO HERE  Thanks for a great night out for my family.  You totally earned this rave review.

tbgV61pHVk1w5x-uJVzD9g.text: So far the best Mexican food I have had in Vegas. Margarita on point and the table side Guac was made to a tee. Great work guys keep it up.

X4YTFBCTdrxWqtb3SdxJ3w.text: Food was so yummy. I ate here last august. It was surprise to find such great taste nearby. Food here is authentic from different parts of Mexico. Quality of food is just out of world. Jalapeno margarita was really good.

TgsRkm2b6qNcdMLXauBVGA.text: Great service again veggie burrito delicious mahi tacos delicious flan delicious. Open 24 hours a day.

FmlBGP9maXreyzwC6pa5eg.text: I've been waiting to try this place since I saw their episode on Taco Trip. The problem was that I live in Florida. Work brought me to Vegas this week so I had to make this meal happen. Absolutely amazing. From the salsa to the flan everything (including the service) was right on. I have two days left here and I mighty have to make it back one more time before I leave. Don't miss this place if you're in Vegas and you love Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tacos

ITKNcZ763Pujnk6A8fnLIg.text: The location of this restaurant is awesome! It is right next to Sapphire!!!! ....... That is a plus, right?  When I got here, I thought we would be eating inside Sapphire, so I was going to turn around to find somewhere else. I like strip clubs, but I was not sure if I wanted to eat while watching strip shows..? But, El Dorado Cantina is just next to Sapphire, not inside Sapphire.   All servers were nice and helpful. I thought the interior is kind of confusing. It looks like it wants to look fancy, but it looks odd. Also, multiple large TVs add a sport bar feeling... It is pretty chill though. The food here is just ok. 3 tacos are $13, and Burittos are about $15+. But hey, you are in Vegas. Everything is overpriced, and you should be either too drunk or hyped to care about that, right?

w4-DZsHrdRLYrSQMzVJ-MA.text: Firstly, we went here because we saw this place on an episode of "Taco Trip"  Las Vegas. Food is kinda pricey, but I'll pay for good food. I got the grilled steak fajitas and they were delicious. The meat was perfectly cooked and flavorful. It was a very generous portion as well, but then again for $24 if should be. On the scale of 1-5, the fajitas were a 5. My mother got the street tacos and although she didn't hate them she wasn't impressed. Her exact words were "I'm not dying to go back".  I on the other hand will be returning. Also, I think the fact that food is non gmo and organic is a hella plus for me.

SL2p7Ku5YnQU5N84xgTsRg.text: This place rocks! Make sure Amber is your server- great recommendations and attentive service!  Chef Paco is a sweet and talented chef! Sharing his love through the food is evident!  Open 24/7, good music, healthy choices, attentive servers...one couldn't ask for more!

O6jF4lS59yRE26qnrnR7Qw.text: I still love the food here but seriously, 50% of the time the service is HORRIBLE, even when the restaurant is half empty.

VsJ1p25INd43vQIfBBV41Q.text: I've loved everything I've ever had here! Lobster tacos, the steak and shrimp fajitas and even the beans n rice! Excellent service and fresh ingredients!

MPdJpHCfFaFG4B9JYpWorw.text: OMG seriously, where do I start? Amazing staff: Martine, Eddie and Chef Paco looked after us first class! Food was incredible, fresh, light but very seriously sized! I'm gluten free but I had unmatched range of different dishes to chose from. Easily the best food I had so far during this trip to US. My little boy fell asleep and Martine arranged a taxi for us without even me asking. Please open a branch in SF and hopefully see you soon!

qprvEFXSTtX08JKOhJ7cwQ.text: What a great experience and fantastic food!!! Martine Jordon was awesome!! The service top notch!!! We will back for sure

H2oWcUxfcdxWhSW-HVKe2w.text: Really nice surprise, this place. Came here on a whim based on other Yelper's reviews so we expected a decent experience however they really exceeded our expectations.   The Tableside Guacamole is spot on - great ingredients simply prepared - we consumed every last delicious bit.   Everything ordered was well balanced, flavorful, and a real value. But our experience was really made memorable, as all are, by the attentive but not clingy service. A nod to Tiffany at the bar who is very capable and clearly cares about her customers.   It is next to a strip club which is not our thing but they are a separate business so do not let that dissuade you.

2TaZ_GUhviIikEvMKozo8A.text: Executive Summary ***The best Mexican food in Las Vegas*****  We live in Southern California where Spanish is the official second language (if not first), and we have yet to find a restaurant this delicious!  Of all places, we find our favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.  Imagine that.  We were initially attracted by the numerous reviews written, and after eating there once we understood why.  Chef Paco brings generations of passion for Oaxacan cuisine to this fine establishment.  He is not only talented, sources none GMO ingredients, but also one of the friendliest and humble Chefs I've met.  He is genuinely interested in how he can better your dining experience.  For that, I would give him more stars if yelp allowed.    Drinks: We enjoyed the "fresco" of the day.  Jamaica is my favorite.  Their alcoholic menu was tempting though...  Appetizer: queso fundito (three cheeses baked in a skillet) is enough for 4 people to share.  The guacamole made table side is also good.  The table next to us, all men, really enjoyed the view when the waitress was smashing the fresh avocados. ;). Again, good size to share.    Entree 1: mole--three sauces simmered for 6+ hours.  It's flavored with spice so if you can't handle it, order something else.   Entree 2: chile relleno--vegetarian's Dream come True.  The cilantro rice also has good flavor and is very buttery.  If you are not too hungry they also have street tacos and Tortas (aka: Mexican hamburgers).  Dessert: flan (grandma's recipe) was creamy and the best I had!  I also saw other delectable choices such as fried ice cream and churros.  Next time....  This is now on our "must visit" list when in Vegas.  We will definitely be back!  Thank you Chef Paco for bringing world class Mexico cuisine to Las Vegas, just open a few more in southern California now will you please?  Tip: it's right next to Sapphire strip club (practically sharing the same wall) so park in the same parking lot and you will see the restaurant!  Makes for a convenient excuse for those men who's wives are GPS tracking them...  "what? Honey? Oh no you are mistaken, I'm eating awesome Mexican food, not at the strip club."    As the church lady would say, "how convenient."  ;)  Tip#2: open 24 hrs!

X6sR4_FbJ2sw8FIQMM54Sg.text: Great Mexican food ....non GMO @ Organic ingredients drew us here as well as positive Yelp reviews . We ordered the veggie burrito and veggie tacos served with excellent cilantro rice . Our waiter Francisco made us table side guacamole and provided us with professional friendly service ....I 100% recommend this to anyone wanting excellent Mexican food and friendly service.

h81c-ac5-0z98uN4w_Xuvw.text: The food was simply amazing very traditional very very very good Chris was our waiter and he was excellent and save room for the fried ice cream
