QE2ZKMNNYLKABNJLlLHgHw.text: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants! Service, food quality and prices are top notch. Our sever Enrique went about and beyond to ensure we had a fantastic dining experience.

Gmy9bo2hg9k7FoxLkDPR-A.text: Came out on national taco day. The place was packed. I had the street tacos and they were very good. the rest of the food looks delicious. The service was ok. I sat at the bar and the beer and the service was good.

IZ7ijGZx9daHTzjhp0AoBg.text: My husband travels to LV frequently and promised us the best Mexican food!  We were not disappointed we had table side made guacamole, watermelon and jalapeno margaritas.  I had the shrimp and rice plate, my guys had the carne Asada platter, and one mahi bowl.  Everything was amazing and even my empty legged sons were filled.  We finished with mouth watering flan!  Emily our waitress was so helpful!  10/10 will return!

lG4uvoGxb23eW3AhKsTmLw.text: I just had an unbelievable meal here. I saw the chef on Chopped and tracked down his restaurant when I arrived in Vegas. Mole sampler plate was to die for and the lime cured wild shrimp with habanero was a great start to the meal. The staff is terrific here and took great care of me. I'll be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-PWZfTF3CdSDnl6rI5g44A.text: So I came here since a good friend referred me to it. The restaurant has been open for 2 months so fairly new. Love the restaurant ambiance, dim lighting, sugar skulls, very comfortable seats, big tv's for the bar, and great selection of tequila.   We sat down at the bar and had Jessy as our server/bartender I believe. Very knowledgeable, we came in for happy hour which is 3-6 pm, $1 street tacos , 3 dollar domestic beers, 4 dollar imports, and 4 dollar well drinks. All beers are in bottle, no draft beer here.    They ask you if you would like any chips and salsa they give you 3 types of salsa mild, med, and hot. All 3 were very good. For the tacos I had 1 of each they have 5 types. Top 3 are the Carnitas, alpastor, and cochinito. Get those 3 and you will be extremely happy, especially paying 1 dollar each. The Margarita was decent but not bad.    We got 7 street tacos, 1 domestic beer, 1 margarita, beans and rice and only paid 19.47 so yeah I definitely think this place earns 5 stars.

9PmJ62DoC-XL4o9y_uqDpg.text: Finally .... A place I can go eat at and NOT get sick. :) Wow!!! So impressed with this place! Seen it on a friends news feed & the Non GMO is what caught my attention. I am a vegetarian with celiac 's also , so to see they had a gluten free , vegetarian menu on top of non GMO was a jackpot! We have needed a place like this in Vegas . I really hope they do well & stay open . My only fear is the location . Not so convenient for the locals.   The Food was delicious ! I had the veggie tacos , my Aunt had shrimp taquitos , cousin had carne  Asada tacos , mom had the breakfast fried eggs & beans plate (can't remember name) . We also had the flan & fried ice-cream . EVERYTHING was amazing. . All the meat is hormone free also . If you don't know much about organic , non GMO food ... Do some research ! This is NOT easy or cheap to do.. It is not the most convenient either . For them to have a great menu with these wonderful options at great prices is incredible . Now to the service ... Holy smokes , our waiter was so friendly & educated on all their food & different diet needs . His name was Kai and I would request him for sure .He also happened to be an assistant manager. Then another assistant manager (Arianna) came to our table to introduce herself & see how the service was. After that , the Chef himself (Chef Paco) wanted to see how we enjoyed the food , then brought us a free sample of the flan. . Such nice people & such a cute place . The only negative thing I can say is it's next to a strip club & not in a great part of town .  Excited to go back !

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NylP29M8_EDdRugMLRj2zQ.text: Want to say food was just ok and service was the worst I've ever had in Las Vegas history won't go into details but they did try to fix the bill but not to my satisfaction maybe they had a bad night which happens but I will say try with caution

MS667BaJRZfYP06A0CmuPQ.text: My man Rafael on deck!! Probably the best bartender I've ever had!! The best drinks and amazing food!!  We Appreciates great service like yours!! Thank you my friend!!

TZyzStM3FZl5C9h_TAPmgQ.text: Never, have I EVER had better Carne Asada. If you like authentic Mexican cuisine and you DON'T c ome here...it is your loss. THIS CHEF KNOWS WHAT HE IS DOING.  And, it's like 4077th  MASH....Best Care Anywhere...Melany was the perfect hostess/manager. Don't waste time elsewhere, you really want to eat here.

Twz6AWOjHAr_2ODsAM095Q.text: Hands down best Mexican food in Vegas.  Chef Paco is amazing! This is the second time we've come here and we will definitely be coming back! All we can talk about when we get home to Modesto is coming back here!

wGqC72ccH7QHe87kFbqqGg.text: Mexican restaurant with some personality (including its location attached to Sapphires) haha. The only reason I came across El Dorado is due to its proximity to my workplace, and I'm glad I did.   The street tacos are amazing! Authentic, fresh and delicious. You can choose from a variety of meats including al pastor, carnitas, carne, pollo, and more. Think traditional Mexican restaurant-sized portions too so you might have leftovers. Shoouulddd have leftovers I should say...  I'm a sucker for corn elote and I'm glad I ordered it because it didn't disappoint. Also, Vegas locals get half off on Mondays (maybe just for lunch, call and verify). When we went, a Yelp check in also meant for a large, free churro dessert. Yes please.   After coming here a few times, a common thread seems to be slow service, especially for lunch in an area common for businesses. But hey, can't say I won't be back!

Aq2eLkp88NJt3m2v_qfxIw.text: The Shrimp tacos are amazing and the staff is super friendly and the service is awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The shrimp tacos!

tUt-MgMwBIiAMZ2x1IN5Cg.text: I had a small, very quick wedding last weekend with less than 20 of my closest family and friends. I had very high hopes for this place to be our post-ceremony dinner after researching and reading positive reviews. They were very sweet and accommodating leading up to the night but sadly, I was dissapointed.  We were placed in a back room I'm assuming due to the size of our party. The room was hot and had zero music or atmosphere to it. I thought it would have more personality and it was a let down. Our drinks took almost 30 minutes to arrive, I think only about 4 of us ordered a cocktail, the rest were bottles of beer. It took about 30 or 40 minutes for our food orders to be taken and at that point everyone was restless and started to order their drinks directly from the bar. From what I recall, it wasn't slammed or crazy busy in the front of the restaurant so that was unfortunate. The few people who ordered food didn't have any complaints about taste or quality so I gave them a star for that (hoping nothing was tampered with). I had wanted to try their cocktails more than anything but couldn't see holding my group back to wait another 30 minutes to be served.   My biggest regret was my father spending around $500 here and everyone getting the terrible service that they did. I don't know if the server was the issue or if management set her up for failure by assigning her other tables AND a large party but regardless, it was the downfall of my wedding weekend :(

pd6FvKd5aWr8x4CNVVHiaA.text: Liz our waitress at the bar was amazing!!! She makes a killer margarita. This is the BEST Mexican food in Las Vegas. Everything we've had here is amazing. We would always get the fajitas but we've recently been hooked on the carnitas burrito. Literally the best burrito I've ever had. Also, their happy hour is great. $7 margaritas!

zIgJTyTVckmMb-kQMHkv9A.text: We found this restaurant on yelp and we decided to try it based off the reviews and when we first pulled up we weren't sure if it was the Safire strip club or a restaurant because the strip club is right next to it lol. After we walked in it's a beautiful decor and the front hostess was very nice. Once we ordered our waiter Shawn was only seen while taking our order then he was MIA the whole time we were there!! The guy who brought out our plates hands them to be burning hot and doesn't even think to tell me that SMH! Then we were never offered refills or asked if we needed anything. The hostess was running around to help tables and everyone as much as she could bring one person instead of the waiters doing there job! ZJNw334uzdja5vylD_sc7g.text: The restaurant is next to a strip club so we were very hesitant to try it but the review was really good that we went ahead and tried it. bC1V-ZtsVWuCaUs2BbbmeQ.text: Came here after seeing an ad on a billboard and decided to come here, and we were not disappointed at all! SO GOOD!!! Service was amazing and Jeffery was incredibly helpful, friendly and funny! Best Mexican food we have ever had. We would definitely recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Steak Fajita Platter! HUGE portion and so fresh.

XKjvms7X8T9ovobRM8MmWg.text: We came here for lunch last week on a Monday.  I had heard about El Dorado for years but never made it in. It is a Mexican restaurant that's attached to sapphires gentlemen's club right off of the strip. There is a separate entrance so you don't have to go the same way as the Gentlemans club doors.  First impression was it was really nice inside- the decor looks a bit like old Vegas with red walls and dark leather seats, but really clean and nice. It's kind of in a U-shaped with a bar in the middle area.  We were seated immediately and given menus which had quite a good selection of Mexican food. I will say that this is pretty Mexican food and not authentic Mexican good.  Also, it is very overpriced. 3 tiny street tacos a la carte were $15.  There were four of us in our party and we all ordered. We did get the tableside guac which was OK. There wasn't that much seasoning to it so it was a bit bland.  Our food came out and everything looked good, presentation is definitely important to the kitchen. One person had the fish tacos which they said were mediocre, other person had some other seafood taco which they said were also mediocre. My husband had some taco plate which he said was just okay. I had veggie tacos which were also mediocre LOL. All in all, the food here was mediocre, but the prices were definitely high. Don't get me wrong, I get that you can charge a lot for food when you're located next to a nudey bar because drunk guys coming to eat off their buzz will spend their money on food.  I don't think that I would go back, only because there are good Mexican food options that are  a lot better all over this town.

g2tshUiZxY2AI0ldA4ephQ.text: All the high reviews cause they give everyone a free desert. Food was aight. But not the best Mexican food I've ever had. Everything was fair. But the carnitas was made a in a crock pot.

NABFv2q2otn_M4XMntCIzw.text: Great food! The homemade chips are perfectly crispy and salty.   We ordered:  Shrimp tacos - Great texture, crispy shrimp but slightly on the sweeter side.   Carne Asada Platter - Tender steak with crispy edges. The rice was out of this world, perfectly buttery   Steak Fajitas - Good report from those that ordered it!    The food was amazing, and great presentation as well.   Good ambience and decor! Thanks for the great service Jess!

ksR6KFcURY4EQxpo-CY_4w.text: Not gonna lie...when I can't remember the biz name, I call it "Stripper Tacos".  Yes, the front door is to the left of the strip club entrance.  It's really the perfect spot if you look at it from a business point of view....drunk guys who have enough $$$ left can find a great meal just a few stumbling steps away.   We went for a late night meal so it was nice the place wasn't packed.  I had the pozole and it was amazing.  Service was also top notch.  Will be returning with a large group in their back party room and looking forward to trying some more options from the menu.

rpD63ssApW8qZgTHt-N0YA.text: WOW this place is a hidden gem! Don't be alarmed that it shares the same parking lot as Sapphire nightclub. That's Vegas for you!  I was looking for a good Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas and this was such a better option in comparison to El Gordo. My recommendation is to eat at the bar because you will be in good hands with Ivan or Aaron. Hands down, they are the best bartenders/waiters! They will give you the best laughs to end a long work day 100 times better.  They also recommended to order the imperial shrimp,  seafood enchiladas, carne asada plate and any of their tacos a la carte, which were all fantastic recommendations and was a good amount of food for 3 people. We did family style and shared so we could try a little bit of everything. The dishes were all so delicious but the seafood enchilada was probably my favorite. We got the flan for dessert and it was a yummy nightcap to end the meal. I am so glad I found this restaurant because I will definitely come back!

jJ2zZ-bo6xGsriPPlBShRQ.text: While staying in vegas on business friend and I started craving some mexican food.  I yelped what was in our area and chose this place.  As maps got us to our destination we were laughing because it took us to the parking lot of a gentlemens club.  After asking someone though he pointed out the restaurant litterally right next the the club. It was sorta camoflauged by plants.   Really nice atmosphere inside.  Was immediately greeted and seated and brought drinks including water.  Camille was our server and she was super cute and very hospitabiltle.  We both ordered the carneasada rajas burrito (mine chimichanga style and wet).  OMG were we floored by the taste.  This was litterally the best burrito of my life.  We both enjoyed it.  It came with cilantro rice which was cooked perfectly as well. I added a little of their green sauce which I could have drank from the bowl it was so good.  I visit vegas about 3 times a year since my son lives there.  Going forward this will be someplace I visit as well!  I highly recommend it!

KnP2kTDIswz0p1VefYkH0A.text: Return visit delicious food courteous staff.great atmosphere away from crowded strip .Thank you Camille and thank you Paco

I will be back and with friends!   I got the carnitas, carne Assad and al pastor all where great! And only $3.50 on happy hour

0xn4Gpu4fa9Uk8pquwj3YA.text: I have been wanting to try this place for so long and it did not disappoint. The inside is really nice and the service at the bar was excellent. Immediately we received a complimentary basket of chips and salsa - both red and green salsas were great. Ordered up Carne Asada Street Tacos plate with added cilantro rice and beans and a Carnitas Street Tacos plate. They stuff these Street Tacos! So much food. The bartender said the cilantro rice was really good and normally I think that rice can only be so good - it's rice after all, but IT WAS! So delicious and the texture of it was great. I didn't have room for any dessert but next time I will order something smaller so I can taste the flan.

Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 Carne Asada Tacos

PBU38WyfOcR9NOWWes9EJA.text: I had the worst experience here the other night unfortunately. It was late hours after midnight . Me and my people decided to check it out due to the high ratings and reviews. The service was HORRIBLE. The food was ok but the service man was something else. Our waitress would get lost and not check On us. Everything we needed we got from the bus boy who was busting his ass off.

yh25VEhLWEGeiLCg7V1Qgw.text: I'm a Mexican food snob. I love it and could eat it 7 days a week. Therefore I'm always looking for super Mexican places. El Dorado Cantina is one of the best in Las Vegas. I had their chicken in a cream sauce with chipotle and it was extremely good. The mushed is black beans lacked much flavor and were a little starchy, they needed some salt. Imagine, anything that isn't over salted? What a rarity that is. The rice with cilantro was an amazing surprise. I usually don't eat this rice but this rice was really, really good. My wife had enchiladas and they were good, two thumbs up. My first judgement of a Mexican restaurant starts with the salsa and this salsa was definitely in the upper level. I know there a lot of 5 star ratings but I couldn't go there because my chicken was a little ( note I said "little") over cooked and the black beans could have been a little more flavorful. My final comment is that I would not hesitate to go to the El Dorado Cantina. I can't imagine someone not liking this place.  One final comment mentioned by others, this place is in the same building as a "gentlemen's club." That creates no problem as the entrances are completely separate. The only thing to note is the gentleman's club signage is dominant so just follow your gps.

AYg5HXL1DoT3El35ts6-cw.text: Found this restaurant with my wife late night, our waitress Stella took care of us to the maximum capacity and suggested superb meals for us. Amazing service, great food, tasty drinks and awesome recommendations. Try the flan, it is amazing!  Looking forward to our next meal here.

HJel--PoaucsgFhvUqK2VA.text: Welcome to the best Mexican restaurant in the valley.   Between Chef Paco and the fantastic staff, the outstanding food, and the surprisingly convenient location... this is not a place to skip.   I've been to El Dorado Cantina a few times and each time is better than the last. A few of my favorite things:  - carnitas torta - pupusas - tres leches cake  I've had cartinas tortas before and tres leches cakes elsewhere, but the pupusas were next level. I recommend each of these things regularly and never regret it.   Kudos to Chef Paco for bringing Mexican food to a great restaurant in the valley, I'll be back!

26xMsK5i0J52rtDWzVJwmw.text: What a great place to eat good atmosphere and great food Camille was a wonderful waitress and we all enjoyed ourselves.

sAl_Ms0psswM1Rkmw4blrw.text: El Dorodo Cantina for the first time tonight. Heard they had amazing tacos so I had to try. Located literally right next door to the spearmint rhino gentleman's club. Open 24hours and man these tacos are good! Fresh and organic ingredients and it shows in taste. I went with the carne asada and the meat was very flavorful. I'm usually a more american lettuce and cheese kinda guy, but this fresh guacamole, lime, cilantro mixture was really good. Also almost passes on the free chips and salsa and so glad I got talked into it. This maybe my new favorite restaurant salsa! Not to chunky and very flavorful.

msH5JIRs7tWYJOztGSbkwg.text: Masterful Mexican Cuisine. All sustainably sourced. In a super adorable ambianc.  (Next to a Strip Joint, but that ADDS so much character!) Table side Guacamole.  Must Have. Cochanita Tacos... just heavenly... moist, and bursting with flavor. Mexican Street Corn off the husk... YES!  roasted, smokey, lime, creamy sin in bowl. Erika our waitress was FANTASTIC!  She was a lovely as can be and professionally guided us through the menu to make the perfect choice for our meal. Oh... and the Flan.  Even if you are stuffed, you MUST have this.  It is perfection. I'm a local.  this is one my favorite Restaurants in Vegas.  I highly recommend.

lY937QZ6ex1UZH_j2C47bA.text: These place is a Mexican food lovers dream! The atmosphere is trendy with a Spanish chic feel! The walls are polyester satin with buttons embedded! I ordered shrimp  tacos with cilantro/lime rice. The rice is mouth watering, literally! I had the fried ice cream  for dessert. It was another great choice. Melts in your mouth. Delicious amount of cinnamon, fruit, flakes and whip cream. My friends ordered the carne asada plate, she ranted and raved about it. The queso chorizo dip sizzler was pipping hot and delicious! Erika our waitress was amazing! She was very attentive to our needs and her hand made guacamole was purely scrumptious!

JS_7iQ6rwbaDQpsLbNCh6Q.text: Coming from a Hispanic culture I am very pick with my Mexican food... but the food was delicious!! Service was great and very friendly! They checked up constantly although the food took a very long time to arrive... but over all I would strongly recommend when in Las Vegas!! Try the nachos they are fantastic!!

hLGhNF612JRy6bXvi_brcQ.text: I came here with my husband for his birthday we had table side guacamole which was very good! My husband has the chicken Fajitas and I had a veggie and cactus taco. My husband enjoyed the fajitas, it was a large portion, I enjoyed my veggie taco. I did not enjoy my cactus taco at the texture was very slimy but the manager came over and took it off my bill which I appreciate. The big downer is we both had stomach aches later that night and all day most of the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fajitas
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie taco and Cactus taco

Ddmz9Mi9aNvIi407qyqjeA.text: As a Vegas local for 12 years, El Dorado Cantina is my go to for the best Mexican in town including an amazing organic menu with gluten free options and  the freshest organic guacamole made table side.  Ask for Jessica her service is the finishing touch!

jctd7gOVea_HyuaBc1FYpg.text: Ok so I've been here twice now and both times we were blessed with the same server. Super nice lady named Stella that works a perfect balance of being attentive without being intrusive. The food here is excellent so the stars are deserved for that alone but the service just puts the cherry on top of it. Both times I've had the cheese enchiladas and we also ordered the table side guacamole. My friend and fellow comedian Steven Roberts ordered the corn this most recent time and it was AMAZING and a big enough portion that combined with our respective meals it was plenty to share between me, Steven and his husband. I can't remember what all they had because my head was buried in my own plate. While Stella was making the table side guacamole we were able to chat and that was great too. Again a great balance of personable without being overly personal. Between the food and Stella this place really is tough to beat. Originally when I was told that the restaurant was on the same property as Sapphire Gentlemen's club I though the food would be overpriced and the patrons would be frat guys, NOT the case. Good ambience and mostly just seemed like people that wanted to have a relaxed dinner at very reasonable prices. I'd definitely recommend El Dorado, and Stella, to anyone. Not sure of her exact schedule but we've been in graveyard Sunday nights on both visits. If you're thinking about it, GO FOR IT!!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red and green AKA Christmas enchiladas.

GuWTmx6QFCWY8KGVVAbdtg.text: Once again, this place was amazing. Chef Paco came out and told us about the menu and what new items were there.  Everything from the main courses to the rice (seriously, get the rice) are amazing. I am not kidding when I say we go to this place every time we were are in Vegas. Sometimes every day we are there. Great for small and large groups.

PMhbmzc-xXRNgPkwRH9f-Q.text: Service was great, the waiter was very friendly and helpful, and also very funny. The food was delicious and didn't take long, the drinks were a welcome remedy to a hectic day, would highly recommend this restaurant.

ZH-FBPxW261ggKHN0iaxqw.text: Visiting Las Vegas from Massachusetts. This restaurant was a comfortable walk from circus circus were I was staying. The atmosphere was nice with sports on the television if you enjoy that.  Ordered the vegetarian burrito which came with cilantro lime rice.  Food was delicious. Burrito was very filling. Received a free flan for checking in, also quite good and I'm not usually a fan of flan.  Server was hospitable, might be new he looked a little nervous but was friendly and quick with our order.  Chef came out to check on our table and to deliver the flan.  Overall I would definitely return to this restaurant if I'm back in town and highly recommend it.  Food was priced fairly (on the higher side if your on a budget) but the taste and service brought everything together.

KPLqFabhWX0S9rp4C2z9nQ.text: Our favorite spot in Las Vegas--fresh, GMO free, delicious food and incredible staff. Try the veggie bowl, mole sampler, or the fajitas, with generous portions you could easily share.

jmtwqR_3yNi6UZx3gHE_Ug.text: Maria is an amazing friendly and bubbly server. The food is dope.  Guac is amazing. The margaritas are only meant to be ordered by the pitcher. Love it here.

re1_iVQRKwdr05is0mtKeQ.text: Ok, so let's get this out of the way, this place was way OVERPRICED. Twenty-four dollars for a dinner plate of pork rice and beans? It's more expensive than WEST LA. What is the justification for this price? Even with the free FLAN (The highlight of the night), it should have been less than $20 dollars.  I got the Pork Carnitas. The meat was very juicy and tendor, but came out only slightly warm. The side chips came with three type of salsa, but the chips were STALE and cold. Definitely the disappointment of the meal. Chips should be hot, fresh off the oven. If they are not, then just warm them up slightly. It was luke cold!  The black bean side was warmed up in the microwave I could tell simply because the outside was colder than the inside. I HATE when restaurants microwave their food. If I wanted a microwave, I'd would have bought some SMART ones, which ain't so SMART, and just nuke it myself.  Side rice was just ok, alongside the pickled vegetables.  The Flan was absolutely excellent. The highlight of the night, and a must have. You get one for free with your meal when you check into yelp  It is this critics opinion that he judges this place perhaps more harshly than it needs to be because he lives in Las Angeles, which has the greatest Mexican food in the world arguably.   3/5

j4iYttiIRXna5nZQkGQXHQ.text: Excellent service and delicious food! Very authentic Mexican food.  Margaritas are yummmo

xRp8DCWcEET8v1eQXBWQvg.text: It must go to for dinner every time we go to Vegas.  I am from Los Angeles where Mexican and Latin restaurants are plentiful but we don't have a unique fair like El Dorado that I have yet discovered.  Not a fan person but....El Dorado's flan is so delicious I can't get enough!  Try the platter with three different types of Mole.  Incredible.  Just be sure to ask for extra tortillas.  It can feed four if you go to El Dorado's happy hour first.  Oh and the happy hour, great margaritas!  I just notice that five months ago the margaritas were larger though.  You get three amazing level of salsas with chips.  Son miss and don't let the Sapphire Gentlemen's Club scare you away.  They share parking. Bon appetit!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying another amazing happy hour.  Bartenders are awesome!

HS9__dcDt7rCPfmgjgbXtw.text: Best Mexican food I have ever had. Unbelievably good. Go there now. We had the medium feast dinner. Outstanding food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1uk9K8CllzApocQBRq-UCg.text: Great food and service. I had the mole. Enchiladas and they were delicious. Our server Danny was awesome. I highly recommend this restaurant.

X0nnFwkxOUDrhyUxjMx8vA.text: This is my first time at this spot, my friend and I came and we loooooooovvvvveeeee it!!! the ambiance is chill, the rice is freaking amazing! we both had chicken enchiladas which were amazing!!! just a hint of heat. it's clean, the servers are attentive and friendly! Paco the chef brought up some flan himself! he's pretty awesome . definitely will be back the next time I'm in town . Don't leave vegas without checking this place out .

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchiladas
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QzrRClLPz00jBOqMkUYO9g.text: First time here. Ericka took really good care of us. Food was delicious! Came with the kids mid afternoon, not too many people here. Fajitas were yummy.  Order the nachos topped with steak for the win!

QPXM_MXn00BwATnC6oxESA.text: Back again! This place never disappoints. We had our wedding reception here a few months ago and had to come back. We were only here in Las Vegas for the weekend but managed to come eat here twice. Our waitress Erika was very sweet. Thanks. Will be back!

AdeDhBuQ4VmsWSwOr9q2iQ.text: Wife had the chipotle chicken. I had the beef enchiladas. We shared the guacamole which was prepared table side by Lindsey our server from absolutely fresh Ingredients including fresh garlic. We shared a tres leche for dessert. The meat was flavorful. The dishes had great seasoning . The service was fabulous. The place is offstrip and although $82 for two, it was a great value compared to the strip. One unnerving thing to mention is that when you pull up to the place you sign to a gigantic strip club. Rest assured the restaurant had a completely separate entrance and had a great family feel.

rqKgDpE-U09_q8MMoharEw.text: What an incredible restaurant.   My family tends to seek out the best Mexican restaurants wherever we are, and this is definitely it in Las Vegas. The location is definitely odd, but the inside is incredibly inviting.  The food is fantastic. From the different salsas to the fried ice cream, El Dorado Cantina has not disappointed me. I love the carne asada burrito; I crave it. The steak is definitely the best out of chicken, shrimp, and steak, but they are all good. The chef regularly comes into the dining room to greet the guests, and he is incredibly friendly. It really makes dining here a special experience.   This is my idea of a hidden gem in Vegas, and I certainly hope more people are able to discover it.

7h_EoPQh-9HDrzQvEmUgRQ.text: Food and strippers in the same place? He'll yeah... Jk on the strippers. But hey if you like that no judgement haha. Anyways I've been wanting to try this place for a really long time so finally today on a very random night we decided to go. And well because there wasn't many places open that late. We were greeted by a man at the door who gave us the option to sit at a table or the bar since they had happy hour going on. We didn't want to drink so we sat in a table. Right away he brought us chips and salsa which we enjoyed a little too much as they were gone before our food came out. Huge mistake because I was so stuff by then. I usually don't like to eat meat, but because this place is organic and GMO free I was perfectly okay with it. I had the street tacos. 1 alpastor, 1 cochinita and 1 rajas. All accompany by rice and beans. I loved the tacos! The cochinita had purple onions with habanero omg really good kick. The alpastor were good and sweet from the pineapple. The rajas were okay. My boyfriend had their carne Asada plate and he loved it! I tried a piece of it and it really was delicious. To finish off we had their flan. Ohhhmmgeeeee it was so bomb! So rich and creamy at the same time. Our server was named Charles and he was amazing! Really nice and was on top of everything. Over all I had zero complaints about this whole place. Definitely coming back next week, and I am bringing the parentals.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Street tacos and Carne Asada plate.

Msw046puIcEg0X_DMUYxkg.text: Chef Paco is THE BEST! Seriously, a non-GMO, organic Mexican restaurant that isn't hippy/hipstery and delivers above and beyond on flavor and authenticity. Chef Paco brought his family's recipes straight from Mexico City and you can taste it in every bite. This isn't your average Mexican restaurant.   Don't be sketched out by the fact that it shares a building with Sapphire. You won't even know you're next to a strip club once inside. The decor is beautiful and the food is out of this world. It's also a great value! Do yourself a favor: get off the strip and try this NOW. Your wallet and taste buds will thank you. Even the rice and refried beans have a unique flavor!   We look forward to coming to El Dorado the minute we start planning every Vegas vacation! Wish we had one in Tampa!!

zKuE85xXX8UbyixA71UlsQ.text: Excellent place, it seems sketchy being right next to sapphires, but it's really family friendly environment, nothing that even resembles a strip club as we are not into those. But the drinks and food were great.   Victor and Joseph (two bartenders) were so nice and helpful. They really made our experience here a 5 star experience. Chef Paco was very kind and took very good care of us as well.

AJzZ1RASfVPpZZermUxw1A.text: This place is our favorite for Mexican food.  We LOVE this restaurant!!  We went tonight to take our son who lives out of town and he fell in love as well.  We had amazing food and great service..... thanks Lindsey for providing us with the best service!

cqluW8oBXZ0sF_oAEy1oAQ.text: As my friend Tony the Tiger says, "They're great!"  But seriously great chips and salsas, fantastic service and a menu that can please anyone. Was very impressed with the organic meats.

YQ7pMLD_daSA0l_Du_Cuug.text: Went out with some friends and decided to come here for some food and drinks. Located in the same building as Sapphire's, if you didn't know where it was you may get lost or drive past several times. A reservation would be a good idea on weekends for prime time dinning hours. We didn't have one but were seated right away, then the place filled right up and people were waiting. The food is Non GMO and the proteins are free from antibiotics, pesticides, and steroids. the waiter brought out some chips and salsas right away and we ordered some guacamole which is prepared tableside to you liking. I had an ear of Mexican street corn(elote) which was perfectly grilled an just enough spice along with the cheese and mayo. My entre was a mahi taco and a shrimp taco served with rice and choice of beans, refried for me. Both marinated in  citrus come with guacamole, a chipotle mayo and cabbage. The Mahi has a mango salsa while the shrimp have a pico de gallo. Both were excellent with the shrimp being my favorite of the two. We received an order of flan with our Yelp check in. It was brought out by the Chef himself and he explained that it was a family recipe and I wish he would share it. One of the best flan desserts I ever had.

SjumDb1HwBNElnwNb4aZsg.text: I love the fact that this place serves organic and non GMO food/ingredients. It used to be 50% off for locals, but it went down to 25% off and the prices kept rising it seemed like every time that I went back, but it's still great food and 25% off just for living in Las Vegas. They also started charging for things like refills on chips and salsa, which caused one of my friends to stop going. I also don't go nearly as often as I used to because of such things.

8G9i9xRA3FSekpRq5OfQOQ.text: As always the food here is great. The Jalapeno margaritas are to die for and the service was spectacular. We'll be back again.

11e6ZBhIuYwef251I4W5CQ.text: The location is right next to a strip club but don't let that stop you from coming here. The atmosphere inside is great. I love the non GMO organic ingredients. The habanero salsa is amazing. Chips are great. Although I do not usually like flan, their flan was different. It is the best flan I've ever had which was free after checking in on Yelp. The street tacos and tostaditos were outstanding with authentic flavors. The juices were refreshing and delightful. The service was great; staff friendly, courteous and attentive although busy. Overall I rate this restaurant 4 1/2 due to the location.

79t2V4xC7B8EE1L8Pf0HbA.text: Excellent. The restaurant is next to a gentleman's club, in case you think you may be lost. Margaritas are jumbo, and to die for (try the Jalapeno!) Hubby had the chicken enchiladas and I had the veggie bowl (tons of veggie, GF, vegan options). Reasonable food prices for Vegas. Service was fast and super friendly. Checking in on Yelp got us a free flan dessert that retails for $8. We had leftovers for the next day. They take reservations and we were seated pronto. So. Good.

TlWP3cIVcx68inLU6A8pUg.text: Oh no. BF and I had lunch and loved the posole and the salsa that came with the chips. Decided to host dinner with others Friday night because of their non-GMO and organic selections. We ordered the table side guacamole. ..it was terrible. The avocados tasted fresh but that was all you tasted. We asked for medium hot and it was zero hot. it had no flavor outside of the avocados. Gorditas: Bad and they charged $9! Must have had a bad day. We ordered this based on rave review of a friend. Carnitas: Very good. Jalepeno margaritas also very good. Flan was excellent. Converted a non-flan eater to fan. The other 3 in the party had burritos...all okay but not enough to go out of their way to come back.

ArL9XBOuYraiivuYYNLWVw.text: Wow, such great food and in an unassuming place ;). The pozole, flan and guacamole were absolutely amazing!  Fresh organic ingredients, great staff and cool vibe inside.

It4uQ_o7RYXCsttc9ZVuFg.text: Delicious food and good location! Best place to have fun with your friends!

SkvQvQIax7WCHkaIUfzU6g.text: Don't freak out... You are not going to a strip club. It's just right next to it.   Really great food and drinks!! I like the decor and the vibe. However they were super slow. A table of 6 took 2 hours to eat. Would be ok if drinks were flowing but those took forever too. But would go again for sure!

zGZ2JqQtoRxlnsU0O0odpw.text: What a fun and delicious place! And if you sit at the bar, consider yourself lucky if Nell, vivacious and funny, waits on you.

T6DbltzIqO9hIjvrZ28lDQ.text: NON-GMO!!!!. Not only is it chemical free it's freakin delicious!!! Don't be scared of its next door neighbor, it's well worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ztMKbkXGGcMcJf-6vdGRKw.text: My new favorite Mexican restaurant in town! Great atmosphere, great service! And food is very fresh and very tasty. You have to try El Dorado's flan. It's amazing.  Compliments to the Chef!!! I will definitely be back!!!!

_zcwsrCHV87O9M-K0_7wNg.text: This is my new favorite place. Organic, non-gmo fantastic Mexican food. We got the pozole elote and carne asada plate for two of us. We couldn't even finish it all. The prices are a little high but it's worth it. Delish

15ogxBXVv_qXdrZop4jvPg.text: Fantastic food and great selection of alcohol and our server Lindsey is excellent and went out of her way in giving recommendations.

K6xBfyN_N0mxFuqh4Nx9bg.text: I'm giving this Mexican Restaurant a 5 stars because the foods amazing fresh organic ingredients and flavors are those I will never forget for years to come. A FOODIES paradise!  Our server Enrique who was fun and excellent at his job. The inside of the restaurant was very clean and has a classy feel of high end  dinning. Make sure you take the time to sample their wonderful food before you leave Vegas and you'll probably visit it twice.

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our server. Nice outfit.

oLqMggeYzn8FopIhyc1klw.text: Excellent place to eat.  The staff is very friendly as well as the manager who checked on us a few times to make sure we we're enjoying our meal.   The food is great.   The chips and salsa is really good.  If you like spicy ask for the habanero salsa.  The carne asada and carnitas tacos are delicious that is what I ordered.   Finally to finish it off THE FLAN is the bomb!!!!!!'nn

BgmlhBFMFlI-9arKO-7TNg.text: It was ok. Big portions, but it lacked flavored. I dont know why its rated so highly. Maybe people get drunk and then go here. The tacos were ok I would pass on the queso fundido next time.

v9shfUK6rQHzqDfoCzY21w.text: The best Mexican food in Nevada!  The drinks are generous, the food sublime, the environment lively and fun a must do if you come to Las Vegas.  Enrique our server was charming and very attentive. The chef came out to meet us making us feel very special.  A five star experience!

hbY_ngN3cOjfMmvY-SKmng.text: Enchiladas and table side guacamole...everything was amazing. Server Christina was gracious and provided exceptional service.

r2GYYjkGeMtKVNyeZUi_5g.text: We were here for the annual  baker to vegas race and found this place on yelp,um YUM! the food was so tasty,the service exceptional  and the manager  (Martine )was amazing,very hands on and really wanted to make sure your visit  was the best it could be! We will see you next year!

RTslVHguT6Jzx707YeoPng.text: We have been looking for an authentic mexican restaurant in Vegas for over 16 years and we have found it! The food is just like the dishes we greatly enjoy when we are in Mexico.

33Ryoh0OVhopQ4zv_ITppw.text: Amazing food, amazing service (our waiter Kai is the best!).. Definitrly the best Mexican restaurant in Vegas and also the best compared to what we know in SoCal..! Besides, the place is very nicely decorated, good music; great Margaritas!! Everything perfect; guys keep up the great job!! We can't wait for our next time!

8fYLJ_cqtGAi-9wq-pt36Q.text: Lets put things in perspective here. The prices. The Service. The Food. High Expectations because of what El Dorado ADVERTISES.  For a Mexican restaurant the prices  are a bit high but that was the best part.  I went in early, some were just getting out of working from the club next door. 7am. I was hungry and heard great things about the food even though I been here for drinks before.  I waited 20 mins before we even got a Menu. I had to ASK. Fine. Our waiter Nick was the WORST. No expression. No recommendations. No experience or desire to be there. Daniel a pretty popular guy there I would think would have much better. FIne. Most importantly The Food. I wanted to try something one just doesn't order anywhere, the place looks nice and I ordered the mole with rice and beans. DRY Sauce, Dry CHICKEN, Barely any sauce? Like what! I asked for onions on the side and he got upset. " I can...but it will take a long time".....? Rice is all BUTTER and well Refried Frijoles is hard to mess this up.  The last draw was that it was left under the heat lamp for too Long. Keep in mind this place had maybe 5 tables at this time, no excuse for food to be left unattended THAT long.  It was terrible!  20 dollar plate for a JOKE of place that thinks its Mexican. ITS NOT. This place is a well decorated TRAP and CLEARLY underdeveloped waitstaff that in the end, the FOOD says a thousand words. I wanted to like this place my second time around but NO. You will be better off going to Roberto's at least they dont ROB you like this place Robbed the idea of a decent Mexican restaurant. I would give 0 stars if I could!

KB9i7ffxhDnmHsvWriHoTA.text: Vhalery was a fantastic server! She was attentive and made us feel right at home. She gave a us a menu tour since the menu was quite overwhelming at first. We decided on the elote and carne asada tacos. It was quite tasty! She suggested that we get our elote shaved which made it so much easier to eat and less messy. From there we tried the tres leches cake, the flan and the churros. The tres leches cake had a strong rum taste which was interesting. Other than that, everything was on point! I definitely recommend this spot!

MVDlW7J0SdzyLHrZNpT8zw.text: Let's put aside the bizarre location, the fact that you park in a strip club parking lot, and the stripper neon blue with accompanying music as you exit. The food is delicious. The menu is all GMO free and organic and it shows in the quality of food. Table side guacamole is so tasty. My son said it was the best chicken quesadilla he's ever had. My street tacos were perfect with moist and flavorful chicken. The mango margarita was on point all around. Kids are welcome (just shield their little eyes from the neighbors).

Rw8esjeIy0wdmVCkz_GO4Q.text: service is a tad inconsistent, but the food more than makes up for that.  hands down best mexican food i've ever had.  and organic to boot? yes please.  if you sit at the bar say hi to tiffany. she's the best!

BFfYCs1la5GQg6hj3rXl4A.text: I honestly love this place! Best in town! Chef Paco is great! The service is amazing thanks to Enrique and Kai!!

8EWxAONTErQ5KvGNMNG5VA.text: Let it be known I'm commenting on the street tacos only. If you're looking for a great, healthy taco look no further! Happy hour these bad boys are $1 each and it's absolutely delicious. Best carne Asada I've had in my life. Honestly if you're looking for a range of Mexican food, I can't vouch, because all I ever get here are carne asada tacos. You can't beat the price during happy hour or locals Mondays where your check is half off!

2WUSvALrvzXFtSt-gpHGaw.text: Let me start by saying the food is really great. As a vegetarian, finding a Mexican restaurant that I have many dishes to choose from is great. We started with table side guacamole and it was delicious. We followed this up with cheese enchiladas. The sauce was flavorful and had a kick. I would recommend the food to anyone. On a side note, the decor is great and the service was spot on. Kudos....

qZHu2_w4lKKgEnKw5Z6b9Q.text: A little hard to find, just know that YES, it is within the same building as Sapphires Gentlemen Club but do not worry it has its own entrance. Great food and beautiful interior, service was a little too slow for my liking though.

x5Vz3znn2yNF5LonILVj5A.text: Coming from a Hispanic background it is not that easy to find and authentic Mexican food restaurant that we like. El Dorado Cantina exceeded all our expectations, Enrique our server did absolutely amazing and was able to cater to all our needs and was knowledgable about all the food. We will definitely be coming back any day, food was so delicious!

BfhUwQ_5AQTXjlEFF2A4DQ.text: Awesome all around spot for lunch or dinner. Tacos are amazing! I love the cochinitas (pork) the best. Habanero on top makes them perfectly spicy :) Enchiladas are awesome too. Really nice staff all around. Great location near the strip and they offer take out as well.

wcgaezRRUuDB4yDYgsDIIA.text: Ashley the bartender is amazing.  The cocktails were the best I have had ever. The food is the best mexican in town. We had all the desserts and each one was better. The fried ice cream, churros & flan was by far the best. We will be back.

WuPL29CWfkCfXwcQlmizDA.text: I would absolutely recommend this place it has amazing food choices, many healthy and traditional authentic Mexican dishes to choose from all along with a great ambiance and very friendly staff I would say this is the #1 Mexican food place in Las Vegas and to make it better it is open 24/7

OySFEkTd-Rt2OLAx0KVD7w.text: I ordered Steak & Shrimp Fajitas which were tasty. They came with plenty of rice and beans on the side. Free chips & salsa were a welcomed starter. The drinks left a lot to be desired, the excuse we were given was that a new bartender just started, I had to switch over to beer. If I had to nitpick, I would like the shrimp to get some grill time to give them some smokiness, but maybe I just love grilled shrimp!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Shrimp Fajitas

cZ6tuafAWjDgfL9m2muuxw.text: Enrique is an amazing server! the table side guacamole was to die for. the Mexican chili is the best I've ever had! can't wait to come back.

GmzDsSr9EOuWElUyjcrYSA.text: El Dorado Cantina is my new favorite Mexican restaurant! The prices are kinda high, but the food quality is well worth the price! Try the taco platter, you have to ask for it!

U95MGiaqSL7pj9Nrfo7Y1w.text: So I have never written a review on yelp before but this place was so good I just had to. My wife and I were in Vegas for the weekend and went with two friends looking for some good Mexican food that wouldn't break the bank. This place had great reviews on YELP and so we were like let's do it. TRUST ME... Some of the best Mexican food I have ever had for such a good price. Please go and support this place. The owner/chef even came out an introduced himself to us and told us about his mother's recipes. Awesome. Great service. Great food. Great atmosphere. If you are staying in Vegas and don't want to eat at the expensive places at the hotels just go a little off the strip and hit this place up.

Zne8lWa0VaJGqzP6GA1eQg.text: Everything is organic here and extremely tasty.  My wife ordered the steak fajitas and the meat just melted in the mouth!  Prime quality ingredients!  I can't wait to come back here.   Our server was Juan and he was really attentive and informative about the menu.

Igt8-dRQxSUSDQt_lFIhIw.text: We enjoyed this place with two grandkids.   Chips and salsa were tasty.  C hurros were excellent with two dipping sauces.

EQ11waH6bfqbrvidJ0rS0Q.text: This place is amazing , my server Amber is really nice so she was all the time taking care of my service . Food its bomb.com

Bmpq5wK7miF4yanqpaBURQ.text: Nice Mexican restaurant delicious food I really liked my Chicken burrito with grilled chicken and my wife loved cheese enchiladas. They do need big sign to attract more customers.

c4HmI4sZPLc8Gf7QDoRHWg.text: Awesome restaurant!  Chef Paco is super cool and goes out of his way to say hi and see how we are doing.  Food is great and the value is spot on.  Don't forget to check in on yelp and get Chef Pacos Flan Dessert.  Highly recommend!

qWdLB-AvRcm3L3H61ds-cQ.text: We passed this place because it's attached to the Sapphire. When we realized where it actually was, we almost didn't go in. Surprisingly, though, almost everyone dining at ED was what I would call a "normal"--i.e., not a recent visitor to the Sapphire.  Short story: Do not be dissuaded by the Sapphire.   ED has Excellent Mexican food. We had one of each of the street tacos, as well as guacamole and a salad.  Everything was high quality, particularly the al pastor and cochinita tacos.  The chips weren't great, but otherwise, everything was very good.   For those who care, the place is very nice on the inside.  They seem to have a lot of specials--happy hour, etc--so much so that the servers forget some of them.  In fact, our $1 tacos special didn't actually make it onto our ticket.   This strikes me as the kind of place that, in a different city, might have started out as a well-loved food truck and then transitioned into a better spot than where it actually ended up. (I wish that it were in downtown, for example.) That being said, we'll definitely be back.  Chef Paco came by our table, and seemed genuinely excited about his food.  I think he has every reason to be.

xBTK7RXhQsMlDI0CglistQ.text: Talk about great food, service and atmosphere. This is hands down the most amazing quality of food and service I have received in a long time. Chef PACO, (amazing chef by the way) had cooked myself chicken enchilada's and my significant other had ordered, posole. Was delicious, tender and had all the right spices.  Not to mention the huge margaritas, with the perfect combination of salt and tequila. The food was amazing and the presentation when they brought the food and drinks out, looked out of a magazine. The quality of this restaurant and experience I had was something no other place has ever topped. Can't wait to go back and dine again.

gRGvEVSqsOYQc9jIrrRhkA.text: Love the food here!! Best kept secret in Las Vegas!! I had burrito and I wanted it wet with out hesitation my waitress made it happen. The food and service is great here!

gSA689ACoBDkNKyBUcMOnQ.text: We decided to go back to El Dorado on Father's Day because we had such a great time the last time we were here. Luckily the manager Sean recognized us from our last visit because we didn't make reservations and the place was packed. We had a drink at the bar with Omar , who made us some sweet Cadillac margs, then the next thing you know Sean has a table for us,Amazing!! Our server was Autumn and she was awesome, we promised we would spell her name right. Margaritas and apps and Mole and this and that,,, it was all awesome, at the end Chef Paco brought out an amazing Churro plate with chocolate and banana fosters sauces ABSOLUTELY AMAZING ..I feel sorry for you if don't experience the amazing food and service at The Eldo!!

V5d29Y6U_6tz3SkdRnnkxw.text: Where do I start!!! Everything was so delicious! The Mahi and shrimp tacos to the best flan ever. I am coming back tomorrow for the Chilaquiles!

CrwsWGUINBrvrdoi3vFGdQ.text: I'll just get to the point. Really good food, Great prices, Friendly staff and even the Chef came out to see how we were doing. I had the carnitas street tacos and they were bomb. Try the black beans if you get a chance. I really liked the place. I'll definitely be going back since its not too far from my location. BTW, it is located next to the Sapphires entrance.

1bU3PZJNx4zExFe-ZxPJVw.text: Place is great! Chef came out and said hello! If you are a local hit this place up on Mondays. I had the Carne Asada Burrito and it was one of the best burritos I have ever had. Chef Paco is the man!

dBBtzJlsNMmPM284ggCMyQ.text: So we visited this place about a week ago thanks to Yelp. Yes it's next to a strip club but that shouldn't stop anyone from coming here. The food and service was awesome. The corn chips and dips which came out to start tasted so fresh. The habanero one was no joke. The head chef/owner I believe came and spoke with us after our meal to make sure everything was fine. He was so excited to hear what we thought and explained all the recipes had been passed down from his mother. He was very proud of the place and so he should be. We are visitors from Australia, it's a shame we probably won't be able to go back again!

6NIjM8IoxA_1IckD7PmC7Q.text: Kudos to El Dorado for going non-GMO and organic.  You pay a premium for this so it's a bit pricey but it's an upscale venue and still well worth it.  The care they show (especially manager Kimberly) was demonstrated when our waitress noticed one of our orders was unusually dry, and they left out putting cheese on the enchilada.  Without our asking, El Dorado re-made the order (it was perfect) AND deducted it from the bill. Again, without our asking (or demanding) the credit.  We will definitely return, knowing they go that extra mile.

bNfXiFgpgf54qdfmvvdtEA.text: The salsas and chips were good. I didn't think that the food lived up to my expectations. Quality wise it was comparable to the chain Cantina Laredo.

NjEkHQIRDoAIdZqq0kOo2w.text: Went in for a happy hour wasn't super impressed.  I was left wanting to give this place another try however.  Many interesting dishes were on the menu but I was in for happy hour and taking full advantage of that.  We tried all the tacos and they were good, none made it through the massacre but one with the pickled habaneros had some left overs.  Service was great, margaritas were tasty, decor is top notch.  I rate restaurants on food so it gets 3 on what I had I will update when I return.

7vzQhjiqGDAyQUA6Eu3mzg.text: I love me some Mexican food. I have had a lot of friends tell me that this is the best Mexican food in Las Vegas, so I have to try it. Upon entering the restaurants the door is right next to the entry door for sapphires Gentlemans club. But once you're inside you don't even know or notice that your next to a strip club. so don't let that stray you away from coming here. The food was absolutely delicious, it is probably the best Mexican food that I've had in Las Vegas. Everything from the appetizers to the dinner to the dessert was amazing. The waitstaff was really nice, everything was fast, friendly, the restaurant is very clean. I will definitely be coming back here.

lU_Q_w6QsI5gFUd6QVyXVw.text: Food was acceptable, but the service was not. Wasnt even a busy night and it took nearly an hour to bring out three burritos. After 45 minutes our server claimed our food was coming out soon, then a few minutes later the manager asks us if we need anything...yea we still need our food. Another 10 minutes passes and the two tables ajacent to us (who arrived maybe 40 minutes after us) had their drinks and food already. Manager brings out our food, which is luke warm by now) does not offer an apology for the delay. Took forever to get the check, and even longer to get the receipt and go. Maybe this place has more charm when youre there for the liquor and not a meal.

HzkcYFITDarMNzVkA-Pszw.text: Hard to find place. It is in the same parking lot as the famous sapphire strip club. Free margarita was very nice. Place has a nice feel. Free chips is also very good. Veggie burrito was a little bland so you might want to ask them to put some sour cream and guac. Guac also has a lot of garlic which depends on your palette - some might like it.

yyG0jKeZoucHUwCn-8f5pQ.text: "Paco's Grandma's Flan"=Worth the flight from Seattle. I think they are really trying to make an impression. The food is great. This coming from a dude who grew up in the San Joaquin and knows what is and is not good Mexican cuisine. The place is off strip and was extremely slow on a Saturday afternoon in January. I had the carnitas torta and it was very good. It was not awesome until I added the pickled veggies on the side to the sandwich. The carnitas is sufficiently mild and flavorful that the light seasoning is probably the right approach. However, it just didn't fire all the cylinders for me until the zing of the pickled veggies (I think it was carrots, jalapenos, Anaheims, onions, and coriander greens) was added to the kit. I appreciate slow-cooked flavor and subtle fatty mild goodness but for a torta you may as well go all in. Jesse was our server and he was awesome. He took responsibility for the place and owned the experience. Congenial, professional, personal, and honest. Jesse was a lot more than I expected from the establishment connected to one of the world's largest stripper joints! This place is not to be missed. We walked there from the strip which was about a 15 minute investment just in getting there. Worth the walk and the exercise helped to ease the levity of "Paco's Grandma's Flan" which was, in all honesty, the crowning work of everything we ate while in Vegas. Get down to El Dorado people.

xaxng-ysDopuCulgiQS7_g.text: Ok holy guacamole this is my kind of place .. Seriously delicious on every level, the dishes are prepared immaculately, with every detail refined to the T , super friendly and comfortable atmosphere, I highly recommend the cactus tacos, compliments to the very cool chef who even explained how the dish was prepared with such care.. Vegan friendly for sure !

Bq1EGQKrYvEp-PbpHt9jWQ.text: This is, well, kind of in a strip club. There's a large strip club and a little sign for el dorado.  I was apprehensive at fist, but so glad we went in. Great food, reasonable prices, great drinks

C0CPKyAumSDIuYUvDpr4MA.text: Our bartender Dino, treated us like royalty... I got trio mole chicken, they were finger licking GOOD! Can't go wrong with bottomless chips and freshly made salsas either! I'll be back to try other dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at the size of this plate with corn tortilla and utensils to show how huge the plate is.

_DjJoCOf0ZafawFRLzfFvA.text: This is a tough place to review. This spot has spectacular highs and some catastrophic lows. Here goes the lot:  The best:  Service. Our server Layla was friendly, prompt, kind, and attentive. A better server could not be.   Refried beans.  Often forgettable, this side really stands out here. They're delicious.   Salsa selection. The trio of salsas are excellent.   Chile Relleno. Damn near perfect.    Flan. It's not what I would consider a traditional Flan, but it is delicious nonetheless.   So-So:  Rice: Coulda been better. Serviceable, but was served cold   Margaritas.  They're fine, but lacked spark.   The Bad:  Tacos. Yup, terrible, what they should be a highlight at was an unmitigated disaster. Cold, flavorless, dry chicken.  Tepid , boring, al pastor, and carne asada not fit for a lunch truck.  At $4 a piece, these were a terrible disappointment.   Pricing. Good Lord, one pays a hefty sum for some great to terrible food.  If you're local, Mondays are the day to come.  There's a discount that will make this restaurant a more reasonable outing.  At a reduced price tag, I would go to get the good bits, but I would not be interested in returning at full price.

t1ADFfNnePqiOk-y9_km4Q.text: The queso fundido was good ordered withthe chorizo. Aguas frescas of the day were watermelon and melon. Very delicious. i also ordered 3 street tacos asada, al pastor,  and chicken.. the asada was my favorite out of the three. but the tacos are ridiculously over priced for what they really are worth..  so in total it was 6 tacos 1 queso fundido and 2 drinks came out to 56.76. which is crazy for tacos priced at 4.50 each. out of all 6 tacos me and my gf had only asada we agreed was the only one with actual flavor. the flan was awesome. great density.

h33dkIe5ILhd7mlh5Bj6zg.text: this place is like a hidden gem in vegas. Me and my boyfriend were in town and we were looking for a good restaurant to have dinner and based on the reviews we decided to give this place a try. At first I was kind of thrown off with the location but when we opened the door it was actually a nice place. Our server was Hugo and he was amazing. He explained everything very well and we decided to go with their guacamole and chicken&beef fajita. OMG IT WAS THE BEST MEXICAN FOOD WE HAVE EVER HAD. unfortunantly we dont live in vegas but next time we are in town we will for sure stop by again. We also got a complimentary desert for checking in on yelp which was a plus. i have to tell you that even their desert was heavennn. I am so happy we chose to dine here. it can be more expensive then other Mexican restaurants but you cant find quality food like this anywhere.

ZuNdacjL3da3ToB_Omst0g.text: I have always loved dining here, but never again after today. After waiting for 50 minutes for our food we finally asked about it and got the run around. Finally the bartender who took our order came over to apologize and offered us free guacamole and said the kitchen was backed up. Which was a lie because tables seated after us had already got their food. The bartender never put our order in and rather than just apologizing and trying to make it right she sat there and lied to us. She should be drug tested for sure.

nqVfl-0qSafA3VIPv-Q0eQ.text: Amazing service and outstanding food!!! To start off we ordered imperial shrimp wrapped in bacon... Delicious. I had their sangria sweet and fruity, tasted both red and white I prefer the red!! Street tacos are very authentic and amazing!!! Tasted Asada, al pastor and cochinita with habanero sauce which were my favorite! And after reading so many great reviews about their amazing Flan. It's just that and more...Amazing!! Chef Paco you've out done yourself!! We will definitely be coming back frequently!! And to our server Jesse, thank you for your great service your the best!!! See you again soon!!!

8-Zy1ZCTChM9_9RpJuUmhg.text: We had Danny as our waiter made us some bomb guacamole. Highly recommend the "pain killer" drink !!!!

LGucQx8Ph2zTPjldetLbxg.text: Very nice and we enjoyed the singing boaters! Our waiter Rob was very attentive and the Sangria Margaritas were delicious!

pDw_JgFtq8fZChRNXjTP1Q.text: This place has a great vibe to it!! I liked the ambiance of the space. I was surprised they served crickets!! Haha. The food was alright. I probably would be back for some drinks with friends but maybe not the food.

7k8cdsNPbxVueBYC_pACIw.text: Dan Feinstein has a "fine" taste for authentic Mexican dining. Paco, Executive Chef from Mexico cooks with passion and love coming from his deep rooted background of family recipes it will make you fall in love with his food.  He cooks healthy as well quality  Non-GMO ingredients. For example, the flan is made with organic eggs and natural cane sugar.  And if you have a flare for exotic cuisine, there are sauteed grasshoppers on the menu.   The margaritas are the bomb plesantly poured by server Alcia.  Monday is 50% off for locals and Tuesday is 50% off for industry as well. There are specials throughout  the whole week!  Genius paring with the two establishments by Peter and Dan Feinstein!

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

12nhRiaHtICJmffdQte5Jg.text: One of the best meals I've had in a long time. I had the chicken enchiladas and everything on the plate was fantastic. I highly recommend coming here, you can't go wrong with anything in the menu!

--3gCyYz0Eo3r07tAvUbhg.text: Juan and Maria were awesome hosts...we enjoyed each and everything...from a veggie bowl to shrimp tacos to chicken quesadilla or burrito everything was awesome...and yes awesome house margarita

R83WEQZv2yO97A3xR4A4Jw.text: I was a little off-put by its location cuz... you know... strip club... with boobies... and I'm -- well, anyway, finally Emijandro and I got out to the location on a couple of recommendations and holy bananas it's some of the breast Mexican food in Vegas.  ...BEST. It's some of the BEST Mexican food in Vegas. (I feel like a real boob for making that joke.)  Once inside though, you'll forget it's next to a titty bar. The atmosphere is a really chill type, where it can be casual with friends or intimate with a special someone, but enough about that... the FOOD. OMG so good. I was really torn as to what to order, there was so much good stuff on the menu. I finally settled on the breakfast burrito, and it was fantastic. Paired with a good stiff margarita, it was absolutely exceptional.  The service was phenomenal, and the Chef himself even came out to make sure everything was to our liking, especially Emijandro's flan. We will most certainly be back here.  Until the next review, ta-tas! (Singular. Dang, another boob joke. I feel like an absolute tit.)

PQ_OVa4vUu_p2D2XAvbLNw.text: I we got was the street corn, like 50 bucks worth. No regrets at all. Planning on doing it again.

WCG1OJP77jnNamQcDnumkg.text: I love this place I could come everyday n eat they have the best  organic food in town

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just love it
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omg this flan is so good the deep fry ice cream delicious
Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This tacos are the best I ever ate tnxs chef paco

5H1wGvw8Dl6n8vZKn3p8iA.text: Restaurant was OK but not the four and five star reviews on here. Staff was very unorganized and not prepared with silverware, napkins etc. also out of stock on different drinks. Ask for cheese for chips and did not have cheese. Dinner was above average but similar to an every day Mexican restaurant.

lohAs7XfQTa_SkQElA9zvA.text: This place has amazing food! We had great service! We almost didn't go here because it looks like it's inside the strip club but we were so glad we are here! We will definitely be back!

ATWs0H4M7f09erMeGCkquA.text: I wish I could give 0/5 stars, service was terrible. I waited 30+ minutes for the check on a slow Monday night. I would not recommend this place to anyone unless they were drunk. You can get better Mexican food elsewhere tbh

RjkKFwaEe3qxS6AQz_PNYw.text: Definitely in my top 3 Mexican restaurants I've ever been to. Service was just as great as the food. Food is organic, non-gmo and they take great pride in that. I'm Mexican and my mom cooks up some great food, so I'm a tough critic of Mexican food. This place is amazing.

mAOTkrnuqWJVx7h34stJZg.text: Joe had no bar back no busser today he was by himself running the bar and bar service and he still managed to keep everybody happy and with good service ! Awesome job ! Thanks Joe !!! Your great and your margaritas are to die for !

photos.caption: Photo of El Dorado Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita for happy hour! Made my Joe he had no busser no bar back was super busy and he handled it all amazing !!!

xZBgWjOBMa0qkuDPpjxW7A.text: The food was very delicious and our server was Juan - he was very polite and professional and apply exceptional service . 5 star for him and the food !

qeRb3e-3bCHntnDvwYfQ7A.text: Our first visit was last year and we returned this year as well.  We're mole fans and we had a great dinner. My wife got the mole sampler and I had the mole enchiladas.  Great service too!  I would recommend trying this restaurant!

f0gXd7W4WPZ9Z1IizRTSmw.text: It's delicious and organic!! You can't ask for more! The food was authentic and reasonably priced. Not a fan of it being next to a strip club and kinda outta the way but it's worth going to! I had the enchiladas and it was soooo good! The drinks were well priced and the atmosphere was perfect for a date!

fPBWYf-FVLFqOlViBAVhsA.text: Best mexican food ever! I am not a Mexican food type but this was amazing. The chef brought to our table his special Flan (family recipe) and i wasnt expecting too much as all flan are pretty the same. For my surprise the flan was better than the mexican food which was pretty good. If you are in Vegas dont miss that!
